-10 people: Short course on digital transformation and emerging technologies
-10 people:  Short course on organizational transformation  
Total: 154 = 40 Diplomados + 114 Short courses

Project: Supporting the roll-out of smart grid technologies in Colombia Phase 2: Moving forward to implementation
Result_Title: Excel-based tool to evaluate the economic benefit of implementing smart energy technologies to end users
Description:
An Excel tool that will allow UPME and other beneficiaries to test how the implementation of different use cases (defined by technologies and business models) will affect the energy profile of representative clusters of demand presented in the database (Output 1), and produce benefit for all the end users that can be associated with each cluster. 

This tool will help UPME to assess the value and understand how it changes depending on the different cases of use. Similarly, the tool will provide the network operator key insights needed to implement an offer of ToU tariff that could be interesting to their clients.

Project: Supporting the roll-out of smart grid technologies in Colombia Phase 2: Moving forward to implementation
Result_Title: Delivery of a public event to share findings and collect feedback from relevant stakeholders
Description: Key content of the report (identifying the economic benefits of ToU tariff to end-users) disseminated through an event or webinar (depending on the situation pertaining to the Covid-19 pandemic), to ensure relevance. MINEM, Network Operators, and other stakeholders will be present. Presentation delivered on public event with all beneficiaries and a relevant number of supportive project stakeholders and disseminated by email to all attendees.

Project: Greening the Colombian Financial System: Implementing local green definitions to enable long-term investment into priority sectors.
Result_Title: Fund structuring recommendations report
Description: Fund structuring report that will define sustainable key indicators and a sustainable investment policy applicable for credit allocation and portfolio investment. This paper will contain recommendations for a sustainable policy that is applied both in credit allocation and portfolio investment, the fund corporate governance policy according to international governance standard, and an underwriting strategy that complies with the sustainable fund's policy.

Project: Greening the Colombian Financial System: Implementing local green definitions to enable long-term investment into priority sectors.
Result_Title: Press release on project developments and green finance integration
Description: Press release as part of the communication strategy, related to what has been developed during the project in supporting the integration of green finance. Press releases have been successfully released in the past in other markets and have proven to be an accessible communications tool. If the CASA Colombia as a local proxy to the Climate Bonds Standard assessment proves successful, the press release will be used to announce it as part of the communication products.  However, if it is not successful, the press release will be related to the project in other form.

Project: Greening the Colombian Financial System: Implementing local green definitions to enable long-term investment into priority sectors.
Result_Title: Recommendations report including a sections on available financial instruments and Sustainable Projects Structuring Framework
Description: Procedure document that includes sustainable project structuring framework. The MHCP team will develop its skills with regards to structuring sustainable projects. In the future, this framework can be replicated by other government agencies, regions, and cities, thereby building on UK Pact’s objectives. The report will include a section on the available sustainable financial instruments, profiling the financial instruments available for sustainable projects and list recommendations for their employment. The document will also include a section on the Sustainable Projects Structuring Framework document, which will be drafted to recommend the procedures that allow the fund to design projects that have a financing structure that supports financial returns, risk profile, and sustainability goals, as well as profiles of financial products available in the market for sustainable projects. This report will be of use for any public or private sustainable fund. The fund will be conceived as a blended finance mechanism.

Project: Greening the Colombian Financial System: Implementing local green definitions to enable long-term investment into priority sectors.
Result_Title: Recommendations report on the use of CASA Colombia as a local proxy to the Climate Bonds Standard
Description: Assess CASA Colombia as a recommended local code or proxy to the Climate Bonds Standard (CBS). CASA Colombia is a local scheme for residential construction developed by the Colombian Green Building Council. As a proxy, the program would receive international recognition, and Green Bond issuers using CASA will be able to get certification under the CBS.

Project: Proposal of reform to the public policy and legal framework of territorial planning in Colombia in order to comply with the Paris Agreement
Result_Title: Training workshops with local government & key stakeholders on the implementation of simplified instruments to develop a local planning institutional framework directed at meeting the objectives of climate change mitigation and emissions reduction
Description:
Training workshops by which key stakeholders can understand and feel empowered through a simple set of instruments to respond to the challenges of climate change, emission reductions, and sustainable urban development. At least 15 workshops will be organised (one workshop per focal city), involving local authorities and key stakeholders at the local level. Every one of the focalized cities will have a separate workshop to be arranged with the local and national authorities in the last quarter of the year. At least 30-40 participants are expected at each workshop, combining public and private local representatives, national government and other key constituencies.

Targeted at:
Local governments for the following municipalities: Bogotá, Medellín, Cali, Barranquilla, Bucaramanga, Palmira, Soacha, La Calera, Rionegro, Bello, Jamundí, Soledad, Malambo, Girón, Piedecuesta, Pereira.
The National Planning Department (DNP)
Colombian Ministry of housing, city, and territories (MVCyT)
Colombian Ministry of Environment and Sustainable Development 
Private sector associations and investment promotion agencies (Camacol, Prosantander, Propacífico)
The Colombian Congress.
Colombia’s Autonomous Regional Corporations (CAR)
Urban and city developers
Local and regional development agencies

Project: Proposal of reform to the public policy and legal framework of territorial planning in Colombia in order to comply with the Paris Agreement
Result_Title: Workshop on the current institutional arrangement of Colombian land-use and environmental planning
Description: A workshop session to train key stakeholders to navigate the current institutional arrangement of Colombian land-use and environmental planning. It is expected to have at least one participant for each of the municipalities that was part of the study, as well as national government officials and private sector representatives. The workshop is planned to be a 4-6 hour session with 50 participants in total.

Project: Proposal of reform to the public policy and legal framework of territorial planning in Colombia in order to comply with the Paris Agreement
Result_Title: Recommendations for a reform program of the national regulatory framework of land-use and environmental planning
Description:
A recommendation for institutional reform of the regulatory framework and instruments for land-use and environmental planning. This reform is a crucial step towards renewing and simplifying the existing planning frameworks through the POTs, Local Development Plans, and instruments of rural planning. Simultaneously, the project is needed to promote more effective and cohesive planning of Colombian municipalities and metropolitan areas, with a strong emphasis on the reduction of greenhouse gas emissions, environmental planning, sustainable development, gender equality and social inclusion.
The reform will be formulated as an input for the electoral discussion of the 2022 presidential and congressional campaigns.

Project: Proposal of reform to the public policy and legal framework of territorial planning in Colombia in order to comply with the Paris Agreement
Result_Title: Guides and training materials with key findings from study results (both in-person and web-based) to be used by local authorities, the Ministry of Housing and Environment, and the National Planning Department
Description:
A set of guidelines based on actionable interventions that ensure local implementation will be developed. These guidelines will facilitate an effective response to the challenges of rapid urbanisation, urban planning, expansion, and the densification of Colombian cities. It will outline ways to solve these challenges in the light of climate change mitigation and emissions reductions. 

This product is targeted to:
The National Planning Department (DNP)
Colombian Ministry of housing, city, and territories (MVCyT)
Colombian Ministry of Environment and Sustainable Development 
Regional, departamental and municipal authorities.
The Colombian Congress.
Colombia’s Autonomous Regional Corporations (CAR)
Urban and city developers
Local and regional development agencies

Project: Proposal of reform to the public policy and legal framework of territorial planning in Colombia in order to comply with the Paris Agreement
Result_Title: Webinar event: Diagnosis, benchmark and reform program of Colombian land-use and environmental planning
Description: A webinar that will present the main results of the project, including an overview of the POT Implementation Gaps Report, a comparative analysis of current trends in OECD and the global south countries, and the main elements of the reform program. The possibility of including a panel with presidential candidates will be evaluated. It is expected to have 500 participants, and 2,000-3,000 views of the recording at Fedesarollo's YouTube channel.

Project: Proposal of reform to the public policy and legal framework of territorial planning in Colombia in order to comply with the Paris Agreement
Result_Title: Report of benchmark of current international literature and practices on land-use and environmental planning instruments that directly enhance the accomplishment of the Paris Agreement goals
Description:
Document with recommendations related to a proposal for institutional reform of the regulatory framework and instruments for land-use and environmental planning. This reform is a crucial step towards renewing and simplifying the existing planning frameworks through the POTs, Local Development Plans, and instruments of rural planning. Simultaneously, the project is needed to promote more effective and cohesive planning of Colombian municipalities and metropolitan areas, with a strong emphasis on the reduction of greenhouse gas emissions, environmental planning, sustainable development, gender equality and social inclusion.
The reform recommendations will be formulated as an input for the electoral discussion of the 2022 presidential and congressional campaigns.

Project: Proposal of reform to the public policy and legal framework of territorial planning in Colombia in order to comply with the Paris Agreement
Result_Title: Report on the current institutional arrangement of Colombian land-use and environmental planning
Description:
A report that identifies the interrelatedness of existing laws, regulations, and constitutional jurisprudence on land-use and environmental planning. Furthermore, the report will attempt to simplify these complex topics and enhance the stakeholder’s knowledge, promoting better design and implementation of public policies in this field. The report will pay special attention to the interaction between urban planning environmental management, adaptation, and mitigation to climate change.
The output will be delivered as a guide for navigating land use and environmental planning regulation structures. 
The report will be hosted in a sub-site inside Fedesarrollo's website, and is targeted to:
The National Planning Department (DNP),
Colombian Ministry of Housing, City, and Territories (MVCT), and the Colombian Ministry of Environment and Sustainable Development, regional, departmental, and municipal authorities, the Colombian Congress, Colombia’s Autonomous Regional Corporations (CAR), urban and city developers, local and regional development agencies.

Project: Proposal of reform to the public policy and legal framework of territorial planning in Colombia in order to comply with the Paris Agreement
Result_Title: Report on POTs' (Plans of Territorial Planning) implementation gaps for 15 municipalities
Description:
A report describing implementation gaps of the POTs in 15 selected municipalities across Colombia. Proper execution of the investment program (known in Spanish as “Programa de Ejecución”) is key for the POTs’ success, especially in terms of infrastructure, housing, and public amenities development, as the Territorial Occupation Model (“Modelo de Ocupación Territorial”) materializes through them. The report will include an initial characterisation and evaluation of the POTs’ investment plans by looking for explicit connections with climate change adaptation and mitigation measures, and with greenhouse emissions by transport and industrial sectors. Additionally, the effectiveness of the POTs will be assessed. The degree of their effective implementation will be determined with impact indicators. This study will be complemented with a qualitative evaluation of the plans’ results through a set of interviews with strategic stakeholders. Lastly, best practices will be identified through the evaluation of the alignment of different planning instruments at the local level. 
This knowledge product is needed to understand the causes behind the limited effectiveness of planning instruments, complementing current literature regarding Colombian land-use planning, and highlighting key implementation challenges that need to be tackled in an eventual reform.

Project: Scaling up rural electrification via capacity building to public and private actors
Result_Title: Recommendations based on technical assessment and report on the socio-economic characteristics, energy demand, and renewable energy potential to advance the development of the Rural Energization Plans (PERS) plans across prioritized Department(s)
Description:
Delivery to IPSE of socio-economic studies, energy load profile analysis, and mapping of FNCER energy sources to inform the development of PERS plans in order to define medium- and long-term rural electrification and development plans tailored to location-specific socio-economic characteristics and energy needs.
Target: At least one (1) PERS plan/project.

Project: Scaling up rural electrification via capacity building to public and private actors
Result_Title: Webinar to announce the advancements in the development of PERS plans during the 6th Anniversary of the Paris Agreement with high-level speakers
Description:
Deliver one (1) webinar to announce the advancements in the development of PERS plans during the 6th Anniversary of the Paris Agreement on December 12, 2021 with high-level speakers, such as IPSE’s Director, MME’s Deputy Minister, and UK PACT representatives.
Target: 1 webinar delivered.

Project: Scaling up rural electrification via capacity building to public and private actors
Result_Title: Report and presentation on rural electrification lessons learned, best practices, and business models developed
Description: Report on rural electrification analysing and outlining: a) Commercial business models for rural electrification, b) International best practices, c) Gender-energy nexus, and d) One case study from the implementation of private sector led rural electrification projects. Main findings and recommendations will be collected into a PowerPoint presentation targeted to MME, IPSE, and subnational entities.

Project: Scaling up rural electrification via capacity building to public and private actors
Result_Title: Presentation on rural electrification commercial business models for rural electrification, international best practices, and gender-energy nexus presented at Colombia's 8th Finanzas del Clima 2021
Description: Presentation on commercial business models for rural electrification, international best practices and gender-energy nexus at Colombia's 8th Finanzas del Clima 2021. The presentation is targeted mainly to MME, IPSE, and subnational entities.

Project: Scaling up rural electrification via capacity building to public and private actors
Result_Title: Webinar with high-level speakers to raise awareness about the rural electrification solutions, share lessons learned during project execution and identify opportunities for scale up and replication.
Description: Delivery of one (1) webinar with high-level speakers, such as MME's Deputy Minister, IPSE's Director and Mr. Ban Ki-Moon (8th Secretary-General of the United Nations), and current GGGI President & Chair. The Webinar will serve to 1) Raise awareness about the rural electrification solutions delivered by the project, 2) Share lessons learned, 3) Identify opportunities for scale up and replication, 4) Raise visibility of the “Certified Rural Electrification Project Developer” to drive increased use 5) collect feedbacks. The webinar is targeted at MME, IPSE, and subnational entities.

Project: Empowering territories’ for low carbon transformation
Result_Title: Practical workshops for relevant decision makers of 5 primary beneficiary departments in transport and energy to develop long-term sectoral visions
Description:
Two (2) online practical workshops on sectoral long-term vision setting (1 workshop per sector: transport and energy) 1 day each (5 breakout rooms) OR 5 in-person workshops (one per each of the primary beneficiary departments: Antioquia, Bogotá, Boyacá, Cundinamarca and Valle del Cauca) (COVID permitting).
Expected attendance: 20-25 participants per each departmental workshop.

Project: Empowering territories’ for low carbon transformation
Result_Title: Catalogue of recommended policy actions for transport and energy and priority subsectors identified for 5 primary beneficiary departments
Description: Catalogue of at least 100 relevant policy actions recommended for energy and transport that can have high emissions reductions, as well as generate economic recovery opportunities and promote low-carbon jobs in these sectors. These catalogues will encompass a diverse list of mitigation actions that will help the primary beneficiaries guide their long-term vision setting.

Project: Empowering territories’ for low carbon transformation
Result_Title: Long-term vision recommendations for five departments (on energy and transport) developed and presented to E2050 for alignment at national level
Description: Five (5) long-term visions, one per department. These recommendation documents will include a long-term GHG and non-GHG target(s), sectoral coverage and expected transformation in the energy and transport sector to 2050, that have been discussed and agreed among stakeholders. This vision will be the baseline to guide governments to continue building their pathway for decarbonization in the long-term. Each department will have a recommendations document with a vision for the two priority sectors.

Project: Empowering territories’ for low carbon transformation
Result_Title: Personalised interactive story-telling workshops delivered with journalists and influencers to build sectoral transformation narratives
Description: Five (5) workshop trainings to be held in November (one per each of the primary beneficiary departments: Antioquia, Bogotá, Boyacá, Cundinamarca and Valle del Cauca) based on the narratives and storytelling elaborated from the stakeholders of the long-term visions. Journalists and influencers will learn about these narratives and visions in order to disseminate them. At the same time, they become sensitized and aware of the issues of climate change in the energy and transport sectors. Expected attendance: 20-25 participants per departmental workshop.

Project: Empowering territories’ for low carbon transformation
Result_Title: Theoretical workshops provided to enhance skills of relevant decision makers from 5 primary beneficiary departments in transport and energy policy actions for long-term sectoral vision development
Description: Two (2) online theoretical workshops on sectoral long- term vision setting (1 workshop per sector: transport and energy), which will be 3-4 hours each. In these workshops, the catalogs, Case Studies of policy actions, and the methodology on how to build sectoral visions will be presented. Expected attendance: 20-25 participants per workshop.

Project: Empowering territories’ for low carbon transformation
Result_Title: Video launches to present the decarbonization pathway narratives of each of the 5 primary beneficiary departments
Description: Five (5) videos and complementary communications materials that communicate the visions of the 5 primary beneficiary departments. The videos will be made available to relevant social media accounts, to the institutional websites in Colombia, and the UK PACT website. We are expecting to launch all five videos in January 2022. The videos are the final products presenting the five visions developed by the primary beneficiary departments: Antioquia, Bogotá, Boyacá, Cundinamarca and Valle del Cauca.

Project: Empowering territories’ for low carbon transformation
Result_Title: Social media campaign of the narratives constructed by journalists and influencers for different types of audiences, elaborated from the visions of the 5 primary beneficiary departments
Description: The narratives and messages built by the stakeholders and the result of the journalist and influencer workshop. A communication campaign will be designed to present the long-term visions of each of the campaigns in which it seeks to inform and engage the public to support the vision.

Project: Preparing the public and financial sector for CTR: Capacity building and call to action
Result_Title: Online platform for the communication of project's progress and sharing lessons learned
Description: An online platform with description of activities and progress of the  project. The platform will also have a section for showcasing projects designed to manage CTR.

Project: Comprehensive plan and roadmap for sustainable mobility in Bogotá-Región during and after COVID-19
Result_Title: Recommendations on a priority lanes network and modal transfer zones design for the Bogotá-Region.
Description: Technical document that contains recommendations on the prioritization and agile implementation of various infrastructure projects for sustainable transport in Bogotá-Region, along with the explanation of the process to obtain these results. The objective is to determine which projects should be prioritized by their impact on travel times, modal shift, and GHG emissions reduction. Also, it seeks to establish guidelines that speed-up the effective implementation of the chosen infrastructure projects. In addition, specific design recommendations will be given on one or two prioritized projects according to their magnitude and impact, to generate guidelines for a real and agile implementation of this specific infrastructure.

Project: Comprehensive plan and roadmap for sustainable mobility in Bogotá-Región during and after COVID-19
Result_Title: Recommendations on transport supply models and demand management strategies for Bogotá-Region.
Description:
Technical document that will contain recommendations for implementing in an agile way supply and demand models scenarios, based on their impact on sustainable mobility, to accelerate climate change mitigation and reduce travel times. Including methodology.
For supply models, the impact of different schemes will be quantified by modelling proposals considered by Bogotá Mayor’s Office, Cundinamarca Government and other researchers: It will be included interoperable fare collection schemes, various types of modal integration, public or private bicycle systems implementation, reforms to the feeder buses schemes, among others. 

Regarding demand management strategies, starting again from previous studies carried out by Mayor’s Office, Cundinamarca Government and other researchers, the impact of measures such as congestion fees, urban tolls, peak and plate schemes, management of parking spaces, among others may be analysed.

Project: Comprehensive plan and roadmap for sustainable mobility in Bogotá-Región during and after COVID-19
Result_Title: Recommendation on MaaS architecture for Bogota-Region, including a coupled MRV module for transport
Description:
Technical document that will contain recommendations and technological guidelines required for the implementation of an interoperable MaaS platform in the Bogotá-Region. The document will contain a conceptual architecture that will describe MaaS platform key components, as well as their interactions and functional requirements to guarantee interoperability between different public transport systems of the city-region.
The proposed MaaS architecture also includes guidelines for a coupled MRV module for the transportation sector. The idea behind this module is to make use of data from MaaS and transport sector GHG emissions reports, to be appended to existing Bogotá Mobility Control Center.

Project: Comprehensive plan and roadmap for sustainable mobility in Bogotá-Región during and after COVID-19
Result_Title: Mayor's Office/SDM fund review to estimate funds for regional projects focused on promoting sustainable mobility.
Indicator: Output 2.3. 'Project application/ tools developed to access funds'
Description: It is an exercise to estimate available funds and give recommendations for their use in financing projects focused on promoting sustainable mobility. Also, a document will be delivered with the explanation of the process followed to obtain these results. In this case, Mayor's Office/SDM fund and use of funds exercise will be reviewed and complemented. Mayor's Office/SDM has been developing this exercise at regional level in conjunction with the academic institutions.

Project: Comprehensive plan and roadmap for sustainable mobility in Bogotá-Región during and after COVID-19
Result_Title: GESI guidelines for the regional institutional framework for continuity of sustainable mobility policies in Bogotá-Region, and a pact proposal for reporting GHG emissions from transport
Description: A document that will contain recommendations and technical guidelines for the regional institutional framework in which regional authorities are currently working, and a pact proposal for a reliable emissions report towards the proposed MRV module. These recommendations and guidelines will be focused on roles, responsibilities, and required agreements between stakeholders for the coordination and integration of urban development and mobility projects, and guarantee the availability and transparency of GHG emissions data from transport by means of a collaboration pact.

Project: Adopting New Technology, Mindsets, and Practices to Transform Colombia’s Agricultural Sector
Result_Title: Community-based carbon monitoring system (CB-MRV) to enable local farmers and landowners to monitor their contribution to mitigate climate change
Description:
The CB-MRV system will be designed following government and international guidelines and farmers will be trained in its use. The project's mitigation contribution will be estimated based on a monitoring plan, identification of the chronosequence of cacao and citrus crops, collection of field samples, data analysis and development of models describing carbon trajectories associated with cacao/citrus crops, and complemented with the data from the CB-MRV system. The system is comprised of 3 elements: i) Standardized protocols and procedures for collecting information, ii) Local personnel trained on adequate data collection and iii) The database that aggregates the information collected. The system will be developed following the guidelines of the IDEAM Forest and Carbon Monitoring System and the National Forest Inventory.
System is established in June 2021, while data collection will take place throughout the project.

Project: Adopting New Technology, Mindsets, and Practices to Transform Colombia’s Agricultural Sector
Result_Title: Recommendation paper to strengthen the national reporting of carbon monitoring with data produced at the local level to contribute towards the national NDC system
Description:
Using carbon data gathered through CB-MRV system and other key results from the project, a recommendations report - including technical support, accurate data and evidence contributing to the NDC targets - will be shared and validated with key-stakeholders of the Consultative Committee; a working group with IDEAM and MADR will be established to review the recommendations and assess the level of adoption.
Target: Report with region-specific information on carbon removals associated with the implementation of sustainable practices in cacao production.

Project: Adopting New Technology, Mindsets, and Practices to Transform Colombia’s Agricultural Sector
Result_Title: 5 x 4-hour workshop with municipal mayors and agricultural/environmental authorities on behaviour centered design on governance and community participation towards conservation
Description: 4-hour workshop for municipal mayors, agriculture and environmental authorities on behavior-centered design on governance and community participation towards conservation. 5 workshops, 1 per municipality (Cubarral, Lejanías, El Dorado, El Castillo, Granada). Workshops will enable municipal mayors, agriculture and environmental authorities to identify the steps of the behavior-centered design methodology developed by Rare and create prototypes to conserve the natural resources of their communities and motivate commitment towards implementation of CSA at landscapes levels.

Project: Adopting New Technology, Mindsets, and Practices to Transform Colombia’s Agricultural Sector
Result_Title: Report on behaviour diffusion strategy and lessons-learned
Description: Qualitative and quantitative research with extensionists and farmers will provide the insights for designing the behavior diffusion strategy to disseminate the knowledge and communication products in cost effective ways, adaptating all contents to the local context and develop the behavior change campaing. The report will highlight the key lessons learnt from this project and provide guidance on the adoption of a behaviour diffusion strategy for other stakeholders promoting CSA practices.

Project: Adopting New Technology, Mindsets, and Practices to Transform Colombia’s Agricultural Sector
Result_Title: 5 x 1-day training workshops with farmer innovators on irrigation planning and use of cover crops
Description:
1-day training workshop with farmer innovators on i) How to develop and assess an irrigation plan using the agro-climatic data that farmers have collected through the project, and ii) Use of cover crops to retain soil humidity. 5 workshops, 1 per municipality (Cubarral, Lejanías, El Dorado, El Castillo, Granada).
The purpose of this workshop is so that farmer innovators understand how evapotranspiration and rainfall regime work and the importance to use climatic data for managing irrigation.

Project: Adopting New Technology, Mindsets, and Practices to Transform Colombia’s Agricultural Sector
Result_Title: 2 webinars profiling local and regional leaders as CSA champions
Description: 2 webinars profiling local and regional leaders from different backgrounds (e.g., representatives from farmer associations, officers from agricultural and environmental authorities and regional education institutions). Communication materials will provide a platform to share progress towards CSA and specific experiences and cases in the project's municipalities (Cubarral, Lejanías, El Dorado, El Castillo, Granada) and convince other municipalities to prioritize CSA practices.

Project: Adopting New Technology, Mindsets, and Practices to Transform Colombia’s Agricultural Sector
Result_Title: 5 x 1-day training workshops with farmer innovators on soil analysis and fertilization
Description:
1-day training workshop with farmer innovators on i) How to understand the soil analysis, and ii) How to develop a fertilization plan according to the results. In addition, explanation on how to keep and assess records on the costs of the inputs (especially fertilizers) will be provided. 5 workshops, 1 per municipality (Cubarral, Lejanías, El Dorado, El Castillo, Granada).
Farmer innovators are able to interpret the soil variables (PH, organic matter, CEC (cation exchange capacity)) to properly use fertilizers according to the soil analysis results with adequate dosage of inputs.

Project: Adopting New Technology, Mindsets, and Practices to Transform Colombia’s Agricultural Sector
Result_Title: Virtual presentation targeting an international audience on the sidelines of UNFCCC COP26
Description: Presentation organized in the context of UNFCCC COP26, the Global Landscape Forum, and/or the Global Food Summit, with participation of local stakeholders to showcase the project. The aim is to host a discussion that puts the projects’ results and long-term ambitions in context with international sustainable development, climate and food system agendas, and generate momentum about how these can be applicable to other sectors and geographies.

Project: Adopting New Technology, Mindsets, and Practices to Transform Colombia’s Agricultural Sector
Result_Title: Media campaign with 2 blogs/articles in local/regional media and 1 regional TV broadcasting to reach wider audiences
Description:
Platform to share progress towards CSA and specific experiences and cases in the project´s municipalities (Cubarral, Lejanías, El Dorado, El Castillo, Granada) and convince other municipalities to prioritize CSA practices. 
2 blogs/articles in local/regional media, written jointly with a local leader, to highlight the project's contributions and 1 regional TV broadcasting to reach wider audiences.

Project: Preparing the Road to Zero-emission Urban Mobility in Colombian Cities: Accelerating Electric Bus Adoption
Result_Title: Technical assistance for financing options for national players, including COVID economic recovery recommendations
Indicator: Output 2.3. 'Project application/ tools developed to access funds'
Description: WRI and CEW will provide technical assistance for national players and the cities they work with, through more transparent and comprehensive communication, especially on financing. These skills will help ensure that cities understand the financing options and other resources available at the national level to help scale e-bus procurement plans, with special emphasis on financing in the face of Covid-19.

Project: Preparing the Road to Zero-emission Urban Mobility in Colombian Cities: Accelerating Electric Bus Adoption
Result_Title: Guidebook, highlighting the work and major takeaways from the project for a larger audience
Description: Guidebook which highlights the work and major takeaways from the project to a larger audience. This is needed to document the lessons learned in the project, and preserve them for future use.

Project: Preparing the Road to Zero-emission Urban Mobility in Colombian Cities: Accelerating Electric Bus Adoption
Result_Title: Market analysis and risk assessment for each target city
Description: Market analysis to research the available e-bus makes and models, charging options, and pricing for implementing e-bus programs in each city. WRI will also research and identify key risks associated with e-bus implementation that each city may face. Each of the three target cities will receive the assessments. The Transportation Ministry and other relevant national-level stakeholders will also receive these knowledge products.

Project: Deforestation-free Cocoa for the Amazon Piedmont
Result_Title: Pilot implementation of at least one financing instrument or incentive articulated to the deforestation-free cocoa business model
Indicator: Output 2.3. 'Project application/ tools developed to access funds'
Description: Implementation of a pilot based on at least one of the identified public and/or private financing instruments or incentives available. The pilot will include establishing required agreements with the stakeholders involved in the implementation of the deforestation-free cocoa business model.

Project: Deforestation-free Cocoa for the Amazon Piedmont
Result_Title: Development of a business model for the cocoa value chain in the Amazon Piedmont
Description: Parameters and criteria that define a deforestation-free, climate smart, and socially inclusive cocoa business model adjusted to the specific conditions of each sub-region.

Project: Deforestation-free Cocoa for the Amazon Piedmont
Result_Title: Baseline estimation report of environmental, socioeconomic, and productive indicators defined by the Monitoring, Reporting and Verification system of the Cocoa, Forests and Peace Agreement
Description: Contribute to the Monitoring, Reporting and Verification system of the Cocoa, Forests and Peace agreement by providing baseline estimates of environmental, socioeconomic, and productive indicators, including an assessment of deforestation linked to cocoa agroforestry in the Amazon Piedmont.

Project: Deforestation-free Cocoa for the Amazon Piedmont
Result_Title: Guidelines on forest restoration and rehabilitation using cocoa agroforestry systems
Description: Document with recommendations for implementation and/or improvement of cocoa agroforestry systems to promote forest restoration, connectivity and conservation at landscape scales in the Amazon piedmont. The guidelines will consider the current status of cocoa crops, recommendations made by other organizations, and local growers' preferences.

Project: Deforestation-free Cocoa for the Amazon Piedmont
Result_Title: 6 x 1-day training workshops delivered to cocoa producers to improve skills for accessing environmental/conservation financing instruments and incentives to implement deforestation-free and climate smart business models
Description: Six 1-day training workshops (2 for each department to reduce group size and COVID-19 risks) for 10-12 cocoa farmers in each workshop to strengthen their capacity for accessing financing instruments and incentives to implement a deforestation-free business model.

Project: Deforestation-free Cocoa for the Amazon Piedmont
Result_Title: Capacity building programme delivered to key actors of cocoa value chain in Putumayo, Caquetá, and Guaviare for the implementation of deforestation-free agroforestry business models
Description: Workshop series with 3-day trainings in Putumayo, Caquetá, and Guaviare. Targeted to 75 key actors of cocoa value chain (40% women) including: public officials, cocoa association members and environmental authorities. The workshops will strengthen the participants skills and knowledges in the topics prioritized and previously identified. Moreover, the workshops aim to build a sense of collective ownership over a common vision for deforestation-free cocoa for the region. The Full Value Agreement methodologies will be deepened in order to build alliances between different actors with common goals.

Project: Sustainable Tourism Enhancement Project - Phase 2: Boosting conservation and emissions reduction through tourism and technology
Result_Title: Scientific report published and disseminated with the results of the acoustic monitoring system and the implementation of the pilot of community-based monitoring and measurement of ecosystems in 10 locations
Description: Scientific report with data, results, and conclusions from the community-based monitoring pilot program. These processes aim to strengthen community monitoring efforts and give them important tools, information, and technology that they can utilize. The report is targeted at stakeholders that are interested in conservation of the forest coverage, biodiversity protection, and the impact that tourism has on GHG emission reduction. It is expected that this knowledge can be replicated in other regions and by other tourism organisations.

Project: Sustainable Tourism Enhancement Project - Phase 2: Boosting conservation and emissions reduction through tourism and technology
Result_Title: Scientific report with key findings from the control trial experiment measuring socio-economic and environmental impacts generated by the project, and showcase the potential of nature tourism as a tool for deforestation reduction
Description: The Universidad del Rosario will be in charge of measuring the impact generated by the project, which will evaluate the socioeconomic and environmental results of Awake's intervention on the project’s destinations and beneficiaries. This is fundamental for understanding the impact of tourism interventions on forest conservation. To carry out these activities, a subcontractor will be hired to collect the information on the project destinations, which includes: phone surveys to participants in 76 municipalities and in-person surveys to participants in 76 municipalities. This component is very important as it’s a continuation of the measurement during the project’s first phase. It will help understand the conservation processes that are being implemented in each destination. With these results, there will be a comparison of the deforestation rates in each of the 36 “control” municipalities and in the 36 municipalities where the project was implemented, thereby understanding the socio economic impact that the project has had on its beneficiaries. Target survey participants: reaching 823 individuals to have 710 successfully involved. The Universidad del Rosario will create and disseminate a scientific report of this second measurement phase.

Project: Sustainable Tourism Enhancement Project - Phase 2: Boosting conservation and emissions reduction through tourism and technology
Result_Title: Pedagogical pensum and 25 online courses dedicated to conservation and sustainable tourism in the e-learning platform AwakeU
Description: Pensum with 25 new courses on the AwakeU platform on themes regarding conservation and sustainable tourism. These courses and topics are the result of a conservation and sustainability pensum that has been co-created with experts (academic, NGO's, government). These courses will be available during and after the project for beneficiary organisations and others outside this project.

Project: Sustainable Tourism Enhancement Project - Phase 2: Boosting conservation and emissions reduction through tourism and technology
Result_Title: Guideline for Acoustic Monitoring with a community-based approach in tourism destinations
Description: Guideline for Acoustic Monitoring with a community-based approach in tourism destinations, as a result of the training process. A guide will be constructed, following the national elements regarding community based monitoring, that will contribute to the know-how of forest coverage at a national level, including its analysis of flora and fauna, all with a community based perspective. This information will be consolidated in thematic guidebooks for the implementation of specific activities in monitoring such as forms, reporting spreadsheets, and protocols for information use.

Project: Sustainable Tourism Enhancement Project - Phase 2: Boosting conservation and emissions reduction through tourism and technology
Result_Title: Training materials for leaders regarding environmental education, leadership, conservation, and tourism
Description: During the project, three (3) mentorships for local leaders will be designed. These materials and recordings can be used as guidelines for the training and capacity building of other local leaders.

Project: Sustainable Tourism Enhancement Project - Phase 2: Boosting conservation and emissions reduction through tourism and technology
Result_Title: Partnerships to strengthen sustainable nature based tourism initiatives in the prioritised destinations
Description:
At least 15 virtual or on-site meetings to socialize the project and at least 10 written agreements with the stakeholders. This component seeks to:
- Socialise and articulate the project with local authorities and key actors with a presence in the destinations (NGOs, private companies, national government), to ensure non-duplication of efforts and seek the support of these key actors, not only in the execution of the project, but also in the sustainability of the interventions in the long term.
- Create agreements with local authorities (alcaldías y gobernaciones) and other key stakeholders that have incidence in the prioritised destinations of the project (NGO’s, private entities, government entities, among others), that will demonstrate their commitment in terms of support and contributions to the project, agreements regarding the contributions of these organisations to tourism or conservation processes in the destinations; and agreements on working in coordination with specific components of the project (example: training processes, ecosystem monitoring processes, etc.).
The project’s goal is to create 10 written agreements with clear commitments regarding: support given to the project, exchange of information that enhances the actions of these actors and the actions of the project regarding tourism and conservation, articulation for the work on specific components and interventions of the project, actions or clear resources that will be invested and given for tourism and conservation purposes, in each territory, by these entities.
In order to do so, there will be meetings with leaders from each organisation or key stakeholders (they can be on-site or virtual meetings), where the project will be socialised. Then there will be periodic follow ups through mail, calls, or other meetings, until reaching final written documents that state all commitments between Awake and each actor.
There will be quarterly updates on these meetings.

Project: Sustainable Tourism Enhancement Project - Phase 2: Boosting conservation and emissions reduction through tourism and technology
Result_Title: Set of recommendations proposed for relevant policies, legislation, and regulation on climate change mitigation related to nature tourism
Description:
Based on the results of this project, the measurement analysis data, all insights and conclusions, an official recommendation will be created to the local authorities regarding nature tourism and conservation, which is useful for policy making, regulation and norm design.
An important component is that all data and results will be shared, and will ideally be utilized to create new policies, regulations and norms. This is one of the main deficiencies of local governments. Recommendations will be targeted to relevant national authorities such as: PNN, MinCIT, MADS, Humboldt and Colciencias. Similarly, local authorities will be targeted.

Project: Sustainable Tourism Enhancement Project - Phase 2: Boosting conservation and emissions reduction through tourism and technology
Result_Title: Funding platform for tourism and conservation projects that showcases the impact measurement and report of nature tourism and conservation initiatives
Indicator: Output 2.3. 'Project application/ tools developed to access funds'
Description: Funding platform where 10 tourism organisations involved in the monitoring process will display their conservation agreements, their impact measurement, and have the possibility to receive donations and other income for their impact generation. This platform will display and visualize all contributions made by local tourism organizations for the conservation of forest coverage and GHG emission reduction. The platform also aims at mobilizing resources for these initiatives so that travelers can make direct contributions. There will be a virtual page hosted in a subdomain of Awake.travel using a Wordpress site such as Content Management System. The page will include a profile of each of the 10 organisations involved in the monitoring pilot, the conservation agreements, data, and other results of the monitoring process, hectares of forest conserved, data from the Geographic Information System and data from the acoustic monitoring system, among others.

Project: Sustainable Tourism Enhancement Project - Phase 2: Boosting conservation and emissions reduction through tourism and technology
Result_Title: Guideline for Conservation Monitoring with a community-based approach in tourism destinations
Description: Document with guidelines for acoustic monitoring, as a result of the training process.

Project: Supporting the roll-out of smart grid technologies in Colombia Phase 2: Moving forward to implementation
Result_Title: Report identifying barriers to investment in smart technologies by end users and recommendations to overcome those barriers
Description: This report will contain expert recommendations based on the learnings from the UK experience and other international cases, along with the identification of perceptions and the barriers to flex demand and procurement of ToU tariffs in Colombia based on primary and secondary research. Led by an expert on user behaviour and smart tariffs from Imperial College London with local support from Universidad Nacional team to adapt their assessment to the local context. The lack of social buy-in is a significant barrier to implement and grasp the benefits of smart grid technologies.

Project: Supporting the roll-out of smart grid technologies in Colombia Phase 2: Moving forward to implementation
Result_Title: Report containing recommendations for the implementation of smart technologies for each cluster of demand based technical and commercial feasibility analysis
Description:
This report will contain recommendations based on the details of the technical and commercial feasibility analysis for the implementation of smart energy technologies on each site, and an outlined description of pilots to implement will be included for each based on the findings. 

This report is needed because (i) it will complement the level of understanding on the existence of flexible demand in Colombia and (ii) will help to define where and which type of technology to implement within the sites owned by the clients associated with each cluster of demand.

Project: Supporting the roll-out of smart grid technologies in Colombia Phase 2: Moving forward to implementation
Result_Title: Course material on smart grids and digital transformation (knowledge material of diplomados and short courses)
Description: The delivery of the Diplomados and Short Courses will require supporting course content and materials. The courses will have modules with strategic content focused on decision-makers, technical content focused on the technical staff of the beneficiaries, and other supportive stakeholders of the project. Final versions of content and material are produced for each of the nine decks as follows: - Diplomados on Smart Grids - Diplomados on Digital Transformation - Short course on Smart Grids - Short course cybersecurity and interoperability - Short course on Smart Grids IT and communications - Short course on Smart Grids business models - Short course on Smart Grids regulation - Short course on digital transformation and emerging technologies - Short course on organizational transformation

Project: Supporting livelihoods through Ecotourism Routes for Forest and Peace.
Result_Title: Marketing Action Plan
Description:
Two (2) Marketing Action Plans named "Forests and Peace Community Tour - Marketing Action Plan Outline," one for Quinchas and one for Perijá respectively. This will be the result of an ongoing process throughout the year with the communities. It will be perfected and fine-tuned after each marketing workshop and trip. 

The Plan should include at least:
1. Introduction
2. Strategic Objectives
3.Implementation
4. Selecting Target Markets
5. Positioning
6. Tactic for reaching Target Markets
7. Digital Content Marketing Strategy 
8. Action plan and budget
9. Measurements/Tracking

Project: Supporting livelihoods through Ecotourism Routes for Forest and Peace.
Result_Title: Scientific nature booklets with useful plants for Perijá and Quinchas
Description:
Two Scientific Nature Booklets:
1) One updated for Quinchas that will provide scientific knowledge on biodiversity to communities and visitors that want to support conservation efforts. The current booklet will be updated by adding more species with the support of RBG Kew, local biologists, and with an open invitation to communities and tourists to incorporate traditional and local knowledge.
Expected completion date: 2021 Q3.
2). A new Useful Plants Booklet of Perijá. It will be created through the characterization of useful plants of Perijá with the scientific support of researchers from the RBG Kew with a participatory approach with selected local communities.
Expected completion date: 2021 Q4.

Project: Supporting livelihoods through Ecotourism Routes for Forest and Peace.
Result_Title: On-the-job field training sessions with selected communities on guiding nature tours in Quinchas and Perijá
Description:
2-day on-the-job training session per region to teach communities to recognise local species and to be able to explain their importance to the tourists. 
Number of trainees in Quinchas: At least 8 people from 3 townships.
Number of trainees in Perijá: At least 8 people from the communities of Estados Unidos and La Victoria de San Isidro (Perijá).

Project: Supporting livelihoods through Ecotourism Routes for Forest and Peace.
Result_Title: Training booklet featuring local ingredients and traditional recipes developed for tourism purposes
Description:
Two (2) culinary training booklets for communities, one per region, that contain all learning points during the culinary course (cooking lessons), as well as recipes that, when possible, incorporate native and traditional ingredients, and are balanced, healthy and flavorful.
It can later be used to train other interested people in the region, providing improved food options for tourists.

Project: Supporting livelihoods through Ecotourism Routes for Forest and Peace.
Result_Title: A practical guide of financial options the communities can use to mobilise resources
Description: One (1) financial guide that collects the links made throughout the project to funds, microlending schemes, and other possible funders or donors, once the communities agree to develop basic improvements to accommodate tourists (home stays). The financing schemes can also be implemented in order to improve food and beverage facilities and better transportation options.

Project: Sustainable Tourism Enhancement Project - Phase 2: Boosting conservation and emissions reduction through tourism and technology
Result_Title: Trainings to build capacity and provide technical assistance to individuals from local nature tourism organisations
Description:
300 trained individuals, belonging to 62 organisations, will receive at least 4 hours of training in at least one of the following topics: conservation, environmental education, measurement and monitoring, administrative, operational and commercial processes, and/or implementation of biosafety protocols. The modalities to provide such trainings may be mentoring with experts, virtual or on-site training. Both the modalities and the topics will be defined after the initial diagnosis of each organisation.
Partial achievements will be reported on a quarterly basis from Q2 2021 through Q1 2022.

Project: Accelerating development of new bioeconomy businesses and enhanced capacities for green jobs promotion and increased climate action ambition from policy implementation and integration.
Result_Title: Three published case studies disseminated through the Competitiveness and Innovation System of Colombia
Description: Three (3) case studies published for sharing of lessons learned, best practices, and recommendations for replication and scale-up of the accelerator mechanism by means of dissemination along with MinCiencias, other bioeconomy/innovation-focused stakeholders (i.e. Innpulsa, ProColombia, the Vicepresidency), and other low-carbon bioeconomy business owners.

Project: Accelerating development of new bioeconomy businesses and enhanced capacities for green jobs promotion and increased climate action ambition from policy implementation and integration.
Result_Title: Report of at least three (3) inclusive and low-carbon-bioeconomy businesses accelerated with significant potential for scale-up/rapid growth
Indicator: Output 2.3. 'Project application/ tools developed to access funds'
Description: 3 inclusive and low-carbon bioeconomy businesses accelerated. This will trigger the advancement of the National Bioeconomy Strategy led by MinCiencias, DNP, MinAmbiente, MinComercio, and other institutions by supporting the prioritized projects to reach commercial viability. The selected businesses will receive support in the process of validation for bioproducts with MinCiencias, as well as being connected with potential investors.

Project: Accelerating development of new bioeconomy businesses and enhanced capacities for green jobs promotion and increased climate action ambition from policy implementation and integration.
Result_Title: Low-carbon and green growth guidelines, models, and data visualization tool proposed and submitted for government adoption (DNP and MADS)
Description: Data Visualization Tool to enhance the capacity of DNP and other governmental management teams to make evidence-based decisions centered on the progress of low carbon national and international agendas including the GGP, post-COVID green recovery, and Agenda 2030. It will be based on the inclusive Green Growth Index and will be designed and functional for use by national and regional decision-making teams. This Output includes 1 guideline document and 1 data visualization tool for enhancing low carbon and green growth national and regional decision-making teams.

Project: Accelerating development of new bioeconomy businesses and enhanced capacities for green jobs promotion and increased climate action ambition from policy implementation and integration.
Result_Title: Training sessions with different representatives from DNP, MADS, and other key stakeholders regarding the use of the Data Visualization Tool
Description:
Technical assistance will be delivered to municipalities and departments on using the Data Visualization Tool, which will be based on the inclusive Green Growth Index and will be designed and functional for use by national and regional decision-making teams. This output is intended to enhance the capacity of DNP and other governmental management teams to make evidence-based decisions centered on the progress of low carbon national and international agendas including the GGP, post-COVID green recovery, and Agenda 2030. 
The duration of training is two hours per session. Around 5 sessions with the target audience will be needed. The number of attendees per session will be 10 (overall will be 50).

Project: Accelerating development of new bioeconomy businesses and enhanced capacities for green jobs promotion and increased climate action ambition from policy implementation and integration.
Result_Title: Three new technical capacity building programs fully developed with SENA for low-carbon development targeting highly demanded technical skills in key Green Growth sectors
Description: Three (3) new low-carbon technical capacity building programmes fully developed with SENA for future green jobs promotion and consolidation. They will consider sectorial perspectives and demands in new technical expertise in energy efficiency, bioeconomy, and reforestation.

Project: Expanding the Colombian Climate Asset Disclosure Initiative (CCADI)
Result_Title: Money owners assessment report
Description:
The assessment report will identify the gaps and barriers that money owners have regarding climate smart investments, providing a baseline context that contributes to develop a communication strategy and an action plan that incentivise money owners to demand more sustainable financial products and to include climate change risks and opportunities in their financial decisions.
This output is expected to expand the impact of CCADI to a larger set of stakeholders in the financial system, thus supporting the awareness of climate smart investments in money owners.
Money owners of the Colombian Financial System, who will receive this through the communication strategy, include money savers, consumers, insurance buyers, pension contributors, etc.

Project: Expanding the Colombian Climate Asset Disclosure Initiative (CCADI)
Result_Title: Recommendations Report on climate smart practices by government credit institutions
Description:
Research on how Public Credit Institutions (Bancóldex, FDN, Fogafin, etc.)  align with the Paris Agreement (Art. 2.1.C) and address climate change issues within their operations and investments. 
The recommendations report will allow to diagnose and promote the implementation of the TCFD recommendations  the above financial institutions.
Recommendations will be delivered to Public Credit financial institutions (i.e. Bancoldex, Fogafin, FDN, Findeter, Finagro, etc.). Recommendations to close gaps between Paris Agreement regulations and public/private financial institutions, will be delivered to Superfinanciera (SFC) and Ministry of Finance (MHCP).

Project: Expanding the Colombian Climate Asset Disclosure Initiative (CCADI)
Result_Title: 1 op-ed published in mainstream media to help mobilize public opinion
Description: 1 op-ed published in mainstream media will help mobilize public opinion around the issue to contribute to climate change awareness and skill enhancement to a broader set of stakeholders. It is targeted to a broader public and money owners within the Colombian financial system.

Project: Preparing the public and financial sector for CTR: Capacity building and call to action
Result_Title: Webinars to disseminate results of the project and motivate stakeholders to manage climate transition risks
Description:
2 webinars with 40 attendees, each in which progress and results of the project are communicated to a broader audience including leaders of public and financial sector entities participating in the project as well as other stakeholders interested in replicating the experience.
Targeted at Fasecolda, Asobancaria and their associates. Superfinanciera, DNP, MADS, Banco de la República, as well as other stakeholders interested in building upon the progress of the project to replicate or scale up.

Project: Preparing the public and financial sector for CTR: Capacity building and call to action
Result_Title: Graduation event to present the results of the project and grant certificates to participants of the CTR course
Description: Graduation event (face-to-face or virtual depending on the COVID-19 situation) presenting the results of the project, a panel with key project participants (public institutions and financial sector representatives), and handing out certificates for participants of the course.

Project: Preparing the public and financial sector for CTR: Capacity building and call to action
Result_Title: Report on the transition risk assessment of investors’ portfolios
Description:
This output consists of two pieces of research: (1) Scenario analysis and stress testing of Colombian insurers investment portfolios using 2DIIs methodology and (2) in-depth portfolio risk assessment and development of risk management strategies for one Colombian insurance company using CPIs methodology.

It is targeted to:
-Fasecolda and insurance companies (e.g. Sura), banks and financial institutions like Bancolombia.
-Public sector institutions (Superfinanciera, DNP, BanRep, MADS, etc)

Project: Preparing the Road to Zero-emission Urban Mobility in Colombian Cities: Accelerating Electric Bus Adoption
Result_Title: Network established to foster better coordination at the national level
Description: WRI and CEW will collaborate with national-level NGOs and government ministries, to create a space for dialogue and coordinate different agendas towards a more cohesive national EV plan. Specific coordination channels and/or areas of collaboration will be noted in an MOU, signed by various national-level stakeholders. Beneficiaries who will be part of the network include national-level government (such as planning, transporting, finance ministries) and other national-level stakeholders (such as GIZ, IDB, WWF, and other NGOs).

Project: Preparing the Road to Zero-emission Urban Mobility in Colombian Cities: Accelerating Electric Bus Adoption
Result_Title: Communications products created to disseminate the guidebook to other transit agencies and to the general public (TBD)
Description: Communications strategy which can include articles, blogs, and/or other deliverables to disseminate the key lessons from the guidebook. This is needed to scale the impact of the project past the immediate beneficiaries. Specific products will be defined within the strategy. These communication products will be widely disseminated, but they will be targeted specifically towards officials in other Colombian cities (primary target) and towards other secondary beneficiaries. These targeted audience may include transit agency employees focusing on procurement, financing, or operations; city staff such as within the department of transportation or mayor's office; or technical experts at local universities or NGOs.

Project: Preparing the Road to Zero-emission Urban Mobility in Colombian Cities: Accelerating Electric Bus Adoption
Result_Title: Recommendations proposed to help cities plan for e-bus procurement
Description: Recommendations and expert guidance on actions to initiate and increase the procurement of electric buses. Recommendations to be provided at meetings between WRI and city officials, and will be needed to help guide policymakers towards viable, actionable, and time-bound electrification plans. Each of the three target cities will receive recommendations. The Transportation Ministry and other relevant national-level stakeholders will also receive these recommendations, for their edification.

Project: Business case development for Sector Job Resilience Planning in support of Just Transition in South Africa (Mpumalanga)
Result_Title: 2-day workshop on South Africa's Just Transition Social Protection Plan
Description: 2-day workshop to disseminate information to key decision-makers about the existing skills in the coal phase-out regions, and to discuss opportunities for skills diversification, matching, and the proposed social protection plan.

Project: Steering the Colombian Road Freight Sector Towards a Zero Emissions Strategy GIRO-ZERO
Result_Title: Academic working papers on the adoption of green technologies and practices in the Colombian Road Freight Sector
Description:
Two (2) academic papers based on the outputs and outcomes of this project, targeting top transport and logistics journals including Transport Science, Transport Research Part A/B/D/E, International Journal of Physical Distribution & Logistics, and Journal of Business Logistics. 
The purpose of this outcome will enhance the academic and industry knowledge on sustainable Road Freight Transport that will naturally influence academic and industry community in Colombia on matters related to the remit of this project.

Project: Steering the Colombian Road Freight Sector Towards a Zero Emissions Strategy GIRO-ZERO
Result_Title: Final GIRO Zero project report
Description:
The final project report will give an overview and summary of the all main project findings. 
This includes summaries of all trainings, seminars and workshops, as well as of the draft version of the academic papers.
The final section of the report will present a reflection on the future challenges and an outlook on the future evolution and possible agenda of the Giro Zero project.
Targeted to: Min. Transporte, DNP, COLFECAR, ANDI, RFT and logistics operators, MADS, UPME, stakeholders from other countries, academics, and auctioneers.

Project: Steering the Colombian Road Freight Sector Towards a Zero Emissions Strategy GIRO-ZERO
Result_Title: Recommendations for policy makers on policy/legislation for reducing emissions in Road Freight Transport operations
Description:
As part of developing Best Practices Guides for the RFT sector, recommendations will be delivered to the Ministry of Transport (Min Transporte), Ministry of Environment (MADS) and Dept. of National Planning (DNP). The recommendations will include:
1. Propose strategies for monitoring and enhancing the green credentials of truck fleets and Road Freight Transport operations in Colombia.
2. Propose changes for policy/legislation.
It is expected that with the recommendations:
a) DNP will be able to define, recommend and promote public and economic policy aimed at monitoring and enhancing the green credentials of truck fleets and Road Freight Transport operations in Colombia.
b) Ministry of Transport will be enabled to develop sustainable projects and implement green freight policies aimed at equipping the Colombian Road Freight Transport sector with cleaner vehicles and easing the implementation of the best practices recommended by the project.

Project: Steering the Colombian Road Freight Sector Towards a Zero Emissions Strategy GIRO-ZERO
Result_Title: Scenario simulator
Description: This is a tool that will be available to project stakeholders and beneficiaries, and will allow them to build and simulate scenarios regarding the adoption of green logistics innovations within their logistics networks. Specific innovations that we will include in this tool are logistic planning, vehicle, and fuel technologies. The tool will take into account operational and financial restrictions, as well as policy and regulation.

Project: Steering the Colombian Road Freight Sector Towards a Zero Emissions Strategy GIRO-ZERO
Result_Title: Online repository of project outputs, including the Sustainable Performance Index, KPI dashboard, scenario simulator, cost estimations, case-studies, and roadmaps
Description:
The repository will be hosted in a public website/on-line platform that will encompass the collection of evidence that will be derived from the project along with the tools developed during the project. This repository will support project’s stakeholders in establishing priorities that fit better the realities and localities. Hence, they will be better equipped for monitoring and enhancing the green credentials of truck fleets and Road Freight Transport operations in Colombia. 
It will be shared with: Ministry of Transport (Min. Transporte), DNP, COLFECAR, ANDI, and trucking companies.

Project: Steering the Colombian Road Freight Sector Towards a Zero Emissions Strategy GIRO-ZERO
Result_Title: Workshops with key project stakeholders on gap analysis and agenda setting
Description:
3 workshops (one per region) and 3 seminars (one per region) (2 hours-long each) that will focus on sharing and understanding key stakeholders (primarily from the associations), defining current gaps and possible agendas for future and green logistics strategies in the RFT. 
Total number of attendees of workshops (sum of the three): minimum of 30 people.
Total number of attendees to seminar (sum of the three): minimum of 60 people.

Project: Steering the Colombian Road Freight Sector Towards a Zero Emissions Strategy GIRO-ZERO
Result_Title: KPI dashboard
Description: This is an online tool that will allow the stakeholders to visualize a set of energy, emission, and operation related KPIs or metrics. The data generated by this tool will be used by road freight Road Freight Companies and logistics operators to monitor the environmental performance of their fleets and inform their decision making on the planning and execution of their logistic networks.

Project: Steering the Colombian Road Freight Sector Towards a Zero Emissions Strategy GIRO-ZERO
Result_Title: Four best practice case studies in the RFT Sector
Description: Four (4) case studies that will address the four dimensions of actions of the project (fleet configuration, fleet management, safe and efficient driving, and optimized logistics) and will synthesize best practices in Colombia and the UK in terms of industry emissions reductions strategies. The case studies will help beneficiaries and stakeholders to learn about implemented solutions. Thus, the case will underline the feasibilities of change in the road freight sector.

Project: Steering the Colombian Road Freight Sector Towards a Zero Emissions Strategy GIRO-ZERO
Result_Title: Capacity building workshops and seminars to train key stakeholders in the state-of-the-art industry practices and on project results
Description:
These seminars and workshops will provide training to key stakeholders (primarily the associations contributing to the project) so that they could transfer this knowledge to the rest of their members. These activities are designed to train the trainers, and those trainers will be the project ambassadors. 
This purpose will be to enhance the skills and capabilities of decision makers within the Colombian Road Freight Transport sector and indirectly have an influence on the three project objectives below: 
1. Close the gap between COP21 targets and the current credentials of the Colombian Road Freight Transport sector by determining the feasibility of the adoption of green practices within the sector. 
2. Develop a strategic business plan for the acquisition and operation of low-emission truck fleets. 
3. Propose strategies for monitoring and enhancing the green credentials of truck fleets and Road Freight Transport operations in Colombia.

Total of 14 workshops at 2 hours each with a minimum total participation of 360 people.
This will also result in a total of 6 seminars at 2 hours each with a minimum total participation of 120 people.
Topics include:
Workshop A: Best practices in green logistics innovation for industry (minimum of 20 participants, in-person workshops in 3 regions)
Workshop B: Best practices in green logistics operation for industry (minimum 20 participants, in-person workshops in 3 regions) 
Workshop C: Key Performance indicators and measurements for industry (minimum 20 participants, in-person workshops in 3 regions)
Workshop D: Lessons learned and possibilities for green logistics in Colombia for industry (minimum 20 participants, in-person workshops in 3 regions)
Workshop E: Elements and proposals for regulations, policies and strategies for zero emissions logistics (one for public and one for private sector, minimum 60 participants, hybrid). 
Seminar A (one for private and one for public sector): Green Logistics Management (for public and private sector (minimum 20 participants, hybrid)
Seminar B (one for private and one for public sector): Decision-making in Green Logistics Management (for public and private sector, minimum 20 participants, hybrid)
Seminar C (one for private and one for public sector): Policies and regulation (for public and private sector, minimum 20 participants, hybrid)

Project: Steering the Colombian Road Freight Sector Towards a Zero Emissions Strategy GIRO-ZERO
Result_Title: Strategic business plan to identify feasible and impactful green practices applicable to the Colombia Road Freight Transport sector
Description: The strategic business plan will demonstrate the feasibility of the implementation of best practices identified at Phase 1 according to their impact on CO2 emissions reduction and cost. Purpose: Close the gap between COP21 targets and the current credentials of the Colombian Road Freight Transport sector by facilitating the adoption of clean technologies and practices.

Project: Steering the Colombian Road Freight Sector Towards a Zero Emissions Strategy GIRO-ZERO
Result_Title: Roadmap towards a zero-emissions Road Freight Transport sector
Description: The Roadmap will provide the stakeholders a recommended plan to enable significant reduction in CO2 emissions in Colombia Road Freight Transport sector by providing useful information for future decisions, strategies, and actions. Purpose: Recommendations to close the gap between COP21 targets and the current credentials of the Colombian Road Freight Transport sector by determining the feasibility of the adoption of green practices within the sector.

Project: Steering the Colombian Road Freight Sector Towards a Zero Emissions Strategy GIRO-ZERO
Result_Title: Interactive toolbox that evaluates Road Freight Transport performance on green practices
Description:
Evaluation tools of Road Freight Transport performance accessible via a web-based platform, record of subscribers, and anonymised user-usage information.
The toolbox will allow actors to implement small trials/pilots and develop business aimed at monitoring and enhancing the green credentials of truck fleets and Road Freight Transport operations in Colombia, following best practices in other sector initiatives e.g. GiroLimpio.cl

Project: Steering the Colombian Road Freight Sector Towards a Zero Emissions Strategy GIRO-ZERO
Result_Title: Recommendations for industry association on strategies for reducing emissions in Road Freight Transport operations
Description:
As part of a Best Practices Guide, recommendations will be made to industry representatives such as COLFECAR, ANDI, Road Freight Transport and logistics operators, on the following:
1. Propose strategies for monitoring and enhancing the green credentials of truck fleets and Road Freight Transport operations in Colombia
2. Propose strategies for facilitating information sharing on the adoption of green technologies and practices
It is expected that with the recommendations associations will facilitate the implementation of small trials/pilots and business plans aimed at monitoring and enhancing the green credentials of truck fleets and Road Freight Transport operations in Colombia.

Project: Steering the Colombian Road Freight Sector Towards a Zero Emissions Strategy GIRO-ZERO
Result_Title: Sustainable Performance Index
Description: This is an integrated index that will be composed of set of indicators that consider economic and local societal conditions, environmental factors, and Road Freight Transport characteristics of the region under investigations. This tool will enable a better understanding of the negative impact of freight transport on Colombia’s environment, ensuring a comprehensive evaluation of RFT sustainability performance that is focused on local requirements and is measurable overtime.

Project: Greening the Colombian Financial System: Implementing local green definitions to enable long-term investment into priority sectors.
Result_Title: Fund structuring webinars
Description:
