Two (2) fund structuring webinars to engage with the sector and disseminate any developments to ensure the sustainability of the fund and financial instruments designed.
Targeted at MHCP.

Project: Deforestation-free Cocoa for the Amazon Piedmont
Result_Title: Awareness and Ownership Communication Strategy for Deforestation-free Cocoa
Description: The awareness and appropriation strategy implies the creation of multimedia content with key messages to position a deforestation-free Amazon cocoa among different audiences. The strategy will define the total number of publications in social media and press releases but it is expected to publish approximately 8 press releases (2 per each department and 2 at national level) and 50 publications in social media. Communication products will be disseminated over the duration of the project. Progress report on this output will be presented on 2021-Q4 and 2022-Q1.

Project: Deforestation-free Cocoa for the Amazon Piedmont
Result_Title: Strengthen a network on Amazonian deforestation-free cocoa that involves producers, public and private stakeholders, media and academia
Description:
The network on Amazonian deforestation-free cocoa will be strengthen through: 
1). Cocoa value chain meetings and 6 x 1-day working sessions:
Six 1-day working sessions (two for each department) with 10-12 cocoa farmers and individual meetings to assess the current status of cocoa crops in the prioritized municipalities and allow for an exchange of experiences among producers and other parties of the cocoa value chain in the Amazon piedmont. Cocoa farmers will also discuss alternatives for new arrangements taking into account local biodiversity, improving women's participation in the sector, and improving productivity. This will result in a strengthened network of local farmers based on a knowledge exchange of Amazon cocoa tree arrangements.
Expected completion date: 2021 Q2

2). Creation of strategic alliances with the media and academia to position Amazonian deforestation-free cocoa:
The awareness and appropriation strategy implies the creation of strategic alliances with the media and academia to promote and position Amazonian deforestation-free cocoa. In order to do this, alliances will be established through meetings and phone calls and in some cases, workshops. 
Expected date of completion: 2022 Q1, starting from 2021 Q3.

3). Stakeholder meetings to promote the adoption of the proposed MRV system and develop a plan for scaling up implementation:
Meetings with key stakeholders such as producer associations, territorial entities, environmental authorities, international organizations, governmental agencies, and other public-private actors that operate throughout the northern and western region of Guaviare to promote the adoption of the proposed MRV system for a deforestation-free cocoa. Furthermore, development of a plan for scaling up the implementation of the MRV system for deforestation-free cocoa in the Amazon Piedmont, which will be decided based on the results of the pilot set up early in the implementation of the project. 
Expected completion date: 2022 Q1, with quarterly progress updates from 2021 Q2.

Project: Operationalising Energy Performance Certificates in South Africa
Result_Title: Roadmap for replication and improving EPC compliant data collection for state- and privately-owned buildings
Description: The roadmap will incorporate lessons learned in process of collecting data and issuing EPC's, as per the previous output. It is envisaged that the roadmap will be an invaluable tool for assisting both private and public sector in obtaining EPCs for their buildings and, resultantly, being able to identify EE improvement opportunities that lead to both monetary and carbon savings

Project: Sustainable Tourism Enhancement Project - Phase 2: Boosting conservation and emissions reduction through tourism and technology
Result_Title: Conservation agreements amongst tourism organisations
Description:
20 conservation agreements signed between nature tourism organisations and Awake, which include the description of conservation commitments. Details depend on GIS analysis and monitoring results. 10 organisations out of the 20 that sign the conservation agreements are the same 10 organisations that will participate in an acoustic monitoring process.
Quarterly progress will be presented.

Project: Expanding the Colombian Climate Asset Disclosure Initiative (CCADI)
Result_Title: Recommendations report about target companies adherence to the TCFD recommendations
Description: Recommendation report to encourage listed companies to disclose information on climate-related risks and opportunities, and contribute to the implementation of TCFD by companies. It will contain an analysis of the adherence and gaps of TCFD recommendations of national and international listed companies with presence in Colombia, 78 disclosing to CDP and 30 non-disclosing to CDP.

Project: Expanding the Colombian Climate Asset Disclosure Initiative (CCADI)
Result_Title: Social media campaign to showcase infographics about climate change awareness
Description:
Three (3) infographics that contribute to climate change awareness and skill enhancement to a broader set of stakeholders will be published and shared through social media.
Progress to be presented in Q2, Q3, Q4 2021.

Project: Expanding the Colombian Climate Asset Disclosure Initiative (CCADI)
Result_Title: CCADI's recommendations for policy development for Colombian government institutions
Description:
Two (2) policy briefs to contribute to making all financial flows in Colombia consistent with the Paris Agreement and continue to expand its advocacy with public officials. There will be bilateral meetings to support the implementation of 2020 and 2021 policy briefs. From last years’ experience, the construction of the briefs is made by first having bilateral meetings with public official from the Department of National Planning (DNP), the Ministry of Finance and Public Credit (MHCP), the supervisor (SFC), the Ministry of Environment (MADS), and other stakeholders to identify possible topics that are strategic for the Covid-19 recovery and COP-26, as well as aligned with CCADI’s main objectives. Some of the topics identified and that could be used to write those policies are: financial sector's role on green recovery; fiduciary responsibility and changes in minimum return regulations, with the purpose of incentivizing green investments; recommendations for including the financial sector in DNP’s green growth mission; including the financial sector progress in Colombia’s NDC compliance and observation, as well as article 2.c.1 of the Paris Agreement; making policy recommendations to incentivize investors to use the information published by private companies in the country, and eventually promote sustainable investments. These topics will be evaluated once the bilateral meetings with public officials start, which can mean that they might suggest new topics or modify these new ones (under the objectives and outcomes of CCADI).
In 2021-Q3 the first out of the two policy briefs will be presented. Second policy brief will be presented in 2022-Q1

Project: Preparing the public and financial sector for CTR: Capacity building and call to action
Result_Title: Course on Climate Transition Risk (Two Modules)
Description:
1).Module I of Course - The principles and methodologies of climate transition risk: 80 professionals trained in CTR management for 12 hours of training. Out of the 80 people trained in Climate Transition Risk principles and methodologies, 70 will be professionals (30 representatives of public institutions, 40 representatives of private financial sector) and 10 professors of local universities for scale up.
Expected completion date: 2021 Q3

2) Module II of the Course- Applying Climate Transition Risk Management:
80 professionals trained in CTR management for 12 hours of training. This second module aims to develop a learning-by-doing course using the applied research carried out by CPI,CFS-Uniandes and 2DII in output 4. It will guide the 80 participants (described above) to design action plans for policy makers and projects for financial sector companies, in order to apply the tools and knowledge acquired through both modules of the course.
Expected completion date: 2022 Q1

Project: Adopting New Technology, Mindsets, and Practices to Transform Colombia’s Agricultural Sector
Result_Title: In-person technical support via field visits and clinics
Description:
Each farmer innovator will receive an average of 5 visits during the project. Visit 1: Soil sample collection process. Visit 2: Verification of compost process and how rainfall and temperature information is being gathered. Visit 3: Follow up on progress; assessment of agro-climatic information; support on specific challenges or opportunities. Visit 4: Follow up on implementation of fertilization plan; assessment of agro-climatic information; support on specific challenges or opportunities. Visit 5: Assessment of costs information and optimization plan; assessment of agro-climatic information; support on specific challenges or opportunities.
Quarterly progress will be presented.

Project: Accelerating high-quality growth in China’s Green Bond market and supporting post-COVID green economic recovery
Result_Title: Investor-focused capacity building webinar to China-based asset owners on green bond market trends and to promote taxonomy-based investment screening and disclosure
Description: Investor-focused capacity building workshops to China-based asset owners on green bond market trends and promote taxonomy-based investment screening and disclosure.The attendees are expected to be in the range of 50-60, and the workshops will last for 2-3 hours.

Project: Accelerating high-quality growth in China’s Green Bond market and supporting post-COVID green economic recovery
Result_Title: 1-day off-line workshop discussing green bond and sustainability bond standards, and a case study of innovative green debt instruments in facilitating sustainability action projects
Description: Collaborating with Tsinghua GFD Center to deliver an off-line training workshop on green bond and sustainability bond standards, the case study completed in Activity 2.2, and potentially Tsinghua’s work with the ISO on Sustainable Finance standardization.The number of attendees is expected to be around 80-100, and the workshops will last for half day to one day.

Project: Accelerating high-quality growth in China’s Green Bond market and supporting post-COVID green economic recovery
Result_Title: Report assessing the effectiveness and gaps of existing policies along with policy recommendations
Description: A report with a set of recommendations on how China’s central and local governments can further scale up the available financing for low-carbon transition through innovative and tailored policy incentives.

Project: Accelerating high-quality growth in China’s Green Bond market and supporting post-COVID green economic recovery
Result_Title: China Green Bond Market Annual Report 2020
Description: An annual report on the market development of the Chinese green bond market for 2020.

Project: Accelerating high-quality growth in China’s Green Bond market and supporting post-COVID green economic recovery
Result_Title: Side event in China Social Investment Forum week with the theme around Green bonds
Description: Side event in China SIF week with the theme around Green bonds, with the aim to build a community of “market movers” among China’s green bond practitioners through knowledge-sharing in terms of international standards and best practices, the development of green/thematic bonds market, and the green investment opportunties. The attendees are expected to be in the range of 50-60, and the workshops will last for 2-3 hours.

Project: Accelerating capital allocations to transition-aligned solutions through the UK-China ESG Leaders Forum
Result_Title: Recommendation report based on Asset Manager-Investor Engagement Framework pilot
Description: Asset Owners and Managers not participating in engagement pilot will be able to learn lessons from pilot participants. This will allow asset owners and asset managers to better engage with investee firms, holding them accountable on environmental, social, and governance issues. As part of the recommendations report, we will publish the framework used in pilot.

Project: Accelerating capital allocations to transition-aligned solutions through the UK-China ESG Leaders Forum
Result_Title: ESG Awareness Campaign and Roadshows (Shenzhen)
Description: Physical workshops will be conducted in key financial cities (Beijing, Shanghai,Shenzhen) to communicate the recommendations and lessons learnt with a wide range of Chinese financial institutions and relevant regulators.

Project: Capacity building for green investment and the Green Investment Principles (GIP)
Result_Title: Green Investment Principles annual report and recommendations
Description: An annual report with main findings on overall and individual progress, implementation gaps and options for further actions, including areas for capacity building. May include the potential for revising the principles (e.g. GIP 2.0) to better reflect the evolving BRI, performance and demand of the GIP members, as well as changes of standards and technical progress.
Implementor: Beijing Institute of Finance and Sustainability

Project: Capacity building for green investment and the Green Investment Principles (GIP)
Result_Title: Media campaign with publications featuring demand and supply of green finance capacity building in the key regions along the B&R
Description: Communications for both GIP and non-GIP members. Output will include improved websites for GIP and the GFLP, newsletters, regular updates on the contents, communication disseminated and other writeups post events. The above communications products will be reported quarterly.
Implementor: Beijing Institute of Finance and Sustainability

Project: Promoting green recovery by championing the power of disclosure, transparency and UK-China collaboration
Result_Title: Workshop to build knowledge and capacity of stakeholders on disclosure and TCFD alignment
Description: Three collaborative online/onsite workshops in Beijing, Shanghai and Guangzhou each to build skills of 300 stakeholders on environment disclosure in line with TCFD and to support the implementation of national/Shenzhen green finance policies.

Project: Promoting green recovery by championing the power of disclosure, transparency and UK-China collaboration
Result_Title: Engagement and capacity building of  corporates towards TCFD aligned disclosure
Description:
Engaging (emails, skype calls and face to face meetings) with 300 companies from high emission impact sectors to achieve 15% increase in the number of listed companies disclosing TCFD aligned information against 65 CDP respondents in 2020; and supporting FIs to manage their investment in these sectors.

This engagement and capacity building event will be held in each quarter.

Project: Promoting green recovery by championing the power of disclosure, transparency and UK-China collaboration
Result_Title: Chinese-UK Pilot group networked for exchange towards improved TCFD aligned disclosure
Description:
Establish Chinese-UK Pilot group of a minimum of 4 Chinese and 4 UK companies in environmental high impact industries to leverage learning and grow international dialogue towards quality disclosure aligned to TCFD and international standards.
Run 2 quarterly group webinars with UK companies to share knowledge with Chinese companies.

Project: Accelerating capital allocations to transition-aligned solutions through the UK-China ESG Leaders Forum
Result_Title: Workshops for Engagement Framework
Description: Three technical workshops for pilot participants to build their comfort level with the Stewardship Framework Pilot before implementing.We will aim for about 10 participants for each workshop

Project: Accelerating capital allocations to transition-aligned solutions through the UK-China ESG Leaders Forum
Result_Title: Report to Chinese regulators on how to scale ESG across asset classes for pensions and insurers
Description: Recommendations report delivered to Chinese regulators, underpinned by research and recommendations and incorporating their feedback. The report will include an index and roadmap for asset owners.

Project: Expanding the Colombian Climate Asset Disclosure Initiative (CCADI)
Result_Title: Ranking of institutional investors and accompanying report
Description:
Ranking published and accompanying report.
CCADI designs and updates the first climate change ranking for asset owners in Colombia with the purpose of creating an upward spiral of ambition among the industry players. With the purpose of increasing climate ambition among Colombian asset owners, the 2021 ranking will include not only pension funds and insurance companies, but also banks and private funds since these four beneficiaries are the largest asset owners in Colombia with assets under management of nearly USD 325.000 million, which is more than half of all assets in the Colombian financial system. In the past, the ranking has been a useful knowledge output for gathering information to better understand how each investor is managing climate change risks and opportunities increasing transparency of the financial sector.

Project: A contribution towards a Just Transition Finance Roadmap(JTFR) South Africa
Result_Title: Thought piece on Actions and Activities that can be undertaken in South Africa to increase corporate awareness, adoption and application of CRISA Plus principles related to a Just Transition
Description:
The think piece on corporate awareness on just transition financing will inform the roadmap and increase awareness across financial sector of the need to mobilise finance for Just Tranisition projects and what actions could be taken to support such mobilisation. The think piece aim will be to influence changes in corporate decision making.

This output is needed because the financial services sector to date has been paying lip service to CRISA and Just Transition principles, but on the ground implementation has not yet been meaningful. In addition, only a limited number of financial institutions have been involved in the Just Transition funding discourse and the hope is that the paper will increase industry participation in ongoing discussions.

Project: Business case development for Sector Job Resilience Planning in support of Just Transition in South Africa (Mpumalanga)
Result_Title: Capacity building technical assistance to Department of Environment, Forestry and Fisheries on coal sector diversification and early warning systems
Description: Ongoing engagements with DEFF to share knowledge and build their  capacity to uptake early warning information for decision making and on coal sector diversification options will result in alternative economic development in the Mpumalanga province

Project: Alternative Financing Models for Embedded Generation of Renewable Energy in South African Municipalities
Result_Title: Municipal Training programme and city-to-city learning exchange for Embedded Generation of Renewable Energy and Climate Finance
Description:
Relevant municipal officials will be identified by each municipality (most likely from the electricity, urban planning and infrastructure departments) (3-4 officials per municipality, a total of 12 - 16 people per session). It is preferred that the same officials from each municipality attends every training session as the training sessions will build on one another. The municipal training programme consists of 6 structured half-day online events where municipal officials will be trained on a variety of topics related to renewable energy, embedded generation, climate change, and climate finance. This is required to enhance the skills of municipal officials and build capacity for the implementation and replication of these projects. This training will predominantly be held virtually, with one in-person session.

An overview of the training sessions is provided below:
a. Session 1: An introduction to climate change, NDCs and the Just Transition
b. Session 2: A Just Transition approach to renewable energy planning in the South African context
c. Session 3: Gender considerations for renewable energy and climate change
d. Session 4 (3-day workshop): The importance of renewable energy embedded generation and its co-benefits; The principles of renewable energy embedded generation policy development; Strategic planning and renewable energy embedded generation policy: Goal setting, monitoring and evaluation, Energy data collection 
e. Session 5: Introduction to climate finance and an exploration of finance models for the renewable energy embedded generation projects
f. Session 6: Key considerations to undertake a pre-feasibility study for a renewable energy embedded generation project

Each session will be developed further once the capacity assessment is complete.

Project: City of Johannesburg Electric Vehicle Readiness Support
Result_Title: Urban Energy Network meeting focused on electric vehicles
Description: Host an Urban Energy Network meeting focusing on EV infrastructure needs, City-owned EV chargers as a new revenue stream and supporting the rollout of e-Taxis. Stakeholders to build on SEA's existing network, including SALGA, SACN and a range of local municipalities (including metros and secondary cities). Aims to disseminate the learnings and findings from the project to a wider audience, in order to encourage work on EV readiness in other local municipalities in the country.

Project: Harmonisation and capacity building for green finance in Belt and Road Investments
Result_Title: Recommendations report on the harmonisation of GIP and Green Development Guidance, and international best practice
Description: Two harmonisation workshops with more than 20 relevant participants each focusing on further development, alignment, and operationalisation of GIP and Green Development Guidance, with policy makers and key financial institutions. Involving these target groups in the process, and providing the recommendations, will encourage stakeholders to adopt feasible and suitable approaches to mitigate climate change and reduce CO2 emissions in their investments and projects.

Project: Technical assistance for the implementation of emergent design for active mobility and public space
Result_Title: Sustainable urban mobility policy diagnosis and recommendations
Description:
15 diagnosis and recommendations reports (one for each local government) will be developed through a survey for each city based on indicators on the current state of the sustainable urban mobility policies in Mexico, as well as specific recommendations with targeted actions to improve mobility, climate, and environmental policies.  
The output will develop from June to September, and will delivered in September.

Project: Technical assistance for the implementation of emergent design for active mobility and public space
Result_Title: Digital publication summarising implementation process, evaluation of pop-up infrastructure, and lessons learned from each city
Description:
A digital publication summarising the following information: 
(1) Description of the implementation process
(2) Lessons learned from each city
The output will develop on December 2021 to February 2022, and it will be delivered in February 2022.

Project: Accelerating Fleet-wide electrification of public transport in Mexico City
Result_Title: Financial model for electromobility for Metrobus System
Description: Based on existing financial models (C40 for Line 3), updated financial model to assess financing options for the electrification of Metrobus Lines 1, 5, and Periferico, with sensitivity analysis
Implementor: Dalberg Advisors (Asesores en Desarrollo Dalberg S. de R.L.)

Project: Technical assistance for developing sustainable energy access strategies in Mexico
Result_Title: Policymaker's handbook on sustainable energy access programs
Description: 200 field visits to off-grid communities, data collected and processed, and 1 handbook developed. The handbook will encompass the information collected through field visits and workshops that can be used by policymakers to implement sustainable energy access programs.
Implementor: Ilumexico (Eres Energía Renovable SAPI de CV)

Project: Building the Green Hydrogen Economy (GHE) Just Energy Transition: Co-creating a Just Labour Transition through the TVET College System in South Africa
Result_Title: Handout on Anticipatory Governance for disruptive technologies, including the impact of the green hydrogen economy
Description: This Handout on Anticipatory Governance for disruptive technologies seeks to provide a framework which enables government stakeholders to better anticipate and harness new technologies that support the development of a GHE. It also provides a strong evidence-base for partnership creation across government, industry and training institutions to facilitate a JET and JLT within a green economy paradigm.

Project: Promoting green recovery by championing the power of disclosure, transparency and UK-China collaboration
Result_Title: A record of key dialogue  issues aired  among key stakeholders
Description:
Facilitated dialogue with  key policy stakeholders at key CDP events, including CDP China annual report launch event, training workshops and CDP side events at COP26. The dialogue will bring together key players at national and sub national level that have influence on FI and corporate disclosure and reporting landscapes. Participants will share information, express a common voice on areas of mutual interest. The dialogue will aim to promote greater coherence and consistency and develop practical ways to bring alignment to the direction, content and ongoing development of reporting frameworks, standards and related requirements. A record of key issues aired will be recorded and extended across the dialogue sessions.

These events will be held in Beijing in Q2, Shanghai in Q3 and at COP 26 in Q4

Project: A contribution towards a Just Transition Finance Roadmap(JTFR) South Africa
Result_Title: Financing Roadmap Steering Committee
Description: Partnerships/Networks created especially between project developers and stakeholders and financiers, through an established steering committee, consisting of members from: Eskom, National Treasury, National Business Initiative, Labour (Congress of South African Trade Unions, National Labour and Economic Development Institute - NALEDI, National Union of Metalworkers of South Africa - NUMSA), Standard Bank, Industrial Development Corporation of South Africa, and Department of Environment, Forestry and Fisheries)

Project: Business case development for Sector Job Resilience Planning in support of Just Transition in South Africa (Mpumalanga)
Result_Title: Biomass Feasibility Report
Description: A report assessing the feasibility of developing a biomass project in the Mpumalanga province (Nkangala District) as part of the Low-carbon Just Energy Transition plan for the mining, timber, pulp and paper sectors. This will include a biomass mapping and energy demand assessment, stakeholder engagement to determine energy conversion compatibility, and a techno-economic feasibility study and MUCP tool development.

Project: Building the Green Hydrogen Economy (GHE) Just Energy Transition: Co-creating a Just Labour Transition through the TVET College System in South Africa
Result_Title: Two policy briefings on key recommendations for industry focused TVET training on GHE
Description:
Two policy briefs providing recommendations on:
1. how the DHET and TVET college system could be better capacitated to offer GHE skills training that is aligned with industry needs and secure GHE jobs pipeline
2. the disruptive impact of the GHE on existing skills to enable interventions for a just skills transition

Project: Action Plan for Electrification of Two Wheelers in Jakarta
Result_Title: Report of broader two wheeler landscape in Greater Jakarta
Description:
A report will be produced on the current motorcycle landscape in Greater Jakarta, and issues arising from public reliance on conventional motorcycles including GESI issues will be identified. Also, the report will underpin the benefits and challenges of phasing out conventional motorcycles and highlight the importance of transitioning ride-hailing fleets to electric as one of the first measures to encourage wider adoption of electric motorcycles.
The output will take the form of a series of documents that will be produced as milestones:
1. Report document of current two wheeler landscape, and benefits and challenges for electrification.
2. Documentation of benchmarking analysis from other countries such as China and India on the electrification of TNC and motorcycles
3. GESI workshop report and GESI document

Project: Enhanced TCFD aligned transparency for an economically and environmentally resilient financial system in Brazil
Result_Title: Webinar to discuss the TCFD Readiness Report for top 100 listed Brazilian companies
Description: This output is a webinar during which the companies will have the opportunity to ask questions about the content of the report and also to complete a poll regarding how useful they found the content.

Project: Institutional Capacity Building Framework Program to accelerate adoption of electric mobility in public transport in India
Result_Title: Training of Trainers of Academic and Training Institutions
Implementor: Research Triangle Institute Global India Private Limited

Project: Institutional Capacity Building Framework Program to accelerate adoption of electric mobility in public transport in India
Result_Title: Kakinada E-rickshaws Scheme Designed
Description:
This output aims to create a scheme and a report that will contain an assessment of the current situation of electromobility in Kakinada. The report (pdf format) will include the following:
1. Study of the existing regulatory, operating and financing mechanism including the best practices of State(s) Electric Vehicle Policies.
2. Focus group discussion with the ecosystem of government officials (city and transport permit regulators and elected reps), commuters (age and gender), MSME operators, e rickshaw manufacturers/ product providers, banking and financing institutions
3. Challenges mitigating measures identified.
4. Assessment of the demand and supply side of fleet including charging infrastructure and energy requirement and business structure.
As part of this output, RTI will develop a business structure and financial model to identify challenges and mitigation measures taken by the banking and financial institutions.
Implementor: Research Triangle Institute Global India Private Limited

Project: Institutional Capacity Building Framework Program to accelerate adoption of electric mobility in public transport in India
Result_Title: Training for Entrepreneurs Interested in E-mobility
Description: This output will focus on the supply side of e-mobility and provide specific training to entrepreneurs and businesses interested in establishing and or expanding products, equipment, services and solutions. This training output will cover 3 modules that will be delivered 2 times during the year (for a total of 6 training sessions targeting 100 participants in total).  The training will  focus on upgraded and refined modules on how to establish and thrive in the e-vehicle industry, key technological advents and the fundamentals of commercial and financial ethics of the upkeep of the business.
Implementor: Research Triangle Institute Global India Private Limited

Project: Greening Agri Finance in Brazil, mainstreaming low carbon and gender inclusive interventions in Plano Safra to transform Brazil’s agriculture and livestock sectors
Result_Title: Crosscutting outreach, engagement, and dissemination of consolidated learnings on the value of socioenvironmental metrics
Description: This output works alongside all outputs above to engage primary and secondary beneficiaries in order to legitimise outputs with widespread consensus (in particular outputs 1 and 2), enhance this project’s additionality, disseminate its results, induce the widespread adoption of outputs among primary and secondary beneficiaries and therefore lead to a transformational impact within and beyond this project’s lifetime. This output includes bi-weekly steering group meetings with Banco do Brasil and MAPA, multi-lateral meetings with wider stakeholders and a monthly email bulletin to secondary beneficiaires (other Financial Institutions).

Project: Mainstreaming Climate Risk Assessment in Credit Operations of Brazilian Development Banks
Result_Title: Climate scenario analysis application in DBs loan book portfolio in Brazil
Description: This knowledge product will be composed by the results of the climate scenarios modelling for the primary beneficiaries’ (BNDES and BDMG) credit operation assessment and portfolio stress testing- “pilot projects”. At least 2 economic sectors of analysis will be selected for the pilots together with the primary beneficiaries. The criteria may favour vulnerable sectors to both physical and transition climate risks and low carbon sectors for Brazilian medium to long-term economic context. Having the economic sectors selected, the most relevant climate impacts can be inferred and the linkages between climate risks and credit metrics built. The output will be in the form of an executive presentation (PPT).
Implementor: Waycarbon Solucoes Ambientais e Projetos de Carbono LTDA

Project: Mainstreaming Climate Risk Assessment in Credit Operations of Brazilian Development Banks
Result_Title: Developing a tool for climate-risk assessment in DBs
Description: The tool for scenario analysis and stress testing will work as a pilot platform that combines physical and transition risks for the pre-selected economic sectors. From streamlined data inputs from borrowers and lending portfolio, the tool’s output will include climate risks heatmap and high-level KPIs on borrowers' revenues and how this could affect the probability of Default and Loan-to-Value ratios at borrowers and portfolio level. The tool is the key technical instrument to support DBs in assessing climate risks and opportunities, so they can evaluate and manage the financial and strategic impacts on their portfolios and strategies, and produce functional disclosures. With regards to the project outcomes, the tool has the potential to be a landmark for the local financial sector - the first bottom-up tool for transition and physical risk assessment and stress testing analysis for DBs. The tool will be in a Excel format and will be delivered to BNDES and BDMG.
Implementor: Waycarbon Solucoes Ambientais e Projetos de Carbono LTDA

Project: Greening Finance in Argentina to Combat Climate Change and Promote Inclusion
Result_Title: Presentation of the report at COP26
Description: This output will consist in presenting the report on climate risk and stranded assets at COP26 and coordination of the event. The purpose is to increase awareness of Argentina's contribution to the international green finance discussions among policymakers, the financial community and civil society.
Implementor: Carbon Trust Mexico S.A. de C.V.

Project: Technical assistance for the implementation of emergent design for active mobility and public space
Result_Title: Digital platform with tools for local governments
Description:
Digital platform for local governments will be develop with tools such as (1) training videos, (2) formats, (3) road traffic signaling library, (4) supplier catalog, (5) parametric costs calculator, and (6) witness stories of change, as well as other inputs that lead local governments in the implementation process.
The output will develop during 2021 and delivered on July (1st version) and September (final version).

Project: Harnessing Green Finance through Climate-related Risk Management and Opportunities in Malaysia
Result_Title: White paper on climate-related risk analysis for financial institutions
Description: A white paper on climate-related risk analysis for financial institutions will be developed to provide guidance on practical steps that financial institutions can take to address climate-related risks, including working with corporate clients in high carbon sectors for better data disclosure among others. The findings from the scenario analysis and stress testing (subject to consent of the beneficiary / banks) in the white paper will provide insights for and encourage other financial institutions to consider implementing key recommendations on climate risk management including conducting scenario analysis and stress testing in Malaysia as well as other markets in ASEAN. The white paper will be published in WWF and 2DII's websites.

Project: Strategy and Action Plan for Electrification of Public Transport and Intermediate Public Transport in the Indian Cities
Result_Title: Baseline Diagnostic Study Report
Description: This output is a baseline diagnostic study report. The objective is to produce a review of international experiences and business models for implementing electric mobility initiatives, especially from developing countries in the world. It seeks to outline the key barriers and specific concerns of different user groups including low-income and women groups. The report is essential as it acts as a base for the development of action plan and strategy for case cities.

Project: Development of an EV Financing Tool and Business Model to Enable the Scaling up of EV Uptake
Result_Title: Pilot EV Financing Tool for Bangladesh
Description: This output will consist in developing a pilot EV financing product and an associated outreach model for supporting the uptake of EVs. This will draw on an assessment of the current demand for EVs amongst MSMEs and the barriers to increased uptake, and identify key areas of support and appropriate business models to overcome these. It will deliver an EV Financing Tool for financing, funding and procurement that could be supported by FIs in Bangladesh and that will enable MSMEs to access appropriate financing for EV expansion.

Project: Development of an EV Financing Tool and Business Model to Enable the Scaling up of EV Uptake
Result_Title: Engagement Workshop on EV Financing Tool and findings
Description: An Engagement Workshop will be hosted by the MSME-FI Platform (see Output 5) following bilateral engagement to scope and prioritise suitable delivery and implementation mechanisms for the proposed EV Financing Tool. The workshop is aimed to be conducted during October 2021 (specific dates will be provided later on Q3). The MSME-FI Platform would include the participating FIs from the FIWG and the 30 MSMEs selected to be recipients of the business support services. It is anticipated that the engagement with the Government of Bangladesh will be through the Principal Coordinator on SDG Affairs at the Prime Minister’s Office of the Government of Bangladesh.

Project: Development of an EV Financing Tool and Business Model to Enable the Scaling up of EV Uptake
Result_Title: Financial Institutions Survey Report
Description: The survey questionnaire will focus on gathering quantitative and qualitative information on the type of financial products that is available for MSMEs –and if there are any financial products for financing EVs, an appreciation of the financing needs for MSMEs, securitisation mechanisms in different products, etc. The survey will be used to establish a baseline for EV financing options available for MSMEs in Bangladesh; explore challenges related to MSME financing faced by FIs; and identify key lessons from current financing mechanisms and delivery models for EV financing for MSMEs. The survey report will be delivered as a word and pdf document.

Project: Development of an EV Financing Tool and Business Model to Enable the Scaling up of EV Uptake
Result_Title: Establishment of the FIWG and the MSME-FI Engagement Platform
Description: This output is key in ensuring engagement between two key beneficiaries of the programme, as well as to foster ownership of the programme outputs among the beneficiaries. The Engagement platform will consist of a summary of proceeding from the FIWG and the MSMEs-Fi Engagement Forum, some of these summaries will be annexed in Output 1. In specific: communication from and between the FIWG and Development Partners, and e-commitments for the formation of the FIWG and MSME-FI Engagement Forum (MFEF). These meetings/sessions could include detailed discussion on EV-enabled and EV-based business cases as well as key enablers to allow MSMEs to scale up business solutions around EVs. An additional form of evidence on the usefulness of this output would be reported under the project team’s MEL reports demonstrating linkages between discussions at these sessions and eventual financing application approvals from FIs. Three sessions are planned during the months of June, August, and November. The list of participants is yet to be confirmed.

Project: Building Capacity and an Action Plan to Scale up Transjakarta E buses
Result_Title: Comprehensive action plan to significantly scale up electrification of Transjakarta e-bus fleet
Description: This output will be a roadmap for scaling up electrification of Transjakarta e-bus fleet. This includes an electric bus and charging infrastructure technical specification document, phased procurement plan, investment plan, and operational, charging  and maintenance requirement. The Action Plan will be delivered as a single Word and pdf document.

Project: Building Capacity and an Action Plan to Scale up Transjakarta E buses
Result_Title: Policy recommendations for national and local policymakers to ensure the sustainability of EV in public transport fleet from business, energy, and operations aspects
Description: This output will help to address missing policies for public transport electrification deployment. It will include a review of the current documents and identify policy gaps (including fiscal and non-fiscal policy incentives) and stakeholders responsibilities, such as the responsibilities of the Coordinating Ministry of Maritime and Investment, Government of Jakarta, Transjakarta, State Power Company, charging infrastructure companies, etc. It will develop policy recommendations for supporting the electrification of the Jakarta bus fleet. The document will benefit mainly the policymakers, both on city- and national-level, as a reference document to develop a policy package in support of public transit fleet electrification. A local e-mobility task force and working mechanism for advancing the policy recommendations will be set up and a stakeholder consultation event will be conducted to verify the findings mentioned above.

Project: Accelerating Green Finance Flows Through the Strengthening of the Mexican National Banking and Securities Commission (CNBV)
Result_Title: 2 ESG Climate Reports and 3 webinars
Description: Disseminate 2 Communication Reports and 3 webinars to share best practices, experiences and guidelines on ESG standars and climate risks.  Facilitate virtual mechanisms to openly share international best practices, experiences and know-how on ESG standards and climate-related risk among different stakeholders. These products are needed to share key messages to the sector towards greening the financial system; hence, influencing and bolstering efforts of actors towards acting on integration and disclosure of ESG standards and climate-related risks.

Project: Technical assistance for the implementation of emergent design for active mobility and public space
Result_Title: Training webinars and feedback sessions through the “Mobility Projects Office” program with decision makers from other local governments and non-governmental stakeholders
Description:
4 training webinars and feedback sessions through the “Mobility Projects Office” program with decision makers from other local governments and non-governmental stakeholders (2.5 hours maximum each session) on the following topics (240 trained attendants): 
(1) Design and implementation process of emerging infrastructures in collaboration with Ciudad Emergente (1 day)
(2) Leave No One Behind in the context of urban design and public policies for sustainable mobility in collaboration with Centro para la Sostenibilidad Urbana (1 day)
(3) Active mobility to combat Climate Change in collaboration with WWF (1 day)
(4) Road safety in collaboration with Estrategia Misión Cero  (1 day)
The output will develop during May and June, and it will be delivered from July to October.

Project: Consolidation of the Mexican Climate Finance Hub - mobilizing resources to mitigation and adaptation activities and achieve Mexico´s emission reduction goals
Result_Title: Presentation of the Mexican Green Investment Plan at COP26
Description: The team will hold a presentation of the document in a side-event at COP26 in Glasgow (either official side event or unofficial). The event will include the participation of a CCFV representative, a co-president, INECC, and representatives from BEIS. A detailed report of the presentation will be produced.

Project: Paving the Way for Setting Ambitious GHG Emissions Reductions in the Private Sector to enhance the National Climate Change Policy
Result_Title: Establish a 'Community of Practice (CP)' for 10-15 Mexican companies and key private sector associations
Description: Build a Community of Practice for 10-15 Mexican companies and key private sector associations. The CP aims to enable the increase of private sector knowledge on corporate climate action based on science, and foster their networks to set science based targets. They will ultimately mainstream the concept in their own value chains, of which many are comprised by a large number of SMEs. The CP also aims to prepare the private sector to adapt to changing regulatory and business environments, demanding more accountability and climate action.

Project: Paving the Way for Setting Ambitious GHG Emissions Reductions in the Private Sector to enhance the National Climate Change Policy
Result_Title: 2-4 case studies of the CSM-supported companies
Description: 2-4 case studies of the CSM-supported companies highlighting the benefits of setting science-based targets, the chosen routes to achieve them, and a call to action to the private sector in Mexico to strengthen the national goals and policies.

Project: Paving the Way for Setting Ambitious GHG Emissions Reductions in the Private Sector to enhance the National Climate Change Policy
Result_Title: Final report with insights and lessons learned from the project
Description: A report that will contain the guidelines to integrate the SBTi into the national policy, the lessons learned and example case studies to share with the stakeholders, government institutions and private sector in Mexico (CNBV, SEMARNAT, PROFEPA, SE & Consortium Partners Members).

Project: Paving the Way for Setting Ambitious GHG Emissions Reductions in the Private Sector to enhance the National Climate Change Policy
Result_Title: Technical assistance to 4 Mexican companies to pilot the Corporate Support Model (CSM)
Description: A Corporate Support Model (CSM) to facilitate the setting of SBTs for Mexican companies aimed to be replicated after the completion of the project. The CSM will be tested with 4 carefully selected companies consisting of a more in-depth advisory role including key staff training sessions, assessment of their GHG inventories, and advice on target setting models and options. One-to-one meetings with companies to 1) explain the SBTi framework and the benefits of science-based target-setting and to 2) define the objectives, scope and timeline of the support model.

Project: Expanding sustainable infrastructure network for electric vehicles in urban transportation modes
Result_Title: Macro planning exercise report
Description:
The report will be three parts:
1. Construction of electrification scenarios at the system level (short, medium and long term) by corridor, taking as a basis the existing and planned corridors, as well as the incorporation of the electric fleet foreseen in the short term. The specific result will be:
a. Supply-demand analysis for current and future fleet and service sizing and identification of fleet segments and criteria for technological change.
b. Electrification alternatives modeling considering long term operation and technology performance and potential charging points identified.
c. Operational and energy requirements:
       i. Fleet forecast scenarios per year by technology,
       ii. Energy consumption and sizing of charging points

2.	Analysis of saturation of energy distribution networks in projected charging points. In accordance with the forecast of estimated energy requirements for future scenarios, the investment requirements will be estimated in the distribution network of the patios or other identified charging points ( CFE participation). The specific result will be:
a. Analysis of the saturation and availability of capacity in the distribution grid at the identified charging points. 
b. Infrastructure requirements profile (charging infrastructure and energy distribution grid)  

3.	Deepening the analysis for a short-term scenario (to be selected from: Line 1 Insurgentes, Line 4 or Line 5)

Project: Strengthening the use of Earth Observation platforms to support the implementation of climate change mitigation goals in the forest and land use sector in three states in Mexico.
Result_Title: Updated land use maps for Chiapas, Tabasco, and Campeche uploaded on EO labs and/or other platforms
Description: Updated and validated maps available on EO Lab (and/or other appropriate platform as agreed) and reports generated for decision makers to help inform policy decisions on land use.
Implementor: Ecometrica Ltd. (Ecosistemas Consultoría Integral para Soluciones sustentables)

Project: Strengthening the use of Earth Observation platforms to support the implementation of climate change mitigation goals in the forest and land use sector in three states in Mexico.
Result_Title: Land Use Sector Impact Reporting Dashboard set up and decision makers trained in its use
Description: Business Intelligence Dashboard set up on the EO Lab that brings together all existing and newly generated spatial data products & decision makers trained in its use. Ecometrica will carry out EO Lab training for government users - presentations / workshops of how to use the interface. These will be short sessions (1-2 hour ) that will explain functionality, as well as how to get the most out of the platform as a decision making tool and a plan for how best to use it going forward (e.g. what data should be developed and/or uploaded). Target participation will be at least one representative from each target institution.
Implementor: Ecometrica Ltd. (Ecosistemas Consultoría Integral para Soluciones sustentables)

Project: Strengthening the use of Earth Observation platforms to support the implementation of climate change mitigation goals in the forest and land use sector in three states in Mexico.
Result_Title: Government Programmes Analyses Report on Deforestation
Description: A report that analyses the contribution of government programmes or subsidies to avoided deforestation (or indeed an increase in deforestation) in Chiapas, Tabasco and Campeche. It will look at programmes such as Bienstar, Agricultural subsisdies in sectors such as cocoa and coffee, payment for ecosystem services (PES) schemes and forest management programmes and include communication dissemination products such as infographics.
Implementor: Ecometrica Ltd. (Ecosistemas Consultoría Integral para Soluciones sustentables)

Project: Strengthening the use of Earth Observation platforms to support the implementation of climate change mitigation goals in the forest and land use sector in three states in Mexico.
Result_Title: Training workshop(s) on use of early warning alerts & use of Earth Observation platforms
Description: EO Lab training for government users - presentations / workshops of how to use the interface. These will be short sessions (1-2 hours) that will explain functionality, as well as how to get the most out of the platform as a decision making tool, and a plan for how best to use it going forward (e.g. what data should be developed and/or uploaded). A training (or series of trainings, as appropriate) to build capacity of institutions to use early warning deforestation systems will be more technical. IT will either be delivered as an intensive 3 day training, with follow up support (and possible "refresher" training near the end of the project), or spread out over 5-6 shorter session. This will be agreed with beneficiares depending on capacity of staff for at least 4 women and 6 men from institutions responsible for acting on deforestation.
Implementor: Ecometrica Ltd. (Ecosistemas Consultoría Integral para Soluciones sustentables)

Project: Strengthening the use of Earth Observation platforms to support the implementation of climate change mitigation goals in the forest and land use sector in three states in Mexico.
Result_Title: Policy briefs for incorporating new criteria and geospatial information tools into decision making for policy and programme development to achieve NDCs in the land use sector
Description: A report, presented to key stakeholders and beneficiaries with recommendations on 1) how to incorporate geospatial tools into decision making and 2) policy recommendations for agricultural subsidies linked to reducing deforestation based on evidence generated by geospatial tools.
Implementor: Ecometrica Ltd. (Ecosistemas Consultoría Integral para Soluciones sustentables)

Project: Landscape conservation and livelihood restoration in the Mexican ejidal altiplano: the case of Apan, Hidalgo.
Result_Title: Action plan report including the results of a collective priorization of potential nature-based solutions for climate change adaptation and mitigation
Description: In response to the issues identified during the diagnostic phase, our team of specialists will produce a list of potential solutions drawn from primary and secondary analysis of local, national, and international experiences and expertise. In this step, proposed interventions or solutions will be analysed in terms of potential impact, cost, feasibility, and acceptability as well as with anticipation of potentially adverse or negative effects. Through the participative prioritization of water, land, and forest management strategies, we will refine the list of solutions, highlighting the most cost-efficient ones capable of advancing climate change adaptation and mitigation efforts in Apan.
Implementor: Eetestudio  (Espacio entre tiempo estudio SA de CV)

Project: Accelerating Green Finance Flows Through the Strengthening of the Mexican National Banking and Securities Commission (CNBV)
Result_Title: Recommendations report developed on international best practices and emerging regulation for ESG integration and climate related risks disclosure by financial intermediaries
Description: This recommendations report aims to develop will condense and present international best practices and emerging regulations for ESG integration and climate risks. It will incorporate research and analysis on international best practices and strategies on how to raise awareness, communicate, regulate ESG standards and integrate climate-related risks across the financial intermediaries (covering prudential regulation, including but not limited to supervision of governance and capital requirements, as well as stock markets regulation). The report will also analyse how to establish financial targets based on climate change stress tests. The report will be a comparative perspective that presents relevant opportunities to advance integration of ESG standards and climate-related risks in Mexico’s financial sector.

Project: Accelerating Green Finance Flows Through the Strengthening of the Mexican National Banking and Securities Commission (CNBV)
Result_Title: Recommendations report and policy briefs developed on Green Financial Inclusion
Description:
This output aims to provide recommendations (via report/policy brief) on green financial inclusion. Climate change impact has not been researched alongside financial inclusion, which is particularly relevant due to Mexico’s high climate vulnerability and social context. Hence, based on international good practices and the sustainability-climate-financial inclusion nexus, research and analysis will be performed on:
- Financial inclusion challenges and opportunities for Mexico in a climate change context: Designing and improving access to financial products/services 
- Integration of gender considerations as part of ESG and climate risk analysis and gender-mainstream Financial products and services in Mexico
- Increased access to financial services for people with disabilities in Mexican commercial banks

Project: Accelerating Green Finance Flows Through the Strengthening of the Mexican National Banking and Securities Commission (CNBV)
Result_Title: Training delivered on Green Finance (ESG and climate-related risks and opportunities) to CNBV staff
Description:
This output aims to train key green finance actors (CNBV staff) on ESG and climate risk. The training will strengthen CNBV’s staff capacities on green finance through the following modalities is required to accomplish the international and national commitments on greening the financial sector:
1. Three online technical workshops (due to COVID-19) for GFTF members and CNBV staff
- One webinar delivered to 40 people (40% women);
- Two delivered to ten people in the Sustainable Finance Committee (with four women)

Project: Accelerating Green Finance Flows Through the Strengthening of the Mexican National Banking and Securities Commission (CNBV)
Result_Title: Modular online training content for new staff to be integrated into CNBV’s standard onboarding protocol
Description: The online training will be composed of 3-5 online modules equivalent to approx. 20 hours of training on ESG and climate risk developed and institutionalised.

Project: Accelerating Green Finance Flows Through the Strengthening of the Mexican National Banking and Securities Commission (CNBV)
Result_Title: Green finance self-assessment tool for financial intermediaries
Description: This output aims to support a green finance self-assessment tool for financial intermediaries. The tool that allows regulated actors to assess where they stand on integrating ESG standards into FIs operations and decision-making processes and what specific actions they can undertake to increase their ESG capacities and integrate climate related risks into their operations and analyses. This is needed as FIs require guidance to identify the gaps they need to close regarding environmental, social, gender, and climate-related risk to green their portfolios and mobilize green resources.

Project: Expanding the Colombian Climate Asset Disclosure Initiative (CCADI)
Result_Title: Peer-to-peer knowledge sharing between public and private asset owners in Colombia and the UK
Description:
One (1) peer-to-peer mission to UK: 3 day meeting with UK peers for knowledge sharing and skills enhancement to be delivered on 2022-Q1. Directed at public and private asset owners and asset managers, regulators and/or public officials
It is expected that at least one participant from 7 different organizations attend.
If COVID crisis does not allow travel the peer to peer mission will be held virtually.

Project: Strengthening the Legislative-Executive-Stakeholder dialogue on Mexico's climate change and energy goals at the national and subnational levels
Result_Title: Legislation recommendations to update Climate Change Law in 4 States and 1 Climate Law Proposal. (Jalisco, Guanajuato, Yucatán, Quintana Roo and Puebla)
Description: 4 reform proposals to update Climate Change Laws in 4 States (Jalisco, Guanajuato, Quintana Roo and Puebla) and 1 Law Proposal supported by a participative process which will include interviews to experts of different sectors, as well as an online questionnaire for general public participation.

Project: Development of an EV Financing Tool and Business Model to Enable the Scaling up of EV Uptake
Result_Title: MSME Demand and Needs Assessment Survey Report
Description: This output will undertake a survey questionnaire of up to 400 Micro, Small and Medium Enterprises (MSMEs) in Dhaka, Chittagong and Sylhet. The survey will provide an overview of the current situation, necessities and support needed by the MSMEs. The survey results will identify the 30 MSMEs to receive business services support from the project;  provide FIs and corporates an overview of the appetite and ability of MSME to transition to EVs; and provide an overview to MSME’s various current business models and services provided through EVs, as well as key enablers (and obstacles) to the use of EVs. The survey report will be delivered as a word and pdf document.

Project: Development of an EV Financing Tool and Business Model to Enable the Scaling up of EV Uptake
Result_Title: Workshops and knowledge seminars to raise awareness, sensitise and incentivise existing urban mobility service providers towards the adoption of sustainable transport solutions
Description:
This output focuses on engagement with existing urban mobility service providers on sustainable transport solutions, through capacity building workshops and knowledge seminars to develop their understanding around the potential of electrified urban solutions. These workshops would be designed to sensitise and build capacity in large urban mobility service providers and their rider base of the potential benefits and opportunities arising from the adoption of electric motorbikes. The output aims to encourage and support the business thinking of these key urban service providers, by providing evidence through our programme on the potential and viability of electrified transport solutions, suitable financing options and mechanisms for e-mobility, and demonstrate long-term sustainability that would be key to their businesses.
This output will deliver 4 workshops during two months starting in June. These workshops are expected to be day-long workshops and will include participants from the FIWG and MFEF, the number of attendees is yet to be confirmed.

Project: Institutional Capacity Building Framework Program to accelerate adoption of electric mobility in public transport in India
Result_Title: Training for Technical Students and Employees in the Automotive Industry
Description: This output aims to equip the vital link of this chain with industry-ready technical and managerial skills. The course shall contain three 1-day modules on maintenance of motors and batteries, store management and hands-on practical training for an enhanced learning experience. The target is to train 500 students and employees in total.
Implementor: Research Triangle Institute Global India Private Limited

Project: Utility led smart electric vehicle charging for demand response and grid management in New Delhi, India
Result_Title: Report with technical demonstration of a utility-led electric vehicle smart charging implementation for 3- and 4-wheelers

Project: Utility led smart electric vehicle charging for demand response and grid management in New Delhi, India
Result_Title: Recommendations to improve grid and EV demand response management
Description: This output aims to gather specific information from the technical demonstration in output 1, and use the findings as inputs for an economic model to assess the overall demand management potential of managed charging. It will inform protocols and actions to manage electricity surges and demand with more efficiency. It will also inform policymakers in order to develop incentives and policies in order to promote the adoption of EVs countrywide. The recommendations will be delivered as a pdf document.

Project: Utility led smart electric vehicle charging for demand response and grid management in New Delhi, India
Result_Title: Conceptual framework (recommendations) for incentives and regulations on time of day pricing framework for EVs charging during period
Description: The output will be a study that outlines the technical feasibility and the financial savings or benefits that will accrue to the electricity utility if smart charging is combined with differential pricing to manage and smoothen electricity demand curves, as well as synchronise renewable energy injections into the grid system with EV charging peaks. This study will enable electric utilities to make an evidence-based case for the need for policy and regulatory support for differential pricing, as well as layout the regulatory and policy roadmap for Central and State governments (and regulators) to facilitate this.

Project: Utility led smart electric vehicle charging for demand response and grid management in New Delhi, India
Result_Title: Quarterly events for stakeholders (workshops and webinars)
Description:
This output consists of quarterly events led by the CEEW communications team. This will create a network of stakeholders through a combination of open webinars and invite-only workshops. Distribution companies, regulators, and the broader set of power sector stakeholders will gain access to the pilot insights developed in the project through regular workshops, publications and interactions to support adoption.
It is expected that other utility and charging stakeholders would come forward with the aspiration to better understand the opportunity presented by managed charging and take up similar work in their organisational capacity.

Project: Strategy and Action Plan for Electrification of Public Transport and Intermediate Public Transport in the Indian Cities
Result_Title: Trainings and workshops on EV technology
Description: [TO BE UPDATED WHEN NUMBER OF PAPERS ARE CONFIRMED] This output will provide trainings and workshops to build sensitisation and awareness on EV technology and ensure buy-in from the relevant stakeholders which would be the key for taking the strategy and action plan towards implementation. These workshops will cover topics including vehicle types, charging technology, cost analysis and business models, depot planning, operating model, bus deployment and other such topics included in the action plans. Three sessions are planned during the months of July, August, and December. The list of participants is yet to be confirmed.

Project: Strategy and Action Plan for Electrification of Public Transport and Intermediate Public Transport in the Indian Cities
Result_Title: Creation of stakeholder networks on EV in Indian Cities
Description:
The output is focused on creating stakeholder networks and strengthening the existing collaborations to create a buy-in on the electrification strategy. It seeks to address urban transport planning by the inclusion of  stakeholders in strategising e-bus procurement plans and identification of depots/ terminals for electrification. Also, it will help in defining the roles and responsibilities of different stakeholders which would be key in successful implementation of the plan.

The outputs will be:
1. Formation of Advisory groups with representations from the state and local stakeholder agencies in Ahmedabad and Mehsana
2. Formation of Working groups with NGOs (working for welfare of women and marginalised sections), local representatives and local authority in the respective cities.

Project: Enhanced TCFD aligned transparency for an economically and environmentally resilient financial system in Brazil
Result_Title: Roundtable between financial institutions and companies to discuss the TNFD recommendations
Description: Roundtable between financial institutions and companies to discuss the recommendations on how to incorporate the TNFD in the Brazilian context, focusing on forest-related issues. This output will help support the adoption of the recommendations proposed in the TNFD Guidance paper.

Project: Enhanced TCFD aligned transparency for an economically and environmentally resilient financial system in Brazil
Result_Title: Report of recommendations to the Brazilian B3 stock exchange on how to strengthen reporting for listed companies
Description: As part of the Sustainable Stock Exchange Initiative (SSE Initiative), 55 global stock exchanges, including Brazil’s B3 stock exchange provide ESG reporting guidance. Through the influence of the exchanges, listed companies are encouraged to disclose information on climate-related risks and opportunities. In this output, we will review the existing guidance document from B3 and will provide recommendations for how the guidance can be updated and strengthened. This will include suggested amendments or additions to ensure the guidance is aligned to and promotes the recommended disclosures from the TCFD. The report will be published online, and made freely and publicly available. This work is important as it will improve the quality of guidance and therefore quality of disclosure of the 328 companies listed on the exchange. It also supports ongoing work from the SSE Initiative, Mark Carney and the LSE Group, who have created a new workstream to support stock exchanges in the development of guidance.

Project: Enhanced TCFD aligned transparency for an economically and environmentally resilient financial system in Brazil
Result_Title: Workshop on forest-related reporting and disclosure
Description: In-person  workshop (assuming this is possible) for 20 listed companies on how to report forest and land use-related information in the mainstream report. Once the draft guidance is published we will deliver training workshops for listed companies on how to report forest-related information in their mainstream reporting, through the application and adoption of the guidance document.

Project: Enhanced TCFD aligned transparency for an economically and environmentally resilient financial system in Brazil
Result_Title: Score cards for each corporate and FI responding to the full CDP questionnaire
Description: CDP has a world class scoring methodology that is updated every year based on consultation with market participants and the latest technologies and metrics in the sector. Each corporate and FI responding to the full CDP questionnaire will receive a score card regarding their standard of disclosure. The score cards and the associated peer learning and behaviour contagion among the target group will provide responders with the tools to identify gaps in climate planning.

Project: Enhanced TCFD aligned transparency for an economically and environmentally resilient financial system in Brazil
Result_Title: Insight report into progress of Brazilian corporates and FIs towards climate and forest disclosure and action based on 2021
Description: There is a high and growing market demand for environmental disclosure. It’s crucial that we continue to seek transparency, so investor can make their financial decisions with high quality environmental data. In order to achieve this goal, CDP will deliver an insight report, containing the Brazilian companies and FIs’ progress on disclosing through Climate and Forest questionnaires. The report will be constructed with 100% CDP data and will give insights to investors' decision-making process.

Project: Enhanced TCFD aligned transparency for an economically and environmentally resilient financial system in Brazil
Result_Title: Training course on TCFD reporting for listed companies and FIs in Brazil
Description: This output is a training course on disclosure, introducing the fundamentals of reporting in line with the TCFD recommendations in the mainstream report and guiding companies through CDP climate and forest questionnaires. 2 online webinars will be run in Q2 and 2 in-person workshops in Q3, if restrictions allow. The trainings will be offered for Sustainability and Investor Relation professionals in the top 100 listed companies in the Brazilian Stock Exchange, by market capitalisation, listed on the iBRx Index. It is expected that 70 companies and 10 FIs will attend the training sessions. The training will focus on raising awareness and TCFD fundamentals as well as covering best practices and lessons learned after CDP disclosure cycle.

Project: Enhanced TCFD aligned transparency for an economically and environmentally resilient financial system in Brazil
Result_Title: Online guidance and factsheet for cities & states in Brazil on the impact of TCFD recommendation and requirements for TCFD-aligned transparency
Description: This output is a Guide to help cities and states determine the availability of its own climate related information, identify which information could be disclosed, and prepare them to be able to fulfil the TCFD recommendations, and requirements for internal decision-making to support its budgeting and capital planning. The Guide also intends to enhance the usefulness of the general-purpose financial reports for external stakeholders and prepare cities and states to get ahead of the pack and be prepared for a new reporting cycle. The Guide will be a virtual interactive document in a web page format with a simple format and easy to use. It will include methodological aspects and disclosure matrix tool enabling participants to disclose according to the TCFD framework.

Project: Enhanced TCFD aligned transparency for an economically and environmentally resilient financial system in Brazil
Result_Title: Training course on TCFD alignment for City and State Authorities in Brazil
Description: This training course will consist of two webinars to be delivered to targeted 50 cities and 10 states in Brazil to build their capacity to increase transparency of climate risk and opportunities in line with TCFD. Over the next couple of years, given the raised interested on TCFD among FIs in Brazil, we expect this to constitute a major factor in decision making around sustainable infrastructure projects, which are of critical importance for cities and states in Brazil. Thus, increasing the preparedness of cities and states to understand the TCFD framework and the expectations that FIs and investors will have of sustainable infrastructure investments is critical to facilitate the flow of green finance to cities and states in Brazil.

Project: Closing the gap on sustainable finance and enabling green recovery through capacity building in CDP’s TCFD aligned disclosures and the GRI standards (Indonesia, Thailand)
Result_Title: Multi-Stakeholder Advisory Panel (MAP) formation and on-going engagement towards bolder policy action
Description: This output is to create a network linking regulators, companies and FIs. This output will ensure that all parties remain aware and informed of the relevance of the capacity building program to local policy goals and are able to incorporate feedback from beneficiaries and stakeholders into program content and delivery. The Partners will form a Multi-Stakeholder Advisory Panel (MAP) consisting of representatives from dominant local stakeholders such as BAPPENAS, The Stock Exchange of Thailand and Indonesia Stock Exchange, and intermediary organisations that bridge regulators and companies, including Indonesia Corporate Secretary Association and The Indonesia Business Coalition for Women Empowerment. MAP's key objectives will be to ensuring program design and outputs suitably address the needs of the targeted financial institutions and listed companies, suggest subject-matter experts and market participants that can provide technical guidance and assistance through knowledge sharing and peer-to-peer learning, and assist in promotion of workshops and dissemination of knowledge products (i.e. access to company networks, event promotion, venue provision, etc.)

Project: Closing the gap on sustainable finance and enabling green recovery through capacity building in CDP’s TCFD aligned disclosures and the GRI standards (Indonesia, Thailand)
Result_Title: Capital Markets workshops
Description: To support the sustainable stock exchange initiative endorsed by IDX and SET and enable a green and sustainable capital markets ecosystem in Indonesia and Thailand, the project will conduct two workshops and feedback sessions inviting representatives of IDX and SET, regulators and financial institutions to (i) understand the concept of financed emissions, (ii) engage with portfolio companies on financial risks from climate change and ESG and (iii) use corporate disclosure data in TCFD and ESG in developing green and sustainable finance opportunities. Beneficiaries of these workshops will be representatives of capital markets regulators and financial institutions responsible for sustainable finance initiatives and enabling the transition to low-carbon.

Project: Closing the gap on sustainable finance and enabling green recovery through capacity building in CDP’s TCFD aligned disclosures and the GRI standards (Indonesia, Thailand)
Result_Title: TCFD resources and Training Module Resources – with translation in Thai and Bahasa
Description: With eight customised workshops during the project period, the workshop content will be a valuable resource for participants to use for revisions and reinforce learning outcomes. In addition, the resources may also be of use for the broader corporate and financial communities in Thailand and Indonesia who were unable to attend the capacity building workshops. Training material and content development will focus on merging and harmonising CDP’s TCFD-aligned reporting, the GRI Standards, the SDGs and BAPPENAS’ SDGs Action Plan to reduce reporting fatigue that companies currently experience due to the profusion of reporting frameworks. The translated resources will be made publicly available online and disseminated to beneficiaries through our engagement and stakeholders.

Project: Closing the gap on sustainable finance and enabling green recovery through capacity building in CDP’s TCFD aligned disclosures and the GRI standards (Indonesia, Thailand)
Result_Title: Advanced TCFD and ESG Workshop
Description: Advanced workshops will focus on developing in-depth TCFD roadmaps and best practice benchmarks in ESG management to beneficiaries that have a basic understanding of TCFD and ESG and are mature sustainability reporters. Invitations will be sent through ICSA, IDX and SET. Targeted participants will be corporate secretaries, heads of sustainability, and/management personnel. Partners will deliver this module, consisting of four workshops in collaboration with subject matter experts and market practitioners to ensure knowledge exchange involves practical advice, case studies and peer-to-peer learning.

Project: Developing and embedding an NDC Capital Raising Strategy for Peru
Result_Title: Capital Raising Strategy for Peru
Description:
This output involves the application of a framework for developing of a national Capital Raising Strategy (CRS) document. This work will explicitly build on ongoing parallel work to identify investment needs for the NDC, and will be designed to complement the MINAM (public) climate finance strategy. The output will set out potential options for addressing barriers.
