This may include domestic policy or regulatory action, enhanced investor liaison and market building activities, public blended financing and ‘green investment bank’-type approaches, and technical assistance.
This output will be delivered to the primary beneficiary, MINAM, but will also be directly relevant for the secondary beneficiaries and the broader climate investment community. The CRS will be central to enabling and accelerating tangible action to increase private investment flows for climate through addressing financial sector constraints to raising capital.

Project: Strengthening climate risk assessment and enabling central bank supervision in the Indian financial sector, a partnership with frontrunning banks and DFIs
Result_Title: RBI regulatory and supervisory options paper
Description: Regulatory and supervisory toolkit to reduce financial-sector exposure to climate related risks in a phased manner, tailored to India and informed by international best practice. The RBI options paper will respond to growing appetite from the RBI to tackle climate-related risks in the financial sector. First, it will make the case for greater action by quantifying bank lending and bond issuance to specific industries that may be particularly carbon-intensive or exposed to climate hazards. This will reveal bank exposure to potentially stranded assets and non-performing loans. Second, the paper will summarise the RBI's regulatory responsibilities to understand what additional tools might be available to it. Third, the paper will map actions being taken by peer central banks to identify international best practice and generate ideas and lessons for the RBI. Finally, the paper will summarise and evaluate concrete regulatory and supervisory options available to the RBI in the short and medium-term.

Project: Strengthening climate risk assessment and enabling central bank supervision in the Indian financial sector, a partnership with frontrunning banks and DFIs
Result_Title: Events and meetings with the Reserve Bank of India, Centre for Advanced Financial Research and Learning (CAFRAL), the Indian Banks’ Association (IBA) and Government of Rajasthan sensitising them to the project’s findings and recommendations
Description: Regular meetings will be held every 6 weeks from June to December with key staff from the RBI and Ministry of Finance. These discussions will offer opportunities for staff to shape and review the project, building their ownership of the findings and recommendations. The discussions will also allow to design the training modules and prepare the RBI options paper to be consistent with emerging language and practice around ESG risk management in India. There will also be 3 events throughout the year which will also be used to support adoption of the other outputs, providing guidance on implementing the findings and learnings.

Project: Strengthening capabilities on climate action for investors of the Peruvian financial ecosystem, within the framework of the Green Financing Roadmap
Result_Title: Recommendations to Peruvian pension funds and regulators on options for mitigating climate related risks
Description: This output consists of individual portfolio analysis reports for each Peruvian pension fund, with the results of their scenario analysis and stress testing and a meta-analysis report analysing differences between pension funds (anonymized) and the results of the aggregate sector. This will provide recommendations to pension funds and regulators in terms of avenues for mitigation of climate-related risks and relevance for financial stability. The output will create enhanced awareness on the climate actions that pension funds should carry out to drive risk mitigation in the real economy as well as at portfolio level. This assessment will provide awareness and clarity to the financial community about the threats that climate change implies to financial assets and financial stability. Fund managers and other financial institutions will be able to relate more easily and take concrete decisions.
Implementor: PIR, Asociacion para la Promocion de la Inversion Responsable y Sostenible

Project: Strengthening capabilities on climate action for investors of the Peruvian financial ecosystem, within the framework of the Green Financing Roadmap
Result_Title: Course on financial risks and opportunities related to climate change - INVERCLIMA
Description: This output includes designing an awareness and capacity building plan, conducting 4 training workshops and accompanying materials, which will guide the stakeholders of the financial community in the use of tools to measure climate risks and opportunities, and adopt the TCFD recommendations. Beneficiaries include pension fund administrators, insurance companies, banks, agents within the LimaStock Exchange, asset managers, regulators, financial associations and public entities. List of organisations and number of attendees to be confirmed.
Implementor: PIR, Asociacion para la Promocion de la Inversion Responsable y Sostenible

Project: Greening Finance in Argentina to Combat Climate Change and Promote Inclusion
Result_Title: Report on Climate Risks and Stranded Assets
Description: The output will be a tailor-made report on climate risks and stranded assets focused on Argentine agro-industrial activities, heavily exposed to significant meteorological events. The project team will use local publicly available information on climate change data in combination with the latest international reports – such as the IPCC studies – on the impacts of climate change. Additionally, it will integrate climate risk assessment methodologies to produce: a general vulnerability and risk assessment for the selected activities; a detailed financial risk assessment; a list of potential stranded assets in the selected activities and a set of recommendation for the financial sector.
Implementor: Carbon Trust Mexico S.A. de C.V.

Project: Greening Finance in Argentina to Combat Climate Change and Promote Inclusion
Result_Title: Roadmap to a green Agro-industry commodities markets
Description: The output will be a roadmap for trading exchanges in the grain commodity market, which includes standards to identify and characterise sustainable commodities production and the associated environmental impacts. This document will play a vital role to start greening the sector, proving an applicable benchmark to help agri-businesses and investors contribute to sustainable development identify and mitigate adverse impacts. The roadmap will also improve the disclosure on procedures and financing practices and will help to strengthen the long long-term sustainability of the market. The roadmap will be developed following international best practices, such as the OECD-FAO Guidance for Responsible Agricultural Supply Chains, and have four main pillars: transparency, traceability, environmental social and productive integrity.
Implementor: Carbon Trust Mexico S.A. de C.V.

Project: Greening Finance in Argentina to Combat Climate Change and Promote Inclusion
Result_Title: Building and strengthening knowledge and capacities of Argentinean financial sector in sustainable finance
Description: This output is an extended sustainable finance (four one-week courses) course directed to the financial sector, including private and public institutions, investors, regulators, private corporations, academy, and NGOs. The course will cover sustainable finance, climate risks, TCFD and ESG investing and balancing fiduciary duty. The course will be supported by a dedicated webpage and marketing strategy to publicise the course and maintain engagement with the participants. A marketing strategy will support the courses to secure attendance (Goal: 300 attendees in the four courses altogether).
Implementor: Carbon Trust Mexico S.A. de C.V.

Project: Capacity building to the government of Peru to support its first sovereign green bond issuance
Result_Title: Green Bond (GB) governance and issuance process defined

Project: Capacity building to the government of Peru to support its first sovereign green bond issuance
Result_Title: Green Bond Framework defining the process and methodology for project selection and bond issuance developed
Description: The GB Framework establishes the basis for the identification, selection, verification and reporting of the projects eligible for direct or indirect financing by the GBs as well as the management of GB-proceeds. The document also will secure a Second Party Opinion to certify alignment with Peru’s NDC plan, SDGs and international best practices. The GB Framework is essential to guarantee that issuance can deliver the environmental and social benefits. The framework document will follow the Climate Bond Initiative taxonomy to guarantee selected projects are in alignment with a low-carbon economy and a 2-degree trajectory. Eligible sectors will include energy, waste and pollution control, nature-based assets, transport, water, industry, and green buildings. The GB Framework will define a set of socio-economic criteria for project compliance and financing eligibility.

Project: Promoting green finance to foster sustainable development in the North of Argentina
Result_Title: Feasibility study and road map for Sustainable, Green or Social Bond emission
Description: This output includes the evaluation of the participating financial institution position at the prospect of a Sustainable or Green Bond emission. The project will produce a study on how sustainable credit lines might constitute a portfolio that would be eligible for a sustainable bond emission according to the ICMA principles and according to Argentinean regulation and guidelines issued by CNV. The study will underline the institutional process to be revised for this purpose, indicating new processes to be implemented during the granting process, information registration, and impact monitoring and report. The final output will be the feasibility study (Word document), that states the current financial institution situation, the sustainable credit line portfolio perspective and actions to be implemented in order to emit a Sustainable or Green Bond.

Project: Promoting green finance to foster sustainable development in the North of Argentina
Result_Title: Business Plan to implement a Sustainable Credit Line for each financial institution
Description: This output is the development of a plan for each of the participating FIs including financial projections, and estimate of the number of projects to be funded of each kind of production model and sector, and thus the projected social and environmental impact of the portfolio. Based on these projections, the plan will define estimated goals in terms of impact in greenhouse gas emission reduction, the number of women direct and indirect beneficiary of funding, and the number of persons belonging to marginalised communities direct and indirect beneficiary of funding. The project will accompany and assist each participating financial institution in the development of a sustainable portfolio generation. We will help the institution staff implementing and refining the evaluation and granting process, and help them in critical aspects of the process such as identifying proper guarantees for each operation. The output will include a Business Plan report for each of participating FIs (exact number TBC).

Project: Promoting green finance to foster sustainable development in the North of Argentina
Result_Title: Sustainable Credit Lines Design
Description: This output is the design of specific sustainable credit lines presented in a report in Word, taking into account the findings of the outputs 1 and 2, and with that information the estimation of: portfolio targeted amount, client profile, access conditions, financial conditions, risks and guarantees, and internal processes to deliver the financial products to them. The product elaboration process will include a stage of revision and adjustment with relevant producers and civil organisations. The feedback of the beneficiaries, including the voices and opinions of small farmers, women associations, SME associations and NGOs, will be taken into account in the financial product definition. The Amount term and period of each line will be designed to respond as much as possible to specific identified producers' financial requirements.

Project: Promoting green finance to foster sustainable development in the North of Argentina
Result_Title: Market study on economic activities and productive models that have an environmental and social positive impact
Description: This output is a mapping process of all the economic sectors of activity and sustainable practices to be promoted, including stakeholders to be targeted, and existing conditions that would enable specific credit lines to reach a positive social and environmental impact. This research will pay particular attention to identifying production models and activities that contribute to greenhouse gas emission reduction and to activities sector that contributes to gender equity and marginalised population group inclusion. This will enable us to build a framework that identifies sustainable activities to be financed and defines credit lines principal characteristics, such as average amount, existing risk and guarantees, and appropriate financial conditions. The framework will be in the form of a Word document.

Project: Promoting green finance to foster sustainable development in the North of Argentina
Result_Title: Webinars and workshops on REDD mechanisms, carbon and water footprints, how to prepare for a bank loan, sustainable bonds and green finance practices
Description:
The output consists in a series of five workshops and webinars. 
- Webinar on Carbon Market opportunities: participants will be provided with baselines on Argentina forestall conservation and recovery models, the REDD+ certification process, its steps, times, players, costs and income opportunities will be detailed and participating financial institutions’ roles and opportunities in the carbon market will be identified. 
- Webinar on Carbon and Water Footprint: participants will receive the basic tools to carry out the analysis of the carbon footprint and the water footprint in their organisations, and thus apply them in different areas of their management. 
- Workshop or webinar on how to prepare for a banking loan: will provide tools to small rural producers, SME led by women, sustainable projects, and other relevant field actors to access credit, reviewing processes and requisites. 
- Workshop or webinar on sustainable bonds, sustainable finance and banking best practices with regulators: will present the Green, Social and Sustainable Bonds as debt instruments for sustainable development to finance projects with social and environmental impact. 
- A closing workshop will be held to evaluate the achievements and limits of the realised process, to discuss how sustainable credit lines will be implemented, and what the key factor for the success are. The closing workshop will be directed to participating financial institutions, but also to other interested financial providers from Argentina and at the regional level, multilateral and bilateral financial organisations, sustainable producers’ organisation, and support civil society organisation. It will be an opportunity to share experience for other relevant actors of Argentina and other countries interested in replicate the strategy.

Project: Paving the Way for Setting Ambitious GHG Emissions Reductions in the Private Sector to enhance the National Climate Change Policy
Result_Title: Closing Event to present the Final Guidelines Report with the stakeholders. (closure of the project)
Description: A closing event will be organized to present the final report and reflect on the way forward. This output aims to enable key stakeholders of government institutions and the private sector in Mexico to count with specific materials that help to widely spread the importance of corporte participation in the national climate action and broaden the scope of the SBTi in Mexico.

Project: Landscape conservation and livelihood restoration in the Mexican ejidal altiplano: the case of Apan, Hidalgo.
Result_Title: Recommendations report on inclusive and participative governance and funding for nature-based mitigation and adaptation to climate change
Description: With an eye towards implementation and scalability, the project proposes the creation of an inclusive governance management entity whose aim will be to foster environmental justice, ensure an equitable distribution of efforts and benefits among the different stakeholders, and provide transparency in decision-making and accountability for outcomes. Within the first year of the project (February 2021-January 2022), we will draft recommendations for the institutionalization of governance and funding mechanisms that both fit with the expectations of the main stakeholders, respect equity, inclusion and environmental justice principles, and are  compatible with the current legal system in Mexico.
Implementor: Eetestudio  (Espacio entre tiempo estudio SA de CV)

Project: Landscape conservation and livelihood restoration in the Mexican ejidal altiplano: the case of Apan, Hidalgo.
Result_Title: Practice-oriented capacity building training sesions for design and development of nature-based solutions
Description: Solutions identified as priority in the local context will undergo field testing, in a coordinated manner with the local actors. These tests will provide evidence of the suitability of these solutions, as well as any barriers to their effective implementation, resulting in a catalogue of nature-based solutions suitable for climate adaptation in Apan and other altiplano territories. This way, the project will provide practice-oriented capacity-building through collective exercises directed towards the design and development of water and soil management aimed at enhancing local stakeholders skills and experience to develop natural resources restoration capacities on their own. The project will provide the capacity building sessions to at least 20 people.
Implementor: Eetestudio  (Espacio entre tiempo estudio SA de CV)

Project: Landscape conservation and livelihood restoration in the Mexican ejidal altiplano: the case of Apan, Hidalgo.
Result_Title: Network building and establishment of a commission, including representatives from the main beneficiaries, to formalize a cross-stakeholder network committed to territorial management of natural resources, climate change mitigation and adaptation
Description: The project starts the process of convening local stakeholders, beginning with meetings targeted towards individual group leaders (ejidos, non-ejidal farmers, beer industry, urban residents of Apan). After meeting individually, the project will begin triangulating various dyads and triads of engagement, generating new venues of participation and co-production between various stakeholders. Through the establishment of a commission, including representatives of the main beneficiaries, we will formalize a cross-stakeholder network committed to territorial management of natural resources and climate change mitigation and adaptation. We will have laid the groundwork in earlier stages for these connections to be created and reinforced through consensus exercises focused on finding common ground for action. The local commission will be established by the end of April 2021.
Implementor: Eetestudio  (Espacio entre tiempo estudio SA de CV)

Project: Accelerating Fleet-wide electrification of public transport in Mexico City
Result_Title: Two webinars or working sessions on priority topics, identified with Metrobus and SEMOVI
Description: Two webinar sessions with ~20 people to strengthen the evaluation of electromobility projects, both technically and financially. Based on discussions, the project will include presentation of case studies. The project will also develop a policy memo on potential regulatory structures.
Implementor: Dalberg Advisors (Asesores en Desarrollo Dalberg S. de R.L.)

Project: Consolidation of the Mexican Climate Finance Hub - mobilizing resources to mitigation and adaptation activities and achieve Mexico´s emission reduction goals
Result_Title: Design and execution of a training programme (4 editions) for listed entities on how to report under TCFD and SASB standards to improve ESG disclosure
Description: In alliance with BMV (one of the two local stock exchanges), this component will improve local ESG disclosure by bringing access to the most innovative reporting methodologies on climate and environmental elements: TCFD and SASB. Through the four editions, the course will solve many of the issues when getting started with ESG disclosure as well as standardize the public available information in the financial markets. The project estimates at least 20 participants for each training.

Project: Paving the Way for Setting Ambitious GHG Emissions Reductions in the Private Sector to enhance the National Climate Change Policy
Result_Title: 7 workshops with the Community of Practice (CP) to increase knowledge on corporate climate action and foster their networks to set science-based targets
Description:
7 workshops to explain the SBTi framework, methodologies, tools, and other available resources; explore the creation of synergies with public policies; share experiences and best practices; explain policies and financial instruments that enable science-based target setting processes; and cover key themes related to GHG emissions reductions and SBTs to help companies internalize other important benefits such as health co-benefits, labour creation and competitiveness. The CP workshops aim to enable the increase of private sector knowledge on corporate climate action based on science, and foster their networks to set science based targets. They will ultimately mainstream the concept in their own value chains, of which many are comprised by a large number of SMEs. The CP workshops also aim to prepare the private sector to adapt to changing regulatory and business environments demanding more accountability and climate action.
The project will ensure that in each training there are at least 20 representatives from private sector.

Project: Expanding sustainable infrastructure network for electric vehicles in urban transportation modes
Result_Title: Evaluation report on the current state of the public charging infrastructure for electric vehicles
Description:
The report will be in three parts:
1. Evaluation of the current state of the public charging infrastructure for electric vehicles, in the proposed dimensions: 
(a.) Environmental, air quality and energy contribution
(b.) Integrated and sustainable mobility (supply / demand approach)
(c.) Development of new markets and inclusive economic growth 
(d.) Decrease in inequalities and gender gaps

2. International experience and good practices - The analysis will focus on identifying the key problem drivers, policy, financial and market factors, including research and development activities which were implemented and/or present between 2014 – 2019. 

3.  Gap analysis and strategy for the expansion of the network charging infrastructure. The project will identify gaps between the current state of the electric vehicle market in Mexico, and the lessons learned for successful deployment of electric vehicles in the international context. 

The output of this exercise will be a list of areas to address to improve electric vehicle take up, 
including the vision of national Mexican stakeholders (public, private and civil society). To achieve this, a session will be held with relevant stakeholders.

Project: Expanding sustainable infrastructure network for electric vehicles in urban transportation modes
Result_Title: Recommendations and risk assessment report of the expansion of the Federal Electricity Commission's Public Sector Energy Savings Program
Description:
Report with all the results and recommendations that increase the social, environmental and financial value for the expansion of the program.

For developing this report, the project will do these specific activities:
1. Define priorities with stakeholders within the current political and economic context; how much the network can be expanded, how much this expansion can contribute to elements such as the reduction of polluting material in transport. This will be with specific meetings.
2. Analysis of available and expected resources for the next 4 years.
3. Mapping of funding opportunities with international cooperation.
4. Recommendations and a risk assessment of CFE-PAESE's expansion (Federal Electricity Commission - Public Sector Energy Savings Program)

Finally, the project will have a meeting with CFE-PAESE (Federal Electricity Commission - Public Sector Energy Savings Program) and relevant stakeholders to present findings and a proposal for expansion of the infraestructural network.

Project: Sustainable Tourism Enhancement Project - Phase 2: Boosting conservation and emissions reduction through tourism and technology
Result_Title: CO2 emission calculator integrated within the Awake.travel website, so that travellers can calculate and compensate the carbon emission generated on their trip
Indicator: Output 2.3. 'Project application/ tools developed to access funds'
Description: CO2 calculator displayed on the Awake webpage so that travelers can measure their GHG emission during their trip, and can decide to compensate it by contributing directly towards local organisations. This first version will seek to have at least 20 trips with emission calculations option integrated into the Awake page and with the compensation option available. Awake will not obtain any commission or profit from the donations - 100% will go to the beneficiaries. Nonetheless, bank fees and online payment comission will be charged. The payment method will be online or offline, depending on the payment method use by the traveler. In the case that the online payment method is chosen, there may be a commission for the transaction that is a percentage of the total cost of the transaction.

Project: Accelerating Fleet-wide electrification of public transport in Mexico City
Result_Title: Recommendation structure for commercial and operational models and agreements between the operator and bus provider(s)
Description:
Two sets of recommendations targeting:
1. Recommendations on concession agreements and compensation models for bus providers and operators to inform the design of the electrification strategy for Metrobús
2. Recommendations on structure for commercial and operational models and agreements between the operator and bus provider(s), including operations, frequency, number of buses, and capacity
Implementor: Dalberg Advisors (Asesores en Desarrollo Dalberg S. de R.L.)

Project: Integrated freight transport plan combining rail and road freight modes aiming at reducing GHG and improving logistic integration and local economic development for Mexico City
Result_Title: Diagnosis report to understand context and current problems of freight transport in Pantaco Terminal
Description: A diagnosis of the terminal’s current operations and the site surroundings to identify problems and opportunities. Furthermore, there will be a review of three international case studies to draw potential lessons to the project.

Project: Integrated freight transport plan combining rail and road freight modes aiming at reducing GHG and improving logistic integration and local economic development for Mexico City
Result_Title: Roadmaps to promote rail freight and to improve local traffic and public space around Pantaco Terminal
Description:
Roadmaps for: 
- Short and long-term actions to improve traffic flows, improving usage of Pantaco Terminal and promoting modal shift
- Short and long-term actions to recover public space in the vicinity of the Pantaco Terminal

Project: Integrated freight transport plan combining rail and road freight modes aiming at reducing GHG and improving logistic integration and local economic development for Mexico City
Result_Title: Closing event with authorities and donors to present an integrated freight transport plan
Description: Closing event with the beneficiaries and the UK Embassy to strengthen stakeholder engagement. This will be an opportunity to summarize the main project findings, their implications, as well as recommendations and conclusions.

Project: Assessment of the greenhouse gas mitigation potential of hydrogen. An implementation roadmap for Mexico
Result_Title: Dissemination event on the results of the assessment of green hydrogen greenhouse gas mitigation potential in the Mexico and UK experience
Description: This dissemination event will gather experts from the UK and present the results from the project. The aim is to provide information and consolidate the network of interested agents. Moreover, final comments and feedback will be obtained.

Project: Assessment of the greenhouse gas mitigation potential of hydrogen. An implementation roadmap for Mexico
Result_Title: Establisment of a green hydrogen network enhancement hub on Mario Molina Center's website
Description: As part of the Mario Molina Center’s website, a special section will be created with all results from the project. It will also serve as a hub for a hydrogen network of actors in Mexico.

Project: Expanding the Colombian Climate Asset Disclosure Initiative (CCADI)
Result_Title: Report on personalised recommendations to the investors that answer the questionnaire to enhance investment decision-making and strategic actions in line with climate objectives
Description:
With the purpose of scaling up the impact built by CCADI’s implementation in 2019 and 2020, the initiative will continue to support the follow-up on personalised recommendations to pension funds and insurance companies. This process will be completed by using a follow-up tool developed by the project. As a result, CCADI will report on the current status of the recommendations, whether they have been implemented by institutional investors, or not, and the reasons behind. 
Progress reports will be presented in 2021-Q1, 2021-Q2 and 2021-Q3.
All final personalised recommendations to each investor that answers the questionnaire will be presented in 2022 Q1. 
It is expected that asset owners are taken to a position to act on the recommendations in an upward spiral, catalysed by the ranking that can be followed up by the relevant stakeholders in Colombia.

Project: Empowering territories’ for low carbon transformation
Result_Title: Energy and transport network with relevant decision makers from 5 primary beneficiary departments
Description: Bi-weekly meetings and stakeholder engagement strategy that  guarantee the ongoing participation of key actors (governmental and non-governmental) in the activities of sectoral vision creation and diffusion. A champion from each department will became the focal point of the project and bi-weekly calls will be set to follow up and agree on project activities/timeline and continue engagement and political buy-in.

Project: Green Finance for the development of Smart Cities in Mexico II, working to accelerate the implementation of low carbon local projects and sustainable development
Result_Title: On-demand technical guidance documents for cities about specific projects to support and improve their access to finance
Description: As a result of the technical assistance provided and the identified gaps and technical information needed in the project, technical studies will be developed on request of each project to support its access to green financing (e.g. market studies, environmental analyses, business models design, engineering designs, impact assessments, etc.). Since this is an on-demand deliverable, a clear definition of the sectors to expand guidelines on are to be defined.

Project: Green Finance for the development of Smart Cities in Mexico II, working to accelerate the implementation of low carbon local projects and sustainable development
Result_Title: Climate-related networks between financial institutions and local governments are strengthened with a view to increase access to finance for shortlisted projects
Description: Once shortlisted projects are analysed and suitable financing mechanisms are identified, projects are expected to find financial interest from different institutions and collaboration networks are created/ strengthened. For mature projects, project owners will be accompanied to start the journey to finance and will be in touch with the established network of financial institutions or investors through a matchmaking process.

Project: Green Finance for the development of Smart Cities in Mexico II, working to accelerate the implementation of low carbon local projects and sustainable development
Result_Title: Final reports, lessons learned, and study cases (communication products such as publications, infographics, etc.) disseminated
Description: In order to ensure the project's sustainability, several pieces of knowledge dissemination materials will be developed. Theses materials include: Final Report (containing a briefing of the works performed during the year's program), lessons learned  in the preparation and progress of the project, as well as with the seeking of financing, Infographics with processes and methodologies. The dissemination of these documents will be made by live  presentations and shared through meetings, forums, as well as in our social networks (e.g., website, YouTube, LinkedIn). All non-confidential products shall be made available to all interested parts.

Project: Improve and replicate local capacity building processes linked to value chains and networks in the Agriculture, Forest and other Land Use Sector in six jurisdictions of the GCF Task Force Mexico
Result_Title: 1 Academic Program (Jalisco) for 30 farm schools to improve farmer's technical financial and business capacities
Description:
SEMADET and the Environmental Intermunicipal Initiatives receive the four capacity building training models designed and the work plans to implement them in the municipalities considered in the project. The modules will be received by 550 producers in Jalisco, if which 20% are women.
We aim to provide a minimum of 32 training sessions of 8 hours each session, 85 hours per quarter, covering 183 producers each quarter.

Project: Improve and replicate local capacity building processes linked to value chains and networks in the Agriculture, Forest and other Land Use Sector in six jurisdictions of the GCF Task Force Mexico
Result_Title: Jalisco: Roadmap for the continuation of the local training models, planning tool for the government and for producers
Description: A roadmap to increase the potential for continuation of the local training models in Jalisco. The roadmap includes identification of farm field school leaders (securing women participation) as local change agents to get them involved in the constant training local models and replicating processes. The roadmap also incorporates next steps with responsibilities, specific roles, and sources of funding.

Project: Improve and replicate local capacity building processes linked to value chains and networks in the Agriculture, Forest and other Land Use Sector in six jurisdictions of the GCF Task Force Mexico
Result_Title: 1 Academic program (Chiapas) to strengthen producers' capacities for collecting, storing, and transporting the resin, to collection centers and promoting forest conservation
Description: SEMAHN and CONAFOR receive the six capacity building training models designed, in addition to the work plans to implement lessons learned, in the municipalities considered in the project. The modules will be delivered to 340 producers of which 15% are women. We aim to provide a minimum of 36 raining sessions of 8 hours each session, 96 hours per quarter, covering 113 producers each quarter.

Project: Improve and replicate local capacity building processes linked to value chains and networks in the Agriculture, Forest and other Land Use Sector in six jurisdictions of the GCF Task Force Mexico
Result_Title: Chiapas: Participatory road map for the integration of a second-level organization, and planning tool for the government and for producers
Description: This will be a participatory road map for the integration of a second-level organization (organizations formed by groups of entities united by a common purpose) identifying the requirements for its formal constitution. Includes responsibilities, specific roles, and sources of funding.

Project: Improve and replicate local capacity building processes linked to value chains and networks in the Agriculture, Forest and other Land Use Sector in six jurisdictions of the GCF Task Force Mexico
Result_Title: 1 Academic program (Tabasco) for cocoa practices and alternatives activities
Description: SBSCC receives the capacity building training model designed and the work plan to implement it in Finca La Luz, Camalcalco, Tabasco. The training will be provided to 110 producers, with 20% of them being women. The project aims to provide a minimum of 32 training sessions of 8 hours each session, 85 hours per quarter, covering 37 producers each quarter.

Project: Improve and replicate local capacity building processes linked to value chains and networks in the Agriculture, Forest and other Land Use Sector in six jurisdictions of the GCF Task Force Mexico
Result_Title: Tabasco: Study proposing productive alternatives for farmers
Description: This study will propose alternative productive activities associated to the conservation of the agroforestry system for farmers in Tabasco.

Project: Improve and replicate local capacity building processes linked to value chains and networks in the Agriculture, Forest and other Land Use Sector in six jurisdictions of the GCF Task Force Mexico
Result_Title: Tabasco: Roadmap for the Integral Management of the Cocoa Agroforestry System (for the government and producers)
Description: This roadmap will include a  plan for the Integral Management of the Cocoa Agroforestry System. Inlcudes responsibles, specific roles and sources of funding.

Project: Improve and replicate local capacity building processes linked to value chains and networks in the Agriculture, Forest and other Land Use Sector in six jurisdictions of the GCF Task Force Mexico
Result_Title: 1 Academic Program (Campeche) for 4 capacity building modules to strengthen the capacities of beekepers and improve their management models
Description: SEMABICC receives four capacity-building training models and the work plans to implement them in the municipalities considered in the project. The training will be provided to 100 beekeepers, with 25% of them being women. The project aims to provide a minimum of 36 raining sessions of 8 hours each session, 96 hours per quarter, covering 33 producers each quarter.

Project: Improve and replicate local capacity building processes linked to value chains and networks in the Agriculture, Forest and other Land Use Sector in six jurisdictions of the GCF Task Force Mexico
Result_Title: 1 Academic Program (Yucatán) for 6 capacity-building models developed for strengthen the capacities of beekeepers
Description: SDS and JIBIOPUCC receive the six capacity-building training models and the work plans to implement them in the municipalities considered in the project. The six modules designed will be delivered as capacity building to 650 beekeepers in Yucatan, of which 20% are women. We aim to provide a minimum of 36 training sessions of 8 hours each session, 96 hours per quarter, covering 216 producers each quarter.

Project: Improve and replicate local capacity building processes linked to value chains and networks in the Agriculture, Forest and other Land Use Sector in six jurisdictions of the GCF Task Force Mexico
Result_Title: A participatory roadmap for the integration of the honey value chain (Campeche, Yucatán and Quintana Roo)
Description: A participatory roadmap for the integration of the honey value chain in the region (3 States: Campeche, Yucatán and Quintana Roo) identifying responsibilities, specific roles, and sources of funding.

Project: Improve and replicate local capacity building processes linked to value chains and networks in the Agriculture, Forest and other Land Use Sector in six jurisdictions of the GCF Task Force Mexico
Result_Title: 1 Academic Program (Quinta Roo) for 4 capacity-building models developed for strengthening the capacities of beekeepers
Description: SEMAQROO receives the four training models designed and the work plans to implement them in the municipalities considered in the project. The training will be provided to 750 beekeepers of which 20% are women. We aim to provide a minimum of 32  training sessions of  8 hours each session, 85 hours per quarter, covering 250 producers each quarter.

Project: Improve and replicate local capacity building processes linked to value chains and networks in the Agriculture, Forest and other Land Use Sector in six jurisdictions of the GCF Task Force Mexico
Result_Title: Proposal to update the apicultural law in Quintana Roo
Description: The project will design a first version of a proposal to update the apicultural law in Quintana Roo in line with environmental and protection of beekeeping policies, given the risks of the expansion of the agricultural and livestock frontiers.

Project: Strengthening the Legislative-Executive-Stakeholder dialogue on Mexico's climate change and energy goals at the national and subnational levels
Result_Title: Report with recommendations/lessons learned for the update of state climate change laws
Description: A document with recommendations/lessons learned for the update of state climate change laws and a communication event to present the document.

Project: Strengthening the Legislative-Executive-Stakeholder dialogue on Mexico's climate change and energy goals at the national and subnational levels
Result_Title: Partnerships/networks created and/or strengthened with local stakeholders from 5 states (Jalisco, Guanajuato, Yucatán, Quintana Roo, Puebla) to update Climate Change Laws
Description: A document of identification of legislators interested in updating Climate Change Laws in 5 states (Jalisco, Guanajuato, Yucatán (law proposal), Quintana Roo and Puebla) and bilateral meetings with relevant legislators, their advisors, and other key officials.

Project: Greening the Colombian Financial System: Implementing local green definitions to enable long-term investment into priority sectors.
Result_Title: Taxonomy Technical Assistance to main financial market players
Description:
The technical assistance to 3 beneficiary institutions will screen and review each of their portfolios with the local and international taxonomy, while providing them the knowledge to understand this screening process. As a result, beneficiary institutions will broaden their skills in identifying green assets, screening criteria, and being able to replicate the process. Each technical assistance is expected to last on average 3 months, which will include meetings, portfolio review, and capacity building sessions. The technical assistance will be provided to 3 institutions in total with 20-25  internal staff members trained.
Partial progress to be presented in 2021 Q3, 2021 Q4, and 2022 Q1.

Project: Greening the Colombian Financial System: Implementing local green definitions to enable long-term investment into priority sectors.
Result_Title: Pipeline of eligible projects under the local Taxonomy and Engagement Tracker for possible funding by Fonclima and other financial instruments
Indicator: Output 2.3. 'Project application/ tools developed to access funds'
Description:
The special Technical Assistance to the MHCP will entail a portfolio review to identify the pipeline of eligible projects under the local taxonomy. This screening will be useful to tag projects that will be financed by Fonclima (a fund that intends to finance sustainable projects) and other financial instruments such as the Sovereign Green Bond. The engagement with the Ministry of Finance, as well as with the Fund's Senior Committee, will be done through calls and virtual meetings.
Partial progress to be presented in 2021 Q3, 2021 Q4, and 2022 Q1.

Project: Greening the Colombian Financial System: Implementing local green definitions to enable long-term investment into priority sectors.
Result_Title: Advisory to the Taxonomy Supervisory Committee on green definitions and alignment with global standards and best practices, resulting in a Colombian Taxonomy Tool that integrates all recommendations and technical criteria
Description:
Through information sessions with CBI experts, support will be provided to the Taxonomy Supervisory Committee on additional technical questions regarding green definitions. This is to ensure that the Colombian Taxonomy Tool will be in alignment with global standards and best practices when it comes to the final green definitions. Recommendations made to the Taxonomy Supervisory Committee will be recorded through the meeting minutes. 
Partial progress to be presented in 2021 Q3, 2021 Q4, and 2022 Q1.

Project: Greening the Colombian Financial System: Implementing local green definitions to enable long-term investment into priority sectors.
Result_Title: Four short online trainings on green bond basics, market overview, and the Colombian Taxonomy
Description:
Four (4) short online trainings, mainly for financial institutions and potential issuers, for disseminating local green definitions and specific material to deep dive in topics requiring broadened knowledge. The target number of attendees for each training is 20-25 participants and the duration of each training will be of 4 hours total. The four trainings will covered the topics of the green bond basics, market overview and the Colombian Taxonomy.
First three Workshops are expected in 2021 Q3 and the fourth Workshop in 2021 Q4.

Project: Greening the Colombian Financial System: Implementing local green definitions to enable long-term investment into priority sectors.
Result_Title: Green Bond online capacity training sessions
Description: Two (2) in-depth capacity training sessions for verifiers, Ministry of Finance, industry associations, and issuers. CBI has successfully provided Green Bond online training through the COVID-19 pandemic. The target number of attendees for each training is 20-25 participants and the duration of each training will be 8 hours total. The training will cover the following topics : green bond basics and market overview, market dynamics, policy overview, and the Colombian Taxonomy. First training expected in August 2021, Second training expected in October 2021.

Project: Greening the Colombian Financial System: Implementing local green definitions to enable long-term investment into priority sectors.
Result_Title: Podcast series on sustainable finance
Description:
Podcast series containing five (5) episodes related to what has been developed throughout the project. The podcast series on Sustainable Finance targets a broad and diverse audience. This has been successfully rolled out in other markets and has proven to be an accessible communications tool due to the pre-recorded convenience and format. This output helps bridge the gap in the market for a sustainable, finance accessible, international knowledge-sharing medium for which there is growing demand. Also, for the design of an internal communication strategy to integrate green finance.
1st and 2nd episode: 2021-Q3
3rd and 4th episodes: 2021-Q4
5th episode: 2022-Q1.

Project: Accelerating development of new bioeconomy businesses and enhanced capacities for green jobs promotion and increased climate action ambition from policy implementation and integration.
Result_Title: Project's closing webinar with high-level speakers to raise awareness about bioeconomy acceleration and SENA's technical carbon programmes
Description:
Delivery of one (1) webinar with high-level speakers, such as Minciencias Minister, Environment and Sustainable Development DNP director,  GGGI Country Representative, SENA General Director, and UK embassy representative. The webinar will serve to 1) raise awareness about the bioeconomy acceleration mechanism and bioproducts, 2) SENA's new technical low- carbon programs, 3) Harmonization of the Green Growth Policy, Post-COVID Green Recovery Strategy, Agenda 2030, 4) collect feedback.
Webinar to be targeted at:
DNP
MinAmbiente
MinCiencias
MinComercio
Investors
Academy representatives
Subnational entities
Clusters and trade union representatives
Citizens

Project: Scaling up rural electrification via capacity building to public and private actors
Result_Title: Capacity building training modules developed, tested & transferred to MME and IPSE for continued use by subnational entities to develop sustainable rural electrification projects and high-quality funding proposals to the SGR system and public energy funds
Description:
Development of online training modules targeting subnational entities’ capacity gaps to develop rural electrification projects and access funding from the SGR system and Colombia’s public energy funds, including FENOGE, FAZNI and FAER. Before being handed over, the training modules will be validated with MME, IPSE, and subnational entities through the delivery of two (2) pilot capacity building webinars to test the content and deliverability of the training material, collect, and integrate feedbacks. The training material will be bundled into a “Certified Rural Electrification Project Developer” certificate made available via MME’s and IPSE’s websites for their continued use. The course will be embedded into the training and career development plan of subnational entities’ staff responsible for the planning of rural electrification efforts.
Target: One (1) web-based training modules developed and handed over to MME and IPSE.

Project: Scaling up rural electrification via capacity building to public and private actors
Result_Title: Technical and funding proposals for two prioritized projects to be submitted to MME's SGR program and access funding via the SGR scheme
Indicator: Output 2.3. 'Project application/ tools developed to access funds'
Description:
GGGI will work closely with the General System of Royalties (SGR) team from the Ministry of Evergy and prioritize subnational entities to identify, support and re-submit 2 high-priority projects that were submitted to the SGR funding scheme in 2018-2019, but did not fulfill all technical and financial criteria to receive funding. GGGI will provide support during the structuring process of projects from selected subnational entities and throughout the revision process to ensure questions and comments from the SGR team are effectively addressed to achieve funding approval.
Target: Two (2) funding proposals submitted to MME's SGR program.

Project: Scaling up rural electrification via capacity building to public and private actors
Result_Title: Renewable energy rural electrification projects designed and structured, market of private-sector led off-grid projects provided to investors
Indicator: Output 2.3. 'Project application/ tools developed to access funds'
Description:
Through close work with MME, identify and support the design and structuring of three private-sector led off-grid projects and assist with securing investment commitments for the implementation of the projects.. Selected projects will receive technical assistance from GGGI to complete required engineering design, feasibility studies, or other outstanding project needs to bring the project to mature design stage. Structure projects will be marketed to a wide range of possible investors to secure investment commitments leading to funding and implementation.
Target: Three (3) renewable energy rural electrification projects designed, structured and presented to investors for funding.

Project: Adopting New Technology, Mindsets, and Practices to Transform Colombia’s Agricultural Sector
Result_Title: Working sessions and events to strengthen Profe network on CSA and sustaninable landscapes
Description:
This network is key to create a community of practice whereby farmer innovators share their experience implementing and monitoring CSA practices, exchange ideas and solve shared challenges collectively, also provide the recognition when farmer innovators publicly commit to expand their land, and actively encourage farmer innovators to share and teach other farmers in their communities to adopt CSA practices that support reduced emissions.

*Reinforcement of Profe Network by 10 x 4-hour workshop on peer to peer learning methodologies to ignite social diffusion of targeted behaviors. Two workshops per municipality - Cubarral, Lejanías, El Dorado, El Castillo, Granada. A combination of in-person events (i.e. peer-to-peer workshops, public recognition event), digital space (i.e. WhatsApp group chat) and social marketing (i.e. radio) will be used to establish and reinforce a Profe network (“Profe” is an informal term of respect in Spanish denoting experience and expertise). Expected date: 2021 Q2

*5 public recognition events where farmer innovators pledge to expand CSA practices on their land and provide public sign up sheets to enroll more farmers. One event per municipality. During the public recognition event farmer innovators will pledge to expand CSA practices on their land and provide public sign-up sheets to enroll more farmers. Expected date: 2021 Q4

Project: Adopting New Technology, Mindsets, and Practices to Transform Colombia’s Agricultural Sector
Result_Title: 5 x 1-day workshops with farmers and community leaders to become part of the CB-MRV system, emphasizing a gender approach
Description:
1 day training workshop with farmers and community leaders to become a part of the CB-MRV system, emphasizing a gender approach. Main aspects of the training include i) Elements of the system, ii) Data collection protocols, iii) Data collection process. 5 workshops, 1 per municipality (Cubarral, Lejanías, El Dorado, El Castillo, Granada).
Through the CB-MRV system farmers start collecting the data to monitor their contribution to mitigate climate change.

Project: Adopting New Technology, Mindsets, and Practices to Transform Colombia’s Agricultural Sector
Result_Title: Recommendation paper to influence planning instruments at the local level
Description:
Key findings and data from the project are shared through co-design sessions with the Governor's office and Cormacarena officials to craft a recommendations report to the Secretary of Agriculture to inform the PDEA, as well as the Secretary of Environment and Cormacarena to inform the PRICCO.
Target: 1 report with recommendations on integration of sustainable agricultural practices and natural resource management at landscape-level.

Project: Adopting New Technology, Mindsets, and Practices to Transform Colombia’s Agricultural Sector
Result_Title: Report consolidating the data collected through the community-based carbon monitoring system (CB-MRV), available for local communities to access new funding through the carbon market for reducing carbon emissions
Indicator: Output 2.3. 'Project application/ tools developed to access funds'
Description:
Definition of the information required for a Project Document to be registered in one of the voluntary standards for carbon markets. Compilation through the CB-MRV system so that a project could be registered under one of the voluntary standards for carbon markets.
Target: Report analyzing data collected through the community-based carbon monitoring system (CB-MRV) to support local communities’ access to new funding through the carbon market.

Project: Sabah Renewable Energy Rural Electrification Road Map
Result_Title: Policy reviews and dialogues on the application of existing frameworks in off-grid contexts
Description: The policy reviews will generate recommendations in regard to the application in the off-grid context of the existing regulatory framework, grid codes and new policy mechanisms such as feed-in-tariffs and renewable portfolio standards, with the Policy Dialogues covering all these issues. The review will be useful for primary beneficiaries and all stakeholders for mobilising the creative energies and political will to improve the enabling policy environment.

Project: Sabah Renewable Energy Rural Electrification Road Map
Result_Title: Funding map to identify existing and potential financial flows for rural electrification with renewables
Indicator: Output 2.3. 'Project application/ tools developed to access funds'
Description: This output will identify existing and potential financial flows (international, federal, state, private, philanthropic and blended) into rural electrification with renewables in Sabah; nuanced through connection with those funders where possible; and proposing a range of funding models appropriate to the variety of circumstances on the ground. The target for this funding map will be the planners and implementers of RE development, Sabahan agencies, and new philanthropic, bilateral and multilateral funding sources. This funding map is needed because (a) planners and implementers need to understand the diversity of financing needs and options for different kinds of end users; (b) Sabahan agencies have inadequately understood and accessed existing federal and other Malaysian funding sources for which they may qualify; and (c) new philanthropic, bilateral and multilateral funding sources are coming on stream which can bring significant value if identified and diversify the terms under which rural electrification can happen.

Project: Sabah Renewable Energy Rural Electrification Road Map
Result_Title: Implementer and Planner Tool Kit for renewable mini-grids
Description:
The project will deliver a set of tools that enable conceptualization and design of next generation mini-grid solar, micro/mini-hydro and solar-hydro hybrid systems at a scale suitable for Sabah:
(1) Implementer Tool Kits is a useful and reliable tool for renewable energy developers that are looking to actually build and design PV and micro-hydro based mini-grids. They help practitioners determine system sizing and costing, and lowest cost generation options. Related Tool Kits include operator manuals; and literature focused on ensuring best practices are followed when operating, designing and evaluating village-based mini-grids. 
(2)  Planner Tool Kits - typically more academic and geared towards optimizing by identifying the lowest cost, highest performing energy access option. This guides decision-makers and planners by factoring in costs, generation technologies, climate resilience, and grid availability.

Project: Sabah Renewable Energy Rural Electrification Road Map
Result_Title: Two policy briefs with recommendations incorporated for mini-grid projects and renewable energy development
Description: Two policy briefs will be developed (i) a "Mini-grid code" policy brief to include recommendations that will ensure a certain level of reliability, safety, beneficiary involvement and environmental stewardship in future mini-grid projects; and (ii) "Renewable energy incentives" policy brief to focus on developing incentives for communities and the private sector to actually accelerate renewable energy development. These two policy briefs will be developed as to respond to the confusion behind the Malaysian policy and regulatory framework related to off-grid electrification - even for domestic audiences. Currently, there are two separate ministries and numerous other agencies involved in the process for renewable energy development, with unclear accountability on government's authority. The function of the policy briefs is to demystify this process for the benefit of developers and funders, while providing a set of recommendations that could enable replication of renewable mini-grids at scale. This work could usefully complement - and be developed in partnership with - the UNDP proposed UK-PACT project if both these projects are financed.

Project: Sabah Renewable Energy Rural Electrification Road Map
Result_Title: Refresher course for mini-grid operators
Description: Under the remit of a “refresher course” for 30 existing mini-grid operators (village technicians who maintain and manage remote area mini-grids), this output will upgrade their skills, provide a space for them to share their experience of managing mini-grids, and serve as a first step to the organization of this cohort into an association that can build an “esprit de corps” among operators to sustain learning and engagement. The Refresher Course involves five days of full-time training, drawing upon existing training materials developed by CREATE/TONIBUNG, while sensitive to training needs identified by these operators themselves based on their years of experience. Lessons from these operators/managers and this training will also feed into the Tool Kits.

Project: Sabah Renewable Energy Rural Electrification Road Map
Result_Title: Virtual 'Practice to Policy' workshop
Description: A two-day virtual 'Practice to Policy' workshop (target 20 persons) to facilitate knowledge transfer between Sabah and South/Southeast Asia around successful rural renewable electrification policies and practice to enhance capacities in public institutions (including SESB and Ministry of Rural Development) and in civil society. Sabah has much to learn from the experience and innovation of its neighbours; it can be particularly helpful for government officials to learn, for example, what the policy, institutional, financial and technical arrangements were in Sri Lanka and Nepal for the successful roll-out of rural electrification over ten years.

Project: MYEcoPlan – Developing a Low Carbon City Planning System for PLANMalaysia
Result_Title: Low carbon city calculation framework
Description: Development of framework that consist of carbon emissions calculations, estimations, and assumptions to be used in the study and also other relevant information required in order to create a database for subsequent land use calculations and low carbon initiatives and scenarios. This framework will then be used as a basis for the MyEcoPlan system and will be presented to the recipient for approval prior to finalising it for the system. Decision to finalise the specification will be documented in the form of meeting minutes.

Project: Green Finance for the development of Smart Cities in Mexico II, working to accelerate the implementation of low carbon local projects and sustainable development
Result_Title: Coaching on Financial Access for projects in early phases in 7 cities
Description: As a result of the integration of a low carbon initiatives list, seven cities (Naucalpan, Ixtapaluca, Zapopan, Hermosillo, Chihuahua, Chihuahua, Villahermosa & Mérida) — projects identified in early phases — will receive a finance training and will participate in a Green Finance Innovation Workshop where financial trends and best practices in this field will be shared to maximize their potential to access Green Finance.

Project: Green Finance for the development of Smart Cities in Mexico II, working to accelerate the implementation of low carbon local projects and sustainable development
Result_Title: Training sessions on impact assessment (ESG & SDG), economic evaluation, and financial modeling
Description:
As part of the experience and lessons learned from UK Pact Round 1, the project identified two topics that are relevant for green finance and that are critical for the success in accessing to financing to the projects. The modality of these will be an online workshop. Due to the specificity and confidentiality of the information needed for the development of business models, the project will deliver a separate workshop on economic evaluations and financial modeling for each city.
1. ESG & SDG  (General to all beneficiaries)
2. Economic Evaluations and financial modeling (Individual per city and per project)

Project: Green Finance for the development of Smart Cities in Mexico II, working to accelerate the implementation of low carbon local projects and sustainable development
Result_Title: Online workshop series on sector-specific topics to increase beneficiaries' capacities to better prepare projects for financing
Description: Monthly online workshops (trainings) that will run from April through December, designed to increase capacities, knowledge, and funding feasibility (financing). These workshops will be 1.5-hours long  and delivered on a monthly basis with the participation of a senior expert on the topic addressed. The trainings will address specific demands and topics accordingly to the needs identified.

Project: Strengthening the Legislative-Executive-Stakeholder dialogue on Mexico's climate change and energy goals at the national and subnational levels
Result_Title: Two legislation recommendations to harmonize Mexico City’s Climate Change Law with other sectoral legislation
Description: One proposal for each of the two sectors [TBD] to harmonize sectoral legislation with Mexico City's Climate Change Law.  These proposals will be presented to Mexico City's Congress and build-on raised awareness to support the presentation of each reform proposal.

Project: Strengthening the Legislative-Executive-Stakeholder dialogue on Mexico's climate change and energy goals at the national and subnational levels
Result_Title: Partnerships/networks created and/or strengthened with relevant actors from Mexico City to harmonize Mexico City’s Climate Change Law with other sectoral legislation
Description: An identification document of legislators interested in harmonizing Mexico City's Climate Change Law with other sectoral legislation and bilateral meetings held with relevant legislators, advisers, and other key officials.

Project: Strengthening the Legislative-Executive-Stakeholder dialogue on Mexico's climate change and energy goals at the national and subnational levels
Result_Title: Communication products (infographics, banners and podcasts) disseminated
Description: Communication products disseminated (infographics, banners and podcasts) throughout the duration of the project related to the issues addressed to increase awareness among beneficiaries and relevant stakeholders (legislators at the local level, government officials and other relevant stakeholders from Mexico City, Jalisco, Guanajuato, Yucatán, Quintana Roo, and Puebla)

Project: Strengthening the Legislative-Executive-Stakeholder dialogue on Mexico's climate change and energy goals at the national and subnational levels
Result_Title: Skills enhancement of local legislators from 5 states to update local Climate Change Laws (Jalisco, Guanajuato, Yucatán, Quintana Roo, Puebla)
Description: Two high-level events in each state (5 in total: Jalisco, Guanajuato, Yucatán, Quintana Roo, and Puebla) to raise awareness and train legislators about the relevance of having an updated Climate Change Law to support emissions reduction according to the state’s context and necessities.

Project: Paving the Way for Setting Ambitious GHG Emissions Reductions in the Private Sector to enhance the National Climate Change Policy
Result_Title: A public learning platform for government institutions and companies with SBT content and knowledge materials
Description: A public online learning platform (most likely to be hosted on an SBTi website for Mexico) with differentiated content for government institutions and companies, including the tailored workshops, recommendations, technical content, and materials on setting SBTs derived from the project activities. This output aims to enable key stakeholders of government institutions and the private sector in Mexico to have access to specific materials that help to widely spread the importance of corporate participation in the national climate action and broaden the scope of the SBTi in Mexico.

Project: Assessment of the greenhouse gas mitigation potential of hydrogen. An implementation roadmap for Mexico
Result_Title: Networking visit to green hydrogen experts in the UK
Description: Visit to the main green hydrogen experts in the United Kingdom for key actors in Mexico (government officials, private sector, and civil society) to establish a network for possible Mexico-UK collaboration on a future pilot project. Additionally, the visit will serve to obtain feedback from UK leading experts and establish a contact with potential presenters for the final dissemination event.

Project: Green Economy Policy for Sarawak
Result_Title: Green Economy Policy framework for Sarawak: recommendations document
Description: The project will develop green economy policy framework for Sarawak, where it will provide recommendations for suitable green economy policies to be adopted by Government of Sarawak. The framework will incorporate an analysis of the existing policy framework in Sarawak, an overview of international experience in transitioning to green economies, a comparative analysis to identify best practices, and economy wide as well as sectoral recommendations to be adopted by Sarawak within their state planning as the way to transition Sarawak to Green Economy. The policy framework will cover key focus areas (e.g. energy, land use and biodiversity, transport, low carbon cities, industry, and enablers), recommend targets and initiatives for the State to consider and plan for implementation towards a low carbon, resource efficient and socially inclusive economy.

Project: Green Economy Policy for Sarawak
Result_Title: Carbon trading policy framework: recommendations document
Description: The project will develop carbon trading policy framework as a recommendation to develop carbon trading projects. This document will identify the requirements to develop a carbon trading scheme, provide a review of existing regulations on carbon emissions, and provide additional documentations required to implement carbon trading projects such as draft commercial agreement, certification and project development guideline. This document is expected to be adopted by Government of Sarawak to be used as strategy in determining the readiness and pathways for Sarawak to implement carbon trading.

Project: Green Economy Policy for Sarawak
Result_Title: Capacity building on the carbon trading policy framework
Description: The project will provide 3 capacity building sessions on developing/understanding the carbon trading policy framework. This training will last 2-3 hours each and it will be attended by 20-30 people from the EPU division and Ministry of Urban Development and Natural Resources of the Sarawak government. These participants will learn the detail from the recommendations about the carbon trading policy framework. The planned capacity building sessions will cover three main themes: 1. Capacity building on green economy policy - Key insights & lessons learned from around the world; 2. Capacity building on carbon trading - Key insights & lessons learned from around the world; 3. Capacity building on carbon trading policy framework - Adoption & next steps.

Project: Green Economy Policy for Sarawak
Result_Title: Communication products for Sarawak Green Economy Policy & Carbon trading
Description: The project will produce the following communications products for the general public: 1. Summary of Sarawak Green Economy Policy 2. Infographic on Sarawak Green Economy Policy 3. Infographic on carbon trading project 4. Communications framework. These will be disseminated to key stakeholders in the Government of Sarawak, to be used in their website and a potential public event for dissemination upon the formal adoption of the policy.

Project: Harnessing Green Finance through Climate-related Risk Management and Opportunities in Malaysia
Result_Title: Two trainings and engagements on applying climate risk assessment tools (scenario analysis and stress testing) with two major banks.
Description: Two bilateral trainings on climate risk assessment (scenario analysis and stress testing) will be delivered to at least two major banks that enables the banks to assess their portfolio alignment with the Paris Agreement and to assess their exposure to transition risk. The bilateral training is done between 2DII and two banks (CIMB and Maybank), with participants come from the personnel who will be involved in doing climate scenario analysis and risk management.  Preparatory activities (adapting the PACTA and stress-testing tools by identifying and incorporating any information and data relevant to Malaysia) will be conducted April - July. Step-by-step technical assistance for the targeted financial institutions to use the PACTA tool to measure the alignment of their financial portfolios and stress testing, and ongoing engagement with banks during the PACTA application and stress-testing pilot exercise will take place July - November. Due to the sensitive nature of beneficiaries’ data (commercial banks) that will be used in the scenario analysis and stress testing exercise, the result of the training may or may not be disclosed to third parties subject to the Non-Disclosure Agreement (NDA) by the bank. The ownership of the data and the result of stress testing and scenario analysis will likely remain with the respective bank. However, the lessons and insights learned from the scenario analysis and stress testing exercise will be integrated in other outputs. The content will be the same for both banks. Number of training participants is flexible and will depend on the bank, with approximately 5-10 people per bank. The bank may decide who gets involved, but the attendees are usually comes from the sustainability and risks teams. There will be two sessions for all participants (kick off and results presentation), and the follow on sessions on hands on tool training sessions will be targeted to participant with decent knowledge on R coding and that has good knowledge on the banks loan book. The combination of participants will be discussed furthermore with the bank. The duration of the training will depend on three elements: i. the proficiency of the banks on R or other programming languages; ii. the size of their loan book, and iii. the staff made available for the project. Depending on these factors, all of the necessary training will be conducted in 1 to 3 months. In addition to the training, the project will also have several engagement sessions by engaging key person in analyzing and discussing the results from the application of PACTA, including presentation of recommendations based on the analysis.

Project: Harnessing Green Finance through Climate-related Risk Management and Opportunities in Malaysia
Result_Title: Recommendations proposed to industry working groups to draft and develop the (VBIAF) sectoral guide based on the lessons learned from climate change industry best practices and impact risk management.
Description: WWF collaborates with the Value-based Intermediation Financing and Investment Impact Assessment Framework (VBIAF) sectoral guide working group to (1) propose recommendations on ESG risk identification and mitigation to the working group, and (2) review the technical aspects of the draft on ongoing basis. The recommendations and guidance will be developed as the VBIAF sectoral guide based on the lessons learned from climate change industry best practices and impact risk management. The VBIAF sectoral guide will include specific environmental and social risk aspects of the oil and gas, construction and infrastructure, and manufacturing sectors, e.g. identification of impact risks through good practices and benchmarking. There will be recommendations to three different sectoral guidances that include proposing exclusion list of activities, risk identification and mitigation, ESG standards and certifications, etc. The process will be done by conducting technical review and participate in monthly sectoral guide working group meetings and consulting relevant experts within WWF and 2DII’s global network. This VBIAF sectoral guides will be used by the Islamic banks in Malaysia (national level), but may also be applied by the conventional (non-Islamic) banks.

Project: Harnessing Green Finance through Climate-related Risk Management and Opportunities in Malaysia
Result_Title: Recommendations to improve BNM’s guidance document on their climate risk management and scenario analysis
Description: The project will review and provide recommendations to the draft guidance document that will be developed by Bank of Malaysia (BNM), to be used as the basis of BNM's climate risk management and scenario analysis. The recommendations will be based on the lessons learned from international practice as collected through 2DII's proprietary tools and engagement with international banks and financial supervisory bodies in various countries. The BNM's guidance document will complement their Climate Change and Principles-Based Taxonomy to advance climate risk management and stress testing practices for the financial sector in Malaysia (see https://www.bnm.gov.my/-/joint-statement-bnm-sc-greening-the-financial-sector). The recommendation is targeted to be adopted by the BNM and it's applicable to other financial institutions such as banks, insurance companies etc).

Project: MYEcoPlan – Developing a Low Carbon City Planning System for PLANMalaysia
Result_Title: Two trainings on low carbon city calculation framework
Description: Two (2) full-day training sessions will be conducted to brief the training recipients on the development of low carbon city calculation framework such as the principles of the framework, boundaries, basis of the GHG emissions calculation. This calculation framework will consist of carbon emissions calculations, estimations and assumptions to be used in the study and also other relevant information required in order to create a database for subsequent land use calculations and low carbon initiatives and scenarios. The framework will be used as a basis for the MYEcoPlan system and will be presented to the recipient for approval prior to finalising it for the system. Decision to finalise the specification will be documented in the form of meeting minutes. The training will also discuss on how the training recipient can update the emission factors if they would like to expand the scope in future or customise the emission factors for specific scenario. It is anticipated that less than 6 people to join each of the sessions. Estimated participants for the training includes Government agencies from national, regional and local government (e.g. PLANMalaysia, Ministry of Environment and Water, Iskandar Regional Development Authority (IRDA) and local authorities e.g. Iskandar Puteri City Council (MBIP)) as well as other sectors e.g. research institutes, NGOs, low carbon practitioners and planners.

Project: MYEcoPlan – Developing a Low Carbon City Planning System for PLANMalaysia
Result_Title: Series of trainings to operate the MYEcoPlan system: (1) full day training on web portal user training; (2) half day training on web database and server training; (3) half day training on web portal maintenance training.
Description:
Three (3) trainings for transfer of technology and capacity building will be done to ensure that the beneficiaries are well-equipped to take over the MYEcoPlan system once the project period ends.
