Training recipients will have better capacity to operate the system on their own where they can integrate carbon emissions data into city planning which will further provide them a basis to convince their management to replicate or scale-up the system for wider coverage. As the system's application expands after project closure, training recipients can share their experiences and skills to new staff and replicate the project to wider stakeholders. There will be three sessions for this training: 

(1) A full-day training will be conducted to brief the training recipients on the development of the web portal and the function of the portal. Estimated participants: 10 people .
(2) A half-day training will be conducted to brief the training recipients on the development principle of the database, the coding and how to maintain the database and server. Estimated participants: max 5 person from IT department.
(3) A half-day training will be conducted to brief the training recipients on the development principle of the portal and how to maintain the portal if there is any update. Estimated participants: max 5 person from IT department.

Project: MYEcoPlan – Developing a Low Carbon City Planning System for PLANMalaysia
Result_Title: Web-based MYEcoPlan Low Carbon Cities Planning System
Description: The web-based MYEcoPlan system provides an opportunity for cities to have a standardised low carbon city calculation framework to add value in their planning and decision-making processes. This system forms the main component of this project and acts upon the low carbon city calculation framework, and basically is an integration between carbon emissions data according to land use types and produces results in the form of carbon intensity maps according to user modelling of low carbon initiatives or indicators. It is a deliverable which can potentially be replicated and scaled-up to involve other areas or indicators in the future. Besides continuing to carry out data collection and data analysis for the pilot area and incorporating the data into the MYEcoPlan system for future land use planning, the users can start to look into the possibility of using the system as a supporting tool in the implementation of existing local plans and special area plans. The MYEcoPlan system specification and development will be presented to the recipient for approval prior to finalising it for the system. Decision to finalise the specification will be documented in the form of meeting minutes. The system will be officially handed over to PLAN Malaysia upon the completion of the project together with the final report and acknowledgement of transfer of ownership of the system. After completion of the project, the system can also be integrated into the I-Plan, IMUO and One Map platforms, as well as the UK-funded carbon calculator of GreenTech Malaysia, UK Prosperity Fund - ASEAN Low Carbon Energy Programme and GCom where IRDA and MBIP have participated and share a long-term vision to combat climate change with other cities around the world.

Project: MYEcoPlan – Developing a Low Carbon City Planning System for PLANMalaysia
Result_Title: Low carbon city calculation framework for spatial planning technical report
Description: A technical report on low carbon city calculation framework for spatial planning will be documented based on the useful lessons learned from this project in as a written report, with graphical charts. Sharing project lessons will benefit other local councils and town planners in developing their own carbon emissions reduction goals and contributing towards their NDC targets. The report will be submitted to primary beneficiaries and they may share with other relevant agencies (secondary beneficiaries) to showcase the project outputs especially to the local councils that are interested to replicate the system. The primary beneficiary can use this system to aid in the development of Low Carbon City Planning Guidelines.

Project: MYEcoPlan – Developing a Low Carbon City Planning System for PLANMalaysia
Result_Title: Project briefs on the lessons learned and good practices to develop city-level carbon emissions plan
Description: At the completion of the project, the project team will come together for a final session of sharing experiences, lessons learnt and good practices developed throughout the 9 months, with the hope that the system can be further shared to other town planners and wider local councils not only in Malaysia but also to other countries through ongoing city cooperation networks such as C40 Cities Climate Leadership Group (C40), Global Covenant of Mayors for Climate and Energy (GCom) and so on. The project will conduct a half-day workshop to share our experience with other local councils and town planners on the lessons learnt and good practices developed throughout the 9 months which can hopefully allow them to replicate the system to their respective local councils. Useful project lessons can be shared through websites, social media platforms and awareness events, so that the impact of the project can be shared with a wider community. Sharing project lessons will benefit other local councils and town planners in developing their own carbon emissions reduction goals and contributing towards their NDC targets. The project will promote the project through Eco-Ideal and beneficiaries' websites and social media platforms to increase the awareness on low carbon cities.

Project: Sabah Renewable Energy Rural Electrification Road Map
Result_Title: Project Profile Portfolio database for 200 villages
Description: Using the data collected through deployment of field researchers after the field research training, a database comprising of project profile portfolio will be developed to be used in the Feasibility Studies and Road Map. This database will be uploaded onto a public website, where impacted communities can provide further data and corrections. This database will serve as a reference point for unmet need and thus drive political will and assist CBOs, NGOs, and funders identify project actions.

Project: Sabah Renewable Energy Rural Electrification Road Map
Result_Title: Media releases and information package on the toolkit for renewable mini-grids
Description: The project will produce media releases and upload the information associated to the toolkit in the website, including a manual. In addition, the project will hold two socialisation sessions, one for implementers and one for planners, to introduce the toolkit to the relevant stakeholders.

Project: Sabah Renewable Energy Rural Electrification Road Map
Result_Title: The launch of Strategic Road Map website and media engagement
Description: In order to connect the co-creation and strategising process around the Road Map with broader societal and political will, we will build an interactive website to transparently present the Strategic Road Map, the underlying data and reports and other associated documents, and engaging material around the process, alongside a print and social media effort that includes community video that allows marginalized voices to be heard in the process. The website that include community video and social media streams, will be designed in September. This Strategic Road Map and its website will be launched at the end of the project with relevant media (precise event format to be decided with beneficiaries and stakeholders). High resolution versions of energy demand maps will be directly delivered to the primary beneficiary government agencies a planning baseline. An online launch event will be conducted to raise awareness and attended by all stakeholders. In addition, the map will be posted to the road map website so that it can be accessed by public.

Project: Hutanomics: Developing frameworks to enable private sector investments into nature-based climate solutions in Terengganu, Malaysia
Result_Title: Report on Forest GHG emissions scenarios
Description: The project will conduct assessment of forest GHG inventories and reduced GHG emissions under an alternative scenario, and identification of potential areas that could qualify as NBS projects and baseline assessment of co-benefits from potential NBS projects. Rimba will also conduct remote sensing and land use modelling to develop a map of forest reference emissions levels that can be used in land use planning to identify NBS projects.

Project: Hutanomics: Developing frameworks to enable private sector investments into nature-based climate solutions in Terengganu, Malaysia
Result_Title: NBS project business case
Description: The project will conduct feasibility assessments, develop business case and propose potential project structures for one pilot project. The findings and tools generated from the project will be applied to assess the financial and environmental viability of a proposed NBS pilot project area (the 200,000 ha Kenyir watershed). The business case will show the flow of finance through NBS projects, to ensure income from the sales of carbon credits fund forest protection activities.

Project: Hutanomics: Developing frameworks to enable private sector investments into nature-based climate solutions in Terengganu, Malaysia
Result_Title: Formalization of intent of private sector to collaborate on NBS projects in the state of Terengganu (Letter of intent or Memorandum of Understanding equivalent).
Description: Series of engagement with private sector (potential investors and off-takers) will be conducted with the goal of developing partnerships and collaboration between private sectors and the state government toward the development of NBS projects. This could include letter of intent, Memorandum of Understanding and /or any other form of formalised intent to collaborate on NBS project development.

Project: Sabah Renewable Energy Rural Electrification Road Map
Result_Title: Strategic Road Map to tackle rural electrification gaps
Description: This Strategic Road Map is a policy/strategy document that integrates learning from previous outputs with the results as generated in discussion among government, technical experts, funders, private sector and civil society. Special attention will be given to the views of primary beneficiary agencies (who will play lead roles in channeling funds to implementation) and non-electrified communities and their allies (who need to remain at the heart of the process). The Road Map is needed to clarify and focus public and private intention and resources to systematically transform the enabling environment, institutional capacities and technical approaches to tackling rural electrification with renewable. The Road Map will be useful for all stakeholders to deploy and mobilise political will, funding and institutional capacities.

Project: Sabah Renewable Energy Rural Electrification Road Map
Result_Title: Energy demand map
Description: This digital map will identify and characterise (in relationship to infrastructure, economic activity, topography etc.) 90% of all villages in Sabah without 24 Hour Electrification (estimated 800 villages). There is currently no comprehensive data on rural settlements and/or rural electrification status upon which to base state planning; this output will fill that gap. The digital map will be delivered in three stages. M1: a Working Draft shareable across the consortium and usable for scoping & communication purposes; M2: an Internal Draft that will be disseminated to beneficiaries and interested stakeholders for use and feedback; and M3: the Final Map. The digital map will be accompanied by a technical description of the metadata/data sources and process. This energy demand map is expected to be used by primary beneficiaries and all stakeholders to understand who and where are the non-electrified in Sabah, how far they are from the existing grid, and what the renewable options are.

Project: Sabah Renewable Energy Rural Electrification Road Map
Result_Title: Feasibility studies for 40 mini grids
Description: Forty technical feasibility studies for 40 mini grids will be developed as a representative set of investment-ready potential mini-grid design concepts based on solar PV, micro-hydro (integrated with ecosystem services/ catchment management options) and other locally-available renewable sources such as oil palm wastes. This output will bring the prospect of a tangible outcome to the Road Map process, and prepare for a new round of pilot projects, which will also prove an advocacy tool for the expansion of energy access goals. It will also provide a testing ground for the tools developed above. Finally, It will establish a suite of projects for proposed implementation beginning in 2022. These studies will be undertaken whenever COVID-19 regulations allow inter-district travel and community work; we hope to complete at least 10 in the first quarter; geographical grouping will be used to maximise productivity. In the eventuality that travel is not possible for the engineering team, village technicians will be called to mobile phone accessible locations in their home districts where they will be able to attend a virtual training session on feasibility study methodologies. They will then travel back to their villages to conduct the studies, submitting the data on to the engineering team. This team will be able to determine rough sizing, costing, and preliminary designs based on this and geospatial data. Green Empowerment and TONIBUNG have experience conducting such an exercise in Indonesia; while the results were satisfactory they can never be as accurate as a field engineer visit. First 10 feasibility studies will be completed by June, further 15 completed by September and the final 15 completed by December.

Project: Hutanomics: Developing frameworks to enable private sector investments into nature-based climate solutions in Terengganu, Malaysia
Result_Title: Workshop and technical support sessions with the task force to improve the capacity of the task force to adopt project outputs and develop NBS projects.
Description: Rimba will use the Terengganu state government's 'Green Financing Task Force' as a platform to enhance the members' capacity and provide technical support towards the develop of NBS climate project in the state. The task force includes: 1) Director, State Economic Planning Unit (Chair) 2) State Finance Officer 3) State Legal Advisor 4) Director, Terengganu State Parks Management Council 5) Director, Land and Mineral Department 6) Director, Federal Development Authority (KETENGAH) 7) Director, Forestry Department 8) Technical expert, UniSZA 9) Technical expert, UMT. Rimba will provide technical support and conduct workshops with the task force with focus on 'project development, legal/ governance frameworks, and project structure/ economics for NBS climate projects' to ensure they are equipped to use the project outputs.

Project: Hutanomics: Developing frameworks to enable private sector investments into nature-based climate solutions in Terengganu, Malaysia
Result_Title: Policy and legislative recommendations to the state Green Financing Task Force/ State Economic Planning Unit to develop NBS projects.
Description: Rimba will develop policy and legislative recommendation to develop NBS projects through conducting GHG assessments and stakeholder engagements. This process will develop a roadmap to guide policy at the state level, including tools and a framework to develop NBS projects and meet the requirements of future private investors/off-takers.

Project: Hutanomics: Developing frameworks to enable private sector investments into nature-based climate solutions in Terengganu, Malaysia
Result_Title: Recommendation to the Green Financing Task Force on how to participate and integrate local NBS projects into future national framework.
Description: Rimba will engage the federal ministry in charge of climate (KASA) and study the initial plans for a REDD+ programme and guidelines for developing voluntary carbon projects to provide recommendations to the State government on how to participate and integrate local NBS projects into a future national framework. The recommendations will be taken from the REDD+ strategy as well as from the identification of barriers and opportunities for the State to implement NBS projects independently and/or a future REDD+ state-level programme.

Project: Hutanomics: Developing frameworks to enable private sector investments into nature-based climate solutions in Terengganu, Malaysia
Result_Title: The Green Financing Task Force, as a network, is strengthened through the usage of project outputs towards the development of pilot project (a paper to be approved by the Task Force to be presented to state EXCO/ decision makers).
Description: Output from "Recommendations", "GHG emissions", "REDD+ guidelines" and "NBS business case" will be adapted for a specific pilot project area that can be used by the state government through the Green Financing Task Force to action upon (deliberate the approvals for the business case and legal structure) that would support the development of a pilot project. Project will convene the Green Financing Task Force to review the outputs towards optioning a paper to the the state EXCO (decision makers) for development of pilot project.

Project: Sabah Renewable Energy Rural Electrification Road Map
Result_Title: ENTEC Technical Exchange
Description: An in-person training at ENTEC’s HYCOM (Hydro Competence Centre) in Bandung, Indonesia, for five Sabahan engineers and technicians, with the purpose of enabling Malaysian engineers to manufacture the T15 cross-flow turbine (suited for low and medium head applications). This is expected to involve five engineers over six days.

Project: Accelerating Green Finance Flows Through the Strengthening of the Mexican National Banking and Securities Commission (CNBV)
Result_Title: Webinar to disseminate the recommendations report on international best practices and emerging regulation for ESG integration and climate related risks disclosure by financial intermediaries
Description: This webinar will be used to socialise the report on international best practices and and emerging regulation for ESG integration, as well as its recommendations, to a wider audience.

Project: Accelerating Green Finance Flows Through the Strengthening of the Mexican National Banking and Securities Commission (CNBV)
Result_Title: Webinar to disseminate the report and policy briefs developed on Green Financial Inclusion
Description: This webinar will be used to socialise the findings and recommendations in the report and policy briefs on Green Financial Inclusion to a wider audience.

Project: Technical assistance for the implementation of emergent design for active mobility and public space
Result_Title: Dissemination strategy (publications, infographics, and images) through allied media and public relations
Description:
A dissemination strategy will be developed to make the impact of the project visible and strengthen the relationship of multilevel work between federal government and local governments. The dissemination will be carried out through allied media and public relations. The delivery of this output will be through a series the publications, infographics, and images that will be disseminated through these media.
The output will develop and delivered from March 2021 through February 2022.

Project: Accelerating Fleet-wide electrification of public transport in Mexico City
Result_Title: Financial model for Corridors 5 & 6
Description: Financial model for Corridors 5 & 6 to help evaluate options for the purchase and operation of trolley buses for private operators.
Implementor: Dalberg Advisors (Asesores en Desarrollo Dalberg S. de R.L.)

Project: Technical assistance for the implementation of emergent design for active mobility and public space
Result_Title: Technical site visits and follow-up meetings with local government decision-makers
Description:
15 technical site visits (one per city, 3 days each) with local government decision-makers (105 in total) will be carried out in order to address the knowledge acquired by local governments in the territory. as well as to better understand the context of the city, identify and evaluate critical infrastructure issues or social aspects, and to have a closer approach with local governments. The technical sites visits will be developed and delivered from November 2021 through January 2022.

24 follow-up technical meetings with local government decision-makers will be scheduled between workshops with the aim of maintaining constant communication with the cities and to oversee the progress of the projects. During the follow-up meetings, the project will resolve doubts about the components of the projects. The follow-up technical meetings will be divided in 3 groups of work with 5 cities in each group, and will be develop during 15 days. The meetings will be developed and delivered from August 2021 through January 2022.

Project: Mexico Secondments: Enhancement of the Mexico City Public Environmental Fund (FAP)
Result_Title: Development of a communications strategy for the FAP
Description:
The secondee will support development of a communications strategy that will help communicate the existence of the FAP and its opportunities and strengths in mobilising funds. The strategy will also demonstrate the successes of the pilot and showcase an appealing profile of the fund that leads to mobilising funds for financing the climate change mitigation and adaptation Programme of Mexico City.

The communication strategy aims to be presented at green finance forums and to be shared with potential investors and allies.

Project: Mexico Secondments: Enhancement of the Mexico City Public Environmental Fund (FAP)
Result_Title: Developing recommendations and procedures manuals required by the rules of operation of the FAP, aiming to enhance due diligence processes and governance of the fund
Description:
The secondee will promote and provide recommendations for the publication of the rules of operation of the FAP (including procedure manual, risk management plan, project assessment methodology, and the credit framework) and the board composition, aiming to consolidate a more robust profile of the fund.  

This includes convincing the fund manager, board members and advisors of the benefits, opportunities and strengths of the FAP for using financial mechanisms to access to funds and increase, the size of the pool and the project pipeline.

Project: Business case development for Sector Job Resilience Planning in support of Just Transition in South Africa (Mpumalanga)
Result_Title: Climate extremes adaptation recommendations, through the application of early warning systems
Description:
Development of climate extremes adaptation recommendations, through the application of the early warning systems. This will include a strategy for use of early warning systems for the targeted sectors (agriculture and energy distribution infrastructure) and will have potential application in related sectors, such as water, transport, mining, construction and others. This will include an early warning system design and interpretation tool, piloted in the agriculture and energy distribution infrastructure sectors.  The approach planned is to follow the core principles of Responsible Research and undertake a 2-way co-design process that includes active participation of targeted stakeholder to ensure uptake of the project outputs thereby promoting climate resilience and preservation of livelihoods.  A  strategy for early warning systems will be proposed as a way of extending the lessons learned from the case study for other sectors of the economy. 
The climate extremes adaptation recommendations will be submitted to the Department for Environment, Forestry, and Fisheries (DEFF)

Project: Business case development for Sector Job Resilience Planning in support of Just Transition in South Africa (Mpumalanga)
Result_Title: Just Transition Social Protection Plan (SPP) for coal phase-out regions in South Africa
Description: A proposed just transition social protection plan will be developed based on the coal sector workforce skill audit as well as a high-level assessment of other social pathologies.  This is critically important since it will provide data for those that will be adversely affected by the transition and those that could be redeployed elsewhere.

Project: Business case development for Sector Job Resilience Planning in support of Just Transition in South Africa (Mpumalanga)
Result_Title: Coal waste beneficiation feasibility study and business cases (of at least 2 opportunities, if financially viable)
Indicator: Output 2.3. 'Project application/ tools developed to access funds'
Description:
Develop a feasibility assessment and the business case of recycling coal combustion waste products such as fly ash, to create new jobs and livelihoods in construction and agricultural markets. This will entail consideration of technologies for beneficiation of fly ash through a techno-economic feasibility assessment, market assessment and licensing of technologies (with CSIR having some ready for commercialisation), including those relevant to brick and paving applications, rare earth metal extraction from ash, mine backfilling after mine closure, mine drainage treatment, soil amelioration, and land reclamation. Key objectives include the following:
- Conduct a value chain analysis on coal combustion waste and identify opportunities for value addition of the waste into commercial products 
- Conduct a feasibility study on a minimum of two opportunities to investigate the viability of establishing a sustainable business(es).
The feasibility reports and business cases will be submitted to the Department for Environment, Forestry, and Fisheries (DEFF)

Project: City of Johannesburg Electric Vehicle Readiness Support
Result_Title: EV tariff proposal for submission to NERSA
Description: An EV tariff for submission to NERSA. The tariff will need to balance the City's needs (e.g. revenue protection / creation), City's goals (e.g. sustainable, inclusive city) and consumer and industry needs (e.g. EV charging cost vs. ICE vehicle fuel-up cost).

Project: City of Johannesburg Electric Vehicle Readiness Support
Result_Title: Feasibility study for the rollout of City-owned EV charging stations powered by renewable energy
Description: Review of regulatory environment to assess constraints / opportunities for implementing City-owned infrastructure; determine optimal locations of charging stations, in consultation with City, considering localised grid capacity constraints and major traffic corridors; and assess potential for each site to be powered by renewable energy (whether on- or off-site). This information will be drawn into an indicative "making the case" feasibility study, which aims to inform planning for / implementation of city-owned charging sites powered by renewable energy. The feasibility study will be presented as a power point presentation so that City staff can then reuse the presentations.

Project: City of Johannesburg Electric Vehicle Readiness Support
Result_Title: Feasibility study for e-Taxis
Description: Informed through a review of the taxi business model, consultation with industry experts and national government (potential for EV funding taxis through the taxi recapitalisation programme), as well as the proposed EV tariff and infrastructure rollout feasibility. Aims to highlight barriers / opportunities to shift the minibus taxi industry to EVs. The feasibility study will be presented as a power point presentation so that City staff can then reuse the presentations.

Project: City of Johannesburg Electric Vehicle Readiness Support
Result_Title: Paper submission for the Association of Municipal Electricity Utilities Convention
Description: A paper on “New customers and new revenue streams: How electric utilities can start preparing for EVs”, which will be based on learnings to date. The report will be submitted to the AEMU (Association of Municipal Electricity Utilities). The project aims to disseminate learnings to a larger audience on a platform containing stakeholders that are likely to have a high level of interest, which may encourage further research / work on EV readiness in local municipalities.

Project: City of Johannesburg Electric Vehicle Readiness Support
Result_Title: A media briefing document describing the opportunity of e-Taxis
Description: Media briefing containing key findings from the feasibility study and emissions reduction potential modelling, to highlight barriers / opportunities of shifting to EVs in the minibus taxi industry. Aims to build momentum / interest / awareness of this space. The project will produce a brief for the City to use for media briefings and will likely upload it as a resource on our Urban Energy Support website and reference it in our newsletter, but it will be up to the City as to how they want to approach the media.

Project: The development of a Green Economy Cluster organisation to support Mpumalanga's role in the validation, implementation and follow-on research of the South African Renewable Energy Industry Masterplan (SAREM)
Result_Title: Mpumalanga Provincial Government Green Economy Training and Strategy Support
Description: Provide upskill training to Mpumalanga Provincial Government on the energy, water and waste economies in South Africa. The exact content will be co-designed with the province.

Project: The development of a Green Economy Cluster organisation to support Mpumalanga's role in the validation, implementation and follow-on research of the South African Renewable Energy Industry Masterplan (SAREM)
Result_Title: SAREM Policy Recommendations
Description: Provide the government with the right steer to act on the levers listed in SAREM that will achieve the greatest climate action results. SAREM will highlight several paths with a very strong focus on job creation and economic development, the goal of this output is to add a climate change lens to the thinking created in SAREM and highlight the paths that optimize for climate change as well as economic goals.

Project: The development of a Green Economy Cluster organisation to support Mpumalanga's role in the validation, implementation and follow-on research of the South African Renewable Energy Industry Masterplan (SAREM)
Result_Title: Mpumalanga Provincial Government Green Economy Strategy Support
Description: Provide the Mpumalanga Provincial Government with the insights they need to prioritize and develop strategy to grow the regional green economy, with objective of creating local strategies and policies to drive job creation and increased investment.

Project: The development of a Green Economy Cluster organisation to support Mpumalanga's role in the validation, implementation and follow-on research of the South African Renewable Energy Industry Masterplan (SAREM)
Result_Title: Market Intelligence Report highlighting the green economy investment potential in Mpumalanga
Description: Market Intelligence report for investors and businesses who are currently active or interested in green economy sectors in the Western Cape and South Africa. Each report provides an overview of the market within a sector, including key developments and achievements, the key players, legislation and regulation, market opportunities and challenges, funding opportunities, and an overview of general green economy investment opportunities.

Project: The development of a Green Economy Cluster organisation to support Mpumalanga's role in the validation, implementation and follow-on research of the South African Renewable Energy Industry Masterplan (SAREM)
Result_Title: Mpumalanga Investment Promotion Materials
Description: Production of promotional material highlighting the opportunity for local manufacturing and investment in the implementation of SAREM. This will be packaged in the form of a presentation and based on the insights gathered for the Market Influence Report. This will then be used to present to International Investment promotion agencies, potential investors and other stakeholders. GreenCape’s sector desks are in a unique position to collect, create, and disseminate free market intelligence on the green economy.

Project: Operationalising Energy Performance Certificates in South Africa
Result_Title: Two webinars on NBPER  process and user guidance
Description:
Two half day webinar training sessions on NBPER  process and user guidance. The aim of the sessions is to familiarise the targeted public and private sector building owners with NBEPR and understand the required process for issuance of EPCs. Accessible public and private sector training materials and user guidance will be introduced. It is expected that 100+ participants will attend each session. The project will target building managers and others with responsibility for data collection and reporting in the buildings management space.
2nd webinar on NBPER process and user guidance:webinar based training session to ensure the targeted public and private sector building owners are familiar with the NBEPR, and understand the required process for issuance of EPCs. Accessible public and private sector training materials and user guidance will be introduced. We expect 100+ participants to attend, and will target building managers and others with responsibility for data collection and reporting in the buildings management space. The training webinar will be half a day in duration.

Project: Operationalising Energy Performance Certificates in South Africa
Result_Title: Report capturing international EPC best practice and integration approaches, opportunities for a local EPC mechanism integrated into national carbon reporting framework
Description: A report that provides an overview of international best practice from operationalising EPCs (mainly the UK), and the required steps to integrate EPC mechanisms and required instruments in the South African EE policy framework for buildings. Targeted technical assistance on content of the report will be provided by the consortium to support its uptake.

Project: Operationalising Energy Performance Certificates in South Africa
Result_Title: Energy Performance Certificates (EPCs) issued for a sample of state- and privately-owned buildings
Description: Issuance of the first EPCs for both private and public building sample buildings, bringing the National Energy Act regulations for the ‘mandatory display and submission of EPCs for buildings’ into effect.

Project: Operationalising Energy Performance Certificates in South Africa
Result_Title: Two webinars of awareness raising roadshow for public and private sector stakeholders
Description: Two awareness raising roadshow webinars. The webinars will be fore public and private sector stakeholders. The roadshow will entail 2 engagements set a month apart (to maximize audience reached) for both the public sector (through SANEDI) and the private sector (through GBCSA members) to mainstream the NBEPR, and highlight is role in helping building owners become compliant with the upcoming EPC legislation (Notice 700 of 2020). We expect 50+ participants to attend and will target individuals in decision making roles especially.

Project: Operationalising Energy Performance Certificates in South Africa
Result_Title: National Building Energy Performance Register (NBEPR) built, tested and signed off on by South African National Energy Development Institute (SANEDI), accompanied by detailed NBEPR system specification
Description: Successful development of the NBEPR, ensuring that the Energy Performance Certificate (EPC) mechanism (as delivered by the NBEPR) accounts for and reinforces the wider buildings EE framework, and collates data from buildings to seed the database. This work package will therefore see the successfully developed NBEPR becoming the first highly integrated platform to operationalize EPCs in South Africa.

Project: Building the Green Hydrogen Economy (GHE) Just Energy Transition: Co-creating a Just Labour Transition through the TVET College System in South Africa
Result_Title: Four policy brief proving recommendations on the green hydrogen economy
Description:
Four policy briefs proving recommendations on the green hydrogen economy, particularly:
1. Quantitative and qualitative analysis of how the job creations, revenue generation, and infrastructure requirements of the green hydrogen economy will assist targeted policy makers, and other primary beneficiaries to prepare for JET and JLT.
2. Analysis of how regulatory requirements of an enabling ecosystem for the GHE will assist targeted policy makers to prepare for a JET and JLT
3. Analysis of industry demand for hydrogen skills with the view to determine the future potential jobs pipeline to provide a strong evidence-base to policy makers and industry to support more rapid action in this area. Targeted policy recommendations drawing on the industry consultations will support such actions by the intended beneficiaries.
4. Analysis on  the reduction of carbon emissions based on the hydrogen societal road map targets to provide a strong evidence-base to policy makers and industry to pursue more ambitious  South African NDC targets. Targeted policy recommendations drawing on this analysis will support  framing of the hydrogen societal roadmap within a green economy paradigm.

Project: STRAPSA - Shifting the transport  paradigm  for South Africa
Result_Title: Series of webinars hosted by Cenex covering EV charging infrastructure, business case and fleet electrification, EV policy and regulation and electric busses
Description:
2x Electric Vehicle Charging Infrastructure Webinars with international partners from Cenex: training in the form of a webinar with personnel (key decision makers) from National and Provincial Government and State-Owned Enterprises to develop their skill and knowledge on electric vehicles and to also provide recommendations and information on international best practices. 50-100 people attending each webinar = 100-200 in total.

2x Business Case and Fleet Electrification Webinars with international partners from Cenex: training in the form of a webinar with personnel (key decision makers) from National and Provincial Government and State-Owned Enterprises to develop their skill and knowledge on electric vehicles and to also provide recommendations and information on international best practices. 50-100 people attending each webinar = 100-200 in total

2x EV Policy and Regulation Webinars with international partners from Cenex: training in the form of a webinar with personnel (key decision makers) from National and Provincial Government and State-Owned Enterprises to develop their skill and knowledge on electric vehicles and to also provide recommendations and information on international best practices.  50-100 people attending each webinar = 100-200 in total

2x Electric Busses Webinars with international partners from Cenex: training in the form of a webinar with personnel (key decision makers) from National and Provincial Government and State-Owned Enterprises to develop their skill and knowledge on electric vehicles and to also provide recommendations and information on international best practices. 50-100 people attending each webinar = 100-200 in total.

2 x GESI and the Electrification of Transport webinars with members of the Business Women's Association and personnel (key decision makers) from National and Provincial Government and State-Owned Enterprises.

Project: STRAPSA - Shifting the transport  paradigm  for South Africa
Result_Title: Webinars on electric vehicles with international partners from Cenex
Description:
2x Electric Vehicle Charging Infrastructure Webinars with international partners from Cenex: Training in the form of a webinar with personnel (key decision makers) from National and Provincial Government and State-Owned Enterprises to develop their skill and knowledge on electric vehicles and to also provide recommendations and information on international best practices. 50-100 people attending each webinar = 100-200 in total.

2x Business Case and Fleet Electrification Webinars with international partners from Cenex: Training in the form of a webinar with personnel (key decision makers) from National and Provincial Government and State-Owned Enterprises to develop their skill and knowledge on electric vehicles and to also provide recommendations and information on international best practices. 50-100 people attending each webinar = 100-200 in total.

2x EV Policy and Regulation Webinars with international partners from Cenex: Training in the form of a webinar with personnel (key decision makers) from National and Provincial Government and State-Owned Enterprises to develop their skill and knowledge on electric vehicles and to also provide recommendations and information on international best practices. 50-100 people attending each webinar = 100-200 in total

2x Electric Busses Webinars with international partners from Cenex: Training in the form of a webinar with personnel (key decision makers) from National and Provincial Government and State-Owned Enterprises to develop their skill and knowledge on electric vehicles and to also provide recommendations and information on international best practices. 50-100 people attending each webinar = 100-200 in total.

Project: STRAPSA - Shifting the transport  paradigm  for South Africa
Result_Title: Guidelines and Standards for Electric Road Transport and Charging Infrastructure
Description: Developed guidelines and standards for electric road transport and charging. The document will contain recommendations around best practices to support the adoption of standards for electric road transport and charging. The recommendations will be submitted to the Department of Transport: Integrated Transport Planning Division, to support the following key performance indicator within the Green Transport Strategy: Develop green standards and guidelines for construction of low-carbon climate resilient road infrastructure,  including EV charger points. The recommendations will be targeting: Department of Transport: Integrated Planning Division and the South African National Roads Agency.

Project: STRAPSA - Shifting the transport  paradigm  for South Africa
Result_Title: 2 x GESI and the Electrification of Transport webinars with members of the Business Women's Association and personnel (key decision makers) from National and Provincial Government and State-Owned Enterprises
Description: Training in the form of a webinar to develop skills and knowledge on Gender Equality and Social Inclusion (GESI) for the electrification of  transportation . Approximately 100-200 people attending each webinar = 200-400 total.

Project: Alternative Financing Models for Embedded Generation of Renewable Energy in South African Municipalities
Result_Title: Four Technical and Financial Pre-feasibility Studies
Indicator: Output 2.3. 'Project application/ tools developed to access funds'
Description: Technical and financial feasibility studies will determine the necessary project details required to complete applications to the Development Bank of South Africa (DBSA), including but not limited to the proposed technology, site selection, electricity evacuation analysis, yield assessment and cost analysis.

Project: Alternative Financing Models for Embedded Generation of Renewable Energy in South African Municipalities
Result_Title: Four Project Preparation Facility Applications to the Development Bank of South Africa (DBSA) to access Embedded Generation Investment Programme (EGIP)
Indicator: Output 2.3. 'Project application/ tools developed to access funds'
Description: The DBSA PPF (Project Preparation Fund) Application is required in order to access further project preparation support from DBSA and to access the financial mechanisms provided by the EGIP.

Project: Distilling the JET in South Africa: Harmonizing conflict and seeking opportunities
Result_Title: Two Policy/issue briefs covering key forward-looking solutions identified through interviews, research and dialogues
Description: Exact topic and audience of the brief will be determined in the first quarter through the co-development of the project plan.

Project: Distilling the JET in South Africa: Harmonizing conflict and seeking opportunities
Result_Title: One coherent series of four newspaper articles
Description: Set of recommendations for actions disseminated to a wide audience through newspapers

Project: Expanding the South African Green Finance Taxonomy and embedding its use
Result_Title: Five capacity building training pilot projects
Description:
Five capacity building training pilot: 
(1) Financial Institution (commercial bank): pilot project delivering bespoke TA and capacity building to a commercial bank (from July to November) to embed taxonomic practices and governance which includes an individualized 1-day training workshop at the close of the pilot session, with a minimum of 5 key participants from the bank (being decision makers with a key role in the implementation of the taxonomy in the organisation) and 10 additional participants.
(2) Financial Institution (pension fund or development bank): pilot project delivering bespoke TA and capacity building to a pension fund or development bank (from July to November) to embed taxonomic practices and governance  which includes an individualized 1 day training workshop at the close of the pilot session, with a minimum of 5 key participants from the pension fund or development bank (being decision makers with a key role in the implementation of the taxonomy in the organisation) and 10 additional participants.
(3) Municipalities: pilot project delivering bespoke TA and capacity building to each Municipality (from June to November) to embed taxonomic practices and governance which includes an individualised 1-day training workshop at the close of the pilot session, with a minimum of 3 key participants from each Municipality (being decision makers with a key role in the implementation of the taxonomy in the organisation) and 10 additional participants per Municipality. (Therefore 6 key persons and 20 additional participants in total)
(4) National government (DEFF): pilot project delivering bespoke TA and capacity building to DEFF (from June to November) to embed taxonomic practices and governance which includes an individualized 1-day training workshop at the close of the pilot session, with a minimum of 3 key participants from DFFE (being decision makers with a key role in the implementation of the taxonomy in the operations) and 10 additional participants.
(5) National government (DPME): Pilot project delivering bespoke TA and capacity building to DPME (from June to November) to embed taxonomic practices and governance which includes an individualized 1-day training workshop at the close of the pilot session, with a minimum of 3 key participants from DPME (being decision makers with a key role in the implementation of the taxonomy in the operations) and 10 additional participants.

Project: Expanding the South African Green Finance Taxonomy and embedding its use
Result_Title: Six case studies for each user group
Description: Case studies for each user group (Policy makers and government agencies; financial market participants; asset owners) and basic sector guidance for each user group with recommendations for broader adoption (6 in total)

Project: Expanding the South African Green Finance Taxonomy and embedding its use
Result_Title: Three virtual webinars for taxonomy user groups
Description:
Three virtual webinars with each user group to: provide them with exposure to the taxonomy and support resources and guidance; disseminate the processes to embed and adopt the taxonomy employed in the pilot projects; disseminate practical lessons learned and responses identified in the pilots for others to gain access to this information; and to provide a platform for the attendees to ask questions and explore taxonomy implementation processes. 
The Policy makers and government agencies webinar is expected to last 3 hours, with more than 50 attendees, the financial market participants webinar is expected to last 3 hours, with more than 80 attendees, and the asset owners webinar is expected to last 2 hours with more than 30 attendees.

Project: Expanding the South African Green Finance Taxonomy and embedding its use
Result_Title: Sustainable Finance Taxonomy Version 2 National Launch Event
Description: Organise and hold a (virtual) public awareness raising event to close the project, ensuring international investors’ participation and broad awareness raising of the project outputs. The event is planned to be 2.5 hours of participant content, include engaging presentation material, and presentations by an engaging project representative and national treasury, and include a panel of keynote speakers from national and international finance institutions and taxonomy users, with a facilitated panel session. The project is expecting more than 50 individual participants from 25 organisations.

Project: Mexico Secondments: Enhancement of the Mexico City Public Environmental Fund (FAP)
Result_Title: Network and partnerships established for accessing funds and grants for the FAP
Description: Establishment of partnerships with stakeholders such as NAFIN, FMCN, and other potential allies, aiming to mobilise investments for sustainability.

Project: Mexico Secondments: Enhancement of the Mexico City Public Environmental Fund (FAP)
Result_Title: Development of a financing framework to support the implementation of a new line of business consisting of issuing credits by the  FAP
Indicator: Output 2.3. 'Project application/ tools developed to access funds'
Description: The framework will help to increase the number of projects financed by the FAP, and promote the fund profile for receiving donations and grants which can be used as guarantees to finance environmental and climate change adaptation and mitigation projects in Mexico City.

Project: Accelerating high-quality growth in China’s Green Bond market and supporting post-COVID green economic recovery
Result_Title: Two reports on the demonstration of compliance for China's green bond market regulators and market participants
Description: Two in-depth reports on the demonstration of compliance, together with recommendations on how green bond market regulators and market participants can further harmonize Chinese domestic rules and the requirements between China and the international markets

Project: Urban Road Map to improve urban logistics in Mexico City
Result_Title: Training workshop with authorities (SEMOVI, Municipality of Azcapotzalco, Ferrovalle) to develop skills and acquire recommendations to improve freight transport and recovery of public space.
Description: 2 session training workshops with ˜10 participants to develop skills, and share a set of recommnedations oriented to  a better  understanding on the current challenges and actions for improving freight transport and contributing  to the recovery of public space.

Project: Green Finance for the development of Smart Cities in Mexico II, working to accelerate the implementation of low carbon local projects and sustainable development
Result_Title: Identification and analysis of municipal low-carbon projects feasible for financing and to be presented to potential investors
Indicator: Output 2.3. 'Project application/ tools developed to access funds'
Description: Identification of a list of feasible projects to be analysed and eventually presented to a potential public or private investors. The analyses provide financial evaluations with  executive documents containing all relevant information for the project from technical and economical perspectives presented in a coherent, comprehensible, and attractive format. The project will develop a set of technical/executive documents and financial models on-demand by each project, as well as its green finance source. Financial models will be customized depending on the project financial mechanism or business model selected or aimed.

Project: Expanding sustainable infrastructure network for electric vehicles in urban transportation modes
Result_Title: Recommendations on performance parameters of the electric fleet and monitoring proposal
Description: Recommendations on estimated performance parameters for the electric fleet in the various Metrobús corridors, as well as a short, medium, and long-term monitoring strategy proposal (recommendations) for adoption by authorities. Detailed report of the operating characteristics of the electric bus technology will be obtained by estimating the performance parameters of the electric fleet in the Mexico City transport system so that authorities can take informed decisions.

Project: Expanding sustainable infrastructure network for electric vehicles in urban transportation modes
Result_Title: 2 high-level network events with CFE-PEASE representatives, focused on promoting the consolidation, engagement, and extension of a network able to implement  the results of the study and alternative business models
Description:
Stakeholders' main input will be cost analysis and risk matrix and analysis of operating and capital costs, based on existing financial models.
1. Business model analysis and risk matrix: (a.) CAPEX and OPEX analysis and risk matrix based on existing financial models. (b.) Strategic investment estimation (fleet, charging infrastructure and energy distribution network) - CFE participation
2. Study of high-level economic and financial impacts. Includes strategic environmental analysis, as part of a validation process of the existing financial models.
3. Identification of investment alternatives and alternative business models for Metrobús, based on the results of the study through multi-stakeholder work groups and workshops.
Two sessions are expected, one to share the general results of the study and a second to evaluate alternative business models. These sessions could be up to 10 people each, with an approximate duration of 4 hours.

Project: Expanding sustainable infrastructure network for electric vehicles in urban transportation modes
Result_Title: 2 knowledge transfer workshops with the Comisión Federal de Electricidad
Description: Workshops are based on the attributions of the business unit and will share project results. Two high-level sessions are scheduled with approximately 10 people and an approximate duration of 2 hours per session.

Project: Improve and replicate local capacity building processes linked to value chains and networks in the Agriculture, Forest and other Land Use Sector in six jurisdictions of the GCF Task Force Mexico
Description: The training models designed and implemented to community stakeholders from 6 States, with the support of local governments improve local productivity skills with a sustainability approach to promote productive reconversion, forest conservation, and the integration of biodiversity, through deforestation.

Project: Skill share: Colombia Climate Physical Risks and Financial Stability (COL-001a-R)
Result_Title: Capacity building workshop to inform and upskill wider teams within the Banco de la Republica and Superintendencia Financiera on the importance of understanding the impact of physical climate risks (COL-001a-R)
Description:
Capacity building support for the teams at the Banco de la Republica and Superintendencia Financiera to help them better quantify and assess the impact of climate related risks on the economy and on financial stability, deliver the best outcomes and build knowledge within their teams. 
To achieve this, the support needed is:
•	Workshop to inform and upskill wider teams within the Banco de la Republica and Superintendencia Financiera on the importance of understanding the impact of physical risks. The consultants will agree exact dates and participants with the Banco de la Republica and Superintendencia Financiera towards the end of the skill-share.

Project: Colombia Skill Share: Develop improved technical capabilities for the MoMe, CREG, UPME and FENOGE in Advanced Metering Infrastructure deployment (COL-003a-R)
Result_Title: Advanced Metering Infrastructure (AMI) capacity building webinars for the directors and technical advisors at Colombia’s MoMe, CREG, UPME and FENOGE (COL-003a-R)
Description:
A series of webinars will be delivered to the directors and technical teams from MoMe, CREG, UPME and FENOGE to strengthen the local capacities on Advanced Metering Infrastructure (AMI) deployment. These webinars will be capacity building sessions which will share UK and international best practice and help the MoMe, CREG, UPME and FENOGE to analyse user issues and the benefits of this type of technology, as well as flexible tariffs for users, demand response and storage. The UK’s experience in the deployment of smart meters would help Colombia to decide the optimal level of meter´s integration based on their market characteristics (such as average consumption, equipment cost, real benefits).

Participants of the webinar will be directors and technical advisors who have been working closely on AMI related topics. There will be approx. 5 participants from each entity below:
•	Ministry of Mines and Energy (MoMe)
•	Energy and Gas Regulation Commission (CREG)
•	Mining and Energy Planning Unit (UPME)
•	Non-Conventional Energies and Energy Efficiency Fund (FENOGE)

Webinars will cover the following topics:
•	Differences between anticipated/expected benefits of the smart meter program and their ex-post evaluation.
•	User's resistance to technology shift and general user experience/perception after meter installation.
•	Use of regulatory sandbox(es) to test smart meter program rules in the UK. 
•	Interaction structure and interoperability scheme between the Data Communications Company (DCC), users, and utility companies.
•	Supplier switching levels prior to the “smart meter program" start and after deploying a significant number of end-user meters and the impact in tariffs and the competition levels.  
•	User issues and the benefits of this type of technology
•	Flexible tariffs for users, demand response and storage. 
Approx. 7 x 2 hour webinars to take place over a four month period (two webinars a month)

Project: Colombia Skill Share: Develop improved technical capabilities for the Ministry of Mines and Energy and Barranquilla’s mayor office in Offshore wind project deployment (COL-004a-R)
Result_Title: Offshore wind capacity building webinars for the technical teams at Colombia's MoMe and Barranquilla’s Mayor’s Office (COL-004a-R)
Description:
A series of webinars will be delivered to the technical teams* from MoMe and Barranquilla Mayor’s Office to strengthen the local capacities on offshore wind projects. These webinars will be capacity building sessions which will share best practice and help the Ministry and Barranquilla Mayor's Office to gain the tools and knowledge to better understand what is required for the proper development of offshore wind projects and to comprehend the related social and environmental spheres of these projects.

Participants will include:
•	Business and Regulatory Affairs Office and Electric Energy Direction (MoMe)
•	Head of Energy from the Economic Development Office
•	Head of International Affairs
•	Renewable Energy Utility Company of Barranquilla
•	Head of Public Services of the city (Barranquilla mayor's office)
The MoMe is also open to inviting other government agencies that are under their domain (Fenoge, IPSE, UPME).

Webinars will cover the following themes:
•	Supply chain & Impact on labour (technical capabilities) 
•	Regulatory framework and auctioning process 
•	Construction and development of offshore wind farm/projects
•	Environmental aspects 

* 12 x 1-2-hour webinars to take place over a six month period (two webinars a month)

Project: Skill share: Colombia Climate Physical Risks and Financial Stability (COL-001a-R)
Result_Title: Provide inputs into the Central Bank's top-down stress testing methodology to map the effects of the materialisation of climate change physical risks to the Colombian financial system (COL-001a-R)
Description:
Lead discussions with the Banco de la Republica and Superintendencia Financiera to explore statistical approaches that could be adopted in order to perform stress tests to the Colombian financial system that assess financial institutions’ resilience to the materialisation of physical risks derived from climate change.
The goal is to create a top-down stress testing methodology which maps the effects of the materialisation of climate change physical risks to the Colombian financial system.

Project: South Africa Skill share: Hydrogen Society Roadmap (ZA-001a-R)
Result_Title: Recommendations for best practice in establishing MEL systems for the national hydrogen strategy (ZA-001a-R)
Description: Bilateral meetings and workshops (webinar) will draw on a range of MEL frameworks/best practice supporting M&E of the ToC, and will be attended by senior officials and by operational/specialist/technical personnel. The high-level workshop will discuss KPIs and key evaluation questions (including for GESI) and will establish MEL governance and how and by whom MEL outputs will be used.

Project: South Africa Skill share: Hydrogen Society Roadmap (ZA-001a-R)
Result_Title: Monitoring, Evaluation and Learning (MEL) framework for the Hydrogen Society Roadmap (ZA-001a-R)
Description:
Building on all the capacity-building work developed by this skill share, creation of a draft MEL Framework, schematic and report which provides analysis of any existing gaps and recommendations to resolve these.

Reports will describe the draft MEL Framework and actions to be taken by whom. It will include an analysis of gaps (e.g. relating to data and their sources) and recommendations to address them.  It will include the intended outcomes (including GESI) and MEL’s role in ensuring their delivery.

Project: South Africa Skill share: Hydrogen Society Roadmap (ZA-001a-R)
Result_Title: M&E mentoring sessions with senior officials (ZA-001a-R)
Description:
Mentoring sessions with senior officials from the Department of Science and Innovation who will be responsible for the implementation of the Hydrogen Society Roadmap (quantity and frequency still to be determined).

The goal will be to support the roll out of the TOC and to ensure that M&E is not only embedded in the roadmap itself but is also taken seriously, in terms of learning and improvement, by key stakeholders (state and non-state). An assessment of the usefulness of the mentoring sessions will be undertaken to see if they have helped support the roll out of the ToC and the MEL framework.

Project: China Skill Share: Training to enhance understanding of domestic and global green finance development and Shenzhen's newly-issued Green Finance Regulation (CN-001a-R)
Result_Title: Green finance development and regulatory training sessions (TCFD) with senior officials from Shenzhen government and financial institutions (CN-001a-R)
Description:
A 2-day training programme with senior officials from the Shenzhen government and financial institutions to develop an enhanced understanding of domestic and global green finance development, especially on information disclosure, climate risk assessment and green investment. The goal is to enhance green finance awareness and knowledge in relation to Shenzhen’s newly issued Green Finance Regulation and give them an opportunity to learn from international best practice.
Presentation slides will be shared with the Shenzhen Financial Services Office (Shenzhen FSO).

Project: Technical assistance for the implementation of emergent design for active mobility and public space
Result_Title: Technical reviews (knowledge products) developed and designed for each local governments.
Description:
45 technical reviews of local government projects (3 for each one of the local governments). Decision makers of 15 local governments will learn or improve the planning, implementation, operation, and evaluation of a project of emergent infrastructure for active mobility or public space.  
The output will develop and delivered from August through October 2021.

Project: Technical assistance for the implementation of emergent design for active mobility and public space
Result_Title: Implementation of a Blog about to share  knowledge products and relevant materials on sustainable mobility.
Description:
A blog on the progress of the project within the digital platform. The consulting team will be in charge of the publications, but there will be the opportunity for other interested persons to publish relevant material on the subject, specifically those involved within the projects in the 15 cities. At least 20 publications will be develop during the project.
The output will develop and delivered from March 2021 through February 2022.

Project: Sustainable Tourism Enhancement Project - Phase 2: Boosting conservation and emissions reduction through tourism and technology
Result_Title: First mentorship to local leaders to build capacity on sustainable tourism and conservation
Description:
First mentorship, 13 key individuals trained in at least three of the following topics: environmental education, leadership, conservation and/or tourism. Specific themes and topics will be prioritised after an initial diagnosis. These mentorships aim to showcase practical application of all teachings through a close accompaniment of the mentors. 

A specific training program regarding environmental education, leadership, conservation and tourism will be designed and implemented.

This training process hopes to generate impact in the conservation and sustainability of each region, through the training of local key leaders. 

Number of trainings: 1 mentorships, each with an expert.
Duration: 4 to 8 weeks per mentorship. 
Number of trainees: 13 people.

Project: Sustainable Tourism Enhancement Project - Phase 2: Boosting conservation and emissions reduction through tourism and technology
Result_Title: Second mentorship to local leaders to build capacity on sustainable tourism and conservation
Description:
Second mentorship, 13 key individuals trained in at least three of the following topics: environmental education, leadership, conservation and/or tourism. Specific themes and topics will be prioritised after an initial diagnosis. These mentorships aim to showcase practical application of all teachings through a close accompaniment of the mentors. 

A specific training program regarding environmental education, leadership, conservation and tourism will be designed and implemented.

This training process hopes to generate impact in the conservation and sustainability of each region, through the training of local key leaders. 

Number of trainings: 1
mentorships, each with an expert.
Duration: 4 to 8 weeks per mentorship. 
Number of trainees: 13 people.

Project: Sustainable Tourism Enhancement Project - Phase 2: Boosting conservation and emissions reduction through tourism and technology
Result_Title: Third mentorship to local leaders to build capacity on sustainable tourism and conservation
Description:
Third mentorship, 13 key individuals trained in at least three of the following topics: environmental education, leadership, conservation and/or tourism. Specific themes and topics will be prioritised after an initial diagnosis. These mentorships aim to showcase practical application of all teachings through a close accompaniment of the mentors. 

A specific training program regarding environmental education, leadership, conservation and tourism will be designed and implemented.

This training process hopes to generate impact in the conservation and sustainability of each region, through the training of local key leaders. 

Number of trainings: 1 mentorships, each with an expert.
Duration: 4 to 8 weeks per mentorship. 
Number of trainees: 13 people

Project: Greening the Colombian Financial System: Implementing local green definitions to enable long-term investment into priority sectors.
Result_Title: Knowledge sharing webinar on project developments and green finance integration
Description: Final webinar related to what has been developed during the project to provide an international knowledge-sharing medium for which there is growing demand and help integrate green finance. This have been successfully rolled out in the past in other markets and has proven to be an accessible communications tool. Between 30 to 50 people are expected to attend this webinar and to last for approximately one hour.

Project: Greening the Colombian Financial System: Implementing local green definitions to enable long-term investment into priority sectors.
Result_Title: Fund structuring launch event
Description: Specific fund structuring launching event with the Ministry of Finance to engage with the sector and disseminate the development of the fund structure. 30 to 50 people are expected to attend this event, primarily from the Colombian financial sector.

Project: Supporting livelihoods through Ecotourism Routes for Forest and Peace.
Result_Title: Practical lodging/homestay guides with basic infrastructure designs, including basic costs budget for Quinchas and Perijá
Indicator: Output 2.3. 'Project application/ tools developed to access funds'
Description: Two (2) practical lodging/homestay infrastructure guides, one for Quinchas and one for Perijá, to secure homestays where communities can receive the tourists and also improve their income-generating potential from the stays. Moreover, the output will ensure the improvements are developed in a very cost-effective manner. In the end, communities will be able to use their infrastructure designs to modify their homes with their own means and even present them to local governments or financial entities that could eventually supporting their development. It will include a baseline assessment of possible infrastructure facilities to be improved.

Project: Landscape conservation and livelihood restoration in the Mexican ejidal altiplano: the case of Apan, Hidalgo.
Result_Title: Identification of local investors and funding mechanisms that ensure long-term viability through collective appropriation and maintenance
Indicator: Output 2.3. 'Project application/ tools developed to access funds'
Description: Identification of funding partners for scaling up the proposed ecosystem-based adaptations and that provide resources to maintain the participation of national and international experts in the project.
Implementor: Eetestudio  (Espacio entre tiempo estudio SA de CV)

Project: Technical assistance for the implementation of emergent design for active mobility and public space
Result_Title: Training workshops with 15 local governments on emergent strategies for active mobility and public space
Description:
The project will deliver 19 training workshops with 15 local governments on emergent strategies for active mobility and public space, leading to 105 decision makers trained.
The project anticipates that the training sessions will strengthen decision makers' skills on:
- Active mobility
- Emergent design process
- Planning
- Coordination of active mobility strategies
- Choice of strategy type
- Zoning
- Communication of the strategy
- Implementation and operation, including design and resource definition
- Monitoring and evaluation
- Climate change mitigation actions
- Inclusion: Leave no one behind
- Road safety
The output will be developed during April and May, and will delivered the sessions from June to October.

Project: Accelerating Fleet-wide electrification of public transport in Mexico City
Result_Title: Energy analysis on the electrification of the Metrobus system
Description: Analysis of drive cycles for instrumented routes and simulations of different types of technology to determine energy consumption to validate assumptions and define strategies for charging and operational viability of buses (e.g., to make adjustments in the size of batteries needed). Additionally, it will calculate the total cost of ownership for the fleet and the electrification strategy for the entire system over the next 10 years.
Implementor: Dalberg Advisors (Asesores en Desarrollo Dalberg S. de R.L.)

Project: Accelerating Fleet-wide electrification of public transport in Mexico City
Result_Title: Communications material designed for pitches deck to investors
Description: 10-15 slide Powerpoint deck (communication products) to mobilize investors and commitments to support the electrification of Metrobus.
Implementor: Dalberg Advisors (Asesores en Desarrollo Dalberg S. de R.L.)

Project: Consolidation of the Mexican Climate Finance Hub - mobilizing resources to mitigation and adaptation activities and achieve Mexico´s emission reduction goals
Result_Title: Scoping study & recommendations on Climate Risks
Description: The project team will develop a comprehensive report on climate risks and their interactions with financial and systemic risks. Topics will include methodologies and tools to analyze climate risks and integration in investment decision making, design of climate change scenarios under Cambridge Institute for Sustainable Leadership, and NGFS methodologies; mobilization of resources to finance mitigation and adaptation projects; the transaction towards a low carbon economy and the achievement of the SDGs; enhancement of the green financial offer in Mexico. The report will be written in Spanish and a 10-page brief will also be designed. The project will also hold a presentation of the study in a validation workshop to Comité de Finanzas Sostenibles members in a dedicated event (online or live) and reception of comments to be addressed in the final version, which will be edited and presented as a final product.

Project: Consolidation of the Mexican Climate Finance Hub - mobilizing resources to mitigation and adaptation activities and achieve Mexico´s emission reduction goals
Result_Title: Mexican Green Investment Plan: A study that incorporates the design of a gap analysis that identifies the infrastructure and finance flows needed to achieve Mexico's NDCs
Description: The study will incorporate a review of available public information, as well as interviews with key investors, three workshops with investors and banks, presenting the results in Glasgow (at the COP26) and Mexico. Content included will be: Introduction, background on the Paris Agreement and Nationally Determined Contributions, background to the Mexico NDC, climate mitigation gap, climate adaptation gap, gap analysis, findings, identification of key gaps, conclusions and next steps.

Project: Colombia Skill Share: Strategy for low traffic neighbourhoods and cities transitioning to proximity urbanism (COL-005a-R)
Result_Title: Recommendations developed to enable Colombia’s Secretariat of Mobility of Bogotá (SDM) to design an M&E tool, strategy and implementation plan for the Barrios Vitales intervention, addressing critical issues faced by cities trying to adopt proximity urban
Description:
The skill-share experts will provide recommendations on the design of the monitoring and evaluation (M&E) tool that will help the Secretariat of Mobility of Bogotá (SDM) and Barrios Vitales to identify and develop the ideal strategy to proceed with the implementation of low traffic neighbourhoods. The skill-share experts will propose appropriate quantitative and qualitative indicators to be able to assess the impacts on each Barrio Vital. The goal is to ensure that M&E is firmly embedded in the low traffic neighbourhoods project, and that the implementation of progressive and tactical actions on mobility, public space and urban revitalisation can be tracked and measured. M&E sessions will be delivered for each of the three Barrios Vitales (Cruces San B, Bosa and San Cristóbal).

As well as the M&E tool, the skill-share comprises a combination of capacity building workshops and peer review sessions to help the SDM develop a specific plan for the implementation of three Barrios Vitales; and design a strategy to address the main critical issues faced by cities that are trying to adopt proximity urbanism strategies. Experts will work alongside the architects and engineers in charge of each Barrio Vital to provide learning from the UK context on the development of low-traffic neighbourhoods, advising on the best ways to measure the impacts of implementing a vital neighbourhood, showcasing the benefits of such interventions. Through peer-review sessions, experts will work with officials to assess the technical design and mobility solution for each Barrio Vital. This support will help to identify the specific technical strategies to solve the redistribution of vehicular flows, protecting the local streets in residential areas. 

The workshops and peer review sessions will be attended by SDM’s technical team for Barrios Vitales (5 people), with the occasional presence of some of the members of the technical social team (4 people), according to the design process. Attendees will be from the following divisions: Planning Division; Pedestrian and Bicycle Division; Road Safety Division; Social Management Division.

Project: Enhanced TCFD aligned transparency for an economically and environmentally resilient financial system in Brazil
Result_Title: TCFD Readiness Report for top 100 listed Brazilian companies
Description: This output will be a publicly available briefing paper providing key information on the current state of reporting for the top 100 listed Brazilian companies about their Task Force on Climate-related Financial Disclosures (TCFD) reporting. This information will be invaluable to understand the project baseline as well as in the engagement with the stock exchange, financial institutions and regulators in understanding which aspects of reporting requires improvement, therefore tailoring interventions towards the reporting gaps. To understand the progress that needs to be made by Brazilian companies, we must first understand the current state of reporting. The publication of the report will be followed by a webinar during which the companies will have the opportunity to ask questions about the content of the report and also to complete a poll regarding how useful they found the content.

Project: Enhanced TCFD aligned transparency for an economically and environmentally resilient financial system in Brazil
Result_Title: Guidance paper for FIs on how to incorporate the objectives of the TNFD, building on the analysis of CDP Forest data on Brazilian companies
Description: This output is a guidance paper providing recommendations on how to incorporate the objectives of the TNFD (Task-force on Nature-related Financial Disclosure) in corporate disclosure by Brazilian financial institutions to increase corporate transparency on forest risk management. The output and the related engagement with the FIs is important to increase the level of disclosure. In the context of TCFD, it is particularly important for financial institutions to understand the deforestation risk in their portfolios and  through the lever of financial institutions we will drive better nature related financial disclosure across the market. A roundtable will be conducted between financial institutions and companies to discuss the recommendations on how to incorporate the TNFD in the Brazilian context, focusing on forest-related issues.
