A roundtable between financial institutions and companies will be conducted to discuss the recommendations on how to incorporate the TNFD in the Brazilian context, focusing on forest-related issues, to support the adoption of the recommendations proposed in the TNFD guidance paper.

Project: Enhanced TCFD aligned transparency for an economically and environmentally resilient financial system in Brazil
Result_Title: Draft Application Guidance to the CDSB Framework
Description: This guidance on the Climate Disclosure Standards Board (CDSB) Framework will provide specific guidance to corporates on how to disclose information about forest and land use in their mainstream reporting, following  the principles and requirements of the TCFD. There is a growing demand for natural capital information to be disclosed using existing reporting channels, including the mainstream annual report. The CDSB Framework for reporting offers companies a framework for reporting environmental information with the same rigour as financial information. In turn this helps companies provide investors with decision-useful environmental information, enhancing the efficient allocation of capital. Once the draft guidance is published, an in-person workshop (assuming this is possible) for 20 listed companies will also be conducted on how to report forest and land use-related information in the mainstream report through the application and adoption of the guidance document.

Project: Enhanced TCFD aligned transparency for an economically and environmentally resilient financial system in Brazil
Result_Title: Policy brief towards advancing TCFD
Description: "In 2020, CDP has interviewed  all financial regulators, bank associations and other market actors in their official position of disclosing climate related risks and TCFD.  The conclusion is that there is space for pushing mandatory disclosure in the Brazilian market. This output will be policy brief which will show the possible ways to push for mandatory disclosure in Brazil. Through this policy brief, CDP will make concrete policy recommendations to CVM and Brazilian Central Bank and share the results among relevant stakeholders. A roundtable will be conducted around COP and TCFD together with engagement with central banks and financial institutions to support the adoption of the brief.

Project: Integrated freight transport plan combining rail and road freight modes aiming at reducing GHG and improving logistic integration and local economic development for Mexico City
Result_Title: Training workshop with authorities (SEMOVI, Municipality of Azcapotzalco, Ferrovalle) on recommendations to improve freight transport & recovery of public space.
Description: One session training workshop with ˜10 participants to present the main challenges and set of recommendations to improve freight transport and recovery of public space. In parallel, participants are expected to present their understandings, contributing to develop their presentation skills.

Project: Accelerating Fleet-wide electrification of public transport in Mexico City
Result_Title: Demand study for Corridors 5 & 6
Description: Demand study for Corridors 5 and 6. This will build on existing demand models, with key pieces of information updated, given a full bottom-up study is not possible during Covid-19
Implementor: Dalberg Advisors (Asesores en Desarrollo Dalberg S. de R.L.)

Project: Consolidation of the Mexican Climate Finance Hub - mobilizing resources to mitigation and adaptation activities and achieve Mexico´s emission reduction goals
Result_Title: Scoping study & recommendations on ESG disclosure
Description: The project will develop a comprehensive report on mandatory ESG disclosure and best practices in developed and developing economies, as well as design a series of recommendations for regulators and market players on disclosure. Some of the topics to be included in the reports are: Adoption of TCFD recommendations, financial materiality, social risks focusing in vulnerable groups, governance focusing on gender, and exploration of the adoption of gradual adoption of mandatory ESG reporting. This report will also include the design of recommendations for regulators and market players and peer review by a local financial expert. The document will be written in Spanish, but will include a 10-page brief (with a version in English for for BEIS). The project will also provide a presentation of the scoping study in a validation workshop to Comité de Finanzas Sostenibles members in a dedicated event (online or live) and reception of comments to be addressed in the final version, which will be edited and presented as a final product.

Project: Consolidation of the Mexican Climate Finance Hub - mobilizing resources to mitigation and adaptation activities and achieve Mexico´s emission reduction goals
Result_Title: Design and execution of a training programme on climate change and the relevance of mobilizing capital towards climate adaptation and mitigation activities
Description: 4 trainings (live with streaming or virtual) coordinated with the support of ITAM (Instituto Tecnológico Autónomo de México) and the GFI (Green Finance Institute) to identify the link between climate change and finance. Designed for regulators, government, investors, and issuers. The topics vary for each training provided, with the topic for this specific training being: 1) climate change, economy, and finance. The project expects the participation of 25 people in this training.

Project: Paving the Way for Setting Ambitious GHG Emissions Reductions in the Private Sector to enhance the National Climate Change Policy
Result_Title: Public-private high-level dialogue between government and private sector
Description: 1 high-level dialogue session between government authorities and private sector decision-making representatives to identify challenges and opportunities faced by corporate companies to set SBTs, as well as potential incentives and government programs that might facilitate the alignment of corporate action to the national climate policy.

Project: Closing the gap on sustainable finance and enabling green recovery through capacity building in CDP’s TCFD aligned disclosures and the GRI standards (Indonesia, Thailand)
Result_Title: Beginner TCFD and ESG workshops
Description: The aim of the workshops is to equip beneficiaries with necessary knowledge on climate and environmental, social and governance (ESG) best practice, as well as provide the building blocks to establishing a robust TCFD roadmap. The Beginner Module will demonstrate how companies can develop business models aimed at climate change mitigation and adaptation and ESG best practices in alignment with the SDGs, with a primary focus on social inclusion and gender equality.

Project: Developing and embedding an NDC Capital Raising Strategy for Peru
Result_Title: Stakeholder network strengthening and coordination with other relevant UK programmes
Description: This output will build the network of beneficiaries and stakeholders crucial to delivering an effective Climate Raising Strategy for private investment, while at the same time helping to build strong networks between actors in Peru’s climate and investment arenas. An inception workshop will be held to establish the steering committee, followed by a further 4 workshops  to convene the key primary and secondary beneficiaries (MINAM, COFIDE, Profananpe) within a steering group for the work, and the identification and convocation of stakeholder advisory network drawn from the wider financial sector, including both international and domestic private actors and key public bodies (MEF and SBS). The establishment of these networks will be important to shepherding the work of crafting the CRS itself, but will also serve to help build a broader network for the promotion and support of green financial sector reform to increase private climate investment.

Project: Building Capacity and an Action Plan to Scale up Transjakarta E buses
Result_Title: Capacity building on e-bus deployment
Description: This output will consist of two workshops, one for Transjakarta and one bus operators on e-bus deployment planning and procurement. ITDP will encourage knowledge and experience sharing from transit providers and local governments who have deployed electric buses in their public transport fleet for Transjakarta and other beneficiaries. The output aims to ensure beneficiaries have the knowledge and capacity to be able to deliver and further leverage the action plans beyond the timeframe of this technical assistance project. The output also aims to disseminate to other cities in Indonesia the knowledge and experience of e-bus implementation in Jakarta. This output is planned for the fourth quarter of the project. The number of participating organisations will be confirmed previous the starting of the workshops.

Project: Building Capacity and an Action Plan to Scale up Transjakarta E buses
Result_Title: Toolkit on e-bus adoption
Description: This output will entail the creation of a toolkit on e-bus adoption and disseminate it to other cities in Indonesia by conducting workshops with city government and local public transport operators. The Ministry of Transport will help disseminate the toolkit to other cities under their public transport reform programme.

Project: Institutional Capacity Building Framework Program to accelerate adoption of electric mobility in public transport in India
Result_Title: Kakinada Electric Mobility Network (KEMN) developed
Description: A KEMN app will provide information on green mobility, provide a group chat facility, feature visual media associated with green mobility and periodically host quick tests of knowledge of the science behind green mobility, the extent of adoption world-wide and the range of products available in the market. The app seeks to create at least, a 1000-user community of those who are committed to green mobility technology over the long term.
Implementor: Research Triangle Institute Global India Private Limited

Project: Technical assistance for developing sustainable energy access strategies in Mexico
Result_Title: Energy Access Program consisting of stakeholder meetings and handbook to implement energy access strategies (focused on design, technical and financial barriers, and funding)
Indicator: Output 2.3. 'Project application/ tools developed to access funds'
Description: Energy Access Program that consists of two tiers. (1) 15 potential investor (private sector) meetings to achieve a pipeline to government funding in each state (Puebla, Veracruz, and Yucatán). 45 meetings in total. (2) A handbook will be developed, shared, and used by public and private actors as a tool to identify available funds to develop a strategy for energy access programs with private and public resources.
Implementor: Ilumexico (Eres Energía Renovable SAPI de CV)

Project: Landscape conservation and livelihood restoration in the Mexican ejidal altiplano: the case of Apan, Hidalgo.
Result_Title: Recommendations on actions based on prioritized nature bases solutions for climate change adaptation and mitigation strategies in Apan.
Description: Recommendations on actions for water treatment, waste management, and responsable land use for agriculture based on prioritization of nature-based solutions for climate change adaptation and mitigation in Apan.
Implementor: Eetestudio  (Espacio entre tiempo estudio SA de CV)

Project: Technical assistance for the implementation of emergent design for active mobility and public space
Result_Title: Technical reviews of local government projects on emerging infrastructure for active mobility or public space.
Description: 5 technical reviews of local government projects (3 for each one of the local governments). Decision makers from 15 local governments will use the recommendations to improve the planning, implementation, operation, and evaluation of a project on emerging infrastructure for active mobility or public space.

Project: Technical assistance for the implementation of emergent design for active mobility and public space
Result_Title: Guide with identification and analysis of municipal resources available for potential projects in active mobility and public space
Indicator: Output 2.3. 'Project application/ tools developed to access funds'
Description: Guide detailing criteria for selection, identification, and analysis of municipal resources available for potential projects in active mobility and public space in target cities.

Project: Consolidation of the Mexican Climate Finance Hub - mobilizing resources to mitigation and adaptation activities and achieve Mexico´s emission reduction goals
Result_Title: Recommendations report on the process of supporting the Comité de Finanzas Sostenibles in the design of a National Taxonomy, risk evaluation scenarios, and improving ESG disclosure
Description: Continuous participation at Banco de Mexico's Comité de Finanzas Sostenibles, providing input for the formation of working groups, dissemination of best practices with 2 workshops on international experiences on taxonomies and design of a public policy exhaustive report on improvement of ESG disclosure. These activities aim to develop the market infrastructure needed to mobilize capital towards green initiatives and catalyze both public and private responsible investment. The Progress report 1 will focus on Elements and Existing Efforts: this issue will include a proposal for 1) the definition of the key elements and scope for the local taxonomy, 2) processes that ensure the development of the taxonomy is well supported and is widely accepted, 3) lessons learnt and best practices to assure international compatibility, 4) incorporation of national efforts in the design of local taxonomies and standards, 5) identification of opportunities, barriers and progress of late works that may contribute to the design of the taxonomy.

Project: ETHEKWINI REGIONAL HYDROGEN ECONOMY STUDY
Result_Title: Establishment of the eThekwini Municipality Hydrogen Economy Final Report : recommendations chapter
Description: eThekwini municipality adopted the "eThekwini Integrated Resource Plan" in 2019 which recommended that hydrogen must be investigated and where necessary support commercial deployment and lead pilot projects. We will produce a list of action items at the end of the final report to ensure that the resources and support that is required for the establishment of the hydrogen economy are identified. Strategic target areas will be identified for the eThekwini municipality to undertake upon project completion. These action items will be broken down into levels of difficulty and will be categorized to provide the municipality with a clear pathway. For example, categorizations could be broken down as follows: policy management, capacity building, funding and investment and technology solutions. This is needed as the eThekwini municipality Energy Office  cannot be expected to synthesize the technical information presented in the final report and during the project duration, into tangible outcomes. Having the information distilled into an easy to use format that is broken down into activities, will increase the likelihood of the eThekwini municipality energy office taking the action items forward.

Project: ETHEKWINI REGIONAL HYDROGEN ECONOMY STUDY
Result_Title: Establishment of the eThekwini municipality hydrogen economy report : Chapter 2: hydrogen supply chain infrastructure, chapter 3 : identifying potential hydrigen export hubs, chapter 4: hydrogen precincts and regions
Description: These individual chapters, hydrogen supply chain infrastructure, identifying potential hydrogen export hubs, hydrogen precincts and regions will explore  supply and demand of hydrogen production and also explore which hydrogen technology can be utilized and under which economic sector (e.g. power generation, transport, industry). GHG emissions reduction will be explored as well as infrastructure requirements. This information will allow the Municipality to make informed decisions in the hydrogen space.

Project: ETHEKWINI REGIONAL HYDROGEN ECONOMY STUDY
Result_Title: Lesson learnt memo
Description: Capture the lessons learnt from the project process through conducting lessons learnt workshops with all project key stakeholders (project  team, eThekwini municipality energy office and agreed upon other stakeholders that might be relevant to include). The aim of the capturing the lessons learnt through the project delivery is to ensure that knowledge is not lost and is rather captured and made accessible publicly to future stakeholders that might want to conduct similar or related activities. This will also lead to upskilling and capacity building the project stakeholders who will be able to improve processes and efficiencies going forward.

Project: ETHEKWINI REGIONAL HYDROGEN ECONOMY STUDY
Result_Title: Lessons learnt workshop
Description: There will be knowledge sharing activities during lessons learnt workshops conducted, targeted at eThekwini municipality energy office and key stakeholders ( project team,  UKPACT South Africa, eThekwini Municipality). It is critical to gain buy-in from both public and private sector to ensure the project sustainability as participants need to be empowered through knowledge to take the steps required to ensure that momentum is not lost beyond the project conclusion. A memo will collate all the findings from the workshop and this will be published on the eThekwini Municipality's website and will be publically accessible.

Project: ETHEKWINI REGIONAL HYDROGEN ECONOMY STUDY
Result_Title: Hydrogen roadmap concept video creation
Description: Project summary marketing video to engage with the public and private sector to attract investment . This will be approximately 3 minutes long and likely published on social media and eThekwini's website. This will allow the hydrogen roadmap to garner strategic investment and public buy-in. The video will distil the project information into a concise format easily understood and digestible by non-specialist decision makers and will allow the project outputs to be easily disseminated.We will allow for 2 iterations of video drafts before launching final version.

Project: ETHEKWINI REGIONAL HYDROGEN ECONOMY STUDY
Result_Title: Stakeholder engagement and GESI plan
Description:
"The main purpose of the Stakeholder Engagement Plan is to develop working relationships with each relevant project stakeholder, and to support the achievement of long-lasting, sustainable and more equitable outcomes, in particular the inclusion of GESI (Gender Equality and Social inclusion) considerations into new opportunities for growth.  The plan will ensure that members of the communities and stakeholders are adequately informed and are aware of communication channels should they have any complaints, issues, questions or comments. The plan will also include the processes for ongoing consultation and the mitigation and management actions. Engagement will be undertaken throughout the life of the Project. The Plan will be a key mechanism to provide recommendations on the achievement of the project social performance outcome which is to build Gender Equality and Social Inclusion (GESI) into new opportunities for growth. 

The stakeholder and GESI analysis will provide the basis to develop an appropriate stakeholder engagement plan. Engagement methods will be shaped by potential level of impact and interest experienced by different stakeholder groups, with higher levels of impact generally correlated with deeper levels of engagement. We propose several activities to inform, consult, involve or collaborate with key stakeholders, which will different depending on stakeholder group (e.g.: public hearings, questionnaire's, interviews, focus groups, workshops). The content and topics to be covered in each stakeholder engagement will be developed based on the insights from the literature review and stakeholders and GESI analysis.  "

Project: ETHEKWINI REGIONAL HYDROGEN ECONOMY STUDY
Result_Title: Municipality stakeholder engagements
Description:
"These engagements will help determine key interests, opportunities, drivers, technology preferences, barriers and mechanisms for further investment in the hydrogen economy. Stakeholders identified and contacted will be willing to engage in questionnaires, workshops or private meetings . 

Arup will have 3 public engagements : 

1. Status quo of hydrogen in relation to eThekwini region 
First engagement event ( Status quo) :After the first quarter the project will be well underway and preliminary findings can be presented from information extracted from stakeholders’ online questionnaires and private meetings including other information collated during the literature review. 

2. Present proposed strategy and project progress 
Second engagement ( Strategy): As the project is nearing conclusion more detailed findings around the project strategy can be presented.   We will be into the new year and any developments or key findings can be presented.

3 Present overall project key findings. 
Once the project is concluded summary of key outcomes can be presented. If the hydrogen roadmap concept video is created at this stage this can also be presented. "

Project: Development of an EV Financing Tool and Business Model to Enable the Scaling up of EV Uptake
Result_Title: Provision of business support services for MSMEs on the development of suitable business cases for the adoption, transition or scaling up of EVs in their businesses
Description: This output involves the provision of business support services to selected MSMEs on the development of suitable business cases for the adoption, transition or scaling up of EVs in their businesses. A selection of up to 30 MSMEs including at least 10 Women Entrepreneurs are planned to be supported under this output. The business support services will allow MSMEs to develop and scale their business models incorporating EV-based and EV-enabled solutions and services. This output will consist of six reports delivered monthly starting at the end of July. The reports will be delivered as a word and pdf document.

Project: Development of an EV Financing Tool and Business Model to Enable the Scaling up of EV Uptake
Result_Title: GESI and Women Entrepreneur Engagement Report
Description: This output will be a continuous activity that will embed GESI considerations, provide direct engagement and training to MSMEs selected. It will sensitise FIs, MaaS providers, and other programme beneficiaries on GESI issues, and will deliver business orientation training for Women Entrepreneurs (WEs) on business models. The activities undertaken as a part of this output would be presented in a GESI and Women Entrepreneur Engagement Report that would be published every quarter and shared with the project beneficiaries for collective learning and identification of any best practices. The report will be delivered as a Word and pdf document.

Project: Action Plan for Electrification of Two Wheelers in Jakarta
Result_Title: Action plan for electrification of ride hailing motorcycle in Jakarta
Description:
This output will produce a roadmap and timetable document for electrifying ride-hailing motorcycles in Jakarta. The document includes e-motorcycle scenarios, policy barriers and recommendations, charging infrastructure, financial and business model and grid supply plan developed with the State Power Company (PLN). It aims for the city government to use the output to prepare the regulation and supporting policies needed, as well as, ensure alignment between supporting infrastructure provision and fleet deployment.
The output will take the form of a series of documents (pdf format) that will be produced as milestones:
1. Document with the overall current motorcycle ride hailing service and operation data including passenger’s perception on its services and issues raised by drivers. 
2. Document of best practice from other cities around the world regarding their effort to electrify motorcycles and 3-wheelers including incentives given, commitment from the government, localisation rate of vehicle component policy, and supporting policies. 
3. Roadmap and timetable document of motorcycle electrification of a ride hailing operator (Grab or Gojek).
4. Environmental, social, and economic benefit analysis document.

Project: Action Plan for Electrification of Two Wheelers in Jakarta
Result_Title: TCO and environmental benefit calculation tool development
Indicator: Output 2.3. 'Project application/ tools developed to access funds'
Description:
A calculation tool will be developed with stakeholders to project the benefits of electrification and calculate TCO. The output is important as it will be used for ride-hailing operators to set phases, create timetables, and prepare the mechanisms and investments needed to electrify their fleets. 
It is expected that other cities could utilise the calculation tool.

Project: Action Plan for Electrification of Two Wheelers in Jakarta
Result_Title: Electric two-wheeler supporting policy and e-mobility policy
Description:
This output will conduct a review on the current national and local transport, energy, and environmental planning documents and other relevant policies. It aims to produce a draft policy or a policy recommendation document to remove barriers and support e-motorcycle deployment by ride hailing operators, including a recommendation on the establishment of a local e-mobility task force and its working mechanisms.
The document will mainly benefit the policymakers, both on city- and national-level, as a reference document to develop a policy package in support of motorcycle ride-hailing fleet electrification.

Project: Action Plan for Electrification of Two Wheelers in Jakarta
Result_Title: Complete street design guideline accommodating e-motorcycle uptake
Description: This output aims to develop a guideline in response to e-motorcycles adoption focusing on road safety and accessibility for marginalised communities. The main beneficiaries will be the Jakarta Transport Agency, Jakarta Public Works Agency, and BPTJ. Also, the guideline aims to help to redesign inclusive streets in the Greater Jakarta Area so they can accommodate e-motorcycle as a new road user segment. This output seeks to help other cities and the national government to adopt the recommendations by considering their local contexts.

Project: Institutional Capacity Building Framework Program to accelerate adoption of electric mobility in public transport in India
Result_Title: Feasibility Plan for E-Buses in Kakinada
Description:
This output will assess the electric bus adoption policies and programmes, develop a business structure and operating models in Kakinada. This output will require extensive interaction with stakeholders, as it will provide an overview of  the following:
1. Assessment of the current bus regulations and operations mechanisms for state and cities. 
2. State and city level electric bus adoption policy and programme. 
3. Existing data validation on the identified city routes and support infrastructure.
4. Business, operating and implementation plan, including, social and economic benefits, best practices to create, operate and implement state city level electric buses, and overview of social and economic benefits. The report will be delivered as a word and pdf document.
Implementor: Research Triangle Institute Global India Private Limited

Project: Institutional Capacity Building Framework Program to accelerate adoption of electric mobility in public transport in India
Result_Title: Capacity Development of Power Sector Stakeholders
Description: This output will focus on developing and delivering a dedicated training module to review international best practices and customise them for local policy, regulatory and technical context. The output will provide a mini training to understand the context and level of knowledge in the beneficiary stakeholders (engineers and officials from local distribution companies, contractors, regulatory commission and energy department). The training will consists in two classroom sessions for 25-30 number per session of targeted audiences. This output seeks to actively participate in Kakinada Electric Mobility Network (KEMN) activities.
Implementor: Research Triangle Institute Global India Private Limited

Project: Institutional Capacity Building Framework Program to accelerate adoption of electric mobility in public transport in India
Result_Title: Capacity Development of Banking and Financial Institutions
Description: This output will focus on developing and delivering a dedicated training module for stakeholders in the financial industry to enable them to efficiently provide capital for investments in electric vehicles and charging infrastructure. The training program will focus on sensitising financial industry participants (officials from local banks, financial institutions and Non-bank financing companies, financial advisers, insurance companies) to the technical, operational and commercial aspects of electric vehicles. This will ensure lower cost of capital and efficient processing of proposals for businesses wanting to invest in the space. It is planned to be delivered during two classroom sessions for 25-30 number of targeted audiences per session.
Implementor: Research Triangle Institute Global India Private Limited

Project: Institutional Capacity Building Framework Program to accelerate adoption of electric mobility in public transport in India
Result_Title: Capacity Building of State and City Officials
Description: This output will focus on a training module for city official. It will consist of 6 working days sessions for 30 State and City Officials. The course will cover products and technologies available for adoption in India; Best practices in regulation of operations and financing options for electric auto rickshaws and buses; OEMs products of e-auto rickshaws; OEMs products of buses; interaction with private operations service providers and their business models and contracting experts on learning’s from the RFPs, O&M, Concession Agreements.
Implementor: Research Triangle Institute Global India Private Limited

Project: Strategy and Action Plan for Electrification of Public Transport and Intermediate Public Transport in the Indian Cities
Result_Title: Bus/IPT Electrification Strategy and Action Plan for Ahmedabad
Description: This output aims to present an Electrification Strategy and Action plan for Ahmedabad until 2026. Alternative electric scenarios will be presented as a result of the Diagnostic Report and discussions with the city and state level agencies. The evaluation of these scenarios will help to define future electrification strategy for PT/IPT, including strategies to improve accessibility of public transport for low income groups and women. In addition, the Action Plan will present a monitoring and evaluation framework for the project so that the outcome could be monitored over the next five years.

Project: Strategy and Action Plan for Electrification of Public Transport and Intermediate Public Transport in the Indian Cities
Result_Title: Bus/IPT Electrification Strategy and Action Plan for Mehsana
Description: This output aims to present an Electrification Strategy and Action plan for Mehsana until 2026. Alternative electric scenarios will be presented as a result of the Diagnostic Report and discussions with the city and state level agencies. The evaluation of these scenarios will help to define future electrification strategy for PT/IPT, including strategies to improve accessibility of public transport for low income groups and women. In addition, the Action Plan will present a monitoring and evaluation framework for the project so that the outcome could be monitored over the next five years.

Project: Strategy and Action Plan for Electrification of Public Transport and Intermediate Public Transport in the Indian Cities
Result_Title: Website and conference presentations
Description: This output will create a website for communication and dissemination of the project outputs. As part of the website, a number of research papers dealing with different aspects of the project (policy, survey design and analysis, stakeholder engagements and consultations) will be prepared and presented at a series of conferences (the exact number of papers is TBC depending on the areas of learning from the project). The aim of the reasearch papers and the conference presentation is wider dissemination of the project outcomes.

Project: Closing the gap on sustainable finance and enabling green recovery through capacity building in CDP’s TCFD aligned disclosures and the GRI standards (Indonesia, Thailand)
Result_Title: Report on the readiness and capacity needs of corporates and FIs in Indonesia and Thailand to disclose to national and international climate risk standards
Description: This output is a report on the readiness and capacity needs of corporates and FIs in Indonesia and Thailand. The report will be comprised of two aspects. Firstly a policy review of the current state of sustainable finance in Indonesia. This will include an alignment map of CDP’s TCFD-aligned reporting and GRI standards to BAPPNEAS’ SDG Action Plan and Indonesia’s sustainable finance regulation POJK 51/03/2017 to demonstrate alignment of international standards to local policies.  Secondly, partners will work with SET and ICSA in Indonesia to understand the current capacity of beneficiaries to respond under CDP’s TCFD-aligned reporting and GRI standards and identify specific training needs. These assessments will be conducted through baseline surveys designed in consultation with SET and ICSA.

Project: Greening Agri Finance in Brazil, mainstreaming low carbon and gender inclusive interventions in Plano Safra to transform Brazil’s agriculture and livestock sectors
Result_Title: Diagnostic report on Plano Safra’s disbursement procedures, current disbursement pattern (region, sub-sector, player, scale), and future baseline projections
Description: Directly relevant for primary and secondary beneficiaries, the diagnostic of Plano Safra’s current status and baseline perspective uses public statistics at federal and state levels; individual bank figures; literature review; and interviews with MAPA, Central Bank, key individuals in banks, specialist NGOs, representatives of agricultural loan takers’, and representatives of women-indigenous-marginalised groups. These inputs will provide a clear view of disbursement and diligence procedures; a characterisation of current disbursements in terms of destination, audience, and use; and perspectives on the factors (barriers) limiting the plan’s socio-environmental impact. They will also contribute to the development of a quantitative (baseline) projection of Plano Safra’s future disbursements.

Project: Greening Agri Finance in Brazil, mainstreaming low carbon and gender inclusive interventions in Plano Safra to transform Brazil’s agriculture and livestock sectors
Result_Title: Roadmap for the incorporation of socio-environmental metrics in Plano Safra in consensus with relevant players based on selected metrics, their achievability and evidence-based additionality
Description: The roadmap for the incorporation of socio-environmental metrics in Plano Safra builds on the quantitative projections of Plano Safra’s future disbursements delivered in output 1, and delivers a plan for the inclusion of a selected socio-environmental metrics in loan appraisal and disbursement processes and an alternative scenario projection of the impact achievable by doing so.

Project: Greening Agri Finance in Brazil, mainstreaming low carbon and gender inclusive interventions in Plano Safra to transform Brazil’s agriculture and livestock sectors
Result_Title: Training delivered to address existing gaps including through: piloting the incorporation of socio-environmental metrics in Banco do Brasil, building their capacity to feed into climate risk and impact assessment, and building MAPA’s capacity to simulate
Description: This output includes 4 training sessions delivered to Banco do Brasil and other interested FIs to pilot the integration of socio-environmental metrics in their assessment of Plano Safra loans, building their capacity to assess/monitor metrics, giving them tools (PACTA-TCFD-MRV) to do so, and building their capacity to use such metrics to feed into their assessment of climate impact and exposure to climate risk. The output also includes 2 capacity building sessions delivered to MAPA on modelling the social and climate impact of two regulatory interventions to be selected by the Ministry in sub-sectors to be selected by the Ministry.

Project: Greening Agri Finance in Brazil, mainstreaming low carbon and gender inclusive interventions in Plano Safra to transform Brazil’s agriculture and livestock sectors
Result_Title: Construction and delivery of tools including an MRV Platform and a Policy Impact Simulation tool
Description: Construction and delivery of an MRV Platform for Banco do Brasil (directly replicable to other FIs) ready to be fed with anonymised municipal level data provided by Banco do Brasil (online software format); detailed set of user guidelines describing its application in specific case studies that test the Platform functionalities and usefulness. Construction and delivery of a Policy Impact Simulation tool (MS Excel format) for MAPA.

Project: Developing and embedding an NDC Capital Raising Strategy for Peru
Result_Title: Capacity building activities to support uptake and delivery of the CRS
Description: [TO BE UPDATED WITH NUMBER OF SESSIONS WHEN AVAILABLE]  This Output involves two channels for capacity building support: firstly, immediate activities (meetings and workshops) to embed and support broad uptake of the CRS, and secondly, longer term support (one-to-one training and support), working with beneficiaries to implement actions to enact components of the CRS.

Project: Strengthening climate risk assessment and enabling central bank supervision in the Indian financial sector, a partnership with frontrunning banks and DFIs
Result_Title: Landscape analysis: briefing notes comparing common and best practice in Indian banks in handling ESG issues in credit decisions and balance sheet risk assessments
Description: Indian banks vary in the extent to which they are currently engaged with environmental, social and governance (ESG) issues. Most conduct environmental social impact assessments (ESIAs) according to the minimum mandatory guidelines prescribed by the Reserve Bank of India (RBI), which does not include climate-related risks. Some go further, however, there is no comprehensive evidence on the state of knowledge or common practice among Indian banks. This output will address this gap by developing a questionnaire for risk management and credit lending staff in our 8-10 participating financial institutions. The questionnaire will be complemented by semi-structured interviews to assess about how ESG issues are treated in the banks’ lending and underwriting activities. The data will be used to produce two briefing notes comparing common and best practice in Indian banks today.

Project: Strengthening climate risk assessment and enabling central bank supervision in the Indian financial sector, a partnership with frontrunning banks and DFIs
Result_Title: Training modules: educational material designed to train risk management and credit lending staff in banks and DFIs to identify, measure and report climate-related risks
Description: This output will consist of a series of training modules to equip risk management and credit lending staff to identify, measure and monitor climate-related financial risks. The modules will be designed to meet the needs and enhance the performance of staff in the risk management, compliance and governance departments; corporate lending departments; and sustainability departments. The modules will establish a common language and approach for assessing and reporting climate-related risks across large financial institutions. The modules will be made available to banking associations, the RBI and educational institutions.

Project: Strengthening climate risk assessment and enabling central bank supervision in the Indian financial sector, a partnership with frontrunning banks and DFIs
Result_Title: Training sessions on identifying, measuring and reporting climate-related risks by banks and DFIs in India
Description: [TO BE UPDATED WITH NUMBER OF SESSIONS WHEN AVAILABLE] The modules will be piloted in 8-10 financial institutions (a combination of major banks and state-level DFIs), immediately building the understanding and capabilities of staff in their risk assessment departments. Each training session will include reading materials in advance (including case studies from Indian financial institutions), presentations, curated discussions and breakout activities, followed by worked exercises. We will place a strong emphasis on the potential of the individuals to act as change agents within their institution, using case studies from frontrunning banks in India to show ‘the art of the possible’. We will also focus on TCFD as a reference point (rather than less rigorous ESG standards) in order to establish a high level of ambition rather than incremental change. The list of FIs to be targetted is currently Axis Bank, Bank of Baroda, HDFC Bank, ICICI Bank, ICFC First Bank, IndusInd Bank, Kotak Mahindra Bank, Punjab National Bank, SBI Mutual Fund and State Bank of India. However this is pending confirmation from stkeholders. Number of sessions also pending confirmation of list of particiapting FIs.

Project: Strengthening capabilities on climate action for investors of the Peruvian financial ecosystem, within the framework of the Green Financing Roadmap
Result_Title: Project governance network developed
Description: This output consists in building a governance and a network within the financial ecosystem to serve as counterpart for this project and set concrete commitments on climate risk management and disclosure. PIR is already a solid network from where the project will set up a governance scheme to convey additional market actors. This governance will include PIR members, and invite other key actors, such as banks, market regulators (SBS and SMV) and representatives of the real-economy to join the governance of the project, as relevant counterparts. The participants will be required to commit a minimum dedication of time and human resources, and be able to offer a significant pledge related to climate-risk management and disclosure at the end of the project. Members include leadership from MINAM, BD Capital SAF, Bolsa de Valores, Pacifico Seguros, Prima AFP and Protecta Security among others. Meetings to be held a minimum of once a month every month, starting from the 3rd month (10 meetings at a minimum).
Implementor: PIR, Asociacion para la Promocion de la Inversion Responsable y Sostenible

Project: Strengthening capabilities on climate action for investors of the Peruvian financial ecosystem, within the framework of the Green Financing Roadmap
Result_Title: Online learning platform on climate risk management for the Peruvian financial industry
Description: The preparation of a web-based platform to support an online-learning community and encourage a practical training, based on real-life exercises. The web-based platform will leverage resources publicly available, like the “TCFD-hub”. The project will aim to engage in cooperation with knowledge centres like The Centre for Climate Finance and Investment at Imperial College and entities like UNEP-FI (among others).
Implementor: PIR, Asociacion para la Promocion de la Inversion Responsable y Sostenible

Project: Strengthening capabilities on climate action for investors of the Peruvian financial ecosystem, within the framework of the Green Financing Roadmap
Result_Title: Policy proposals to encourage a green economic recovery for Peru, triggered by the financial system
Description: This output encompasses the elaboration of policy proposals targeting the financial market, to support the migration of financial resources out of risk exposure and into sustainable investments, so as to boost a low carbon and climate-resilient economic recovery for Peru. This output will be delivered to the members of the governance structure in output 1 (including financial authorities, investors and the realty sector and ministries) to present the methodology and workplan for the policy reports. There will be 3 word reports delivered with the policy recommendations which will cover investment vehicles that can channel capital towards low carbon and climate-resilient issuers and projects, reporting and disclosure of climate-related risks, and the integration of climate change under the current financial regulation on the disclosure of socio-environmental risks.
Implementor: PIR, Asociacion para la Promocion de la Inversion Responsable y Sostenible

Project: Strengthening capabilities on climate action for investors of the Peruvian financial ecosystem, within the framework of the Green Financing Roadmap
Result_Title: Update of the Green Finance Roadmap to include commitments for the adoption of the TCFD recommendations by the Peruvian financial sector
Description: This output will consolidate the lessons learned, gaps and the enabling frameworks of the products described above, in order to propose an updated version of Peru's Green Financing Roadmap towards the adoption of the TCFD recommendations. The output will provide a consolidated perspective of the steps required to mainstream the use of the TCFD recommendations by the Peruvian financial community. This product will be developed through a participatory process, engaging actors from the financial sector, public, private, associations and the academia. It will also include and publish a set of commitments from financial institutions members of the governance structure, towards the adoption of the TCFD recommendations. All the results achieved by the project will be available through the online learning platform and will be presented at a side event at COP26.
Implementor: PIR, Asociacion para la Promocion de la Inversion Responsable y Sostenible

Project: Greening Finance in Argentina to Combat Climate Change and Promote Inclusion
Result_Title: Formation of project committee and working group
Description: A project committee will be assembled for the roadmap to a green agro-industry commodities markets, chaired by MATBA-ROFEX (as it concentrates over 90% of the commodities trading) as the main beneficiary. A public launch of the committee at MATBA-ROFEX premises in Rosario will be held with a public media presentation and a press release. A working group will be formed for the debt instrument guidelines output with reciprocal guarantee companies (sociedades de garantia reciproca), specialised cheques funds and market associations. An official launch event will be held with the MAV (Mercado Abierto de Valores).
Implementor: Carbon Trust Mexico S.A. de C.V.

Project: Greening Finance in Argentina to Combat Climate Change and Promote Inclusion
Result_Title: Greening SMEs short-term debt instrument guidelines
Description: This output will consist in the development of guidelines to implement a local voluntary green label/tag for a short-term debt instrument for SMEs – mostly outside Buenos Aires and agro-industrial based – active in the local debt market (known as listed cheques) and trading at the Rosario Stock Exchange. This label will help investors identify which instruments have green characteristics (like in the green bonds market) and eventually generate a green premium –lower transaction costs– for low-carbon and other SDG aligned projects. To create the label guidelines, a participatory, open process will involve banks, brokers, investors, issuers, stock exchanges and traders. The guidelines will be disseminated among key stakeholders such as banks, brokers, investors, issuers, stock exchanges, traders and SMEs.
Implementor: Carbon Trust Mexico S.A. de C.V.

Project: Greening Finance in Argentina to Combat Climate Change and Promote Inclusion
Result_Title: Public event to present the guidelines and make them available for any issuer
Description: A public event open to  banks, brokers, investors, issuers, stock exchanges, traders and SMEs will be held with UK Embassy presence to present the guidelines and make them available for any issuer. Companies will be able to start using the green financial instrument when it is launched on the market.The guidelines will be made available to the public on the MAV website.
Implementor: Carbon Trust Mexico S.A. de C.V.

Project: Capacity building to the government of Peru to support its first sovereign green bond issuance
Result_Title: Monitoring and reporting indicators and procedures for Green Bond projects established
Description: This output will be the monitoring and reporting indicators, processes, and templates to ensure transparent, effective and timely reporting on the Green Bond projects. The scope of the reporting will consist of two aspects. Use of Proceeds includes percentage of proceeds assigned, breakdown of proceeds assigned for refinancing vs financing and balance of unassigned proceeds. Impact Reporting aligned with international best practices and Green Bond Principles, which includes environmental and social indicators such as avoided emissions, renewable energy installed capacity, number of jobs created disaggregated by gender, age and disability status. This output consists of the monitoring and reporting procedures document, a template document for the format of impact reporting and a template document for the format of Use of Proceeds reporting.

Project: Capacity building to the government of Peru to support its first sovereign green bond issuance
Result_Title: Green Bond communication campaign developed and implemented to create capacity and awareness and share to Peru’s experience
Description: [TO BE UPDATED WITH NUMBER OF SESSIONS WHEN AVAILABLE]  The output offers the opportunity to leverage the experience and lessons learned from the project on GB governance, ESG-related project screening and investment reporting to accelerate the development of Peru's and Latin America's green bond market. This output includes the design and implementation of a GB communication campaign to raise awareness of GB’s economic, financial, environmental, and social advantages, as well as Peru's GB sovereign issuance. This will include capacity building sessions to GB governance members for sustainability;  awareness raising webinar on pre- and post-issuance steps and requirements targeting prospective public issuers, and knowledge sharing webinars between MEF and MINAM and their counterparts in Colombia and Mexico (exact number of webinars TBC based on interest of counterparts).

Project: Promoting green finance to foster sustainable development in the North of Argentina
Result_Title: Report with an analysis of the active portfolio, systems and products of each participating financial institution
Description: Our evaluation methodology will be refined to point out critical issues for sustainable credit line generation. With each participating institution, we will analyse current credit lines, identify the institution's capacity to create a sustainable portfolio, barriers to be removed and tools to be developed. Based on this diagnosis, a tailored report will be presented to each participating institution with specific recommendations about what indicators they can add to their current information (related to Gender or emissions issues p.e.), what existing credit lines can be adapted to be used in the financing of sustainable activities, what opportunities we find among existing financial products and structures, and recommendation of what activities and network participations can strength the sustainability strategy of their financial institution (PRI, Weps, Equator principles p.e.).

Project: Mainstreaming Climate Risk Assessment in Credit Operations of Brazilian Development Banks
Result_Title: Climate-Risk Assessment Framework for Credit Operations in Development Banks
Description: The climate-risk assessment framework will provide the baseline structure of the climate risk integration process design and supporting tool. The framework will include methodology for physical and transition risks analysis, steps banks will undertake to evaluate climate risks in their loan portfolios, timeframes, and potential limitations. The framework will be in the form of a PowerPoint Presentation and will be delivered to the primary beneficiaries (BNDES and BDMG) as well as wider FIs.
Implementor: Waycarbon Solucoes Ambientais e Projetos de Carbono LTDA

Project: Mainstreaming Climate Risk Assessment in Credit Operations of Brazilian Development Banks
Result_Title: Training pathways for Brazilian DBs supporting the promotion of a greener, low-carbon and resilient future
Description: [TO BE UPDATED AFTER TRAINING NEEDS ASSESSMENT] This output consists of training pathways that include informational, institutional and capacity buildings activities for selected DBs areas along with the other project outputs. The necessary skills to be enhanced will be mapped out in the project beginning to decide which capacity sessions should be allocated to each project beneficiaries’ team/areas. The training will be used to support uptake an adoption of the other project outputs, but will also address climate change awareness, specifically around climate risk in the financial sector.
Implementor: Waycarbon Solucoes Ambientais e Projetos de Carbono LTDA

Project: Mainstreaming Climate Risk Assessment in Credit Operations of Brazilian Development Banks
Result_Title: Brazilian Financial Sector engaged and project's lessons shared and communicated
Description: This output will be delivered in the form of a Communications and Networking Plan which will include workshops with the beneficiaries and public sharing of other outputs. This output includes the amplified impacts of the project final deliverables and knowledge sharing that will be delivered with the direct support of project secondary beneficiaries, Febraban and BRASFI. The strategy is to leverage WayCarbon and 2Degrees network within the Green Finance agenda and promote knowledge events benefiting from existing DBs communications channels and partners. The communications plan will include at a minimum a one webinar series; a final report presenting the project results in PPT; one workshop for real case use of the tool; one project wrap-up workshop with key stakeholders (primarily BNDES and BDMG).
Implementor: Waycarbon Solucoes Ambientais e Projetos de Carbono LTDA

Project: Consolidation of the Mexican Climate Finance Hub - mobilizing resources to mitigation and adaptation activities and achieve Mexico´s emission reduction goals
Result_Title: Identifying and developing of green financing vehicles needed to mobilize green capital
Indicator: Output 2.3. 'Project application/ tools developed to access funds'
Description: Through the identification and developing of green financing vehicles (green bonds, intermediaries, loans, debt mechanisms and investments, green index, Green ETF, REITs), capital is mobilized toward green infrastructure and other initiatives that contribute to the compliance with NDCs.

Project: Nigeria Public Sector Skill Share: Support in drafting Nigeria’s Climate Change Bill and sharing the UK’s experience of the Climate Change Act
Result_Title: Proposed climate legislation recommendations for Nigeria's Climate Change Bill (based on the UK's experience)
Description:
The Head of Climate Litigation in the BEIS Clean Growth Directorate will review the draft Climate Change Bill for Nigeria's Department for Climate Change and Federal Ministry for Environment, and provide recommendations for its development. Recommendations will focus in particular on strengthening and tightening the legal language of the Bill and to ensure that it is fit for purpose and that the provisions in the Bill can effect change.

This will be followed by a joint workshop held on 22/23 September 2021 with BEIS/Climate Change Committee (CCC) senior leadership to share experiences (with Nigeria's Ministry for Environment) of the UK Climate Change Act. The workshop will provide an opportunity for questions and discussion on how the UK experience can be adapted for the Nigerian context. Discussions are expected to shape the finalise stages of the Bill as well as a plan for implementation of the Bill.

Project: Mobilization of private investment to implement energy efficiency measures in the industrial sector in Colombia
Result_Title: Key institutions accept recommended potential interventions to reduce times in granting tax benefits for investments in EE
Indicator: Int. Out 2. 'Adoption of recommendation for policy/legislation'
Description: Key institutions accept the recommendations on potential interventions which could reduce times in granting tax benefits for investments in EE projects.

Project: Colombia outward skillshare: Mission for Energy Transformation
Result_Title: Adoption of recommendation by the Mission for Energy Transformation
Indicator: Int. Out 2. 'Adoption of recommendation for policy/legislation'
Description: The recommendations provided lead to changes in the final recommendations put forward by the Mission. Exact timings of these are unknown.

Project: China Green Bonds: Effective Implementation; Economic Impacts
Result_Title: Adoption of the policy recommendations
Indicator: Int. Out 2. 'Adoption of recommendation for policy/legislation'
Description: Adoption of the recommendations (MRV system for green bonds, policy changes to support the growth of the green bond market) made to policymakers.

Project: Community-based Sustainable Tourism Enhancing Project
Result_Title: Scientific Tourist Programme mobilises funds
Description: Scientific Tourist Programme mobilises funds for its future implementation.

Project: Promoting forest protection and peace-building through community-based ecotourism
Result_Title: Agreement on terms for three pilot ecotourism packages
Description: Agreement on the terms for the launch of three pilot ecotourism packages.

Project: Systemic perspectives on low-carbon cities in Colombia – An integrated urban modelling approach for policy and regulatory analysis.
Result_Title: Ministry of Environment agrees on recommendations on how to improve the reporting process of GHG mitigation

Project: Building the Green Hydrogen Economy (GHE) Just Energy Transition: Co-creating a Just Labour Transition through the TVET College System in South Africa

Project: STRAPSA - Shifting the transport  paradigm  for South Africa
Result_Title: Stakeholders make improvements towards better climate change integration

Knowledge products (guidelines and standards for electric road transport and charging infrastructure; green procurement guidelines to promote electric vehicle fleets) are adopted not only by training participants but by key institutions to further expand their knowledge and capacities in electric road transport and procurement. 
Communications products (press releases, presentations, leaflets for: guidelines and standards for electric road transport and charging; infrastructure green procurement guidelines and standards to promote electric vehicle fleets) are received and understood by the key stakeholders, and they understand the relevance and use of the material.
Key Personnel (decision makers) within: National Government (Department of Transport; Department of Trade, Industry and Competition; Department of Environment, Forestry and Fisheries; Department of Mineral Resources and Energy; National Treasury); Provincial Government (Western Cape Government) and State-Owned Enterprise (Eskom).

The Energy Demand database is used by UPME to define recommendations regarding the establishment of ToU tariffs in the context of the responsibilities of UPME within the "Plan Integral de Gestión de Cambio Climático" of the Ministry of Energy and Mines.

Project: Supporting the roll-out of smart grid technologies in Colombia Phase 2: Moving forward to implementation
Result_Title: The training programme is used to build capacities of key staff working within the energy sector in Colombia
Indicator: Int. Out 1. 'Enhanced action because of training'
Description:
Relevance of training to increase capacity needed to deploy smart grids in Colombia.
This intermediate outcome will be demonstrated as follows:
The training is relevant for the definition of increasing levels of digitalization within the grid and/or adaptation of procedures to plan and operation of the grid by network companies.

Project: Greening the Colombian Financial System: Implementing local green definitions to enable long-term investment into priority sectors.
Result_Title: Finance stakeholders understand and comply with requirements for sustainable and green bonds issuances
Indicator: Int. Out 1. 'Enhanced action because of training'
Description: Potential issuers, banks, verifiers, and investors alike understand the different components, what is required to develop the market, as well as what is required to issue a sustainable or green bond using the knowledge tools and methodology provided to identify projects, quantify reductions and report information.

Project: Greening the Colombian Financial System: Implementing local green definitions to enable long-term investment into priority sectors.
Result_Title: Green finance community understands the National Taxonomy and CASA Colombia as a proxy
Indicator: Int. Out 3. 'Adoption of recommendation for other action'
Description: Colombia’s green finance community can fully use the definitions system and recommendations via the Taxonomy. In addition, the adoption of CASA Colombia as a proxy under Climate Bond's Taxonomy will lead to more certified green bond issuances.

Project: Greening the Colombian Financial System: Implementing local green definitions to enable long-term investment into priority sectors.
Result_Title: MHCP understands the principles for the Sustainable National Fund management and implementation
Indicator: Int. Out 2. 'Adoption of recommendation for policy/legislation'
Description: MHCP understands the steps necessary for the implementation of the sustainable National Fund. Sponsorship and promotion by the MHCP is a clear message for the country and the international community of Colombia's commitment to sustainable and low-carbon development.

Project: Proposal of reform to the public policy and legal framework of territorial planning in Colombia in order to comply with the Paris Agreement
Result_Title: Appropriation of good environmental planning practices in the prioritized municipalities derived from the Urban Extent Growth and Land Use Change report in Colombia and the benchmark of international practices on land-use.
Description: Appropriation of good environmental planning practices in the prioritised municipalities (Bogotá, Medellín, Cali, Barranquilla, Bucaramanga, Palmira, Soacha, La Calera, Rionegro, Bello, Jamundí, Soledad, Malambo, Girón, Piedecuesta, Pereira) based on the Urban Extent Growth and Land Use Change repor in Colombia and the benchmark of current international literature and practices on land-use and environmental planning instruments.

Project: Expanding the Colombian Climate Asset Disclosure Initiative (CCADI)
Result_Title: Financial sector regulators & policy makers create legislation, roadmaps, guidelines and/or policies that promote data disclosure, appropriate risk assessment & sustainable investments that foster the transition of financial sector to a low carbon economy
Indicator: Int. Out 2. 'Adoption of recommendation for policy/legislation'
Description: Financial sector regulators and policy makers create legislation, roadmaps, guidelines and/or policies that promote data disclosure, appropriate risk assessment and sustainable investments that foster the transition of the colombian financial sector to a low carbon economy.

Project: Empowering territories’ for low carbon transformation
Result_Title: Five primary beneficiary departments integrate the long-term energy and transport visions in local policy planning instruments as well as alignment at national level planning (e.g. E2050)
Indicator: Int. Out 2. 'Adoption of recommendation for policy/legislation'
Description: The five primary beneficiary departments - Antioquia, Bogotá, Boyacá, Cundinamarca and Valle del Cauca - integrate their newly crafted long-term energy and transport visions into their local plans and strategies (e.g. Development Plans, Territorial Plans, etc.). The Inspector-General's Office issues a directive for all Colombian departments to build visions for decarbonization. The Ministry of Environment incorporates the five long-term energy and transport visions into Colombia's E2050 national strategy.

Project: Empowering territories’ for low carbon transformation
Result_Title: Inter-sectoral networks are created across the five primary beneficiary departments
Description: The established networks in the five primary beneficiary departments will bring together government, the private sector, academy, NGOs and civil society, including women, indigenous communities and other vulnerable groups. The networks established will allow the departments to have a critical mass to exert pressure on the subnational government to achieve the long-term visions for decarbonization in energy and transport sectors.

Project: Empowering territories’ for low carbon transformation
Result_Title: Trained journalists and influencers are able to build sectoral transformation narratives and communicate the next steps that departments will undertake after building the vision recommendations
Indicator: Int. Out 1. 'Enhanced action because of training'
Description: Trained journalists and influencers on climate change have enhanced capacity to communicate publicly about decarbonization pathways in the departments, while the general public in Antioquia, Bogotá, Boyacá, Cundinamarca and Valle del Cauca become aware of decarbonization pathways.

Project: Empowering territories’ for low carbon transformation
Result_Title: Representatives from different sectors of society are able to take action and to commit to the development of a long-term vision
Indicator: Int. Out 1. 'Enhanced action because of training'
Description: 500 trained people representing different sectors of society who are able to take action and to commit to the development of a long-term vision.

Project: Empowering territories’ for low carbon transformation
Result_Title: Actions from the catalogue are adopted by the five primary beneficiary departments
Indicator: Int. Out 2. 'Adoption of recommendation for policy/legislation'
Description: The five primary beneficiary departments - Antioquia, Bogotá, Boyacá, Cundinamarca and Valle del Cauca - adopt at least 10% of the actions defined in the catalogue for decarbonization in the energy and transport sectors.

Project: Steering the Colombian Road Freight Sector Towards a Zero Emissions Strategy GIRO-ZERO
Result_Title: Collaborative networks share information on the costs and benefits of adopting new technologies and practices
Description: Collaborative networks (members of COLFECAR) share knowledge on the costs and benefits of adopting new technologies and practices within the Giro Zero network or related networks.

Project: Preparing the public and financial sector for CTR: Capacity building and call to action
Result_Title: Participants of the training programme improve their capacities and skills in climate transition risk management. Local universities continue to scale up the training programme
Indicator: Int. Out 1. 'Enhanced action because of training'
Description: Participants of the training programme improve their capacities and skills in climate transition risk and, as a result, begin to incorporate strategies to manage it in their professional and personal lives. The 3 local universities trained continue to scale up the training progamme thus creating increased capacity on a national level.

Project: Preparing the public and financial sector for CTR: Capacity building and call to action
Result_Title: The institutions and firms that participate in the Climate Transition Risk Course implement the projects that they designed during the training programme
Indicator: Int. Out 1. 'Enhanced action because of training'
Description: The public institutions implement the public mechanisms and policies designed during the Climate Transition Risk Course to promote a smoother and more fair transition. The financial sector firms implement the projects to incorporate climate transition risk management into their investment portfolios.

Project: Comprehensive plan and roadmap for sustainable mobility in Bogotá-Región during and after COVID-19
Result_Title: Integration of the "Guidelines for the regional institutional framework" into the Transport Regional Authority statutes by Bogotá's Mayor's office and Cundinamarca Government, and signing of the "Pact for reporting GHG emissions" by transport stakeholders
Indicator: Int. Out 2. 'Adoption of recommendation for policy/legislation'
Description: Integration of the "Guidelines for the regional institutional framework" into the Transport Regional Authority statutes by Bogotá's Mayor's office and Cundinamarca Government, and signing of the "Pact for reporting GHG emissions" by transport stakeholders.

Project: Comprehensive plan and roadmap for sustainable mobility in Bogotá-Región during and after COVID-19
Result_Title: Adoption of the "Recommendations on transport supply models and demand management strategies for Bogotá-Region" by Bogotá Mayor's Office and effective integration into its policies
Indicator: Int. Out 2. 'Adoption of recommendation for policy/legislation'
Description: Adoption of the "Recommendations on transport supply models and demand management strategies for Bogotá-Region" by Bogotá Mayor's Office and effective integration into its policies.

Project: Comprehensive plan and roadmap for sustainable mobility in Bogotá-Región during and after COVID-19
Result_Title: Adoption of the "Fund and use of funds exercise for the financing of regional projects" by Bogotá Mayor's Office and effective integration into its policies
Description: Adoption of the "Fund and use of funds exercise for the financing of regional projects" - by Bogotá Mayor's Office and effective integration into its policies.

Project: Comprehensive plan and roadmap for sustainable mobility in Bogotá-Región during and after COVID-19
Result_Title: Adoption of the "Recommendations on a priority lanes network and modal transfer zones design for Bogotá-Region" by Bogotá Mayor's Office and effective integration into its policies
Indicator: Int. Out 2. 'Adoption of recommendation for policy/legislation'
Description: Adoption of the "Recommendations on a priority lanes network and modal transfer zones design for Bogotá-Region" by Bogotá Mayor's Office and effective integration into its policies.

Project: Adopting New Technology, Mindsets, and Practices to Transform Colombia’s Agricultural Sector
Result_Title: Agricultural businesses make improvements towards better climate change integration
Indicator: Int. Out 1. 'Enhanced action because of training'
Description: Agriculture senior managers (training participants) improve their organisational mechanisms, practices, and procedures as a result of the skills and knowledge developed through the 3-day training workshop.

Project: Adopting New Technology, Mindsets, and Practices to Transform Colombia’s Agricultural Sector
Result_Title: Knowledge and communication products support changes in practices and policies
Description: Knowledge and communication products have been adopted by extensionistas and farmers to implement and monitor CSA practices, while communication products have been taken into consideration by relevant sub-national or national policy frameworks and/or papers.

Project: Preparing the Road to Zero-emission Urban Mobility in Colombian Cities: Accelerating Electric Bus Adoption
Result_Title: Cities in Colombia adopt knowledge from WRI guidance material disseminated and demonstrate interest in electrifying their bus fleets
Description: Catered cities in Colombia adopt knowledge disseminated through blogs, articles, press releases, and social media on how to implement and scale e-bus programs. Targeted cities adopt the guidance to start e-bus procurement efforts and  take into account lessons learned on best practices from the proposed project (and other WRI e-bus research).

Project: Preparing the Road to Zero-emission Urban Mobility in Colombian Cities: Accelerating Electric Bus Adoption
Result_Title: National-level NGOs and stakeholders have a transparent network to use for collaboration with local and national government
Description: Coordination between NGOs, local stakeholders, and GESI-related organizations to ensure all electric mobility work is collaborative and original.

Project: Preparing the Road to Zero-emission Urban Mobility in Colombian Cities: Accelerating Electric Bus Adoption
Result_Title: National-level financing options and incentives are easily accessible to cities in Colombia
Description: Engage with national institutions and utilities to map financing options available for e-buses in Colombia. Work with national players to develop stimulus packages and other economic recovery measures which incorporate e-buses as a tool for improving economic health in the wake of COVID-19.

Project: Sustainable Tourism Enhancement Project - Phase 2: Boosting conservation and emissions reduction through tourism and technology
Result_Title: Conservation agreements are complied and verified
Description: Conservation agreements are complied and verified through satellite systems, travelers and and communities.

Project: Sustainable Tourism Enhancement Project - Phase 2: Boosting conservation and emissions reduction through tourism and technology
Result_Title: Knowledge products delivered by the project are adopted by key stakeholders and beneficiaries
Description: Knowledge products related to conservation and sustainable tourism created as a result of the implementation of the impact measurement, training processes, and the Awake U courses, are adopted by tourism organisations within their businesses processes.

Project: Deforestation-free Cocoa for the Amazon Piedmont
Result_Title: Producers, companies, and government stakeholders participating in the CB&P adopt the plan for scaling up the MRV system for the Amazon Piedmont
Description: Government, companies and other stakeholders participating in the B&P create inter-institutional programs that adopt and appropriate the plan for scaling up the MRV system for the Amazon Piedmont.

Project: Deforestation-free Cocoa for the Amazon Piedmont
Result_Title: Cocoa farmers, their associations and companies, and public and private decision makers in charge of financing instruments or incentives adopt the recommendations developed
Description: Decision makers in charge of financing instruments or incentives adopt the recommendations developed in order to reduce emissions.

Project: Deforestation-free Cocoa for the Amazon Piedmont
Result_Title: Communication products on deforestation-free cocoa are adopted by stakeholders in the value chain, consumers, and government
Description: Communication products on deforestation-free cocoa are generally disseminated and accepted by industry, consumers, producers, local, regional, national and international government entities. Stakeholders accept and reproduce the communication products in their own communication networks to help position a deforestation-free Amazon cocoa among the market.

Project: Deforestation-free Cocoa for the Amazon Piedmont
Result_Title: Cocoa farmers, field practitioners, Regional Environmental Agencies (CARs), and other organizations/institutions promoting agroforestry in the region adopt the sustainable business model developed for the Amazon Piedmont
Indicator: Int. Out 3. 'Adoption of recommendation for other action'
Description: Cocoa farmers and cocoa programs promoted by different institutions adopt the sustainable business model developed for the Amazon Piedmont.

Project: Deforestation-free Cocoa for the Amazon Piedmont
Result_Title: Cocoa farmers, field practitioners, Regional Environmental Agencies (CARs), and other organizations/institutions promoting agroforestry in the region adopt the guidelines on forest restoration and rehabilitation
Indicator: Int. Out 3. 'Adoption of recommendation for other action'
Description: Cocoa farmers and cocoa programs promoted by different institutions adopt the guidelines on forest restoration and rehabilitation using cocoa agroforestry arrangements.

Project: Deforestation-free Cocoa for the Amazon Piedmont
Result_Title: Key actors of cocoa value chain create a sense of collective ownership over a common vision for deforestation-free cocoa
Description: Key actors of cocoa value chain will gain a sense of collective ownership over a common vision, which translates in implementing deforestations-free cocoa business models and disseminating its benefits.

Project: Sustainable Tourism Enhancement Project - Phase 2: Boosting conservation and emissions reduction through tourism and technology
Result_Title: Tourism organization beneficiaries incorporate lessons learned in their business practices and improve specific process, mechanism, or practice as a result of the training process
Indicator: Int. Out 1. 'Enhanced action because of training'
Description: At least 50 beneficiaries have enhanced capacities in sustainable tourism, conservation, monitoring systems, and operations in their businesses as a result of the training process that they receive during the project implementation. At least 75 beneficiaries will have enhanced actions in their businesses after the project is finished.

Project: Sustainable Tourism Enhancement Project - Phase 2: Boosting conservation and emissions reduction through tourism and technology
Result_Title: Local and national government authorities adopt the recommendations for policy/legislation that the project will deliver as a result of the  different insights, data, and conclusions
Indicator: Int. Out 2. 'Adoption of recommendation for policy/legislation'
Description: Local authorities and national government (e.g. Viceministry of Tourism, PNN, MADS, Humboldt, Colciencias) adopt the recommendations made, and the data and information gathered throughout the project to better understand the link between tourism and conservation with the processes to create community based monitoring linked to tourism activities. This will allow for the formulation of new policies related to nature tourism as a tool for forest conservation and emissions reduction.

Project: Sustainable Tourism Enhancement Project - Phase 2: Boosting conservation and emissions reduction through tourism and technology
Result_Title: Travelers and other actors redirect resources to sustainable tourism and conservation initiatives which will contribute to reduce carbon emissions through the voluntary Funding Platform
