Description: Resources from travelers and other stakeholders interested in conservation are mobilised through the funding platform (with the CO2 calculator incorporated) towards tourism organisations that signed conservation agreements and participated in a conservation monitoring process. All data and results collected from the monitoring, measurement and reporting activities throughout the project, as well as the conservation agreements signed, and all satellite information, will be uploaded to the funding platform. This will not only highlight and visualize the impact generated by these organizations and sustainable tourism towards conservation, but will also help mobilize resources towards these organizations and initiatives.

Project: Sustainable Tourism Enhancement Project - Phase 2: Boosting conservation and emissions reduction through tourism and technology
Result_Title: Tourism organisations adopt conservation knowledge and marketing content to add value to the tourism experience they offer
Description: At least 10 beneficiary tourism organizations that agreed to implement forest conservation and monitoring actions have increased sales as a result of the implementation of the marketing campaign and content strategy, during the implementation of the project. During and after the implementation of the project it is expected to see increased action by local organisations and stakeholders towards conservation and nature tourism, as well as an increase the sales for tourism and conservation initiatives. The marketing and content strategy will keep generating results after the execution of the project, because all the content and marketing strategies will still be published and existing via virtual media channels. This will be measured through the direct sales results from the social media campaign.

Project: Sustainable Tourism Enhancement Project - Phase 2: Boosting conservation and emissions reduction through tourism and technology
Result_Title: Partnerships define specific actions and projects towards nature tourism and emissions reduction
Description: It is expected that the specific activities defined in the 10 agreements derived from the partnerships are maintained and complied after the project ends to enhance the actions of tourism actors in the destination regarding tourism and conservation, articulation, and investment of resources for sustainable tourism and conservation purposes.

Project: Supporting livelihoods through Ecotourism Routes for Forest and Peace.
Result_Title: Strengthened communities to manage tourism operations autonomously
Indicator: Int. Out 1. 'Enhanced action because of training'
Description: Having the detailed tourist plans, tested and fine-tuned the routes and experiences, the communities will have strengthened capacities to be able to manage the tourism operations on their own (lodging, marketing, tourism guidance, restaurants), gradually including more people from the community in the tourism value chain. This will in turn bring more income from a sustainable activity, and not the traditional extractive and climate change-inducing activities (mainly deforestation and mining).

Project: Steering the Colombian Road Freight Sector Towards a Zero Emissions Strategy GIRO-ZERO
Result_Title: Stakeholders apply project outputs in their strategic and operational decision-making processes
Description: Road Freight Companies, members of Colfecar and the Public Sector adopt and use the interactive toolbox, strategic business plan, roadmap towards zero emissions, sustainable performance index, KPI dashboard and scenario simulator to make decisions that contribute towards a zero emissions Road Freight Transport Sector.

Project: Steering the Colombian Road Freight Sector Towards a Zero Emissions Strategy GIRO-ZERO
Result_Title: Public sector develops regulations and policies that include recommendations from the project outputs
Indicator: Int. Out 2. 'Adoption of recommendation for policy/legislation'
Description:
In the process of the development of new policies and regulations that public sector uses project outputs to define elements and goals of such new developments. The recommendations from the project will support and influence arguments to drive the RFT sector towards a zero emissions goal in new policies.
It is expected that the Ministry of Transport, the Ministry of Environment, and National Planning Department use these recommendations.

Project: Steering the Colombian Road Freight Sector Towards a Zero Emissions Strategy GIRO-ZERO
Result_Title: Road Freight Companies, truck owners, and truck drivers adopt cleaner technologies and practices
Indicator: Int. Out 3. 'Adoption of recommendation for other action'
Description: Road Freight Companies, truck owners, and truck drivers understand the positive trade-offs, which leads to the adoption of cleaner technologies and practices.

Project: Steering the Colombian Road Freight Sector Towards a Zero Emissions Strategy GIRO-ZERO
Result_Title: Stakeholders use product repository
Description: Road Freight Companies, members of Colfecar, the Public Sector (Min.Transporte, MADS, DNP), and academics access and use information from the repository for their strategic and operational decision-making processes. This can include, but is not limited to, uses such as capacity building, strategic business planning, emissions reporting efforts, or subsequent academic publications.

Project: Accelerating high-quality growth in China’s Green Bond market and supporting post-COVID green economic recovery
Result_Title: Green bond market players better identify and screen out eligible green projects and assets
Indicator: Int. Out 1. 'Enhanced action because of training'
Description: Training attendee have an increase capacity to better identify and screen out eligible green projects and assets underpinning green bonds that aligned with the Paris Agreement target. which will help leading practitioners in China's green finance sector to improve their  internationally aligned processes and start to accelerate growth in China's Green Bond Market

Project: Accelerating high-quality growth in China’s Green Bond market and supporting post-COVID green economic recovery
Result_Title: Market regulators take suggestions into the decision-making process
Indicator: Int. Out 2. 'Adoption of recommendation for policy/legislation'
Description: Market regulators make reference to the suggestions put forward in their attempt to improve rules related to green bond market. Improved alignment of green standards leads to start of of two-way investment processes for China, i.e. Chinese investment in international green projects and international investment in Chinese green projects (including BRI)

Project: Preparing the public and financial sector for CTR: Capacity building and call to action
Result_Title: Participants and institutions adopt knowledge products regarding the analysis of climate transition risk in investment portfolios in Colombia and how to manage them
Description: Participants and institutions adopt the knowledge and communication products to enhance their preparation and action towards climate transition risk. New firms and public officials gather inspiration from the online platform and the projects showcased to design and implement their own climate transition risk management projects.

Project: Accelerating development of new bioeconomy businesses and enhanced capacities for green jobs promotion and increased climate action ambition from policy implementation and integration.
Result_Title: DNP adopts GGGI's recommendations in the technical basis of the upcoming National Development Plan 2022-2026, and municipalities and governorships adopt the Data Visualization tool and guidelines as a way to track actions regarding GGP, green recovery
Indicator: Int. Out 2. 'Adoption of recommendation for policy/legislation'
Description:
GGGI will deliver the recommendation documents of low carbon and green growth technical inputs  in Q4 of the project for the technical basis of the upcoming NDP. The expected outcome is that the DNP will adopt these recommendations into the NDP through technical discussions with relevant ministries, productive sectors, new presidential team, and through the approval of the Senate of the Republic
GGGI will deliver a data visualization tool for providing technical assistance to municipalities and governorships, with the expectation that they adopt this tool to help them track GGP actions, green recovery and 2030 agenda implementation.

Project: Accelerating development of new bioeconomy businesses and enhanced capacities for green jobs promotion and increased climate action ambition from policy implementation and integration.
Result_Title: Increased supply of technical professional training courses delivered by SENA to increase green labor competencies in fields of energy efficiency, bioeconomy, and reforestation
Description: Students are expected to adopt knowledge in fields of energy efficiency, bioeconomy, and reforestation by their graduation from the training courses. This intermediate outcome will be observed during the first year following the completion of the project. However, this intermediate outcome will be partially observed in the context of the project (Q4) through SENA's official adoption of new low carbon capacity building programs.

Project: Supporting livelihoods through Ecotourism Routes for Forest and Peace.
Result_Title: Enhanced regional food offering and improved tourist experience
Indicator: Int. Out 1. 'Enhanced action because of training'
Description: Enhanced capacities of the communities to provide a gastronomic experience that incorporates native plants and traditional recipes. This will strengthen the food offer of the regions since they will include new and improved menus, enhancing the tourist's experience when visiting.

Project: Supporting livelihoods through Ecotourism Routes for Forest and Peace.
Result_Title: Communities become more knowledgable of the botanical biodiversity of the area and integrate such knowledge in the nature tours they will guide, improving the general touristic experience
Indicator: Int. Out 1. 'Enhanced action because of training'
Description: Communities become more knowledgeable of the botanical biodiversity of the area and integrate such knowledge in the nature tours they will guide, improving the general touristic experience. It will make it more probable that visitors share their experience in social media, which will in turn attract more tourists and translate into more revenue from a sustainable activity.

Project: Supporting livelihoods through Ecotourism Routes for Forest and Peace.
Result_Title: The strengthened Tourism Network will facilitate the work among the community members, enhancing the marketing roles and delivering effective marketing strategies that attract tourists
Description: The delivery of the marketing and planning/admin sessions help the members of the MWG to understand the need to work together as a whole, and not as independent tour operators. Communities are committed to continue working as a group  and to develop more detailed governance schemes to organise the work that must be done. The strengthening of this network will facilitate the work among the community members, improving the marketing roles, and delivering effective marketing strategies that attract tourists. This, in turn, will translate into more income from a sustainable activity for the community, which will in turn protect the forest from deforestation activities (which are currently the main source of income), ultimately mitigating climate change. The primary and secondary beneficiary communities, E3, the PdPs, and project partners are expected to be highly committed, engaged, and generating actions to implement the different components of the project.

Project: Technical assistance for the implementation of emergent design for active mobility and public space
Result_Title: Local governments adopt the recommendations to develop active mobility and public space projects as a mitigation or adaption action
Indicator: Int. Out 3. 'Adoption of recommendation for other action'
Description: 15 local governments will learn to link active mobility actions with Climate Change, as a mitigation or adaption action.

Project: Comprehensive plan and roadmap for sustainable mobility in Bogotá-Región during and after COVID-19
Result_Title: Appropriation by Bogotá mayor's office and Cundinamarca Government of the "MaaS/MRV architectures"
Indicator: Int. Out 2. 'Adoption of recommendation for policy/legislation'
Description: Appropriation by Bogotá Mayor's Office and Cundinamarca Government of the "MaaS/MRV architectures"

Project: Accelerating Fleet-wide electrification of public transport in Mexico City
Result_Title: Electrification analysis taken into consideration by Metrobus
Description: Metrobus incorporates the electrification analysis to assess the operational viability of electric buses in routers and estimate total cost of ownership.
Implementor: Dalberg Advisors (Asesores en Desarrollo Dalberg S. de R.L.)

Project: Technical assistance for developing sustainable energy access strategies in Mexico
Result_Title: Puebla, Veracruz, and Yucatán implement energy access programs based on the knowledge and skills acquired during the workshops
Indicator: Int. Out 1. 'Enhanced action because of training'
Description: Beneficiaries use the knowledge and skills acquired during the workshops to implement an energy access program in their state, following the revised sociotechnical, financial, and policy implications .
Implementor: Ilumexico (Eres Energía Renovable SAPI de CV)

Project: Technical assistance for developing sustainable energy access strategies in Mexico
Result_Title: Puebla, Veracruz, and Yucatán use the handbook recommendations in the implementation of energy access programs
Indicator: Int. Out 3. 'Adoption of recommendation for other action'
Description: Beneficiaries use the recommendations from the handbook to implement an energy access program in their state, following the revised socio-technical, financial, and policy implications .
Implementor: Ilumexico (Eres Energía Renovable SAPI de CV)

Project: Technical assistance for developing sustainable energy access strategies in Mexico
Result_Title: Puebla, Veracruz and, Yucatán use financial schemes in implementation  of energy access programs
Indicator: Int. Out 2. 'Adoption of recommendation for policy/legislation'
Description: Beneficiaries implement an energy access program using the financial schemes developed during the workshops and in partnership with the possible investors.
Implementor: Ilumexico (Eres Energía Renovable SAPI de CV)

Project: A contribution towards a Just Transition Finance Roadmap(JTFR) South Africa
Result_Title: Production of knowledge products (thought pieces, input to COP26 report, comparative study, contribution to a just transition finance roadmap for South Africa).
Description: Evidenced taken into consideration may be in the form of feedback comments or attendance at the webinar and further engagement [including COP26 related products/events] with TIPS.

Project: Operationalising Energy Performance Certificates in South Africa
Result_Title: Enhanced enabling environment and clarity of actions for stakeholders supports much improved public sector EPC readiness.
Indicator: Int. Out 1. 'Enhanced action because of training'
Description: Enhanced enabling environment and clarity of actions for stakeholders supports much improved public sector EPC readiness, increased frequency of process execution for private and state-own buildings, leading to wide scale issuance of EPCs for buildings and NBEPR is fully operational and enhanced to improve gathering of data on EE baseline in South African buildings.

Project: Operationalising Energy Performance Certificates in South Africa
Result_Title: NBEPR is fully operational, and issuing EPCs
Indicator: Int. Out 2. 'Adoption of recommendation for policy/legislation'
Description:
1. The proposed NBEPR requirements have been approved and validated by SANEDI and NBEPR is ready to be built by specification
2. Agreement from SANEDI (and DMRE) to implement/mainstream the highly integrated South African EPC mechanism based on recommendations from international best practice and experiences.
3. NBEPR is online and publicly available, and is being used by multiple public and private buildings owners to obtain EPC certificates. Successfully launched NBEPR that demonstrably meets EE user needs and complies with data management and governance policies.

Project: Operationalising Energy Performance Certificates in South Africa
Result_Title: Increased frequency of process execution for private and state-owned buildings, leading to wide-scale issuance of EPCs for buildings
Description:
Adoption by SANEDI (and/or DMRE) of roadmap for improving EPC compliant data resulting in improved and streamlined EPC mechanism in South Africa
Survey to be undertaken by GBCSA amongst private and public sector members to ascertain levels of awareness around the EPC mechanism, means of obtaining certificates, and benefits of doing so, and survey results show positive results.

Project: Action Plan for Electrification of Two Wheelers in Jakarta
Result_Title: Stakeholders understand the current challenges, issues and benefits of the electrification of ride-hailing
Description: The Jakarta Transport Agency and BPTJ will understand the current challenges and issues, including social, environmental, economic, and GESI issues, faced by vulnerable road users and the general communities with regard to the massive motorcycle usage in Greater Jakarta Area. The beneficiaries will use the report findings to advocate the shift to electric motorcycle in Greater Jakarta Area, with the electrification of ride-hailing as the main starting point, and more sustainable modes to the general public through their communication channels and to related government agencies. The Government of Jakarta acknowledges two-wheeler electrification as one of GHG reduction measures and incorporates the measure to Jakarta’s GHG reduction action plan.

Project: Institutional Capacity Building Framework Program to accelerate adoption of electric mobility in public transport in India
Result_Title: City Officials adopt the scheme for e-rickshaws mobilisation in Kakinada
Indicator: Int. Out 2. 'Adoption of recommendation for policy/legislation'
Description: City officials adopt the scheme and prepare to implement it. This could include entering into MOUs with agencies and institutions promoting electric mobility and clean energy, committing budgets and human resources as suggested in the Final Report, align the ecosystem to the need and acceptability of migration to the new paradigm and entering into pitching and negotiation with bi/multilateral agencies for soft loans at state level implementation.
Implementor: Research Triangle Institute Global India Private Limited

Project: Institutional Capacity Building Framework Program to accelerate adoption of electric mobility in public transport in India
Result_Title: Entrepreneurs and businesses have improved skills and capacity in e-vehicle best practices
Indicator: Int. Out 1. 'Enhanced action because of training'
Description: Entrepreneurs and businesses demonstrate improved skills and capacity in e-vehicle best practices. This will include knowledge regarding e-vehicle business models and this will be demonstrated by beneficiaries starting to develop business plans for their respective concepts.
Implementor: Research Triangle Institute Global India Private Limited

Project: Institutional Capacity Building Framework Program to accelerate adoption of electric mobility in public transport in India
Result_Title: KEMN app users are engaged with the content and find it useful
Description: App users participate actively on the app by reading content, continued active participation in the Kakinada Green Mobility Network virtual events which will bind program participants, civil society and key government officials into a virtual community committed to reduce carbon emissions in Kakinada.
Implementor: Research Triangle Institute Global India Private Limited

Project: Institutional Capacity Building Framework Program to accelerate adoption of electric mobility in public transport in India
Result_Title: Technical students and auto industry employees have increased knowledge of EV maintenance and management
Indicator: Int. Out 1. 'Enhanced action because of training'
Description: Technical students and auto industry employees have increased knowledge of EV maintenance and management. This increased knowledge will be demonstrated through the participants continuing to upgrade their knowledge in e-mobility and contribute to the KEMN.
Implementor: Research Triangle Institute Global India Private Limited

Project: Mainstreaming Climate Risk Assessment in Credit Operations of Brazilian Development Banks
Result_Title: BNDES and BDMG understand how they can interact with and use the tool to conduct climate risk analysis on their portfolios
Description: This understanding of how to conduct climate risk analysis on their portfolios will be demonstrated by identification of the potential and usefulness of the climate risk tool, process gaps mapping and preliminary recommendations for tool’s improvements to better meet DBs' needs, and plans for the formal incorporation of the tool in the credit process considering BACEN regulations.
Implementor: Waycarbon Solucoes Ambientais e Projetos de Carbono LTDA

Project: Greening Finance in Argentina to Combat Climate Change and Promote Inclusion
Result_Title: Participating beneficiaries have an increased knowledge of climate-related financial issues
Indicator: Int. Out 1. 'Enhanced action because of training'
Description: Participating beneficiaries have an increased knowledge of climate-related financial issues and have the knowledge and skills  to identify how sustainable finance practices can be implemented in their own organisations.
Implementor: Carbon Trust Mexico S.A. de C.V.

Project: Capacity building to the government of Peru to support its first sovereign green bond issuance
Result_Title: Government beneficiaries integrate the Monitoring and Reporting methodology into Peru’s GB Framework
Indicator: Int. Out 3. 'Adoption of recommendation for other action'
Description: The recommendations concerning the monitoring and reporting indicators and procedures for Green Bond projects is endorsed by MEF and integrated into the GB framework. The GB governance structure has the necessary understanding of the recommendations to integrate them and implement them.

Project: Harnessing Green Finance through Climate-related Risk Management and Opportunities in Malaysia
Result_Title: Existing climate risk scenario analysis done by two financial institutions
Indicator: Int. Out 1. 'Enhanced action because of training'
Description: Financial institutions are able to conduct their own internal climate risk scenario analysis based on the identification of their current exposure to and potential financial impact from climate-related risks through the workshops, training, and engagements. They can potentially cover more sectors in their portfolio when data is available. At the moment, the banks are still in the infancy stage of climate risk management. Both of the targeted banks have not applied the Paris Agreement Capital Transition Assessment (PACTA)  tool in climate scenario analysis before. The central bank is also in the process of developing the guideline on climate risk management to be applied by financial institutions.

Project: Harnessing Green Finance through Climate-related Risk Management and Opportunities in Malaysia
Result_Title: Adoption of the recommendations from the white paper on climate related risk by financial institutions.
Indicator: Int. Out 3. 'Adoption of recommendation for other action'
Description: Adoption of the recommendations from the white paper on climate related risk by financial institutions, as demonstrated through the generation of demand from public to WWF and 2DII to conduct more industry-wide capacity building workshops to enhance the capacity of financial institutions to identify their current exposure to and potential financial impact from climate-related risks.

Project: Strategy and Action Plan for Electrification of Public Transport and Intermediate Public Transport in the Indian Cities
Result_Title: Participating bus agency officials and operators have increased knowledge and capacity on EV technologies
Indicator: Int. Out 1. 'Enhanced action because of training'
Description: Participating bus agency officials and operators have increased knowledge and capacity on EV technologies. This would be demonstrated by a willingness to take the strategy and action plan towards implementation and to replicate this across other cities in India.

Project: Utility led smart electric vehicle charging for demand response and grid management in New Delhi, India
Result_Title: BYPL has a better understanding of usage trends
Description: Output 1 will develop the technical protocols for utility and charging sites to communicate with each other in order to manage demand in electricity. The project expects that the BYPL (the utility) will better understand the usage trends and coming from different charging points, and will use the demonstration in order to identify ways in which they can manage electricity demand from EVs.

Project: Development of an EV Financing Tool and Business Model to Enable the Scaling up of EV Uptake
Result_Title: MSMEs are fully engaged with the business cases and models developed through the project support
Indicator: Int. Out 3. 'Adoption of recommendation for other action'
Description: After the project has supported the MSMEs in the development of the EV business models, the MSMEs will be fully involved in the techno-economic-commercial assessments of their business cases and models. Subsequent to the completion of this project output, we expect that MSMEs and FIs would continue to engage and meet on a regular basis on the performance of the EV-based and EV-enabled business models through the FIWG and MFEF platforms that were established as a part of the other project output.

Project: Development of an EV Financing Tool and Business Model to Enable the Scaling up of EV Uptake
Result_Title: Participating Urban Mobility Service Providers demonstrate an increased understanding of the potential benefits and opportunities arising from the adoption of electric motorbikes, and electric vehicles for MaaS providers
Indicator: Int. Out 1. 'Enhanced action because of training'
Description: Participating Urban Mobility Service Providers have an increased appreciation of the potential and viability of electrified transport solutions, suitable financing options and mechanisms for e-mobility. This increased understanding may be demonstrated by the participants through the sustainability of their service being incorporated as a key driver of their business models or undertaking steps to actively encourage their rider base/service providers to adopt e-mobility solutions.

Project: Consolidation of the Mexican Climate Finance Hub - mobilizing resources to mitigation and adaptation activities and achieve Mexico´s emission reduction goals
Result_Title: Issuers adopt TCFD and SASB as their main standards for the disclosure of their ESG information, and investors learn how to use and interpret the information publicly available from the issuers
Indicator: Int. Out 1. 'Enhanced action because of training'
Description: Investors use the newly released information to make better financial decisions based on the risks posed by environmental and social factors incurred by the local issuers.

Project: Strengthening the use of Earth Observation platforms to support the implementation of climate change mitigation goals in the forest and land use sector in three states in Mexico.
Result_Title: Government institutions responsible on forest and agricultural monitoring better informed about data inputs and platforms available, as well as reporting pathways and responsibilities, for deforestation reduction activities
Description: Report on platforms and data inputs is accepted by government agencies and informs decisions on the selection of platforms and data inputs for monitoring the forest frontier.
Implementor: Ecometrica Ltd. (Ecosistemas Consultoría Integral para Soluciones sustentables)

Project: Strengthening the use of Earth Observation platforms to support the implementation of climate change mitigation goals in the forest and land use sector in three states in Mexico.
Result_Title: Land use/cover maps adopted and used by institutions in the forest and agricultural sector, through the EO labs and other platforms and tools, as the basis for policy making decisions
Description: New data products (e.g. land cover maps and deforestation alerts) go through appropriate quality assurance/control process within government and are accepted as official, government datasets to monitor the forest frontier and implement mitigation actions to achieve zero deforestation in 2030.
Implementor: Ecometrica Ltd. (Ecosistemas Consultoría Integral para Soluciones sustentables)

Project: Strengthening the use of Earth Observation platforms to support the implementation of climate change mitigation goals in the forest and land use sector in three states in Mexico.
Result_Title: Recommendations adopted and implemented by CONAFOR, SADER & state governments of Chiapas, Campeche & Tabasco
Indicator: Int. Out 2. 'Adoption of recommendation for policy/legislation'
Description: Criteria & tools incorporated into public policy and programmes in order to improve the probability of achievement NDCs in the land use sector.
Implementor: Ecometrica Ltd. (Ecosistemas Consultoría Integral para Soluciones sustentables)

Project: Landscape conservation and livelihood restoration in the Mexican ejidal altiplano: the case of Apan, Hidalgo.
Result_Title: Commitment of main beneficiaries to participate in the implementation of the solutions defined in the Action Plan
Indicator: Int. Out 1. 'Enhanced action because of training'
Description: Through workshops for diagnostic and priorization of solution and field studies to assess their potential of the prioritized solutions, main beneficiaries will be gaining skills and experience that in turn will enable them to take action and thus propitiate their commitment towards implementation.
Implementor: Eetestudio  (Espacio entre tiempo estudio SA de CV)

Project: Landscape conservation and livelihood restoration in the Mexican ejidal altiplano: the case of Apan, Hidalgo.
Result_Title: The governance and funding recommendations are appropriated by legislators and citizens
Indicator: Int. Out 2. 'Adoption of recommendation for policy/legislation'
Description: The recommendations are appropriated by legislators at federal, state, and municipal scale, who will then promote institutionalization. A critical mass of citizens is convinced of the necessity of the legal adjustments and will push forward the recommendations in the political agenda.
Implementor: Eetestudio  (Espacio entre tiempo estudio SA de CV)

Project: Landscape conservation and livelihood restoration in the Mexican ejidal altiplano: the case of Apan, Hidalgo.
Result_Title: Adoption of the Action Plan and consensus over high-priority nature-based solutions
Indicator: Int. Out 3. 'Adoption of recommendation for other action'
Description: Main beneficiaries officially adopt and commit to implement the solutions listed in the Action Plan and organize to continue monitoring natural resources and testing solutions while preparing for implementation.
Implementor: Eetestudio  (Espacio entre tiempo estudio SA de CV)

Project: Landscape conservation and livelihood restoration in the Mexican ejidal altiplano: the case of Apan, Hidalgo.
Result_Title: Adopting a Consensus Statement (a common vision to be implemented in an action plan) shared by the main stakeholders (ejidos, public authorities, industrialists) of the actual state of the territory and its main challenges
Description: Main beneficiaries improve their knowledge of the environmental and socioeconomic issues of the territory, as well as climate change effects, by participating in diagnostic and prioritization of solution workshops, where their knowledge will come together in a consensus statement with inputs from the team of experts. Main beneficiaries will enhance their capacity to assess and monitor their living environment through participative field study that will feed into a shared objective of increased mitigation and resilience to climate change.
Implementor: Eetestudio  (Espacio entre tiempo estudio SA de CV)

Project: Accelerating Green Finance Flows Through the Strengthening of the Mexican National Banking and Securities Commission (CNBV)
Result_Title: Financial Intermediaries use ESG and climate risk screening tools
Indicator: Int. Out 3. 'Adoption of recommendation for other action'
Description: This intermediate outcome is expected to result in the use of ESG and climate risk screening tools by Financial intermediares.  A tool that allows regulated actors to assess where they stand on integrating ESG standards into FIs operations and decision-making processes and what specific actions they can undertake to increase their ESG capacities and integrate climate related risks into their operations and analyses. The tool will be disseminated so that  FIs use it. The tool will guide FI to identify the gaps they need to close regarding environmental, social, gender, and climate-related risk to green their portfolios and mobilize green resources.

Project: Harnessing Green Finance through Climate-related Risk Management and Opportunities in Malaysia
Result_Title: Adoption of basic recommendations (e.g. national standards and certifications) and risk management guidance in the VBIAF sectoral guides and BNM reference document
Indicator: Int. Out 3. 'Adoption of recommendation for other action'
Description: Basic recommendations (e.g. national standards and certifications) and risk management guidance in the VBIAF sectoral guides are adopted by the BNM and VBIAF sectoral guide working group. This will be demonstrated by them taking relevant steps towards implementing the recommendations of climate change industry best practices, risk management and impact mitigation. The BNM reference document on climate risk management and scenario analysis will be used as a reference by the financial institutions and integrated into their climate risk assessment framework (pre-implementation stage).

Project: Green Economy Policy for Sarawak
Result_Title: Adoption of Green Economy Policy for Sarawak
Indicator: Int. Out 2. 'Adoption of recommendation for policy/legislation'
Description: The Green Economy Policy for Sarawak is approved by a Steering Committee chaired by the Sarawak State Secretary and adopted as the strategy for Sarawak to transition to the Green Economy.

Project: Green Economy Policy for Sarawak
Result_Title: Development of action plans for adopting carbon trading strategy
Indicator: Int. Out 1. 'Enhanced action because of training'
Description: The key personnel in the Economic Planning Unit (EPU) and Ministry of Urban Development and Natural Resources of the Sarawak Government develop action plans for adoption of carbon trading strategy.

Project: Development of an EV Financing Tool and Business Model to Enable the Scaling up of EV Uptake
Result_Title: Financial Institutions from the Financial Institutions Working Group commit to evaluating and considering financing EV business cases
Description: Subsequent to the publication of the FI Survey Report and the engagement with the FIWG on both survey results, it is expected that interested FIs would sign MoUs or Letters of Support committing to evaluate and consider for financing EV business cases from the selected MSMEs.

Project: Utility led smart electric vehicle charging for demand response and grid management in New Delhi, India
Result_Title: Utility companies have the necessary guidance to initiate managed charging pilots in their service area
Indicator: Int. Out 3. 'Adoption of recommendation for other action'
Description: The economic modelling analysis will be used by utilities to inform protocols and actions in order to better manage electricity surges and demand.

Project: Strategy and Action Plan for Electrification of Public Transport and Intermediate Public Transport in the Indian Cities
Result_Title: City officials develop an understanding of the gaps and the areas for action for EV uptake
Description: City officials are sensitised towards the need for ‘Shift’, ‘Improve’ and ‘Enable’ strategies. This could be demonstrated by the identification of gaps and challenges by city officials with action areas that would help in assessing institutional strengths and identifying areas of capacity building.

Project: Enhanced TCFD aligned transparency for an economically and environmentally resilient financial system in Brazil
Result_Title: Brazilian listed companies share the readiness report and engage actively with the content of the report
Description: Brazilian listed companies are expected to download the readiness report and share it with their teams and broader organisation. They are expected to engage actively in the substance of the report and reflect on ways to address gaps. Conversations regarding the report findings will be held with companies, regulators and FIs to also ensure we are able to tailor the subsequent project activities related to engagement and training to the specific needs of the beneficiaries.

Project: Enhanced TCFD aligned transparency for an economically and environmentally resilient financial system in Brazil
Result_Title: Brazilian companies engage with their CDP score cards and aim to improve
Description: Companies seek feedback on their scores to identify gaps in climate planning, and take initial action to improve their scores to address these gaps.

Project: Enhanced TCFD aligned transparency for an economically and environmentally resilient financial system in Brazil
Result_Title: Increase in the number of investor signatories towards climate and forest disclosure
Description: The increase in the number of investor signatories will demonstrate engagement with the insight report and a desire by investors and FIs to receive bespoke analysis and insights regarding their portfolios, so investors can make their financial decisions in high quality environmental data.

Project: Closing the gap on sustainable finance and enabling green recovery through capacity building in CDP’s TCFD aligned disclosures and the GRI standards (Indonesia, Thailand)
Result_Title: Beneficiaries that have a basic understanding of TCFD and ESG, and are mature sustainability reporters plan to incorporate the reporting best practices from the Advanced Workshops
Indicator: Int. Out 1. 'Enhanced action because of training'
Description: Following course delivery, it is expected that beneficiaries will develop a plan and deploy resources with a view toward incorporating the best practices outlined in the workshops. This will include creating a process for risk management and target setting, as well as structures for stronger climate governance and strategic development. With respect to scenario analysis, GHG management, and supply chain engagement, beneficiaries will be positioned to both develop their own decarbonisation pathways and draft corporate action plans on SDGs and Low Carbon Transition.

Project: Closing the gap on sustainable finance and enabling green recovery through capacity building in CDP’s TCFD aligned disclosures and the GRI standards (Indonesia, Thailand)
Result_Title: IDX, SET, regulators and financial institutions have a stronger awareness of how to create a green and sustainable capital markets ecosystem in Indonesia and Thailand
Indicator: Int. Out 1. 'Enhanced action because of training'
Description: Beneficiaries will have a stronger awareness of the value in gathering and considering TCFD and ESG metrics as one of the central components of their business and investment decisions. Subject matter experts and knowledge sharing from peers will provide advice on how to create and execute on green and sustainable finance opportunities. Following the completion of the workshops, FIs can begin developing their strategies to tackle financed emissions within their portfolios, engage with portfolio companies on financial matters related to climate change and ESG and begin to develop new processes, products and services relevant that capitalize on low carbon  opportunities.

Project: Greening Agri Finance in Brazil, mainstreaming low carbon and gender inclusive interventions in Plano Safra to transform Brazil’s agriculture and livestock sectors
Result_Title: Beneficiaries are committed to utilising the Roadmap to advocate for changes in Plano Safra
Indicator: Int. Out 2. 'Adoption of recommendation for policy/legislation'
Description: MAPA will use the figures provided in the roadmap to build an action plan internally to materialise the changes proposed, communicate widely on the potential impact of Plano Safra building political buy-in for proposed changes, and take decisions on what form of regulatory change works best to deliver the roadmap’s projections. The Central Bank will use the figures provided in this report to assess the impact of Plano Safra’s loans and re-assess the role of the Rural Credit Manual which it leads. The Ministry of Economy will use the figures provided in the roadmap to inform the National Committee on the Legal Amazon of the current state of Plano Safra – building crucial political support for changes to the Plan to be proposed. Banco do Brasil will use the results of this output to argue for changes in Plano Safra in its annual report to MAPA and the Central Bank, and communicate widely on the potential impact of Plano Safra building political buy-in for proposed changes.

Project: Greening Agri Finance in Brazil, mainstreaming low carbon and gender inclusive interventions in Plano Safra to transform Brazil’s agriculture and livestock sectors
Result_Title: BB have the capacity and skills to integrate socio-environmental metrics in BB’s assessment of Plano Safra loans
Indicator: Int. Out 1. 'Enhanced action because of training'
Description: Banco do Brasil and interested FIs will have the capacity to integrate socio-environmental indicators into Plano Safra loans. This includes reporting internally on learnings about climate risk and climate impact; setting up a plan to scale up the application of the MRV platform to enhance their pool of existing indexes for the entirety of their agricultural sector portfolio; building and submitting their annual report to MAPA and the Central Bank on proposed improvements to Plano Safra. MAPA will have the capacity to simulate the impact of two regulatory interventions of its preference.

Project: Developing and embedding an NDC Capital Raising Strategy for Peru
Result_Title: Increased public sector understanding of approaches to attract private capital for climate, and increased capacity to develop and execute strategic planning for raising and allocating climate investment
Description: Through the delivery of all the project outputs, the Peruvian public sector, including MINAM, COFIDE and PROFANANPE will have greater knowledge and ability to develop and implement the strategic approaches to increasing green finance that will be required in practice. This outcome will include both expanded knowledge base on the challenges to and opportunities for accelerating private climate investment, and increased capacity to plan and implement actions to address barriers.

Project: Developing and embedding an NDC Capital Raising Strategy for Peru
Result_Title: MINAM adopts the key recommendations of the Capital Raising Strategy
Indicator: Int. Out 3. 'Adoption of recommendation for other action'
Description: The combination of the stakeholder network, the CRS and the capacity building will work together to cement actions stemming from the CRS to build momentum for changes that will support the broader systemic financial sector change needed to enable climate investment at scale in Peru. In particular, MINAM, as primary project beneficiary, will show clear commitments to commence implementation of practical elements of the strategy. It is anticipated this will be followed by continued action by MINAM to continue to promote actions and approaches to enable private investment, by empowering MINAM with knowledge and capacity to implement approaches and engage authoritatively with domestic partners to that end.

Project: Strengthening climate risk assessment and enabling central bank supervision in the Indian financial sector, a partnership with frontrunning banks and DFIs
Result_Title: Participating financial institutions have an increased knowledge of climate-related financial issues
Indicator: Int. Out 1. 'Enhanced action because of training'
Description: Through the training and accompanying material, the participating banks will have gained increased knowledge of financial risk. This could include beneficiaries applying the tools and techniques provided during training to look at climate-related risks in their investment and lending decisions, organising internal consultations and peer discussions on systematising climate-related financial disclosures within the institution and raising concerns with management and board about ESG risks and the implications for financial performance.

Project: Strengthening climate risk assessment and enabling central bank supervision in the Indian financial sector, a partnership with frontrunning banks and DFIs
Result_Title: RBI takes steps towards implementing the recommendations made in the options paper regarding tackling climate related risks in the financial sector
Indicator: Int. Out 2. 'Adoption of recommendation for policy/legislation'
Description: The initial steps expected from the RBI to prepare to implement the recommendations include the establishment of an internal working group to examine new supervisory and regulatory options to disclose climate-related risks, and the RBI joining of the Network of Central Banks and Supervisors for Greening the Financial System.

Project: Strengthening capabilities on climate action for investors of the Peruvian financial ecosystem, within the framework of the Green Financing Roadmap
Result_Title: Beneficiaries have the capacity needed to manage climate risks and opportunities
Indicator: Int. Out 1. 'Enhanced action because of training'
Description: The main actors of the financial and public sector of Peru will be sensitized and equipped with  capacity that will allow them to identify, manage and measure climate-related risks.
Implementor: PIR, Asociacion para la Promocion de la Inversion Responsable y Sostenible

Project: Greening Finance in Argentina to Combat Climate Change and Promote Inclusion
Result_Title: The report on climate risks and stranded assets is endorsed by the beneficiaries
Description: The beneficiaries (National government Ministry of Agriculture, Liverstock and Fisheries, state governments, Buenos Aires stock exchange, Matba Rofex Stock Excahnge, CAME and AECA and private sector banks) endorse the report and indicate that the results presented will be used to identify what climate risks could affect their activities and investments and inform public policy makers. They will also use the study as a reference to continue contributing to the knowledge of climate risks in the Agro-industry sector.
Implementor: Carbon Trust Mexico S.A. de C.V.

Project: Greening Finance in Argentina to Combat Climate Change and Promote Inclusion
Result_Title: The participating stock exchanges accept the roadmap and confirm its relevance to their planned future work
Indicator: Int. Out 3. 'Adoption of recommendation for other action'
Description: The involved Stock Exchanges will participate directly in the development of the respective roadmap and will have their feedback and inputs incorporated to support adoption. On their acceptance of the roadmap they will start planning how to implement the recommendations and actions set out. The roadmap will be used by them to start developing an enhanced and aligned enabling environment.
Implementor: Carbon Trust Mexico S.A. de C.V.

Project: Capacity building to the government of Peru to support its first sovereign green bond issuance
Result_Title: GB Framework endorsed and validated by the GB governance structure
Indicator: Int. Out 3. 'Adoption of recommendation for other action'
Description: A draft GB Framework will receive validation by the members of the governance structure. Once validated, a certified Second Party Opinion will substantiate its alignment with Peru’s NDC targets. The project team will support MEF to communicate with appropriate counterparts in ministries and government agencies to prioritise and select a longlist of potentially eligible projects. The successful operationalisation of the GB Framework will be facilitated through support to MEF and members of the GB governance structure.

Project: Promoting green finance to foster sustainable development in the North of Argentina
Result_Title: The participating financial institutions adopt the designed plan for launching a new sustainable line and/or significantly strengthening the emissions and inclusion consideration of existing ones
Indicator: Int. Out 3. 'Adoption of recommendation for other action'
Description: The project output will assist each participating financial institution in the adoption of the business plan to develop a sustainable portfolio generation. The business plan will help participating financial institutions to monitor the credit line evolution, assess the portfolio opportunity and timetable, and plan specific funding actions such as Sustainable or Green Bond emission.

Project: Promoting green finance to foster sustainable development in the North of Argentina
Result_Title: Participating financial institutions' capacity is strenghtened in relation to green, social and sustainable finance. Small rural producers' capacity for accessing credit for sustainable production activities is strenghtened
Indicator: Int. Out 3. 'Adoption of recommendation for other action'
Description: The institution management staff will have acquired knowledge on Green and Sustainable Bonds, principles and framework, regional experience, stakeholders and have a clear understanding of their institution opportunities to access these specific funding. Based on this knowledge they will start to take steps to include this in its business and strategic plans. Bridges will have been built between financial institutions and multilateral or bilateral organisations that might be interested in backing a Sustainable or Green Bond emission.

Project: Promoting green finance to foster sustainable development in the North of Argentina
Result_Title: Participating financial institutions' capacity is strenghtened in relation to green, social and sustainable finance. Small rural producers' capacity for accessing credit for sustainable production activities is strenghtened
Indicator: Int. Out 1. 'Enhanced action because of training'
Description: Participating financial institutions' capacity is strenghtened in relation to providing credit to foster production activities that constitute drivers for sustainable development, climate change mitigation and social inclusion; conducting carbon and water footprints; accessing Green, Social and Sustainable Bonds as debt instruments for sustainable development; and implementing sustainable credit lines. Small rural producers' capacity for accessing credit for sustainable production activities is strenghtened. Participants will be endowed with tools to improve information related to these matters, systematisation and transparency. Workshop topics on carbon and water footprint and REDD mechanisms will bring traditional agriculture, farming, and forestry producers to an accurate consciousness of the importance and benefits of adapting their model incorporating sustainable practices, and therefore in the following months start a transition to greener models. Small rural producers, SMEs led by women and other relevant field actors will be better equipped to access credit. Trained financial institution's officials will be capacitated to introduce new tools in their internal analysis and for each credit evaluation process to take into account the water and carbon footprint and other aspects that affect the sustainability of producers models.

Project: Expanding sustainable infrastructure network for electric vehicles in urban transportation modes
Result_Title: Metrobus adopts the model for system electrification planning to support decision making
Indicator: Int. Out 3. 'Adoption of recommendation for other action'
Description: Metrobus has a macro model for the electrification planning of the system, with short, medium and long-term scenarios and an analysis of saturation of energy distribution networks in projected charging points that allows it to make correct decisions in the electrification process of the system.

Project: Strengthening the use of Earth Observation platforms to support the implementation of climate change mitigation goals in the forest and land use sector in three states in Mexico.
Result_Title: Analysis on deforestation rates and carbon stocks in areas influenced by federal and state public agricultural policies and programmes
Description: Government at national and subnational level receive the outputs of our analysis, including the business intelligence dashboard on EO Labs, the analysis report and infographics presenting findings about the impact of government programmes and subsidies on deforestation. The results support a clear understanding of the role of public policy in deforestation and agreement that policy changes are needed.
Implementor: Ecometrica Ltd. (Ecosistemas Consultoría Integral para Soluciones sustentables)

Project: Landscape conservation and livelihood restoration in the Mexican ejidal altiplano: the case of Apan, Hidalgo.
Result_Title: Commitment of industrial consortium stakeholders and other organizations to contribute to funding the implementation of the solutions
Description: By the end of the first year, the industrialists whose activities depend on natural resources in Apan will officially commit to participate economically in the implementation of the solutions. The project will also be actively seeking additional funding for implementation from national and international organizations.
Implementor: Eetestudio  (Espacio entre tiempo estudio SA de CV)

Project: Paving the Way for Setting Ambitious GHG Emissions Reductions in the Private Sector to enhance the National Climate Change Policy
Result_Title: CNBV, SEMARNAT/PROFEPA, and the Ministry of Economy promote SBTs as a reference and/or complementary tool to their existing mechanisms and platforms
Indicator: Int. Out 1. 'Enhanced action because of training'
Description:
The 3 primary beneficiaries already have access to programs and platforms with which we could promote synergies with the SBTi. The project expects them to start integrating SBTs as a reference and/or complementary tool to their existing mechanisms as a result of the skills and knowledge developed through the 3 training workshops. Specifically, we would expect:
1) CNVB to start disseminating the SBTi as part of their engagement with financial institutions in Mexico.
2) PROFEPA to start using the delivered materials in the redesign and enhancement of their programs to track and improve industrial environmental performance.
3) Ministry of Economy to incorporate the trainings and materials into a module of their learning platforms from MiPymes. We would also expect that they could start conversations with other institutions to include SBTi as a reference for the certification of trust and integrity for companies.

Project: Paving the Way for Setting Ambitious GHG Emissions Reductions in the Private Sector to enhance the National Climate Change Policy
Result_Title: The Community of Practice catalyses increased climate action among the private sector, promoting value chain integration and new companies joining the network
Description: The project expects 3 main short-term actions depending on the level of engagement of the members of the CP: 1) Committed companies and associations boost their value chain to adopt SBTs. 2) Committed companies without approved SBTs start developing targets using the CP's materials. 3) Companies that are not yet committed to the initiative commit or start preparing to commit to the SBTi.

Project: Utility led smart electric vehicle charging for demand response and grid management in New Delhi, India
Result_Title: Utility companies have the necessary guidance to influence regulators to enable managed charging in their service areas
Indicator: Int. Out 2. 'Adoption of recommendation for policy/legislation'
Description: The utility companies will use the conceptual framework for smart charging to collectively impress upon the regulators to adopt the proposed plan/ recommendations to allow time of use/differential pricing.

Project: Assessment of the greenhouse gas mitigation potential of hydrogen. An implementation roadmap for Mexico
Result_Title: Consolidation of a green hydrogen network enhancement hub. (Mario Molina Center's website)
Description: The Mario Molina Center’s website will serve as a knowledge hub of green hydrogen for future projects and their implementation. This will be adopted by all the beneficiaries and is expected to be adopted as beneficiaries continue to be interested in green hydrogen.

Project: Integrated freight transport plan combining rail and road freight modes aiming at reducing GHG and improving logistic integration and local economic development for Mexico City
Result_Title: Authorities adopt recommendations to promote rail freight (first component) and to improve local traffic and public space around Pantaco Terminal (second component)
Indicator: Int. Out 3. 'Adoption of recommendation for other action'
Description: Authorities adopt recommendations after giving feedback, agree, and sign the roadmap to promote rail freight, while improving local traffic and use of public space around Pantaco Terminal.

Project: Integrated freight transport plan combining rail and road freight modes aiming at reducing GHG and improving logistic integration and local economic development for Mexico City
Result_Title: Authorities (SEMOVI, the Municipality of Azcapotzalco and Ferrovalle) make improvements towards freight transport and usage of public space.
Indicator: Int. Out 1. 'Enhanced action because of training'
Description: Authorities/training participants (representatives from SEMOVI, Municipality of Azcapotzalco, Ferrovalle) understand the main challenges and the set of recommendations to improve freight transport and recover public space, as a result of the skills and knowledge developed through the workshops.

Project: Accelerating development of new bioeconomy businesses and enhanced capacities for green jobs promotion and increased climate action ambition from policy implementation and integration.
Result_Title: Minciencias enhances its action to accelerate bioeconomy businesses by using the bioeconomy business accelerator mechanism that provides technical support for bioeconomy-businesses promotion until commercial stage is operational
Indicator: Int. Out 1. 'Enhanced action because of training'
Description: Enhanced Minciencia's skills to accelerate bioeconomy businesses through direct intervention on bioeconomy projects, as well as documenting and building case studies that will contain the lessons learned and best practices for future scenarios. It is expected to observe this intermediate outcome partially at the end of the implementation of this project. During the project's acceleration processes, Procolombia, Innpulsa, and Mincomercio perspectives are included in order to create synergies for the selected projects in terms of internationalization, investors roads, market engagement, and another kind of support.

Project: Scaling up rural electrification via capacity building to public and private actors
Result_Title: Increased number of high-quality rural electrification SGR projects developed by prioritized sub-national entities
Description: Sub-national entities build their internal capacity to access SGR resources. This is achieved by working closely with MME’s SGR team and prioritised subnational agencies to secure SGR funding for priority rural electrification projects via development of knowledge products and technical assistance to projects design and structuring.

Project: Scaling up rural electrification via capacity building to public and private actors
Result_Title: At least 3 bankable private-sector led off-grid projects have reached ready-to-build and financing stage
Description: Development/identification of scalable and replicable commercial rural electrification business models by working with MME to select and structure private-sector led scalable project ideas and market them to potential investors and providers of finance to secure investment commitments leading to funding and implementation.

Project: Adopting New Technology, Mindsets, and Practices to Transform Colombia’s Agricultural Sector
Result_Title: Broader and more agile uptake of CSA and ranching practices, conservation of existing forest and maintenance of agroforestry areas by farmers, supported by extensionistas and mayors
Indicator: Int. Out 1. 'Enhanced action because of training'
Description: Enhanced action directly related to the skills and knowledge developed through training. As a result of the skills and knowledge developed in CSA, carbon monitoring and behaviour change through the trainings undertaken, there will be broader and more agile uptake of CSA and ranching practices, conservation of existing forest and maintenance of agroforestry areas for cacao and citruses on approximately 300 hectares by 40 extensionistas, 250 farmers, and 5 mayors while the 2,000 farmers supported through mobile phone-based services actively use the service to adopt CSA practices.

Project: Hutanomics: Developing frameworks to enable private sector investments into nature-based climate solutions in Terengganu, Malaysia
Result_Title: State government adopts the recommendations to develop NBS climate projects, including development of policy specific to NBS climate projects
Indicator: Int. Out 2. 'Adoption of recommendation for policy/legislation'
Description: The roadmap document will provide a framework for the state government to pursue the development of NBS project in state, which will potentially include (based on output 1 and 4.1), recommendations to develop policy specific to NBS climate projects, project types (based on input from Federal government and private sector) and how projects can comply with the National REDD+ strategy that is still in development. The state government would adopt the recommendations to develop NBS projects.

Project: Hutanomics: Developing frameworks to enable private sector investments into nature-based climate solutions in Terengganu, Malaysia
Result_Title: Project outputs are adopted by state government and private sector to develop pilot NBS climate project.
Description: Partnerships or collaboration between private sector and state government would mature into direct participation or partnerships towards the implementation of an NBS projects in Terenggannu (Agreement or Joint ventures towards NBS climate projects).

Project: Sabah Renewable Energy Rural Electrification Road Map
Result_Title: Public officials adopt the method and knowledge from the training to develop the 'Rural Electrification with Renewables' Road Map.
Indicator: Int. Out 1. 'Enhanced action because of training'
Description: The public officials receiving training use their skills/knowledge from training as the basis to contribute towards, understand, critique and socialise the 'Rural Electrification with Renewables' Road Map. In addition, community mini-grid operators and field researchers/activists use their training to hone local demand, understanding and documentation of renewable energy alternatives.

Project: MYEcoPlan – Developing a Low Carbon City Planning System for PLANMalaysia
Result_Title: PLANMalaysia, IRDA & MBIP adopt MYEcoPlan system in national land use planning
Indicator: Int. Out 1. 'Enhanced action because of training'
Description: The town planners of PLANMalaysia, IRDA & MBIP understand the basis of the low carbon initiative calculation framework and apply it into the system. They are able to customise the low carbon initiative calculation framework based on their need during the implementation phase.

Project: MYEcoPlan – Developing a Low Carbon City Planning System for PLANMalaysia
Result_Title: Adoption of MYEcoPlan System by PLAN Malaysia, Iskandar Puteri City Council (MBIP), and Iskandar Regional Development Authority (IRDA)
Indicator: Int. Out 3. 'Adoption of recommendation for other action'
Description: MyEcoPlan system will act as a tool in helping to address climate change issues at a local level. This system will be used by PLANMalaysia adopted by the Federal Government, regional development authorities, state governments and local councils to support low carbon cities transition projects through the information obtained from this system.

Project: Green Finance for the development of Smart Cities in Mexico II, working to accelerate the implementation of low carbon local projects and sustainable development
Result_Title: Adoption of disseminated communications & knowledge products (guidelines, recommendations, and tools for the design of projects)
Description: Disseminated communications and knowledge products (guidelines, recommendations, and tools for the design of projects) are adopted by cities and financial institutions and shared with other actors to promote local low carbon actions, through lessons learning and actual experiences.

Project: Strengthening the Legislative-Executive-Stakeholder dialogue on Mexico's climate change and energy goals at the national and subnational levels
Result_Title: Adoption of the reform proposals to update  the Climate Change Laws in 5 states (Mexico City, Jalisco, Guanajuato, Quintana Roo and Puebla) and adoption of 1 Climate Change Law Proposal in 1 state (Yucatán)
Indicator: Int. Out 2. 'Adoption of recommendation for policy/legislation'
Description: It is expected that the updated law proposals be presented for discussion to the Congress in the short-term after the outputs are delivered and that they be adopted as result of the enhanced skills of legislators and partnerships/networks created/strengthened.

Project: Green Economy Policy for Sarawak
Result_Title: Adoption of strategies to develop a Carbon Trading framework for Sarawak
Indicator: Int. Out 2. 'Adoption of recommendation for policy/legislation'
Description: The carbon trading framework is approved by a Steering Committee chaired by the Sarawak State Secretary, and it's used as the strategy to develop carbon trading framework for Sarawak.

Project: Green Economy Policy for Sarawak
Result_Title: Key government stakeholders are aware and able to communicate the Green Economy Policy to their stakeholders
Description: Key stakeholders from the Economic Planning Unit (EPU) and Ministry of Urban Development and Natural Resources of the Sarawak Government adopted the communication products on Green Economy Policy and Carbon Trading, and this will be used as materials to be disseminated in their website and potential public event upon the formal adoption of the policy.

Project: Sabah Renewable Energy Rural Electrification Road Map
Result_Title: Framework to develop renewable mini grids are adopted by the Government of Sabah
Indicator: Int. Out 2. 'Adoption of recommendation for policy/legislation'
Description: The commitment to develop renewable mini grid projects leads to its inclusion in the state planning and policies.

Project: Sabah Renewable Energy Rural Electrification Road Map
Result_Title: Adoption of rural electrification with renewables
Indicator: Int. Out 3. 'Adoption of recommendation for other action'
Description: "Rural Electrification with Renewable” Road Map is adopted by stakeholders and the  Government of Sabah.

Project: Sabah Renewable Energy Rural Electrification Road Map
Result_Title: Committed financial support to fund renewable energy activities
Description: Planners and implementers are able to use the information in the funding map to generate sufficient financial confidence to commit to launching their renewable energy activities.

Project: Hutanomics: Developing frameworks to enable private sector investments into nature-based climate solutions in Terengganu, Malaysia
Result_Title: Coordination and utilization of training results and knowledge products for NBS climate projects.
Indicator: Int. Out 1. 'Enhanced action because of training'
Description: Members of the Green Financing Task Force receiving the training can use the project outputs (Output 2.1 recommendations & 3.1 knowledge products) to develop the NBS climate projects. This will involve the coordination between Green Financing Task Force and the state EXCO during the decision making in approving NBS climate projects.

Project: Hutanomics: Developing frameworks to enable private sector investments into nature-based climate solutions in Terengganu, Malaysia
Result_Title: State government, through the Green Financing Task Force, to adopt the output from GHG emission scenarios, feasibility assessments, business case and proposed structures.
Description: The GHG scenarios, business case, feasibility assessments and recommendations are adopted by the Green Financing Task Force and is used for NBS project development and implementation. The task force would use these outputs to inform/advice the state government & decision makers on NBS projects - this includes approving the business case/financial structure, legal framework and land classification that will lead to the development of NBS projects.

Project: Expanding sustainable infrastructure network for electric vehicles in urban transportation modes
Result_Title: Government and CFE-PAESE stakeholders identify potential business models for implementation
Description: Possible business models are identified for progress in the electrification process of the Metrobús system.

Project: Technical assistance for the implementation of emergent design for active mobility and public space
Result_Title: Local governments will adopt the recommendations to improve the local Climate Change Policies ensuring adequate mobility alterantives and public space investment
Indicator: Int. Out 2. 'Adoption of recommendation for policy/legislation'
Description: 15 local governments will make improvements to their legal framework over the short-term.

Project: Business case development for Sector Job Resilience Planning in support of Just Transition in South Africa (Mpumalanga)
Result_Title: Biomass business plan development and SMME evaluation
Description: With regards to further business support beyond the feasibility study, it is estimated that 500k-2mil depending on the level of business support needed. With regards to infrastructure and equipment support these amounts can vary quite widely. It is probably too early to say at this stage as the project will have to conduct the feasibility study to see which businesses applicable to the region. As an estimate, based on previous studies, diesel generators cost between 500k and 1mil whereas gasifiers range between 10-35mil. These costs must be considered as the user of the biomass will need to invest this money and recoup costs based on potential savings from the use of biomass. But the suppliers of the biomass may have much lower costs and needs to formulate their business.

Project: City of Johannesburg Electric Vehicle Readiness Support
Result_Title: Feasibility study for the rollout of City-owned EV charging stations powered by renewable energy
Description: CoJ accepts the findings from the feasibility study and begin identifying optimal EV charging stations and develops plans to install city-owned infrastructure.

Project: The development of a Green Economy Cluster organisation to support Mpumalanga's role in the validation, implementation and follow-on research of the South African Renewable Energy Industry Masterplan (SAREM)
Result_Title: South African Renewable Energy Master Plan Action Policy Recommendations presented
Indicator: Int. Out 2. 'Adoption of recommendation for policy/legislation'
Description: The acceptance of the policy recommendations that aim to steer the government to act on the levers listed in SAREM that will achieve the greatest climate action results. SAREM will highlight several paths with a very strong focus on job creation and economic development that optimizes for climate change as well as economic goals.

Project: The development of a Green Economy Cluster organisation to support Mpumalanga's role in the validation, implementation and follow-on research of the South African Renewable Energy Industry Masterplan (SAREM)
Result_Title: South African Renewable Energy Master Plan Action Validation presented
Description: The acceptance and validation of  focus areas and action items for government and the private sector within the South African Renewable Energy Master Plan (SAREM). This is an important step in ensuring that the SAREM and it's recommended actions are pragmatic, sensible and will lead to the  desired outcomes

Project: STRAPSA - Shifting the transport  paradigm  for South Africa
Result_Title: Stakeholders make improvements towards better climate change integration
Description: Communication products (press releases, presentations, leaflets for: guidelines and standards for electric road transport and charging; infrastructure green procurement guidelines and standards to promote electric vehicle fleets) have been accepted and/or taken into consideration by training participants (decision-makers) within: National Government (Department of Transport; Department of Trade, Industry and Competition; Department of Environment, Forestry and Fisheries; Department of Mineral Resources and Energy; National Treasury); Provincial Government (Western Cape Government) and State-Owned Enterprise (Eskom).

Project: Expanding the South African Green Finance Taxonomy and embedding its use
Result_Title: 6 case studies for each user group
Description: Case studies for each user group (policy makers & government agencies, financial market participants, and asset owners) and basic sector guidance for each user group with recommendations for broader adoption (6 in total) are adopted and taken into consideration by stakeholders, assisting them when using the taxonomy tools

Project: Mexico Secondments: Enhancement of the Mexico City Public Environmental Fund (FAP)
Result_Title: Adoption of FAP communication strategy addressed to financial stakeholders
Description: Adoption and implementation of the communication strategy to present the strengths and opportunities from the FAP to potential investors and allies, thus fostering collaboration and financial access.

Project: Mexico Secondments: Enhancement of the Mexico City Public Environmental Fund (FAP)
Result_Title: Increase in the number of projects being agreed to be financed by FAP funds
Description: Thanks to the finance framework, networks being strengthened, and recommendations on the procedures for the FAP funds, an increased amount of projects will be able to access these funds. Projects will be financed by donations and grants received by the FAP from international organisations, and current programmes will continue to be implemented using credits issued by the FAP, such as credits for electric vehicles and the installation of rain water capture systems in the central area of Mexico City.

Project: Mexico Secondments: Enhancement of the Mexico City Public Environmental Fund (FAP)
Result_Title: Recommendations adopted regarding procedure manuals of the Public Environmental Fund, and FAP rules and operations
Indicator: Int. Out 2. 'Adoption of recommendation for policy/legislation'
Description: Adoption of recommendations and initiatives allowing the FAP to access new financial mechanisms to increase the size of the fund and the pipeline of projects. This includes the adoption of the general procedures manual, the risk management plan, the project assessment methodology, and the credit framework.

Project: Urban Road Map to improve urban logistics in Mexico City
Result_Title: Authorities (SEMOVI, the Municipality of Azcapotzalco, Ferrovalle) make improvements towards freight transport and usage of public space.
Indicator: Int. Out 1. 'Enhanced action because of training'
Description: Authorities/training participants (representatives from SEMOVI, Municipality of Azcapotzalco, Ferrovalle) understand the main challenges and the set of recommendations to improve freight transport and recover public space, as a result of the skills and knowledge developed through the workshops.

Project: Urban Road Map to improve urban logistics in Mexico City
Result_Title: Authorities adopt recommendations to promote rail freight (first component) and to improve local traffic and public space around Pantaco Terminal (second component)
Indicator: Int. Out 3. 'Adoption of recommendation for other action'
Description: Authorities adopt recommendations after giving feedback, agree, and sign the roadmap to promote rail freight, while improving local traffic and use of public space around Pantaco Terminal.

Project: Green Finance for the development of Smart Cities in Mexico II, working to accelerate the implementation of low carbon local projects and sustainable development
Result_Title: Potential investors show interest on financing and funding feasible projects after adoption of recommendations resulted from analyses
Description: 7 cities gain access to green finance from potential investors due to the implementation of recommendations and skills acquired from the executive document. (Relevant documents: analysis, review, recommendations)

Project: Strengthening the Legislative-Executive-Stakeholder dialogue on Mexico's climate change and energy goals at the national and subnational levels
Result_Title: Legislators have enhanced skills on climate change awareness (6 states: Mexico City, Jalisco, Guanajuato, Yucatán, Quintana Roo, Puebla)
Indicator: Int. Out 1. 'Enhanced action because of training'
Description: Legislators have enhanced skills on climate change awareness, resulted from the project trainings that contribute to climate legislation (6 states: Mexico City, Jalisco, Guanajuato, Yucatán, Quintana Roo, Puebla)

Project: Assessment of the greenhouse gas mitigation potential of hydrogen. An implementation roadmap for Mexico
Result_Title: Dissemination of existing technologies related to green hydrogen and greenhouse gas mitigation for Mexico
Description: Information and insights (knowledge products) on the existing work on green hydrogen and the actors involved in green hydrogen projects will be disseminated for further adoption of actions.
