Project: Assessment of the greenhouse gas mitigation potential of hydrogen. An implementation roadmap for Mexico
Result_Title: INEEC adopts roadmap designed for potential green hydrogen projects implementation resulting from assessment report
Indicator: Int. Out 2. 'Adoption of recommendation for policy/legislation'
Description: Adoption of a roadmap (recommendations) resulted from an Assessment Report by the beneficiary (INECC) on: 1. State of the art technologies for green hydrogen production and use in the energy and industry, 2. Potential hydrogen projects in Mexico, their costs, and greenhouse gas mitigation, 3. Transition towards a green hydrogen economy.

Project: Strengthening the use of Earth Observation platforms to support the implementation of climate change mitigation goals in the forest and land use sector in three states in Mexico.
Result_Title: The working group adopts mechanisms and tools to monitor and implement mitigation actions and tackle deforestation issues
Description: Federal government agencies and state level agencies conform a work group responsible for monitoring deforestation to implement coherent, joined up actions and policies across state and federal level. There is improved coordination between relevant actors.
Implementor: Ecometrica Ltd. (Ecosistemas Consultoría Integral para Soluciones sustentables)

Project: Strengthening the use of Earth Observation platforms to support the implementation of climate change mitigation goals in the forest and land use sector in three states in Mexico.
Result_Title: Enhanced actions for deforestation alerts are adopted by relevant agencies and appropriate institutions (e.g. CONAFOR or state level government) resulting from the trainings
Indicator: Int. Out 1. 'Enhanced action because of training'
Description: The relevant agencies to act on deforestation are identified and trained, and able to identify and act on deforestation alert reports at a minimum of quarterly intervals.
Implementor: Ecometrica Ltd. (Ecosistemas Consultoría Integral para Soluciones sustentables)

Project: Expanding sustainable infrastructure network for electric vehicles in urban transportation modes
Result_Title: Adoption of learning tools (knowledge products) resulted from the evaluation and incorporated into the CFE-PAESE strategy
Description: The learning and experiences of CFE-PAESE are consolidated, evaluated and adopted as tools to define a strategy that enhances the impact of the program.

Project: Expanding sustainable infrastructure network for electric vehicles in urban transportation modes
Result_Title: Enhanced business capacities and knowledge in CFE representatives
Indicator: Int. Out 1. 'Enhanced action because of training'
Description: Enhanced business capacities and knowledge in CFE representatives due to knowledge transfer workshops.

Project: Technical assistance for developing sustainable energy access strategies in Mexico
Result_Title: Investors fund the implementation of energy access strategies resulting from the Energy Access Program
Description: Investors provide funding for energy access programs in Puebla, Veracruz and Yucatán, following the handbook for implementation of energy access strategies.
Implementor: Ilumexico (Eres Energía Renovable SAPI de CV)

Project: Proposal of reform to the public policy and legal framework of territorial planning in Colombia in order to comply with the Paris Agreement
Result_Title: Adoption of policy recommendations to update regulatory frameworks and climate change objectives integrated in the regional and national planning instruments to comply with Paris Agreements
Indicator: Int. Out 2. 'Adoption of recommendation for policy/legislation'
Description: Regulatory update and simplification of existing frameworks, including the adoption of policies, national decrees, local decrees, and bills presented to Congress. Objectives of emissions reduction, adaptation and mitigation of climate change are integrated in the POT, regional planning instruments that coordinate urban growth, and protection policies for reserve areas within the local and national planning instruments.

Project: Accelerating Green Finance Flows Through the Strengthening of the Mexican National Banking and Securities Commission (CNBV)
Result_Title: CNBV Social Communication Directorate (network) adopts communication products developed to strenghthen coordination within actors.
Description: This intermediate outcome is expected to result in climate-related networks' adoption of joint activities related to emissions reductions, including increased capacity to coordinate with other actors, present and systematise Mexico’s progress in national and international events and capacity to adopt and adapt good practices from other countries.

Project: Scaling up rural electrification via capacity building to public and private actors
Result_Title: Adoption of recommendations for the IPSE's Sustainable Rural Energization Plan (PERS) in a priority region
Indicator: Int. Out 2. 'Adoption of recommendation for policy/legislation'
Description: The technical and socioeconomic analysis required for the development of one rural electrification project is used to develop the project. The collection and analysis of primary and secondary data to develop rural electrification business models and deploy solutions aligned with the repayment capacity, willingness to pay, energy needs, and uses of targeted communities ensure strong ownership, appropriate maintenance, and equitable benefits of the installed solutions.

Project: Steering the Colombian Road Freight Sector Towards a Zero Emissions Strategy GIRO-ZERO
Result_Title: Enhanced capacities and knowledge of stakeholders on gap analysis and agenda setting
Indicator: Int. Out 1. 'Enhanced action because of training'
Description: Key stakeholders of the road freight sector have enhanced capacities to understand current gaps on the RFT and to define future agendas on green logistics strategies in the RFT.

Project: Deforestation-free Cocoa for the Amazon Piedmont
Result_Title: Key actors within the cocoa value chain have enhanced capacities to implement deforestation-free agroforestry and climate smart business models.
Indicator: Int. Out 1. 'Enhanced action because of training'
Description: Through the participation in the capacity building programme and training workshops, key actors of cocoa value chain, including producers and local authorities, have enhanced capacities to implement deforestation-free and climate smart business models the Amazon Piedmont. This includes developed skills for accessing environmental/conservation financing instruments and incentives.

Project: Supporting the roll-out of smart grid technologies in Colombia Phase 2: Moving forward to implementation
Result_Title: Selected energy consumers use the Technical and Commercial Analysis for the implementation of smart technologies assessment as a key input to make decisions on implementing smart technologies within their sites
Indicator: Int. Out 3. 'Adoption of recommendation for other action'
Description:
Technical and Commercial Analysis for the Implementation of Smart Technologies assessment report is used by members of the energy clusters to implement at least 1 project per region.
This intermediate outcome will be demonstrated as follows:
The cases that are considered feasible move forward as pilots in the selected sites.

Project: Supporting the roll-out of smart grid technologies in Colombia Phase 2: Moving forward to implementation
Result_Title: The Identification of Barriers to Investing in Smart Technologies report is used by the GoC to address barriers for participation in flexibility mechanism and deployment of smart technologies
Indicator: Int. Out 2. 'Adoption of recommendation for policy/legislation'
Description:
Implementation of at least 50% of recommendations from the Identification of Barriers to Investing in Smart Technologies report.
This intermediate outcome will be demonstrated as follows:
Identification of Barriers to Investing in Smart Technologies report used by UPME and MINEM to address barriers associated with user behaviour and participation of end users in flexibility mechanism.

Project: Expanding the Colombian Climate Asset Disclosure Initiative (CCADI)
Result_Title: The institutional investors and real sector companies in Colombia adopt TCFD recommendations to align their business strategies to mitigation and adaptation objectives
Indicator: Int. Out 3. 'Adoption of recommendation for other action'
Description: The institutional investors and real sector companies in Colombia implement TCFD recommendations to align their business strategies to mitigation and adaptation objectives.

Project: Technical assistance for the implementation of emergent design for active mobility and public space
Result_Title: Local governments adopt communication products to enhance active mobility and public space.
Description: 15 communication strategies will be obtained in accordance with the Guide to communicate the emergent strategies for active mobility and public space projects.

Project: Scaling up rural electrification via capacity building to public and private actors
Result_Title: Subnational entities have adopted knowledge and communication products to plan, design, and structure renewable energy rural electrification projects and develop high-quality proposals to public funds and programs
Description: Sub-national entities have raised awareness on best practices on rural electrification and have adopted knowledge to build capacity to design and structure rural renewable energy projects and develop high-quality funding proposals to the SGR system and public energy funds. This is expected to be achieved through the online training modules targeting subnational entities’ capacity gaps to develop rural electrification projects and access funding from the SGR system and Colombia’s public energy funds, including FENOGE, FAZNI, and FAER. The training is made available to all interested parties via MME’s and IPSE’s websites and is included into the training and career development plans of subnational entities’ staff involved in rural electrification planning.

Project: Scaling up rural electrification via capacity building to public and private actors
Result_Title: Established working groups are managed by IPSE and continue to share lessons learned and best practices in rural electrification planning
Description: The working group established generates a space to facilitate the sharing of best practices and lessons learned among subnational entities. Opportunities to share knowledge and build on each other experience are created. The groups are continued to be managed by IPSE after the project completion.

Project: Adopting New Technology, Mindsets, and Practices to Transform Colombia’s Agricultural Sector
Result_Title: Local authorities adopt the recommendations presented to inform the PDEA and PRICCO
Indicator: Int. Out 2. 'Adoption of recommendation for policy/legislation'
Description: The Secretary of Agriculture and the Secretary of Environment and Cormacarena adopt the recommendations on integration of sustainable agricultural practices and natural resource management at a landscape-level to be included in the Departmental Plan for Agricultural Extension (PDEA) and the Regional Plan for Climate Change for Orinoquia (PRICCO).

Project: Expanding the Colombian Climate Asset Disclosure Initiative (CCADI)
Result_Title: Project beneficiaries bridge gaps in climate awareness, data, transparency, and action by strengthening their expertise and capacities
Indicator: Int. Out 1. 'Enhanced action because of training'
Description: Project beneficiaries bridged gaps in climate awareness, data, transparency, and action by strengthening their expertise and capacities through tools, recommendations, communication products and raising awareness activities to better monitor, assess, and quantify climate risks.

Project: Preparing the Road to Zero-emission Urban Mobility in Colombian Cities: Accelerating Electric Bus Adoption
Result_Title: Three target cities plan for charging infrastructure, risks, and mitigation efforts associated with procuring electric buses, and viable financing options for scaling electric bus procurement
Indicator: Int. Out 2. 'Adoption of recommendation for policy/legislation'
Description:
Three target cities identify when and where buses should charge and drive to optimize usage and minimize charging downtime in depots. Evaluate the services defined in the Colombian regulation related to energy storage, sale of energy, and frequency and voltage control service. These three cities identify with city officials the largest risks associated with bus electrification and outline actions for mitigation. Emphasis on the impact of the electrification of transportation in marginalized communities. Evaluation of the 
operational and capital costs associated with different bus technologies and provide (1) The impact on fare structure, and (2) Costs associated with several financing options through different investment models, including the participation of utility companies and financial institutions.

Project: Supporting livelihoods through Ecotourism Routes for Forest and Peace.
Result_Title: Communities contact potential investors or access financial schemes described in the practical finmancial guide to develop or improve tourism businesses
Description: Communities are connected to possible investors, donors, and/or apply to funds and microlending schemes, to develop basic improvements to accommodate tourists in home stays, as well as to improve other businesses in the tourism value chain (e.g., food and beverage facilities, better transportation options).

Project: Proposal of reform to the public policy and legal framework of territorial planning in Colombia in order to comply with the Paris Agreement
Result_Title: Enhanced actions through training workshops related to implementation of instruments for a local planning institutional framework
Indicator: Int. Out 1. 'Enhanced action because of training'
Description: Participating national and local authorities gain knowledge on instruments to respond to the challenges of climate change, emission reductions, and sustainable urban development, as well as understanding the current institutional arrangement of Colombian land-use and environmental planning.

Project: Accelerating development of new bioeconomy businesses and enhanced capacities for green jobs promotion and increased climate action ambition from policy implementation and integration.
Result_Title: Three inclusive and low-carbon bioeconomy businesses accelerated
Description: 3 inclusive and low-carbon bioeconomy businesses reach commercial viability and secure resources from the potential investors identified to be financed and developed.

Project: Accelerating development of new bioeconomy businesses and enhanced capacities for green jobs promotion and increased climate action ambition from policy implementation and integration.
Result_Title: SENA networks include low-carbon labour force development knowledge and practices
Description: Environmental, Biotechnology, and Electric SENA networks enhance sectoral knowledge in accordance to industry needs. Networks ensure that the latest sectoral knowledge is shared, the latest generation of technology is integrated into training and research, and the needs of the labour market are met thereby increasing Colombia's sectoral competitiveness and productivity.

Project: Paving the Way for Setting Ambitious GHG Emissions Reductions in the Private Sector to enhance the National Climate Change Policy
Result_Title: Mexican companies adopt the recommended models for Science Based Targets
Indicator: Int. Out 3. 'Adoption of recommendation for other action'
Description: Mexican companies adopt the recommended Science Based Targets models adjusted to their specific goals.

Project: Paving the Way for Setting Ambitious GHG Emissions Reductions in the Private Sector to enhance the National Climate Change Policy
Result_Title: The communication products are adopted (learning platform, published report, and lessons learned) by stakeholders including government institutions and private sector, as guidance on corporate participation for national climate actions towards SBTs
Description: The communications products disseminated (learning platform, report, and lessons learned) are used as guidance by project's beneficiaries to promote a better understanding of what is required to accelerate climate actions through private and public sector cooperation towards SBT's.

Project: Improve and replicate local capacity building processes linked to value chains and networks in the Agriculture, Forest and other Land Use Sector in six jurisdictions of the GCF Task Force Mexico
Result_Title: Producers from 6 states improve their productive & technical strategies, as well as financial and governance skills, through the capacity building trainings conducted, contributing to the local economy and biocultural preservation of forests
Indicator: Int. Out 1. 'Enhanced action because of training'
Description: The training models designed and implemented to community stakeholders from 6 states,(Jalisco, Chiapas, Tabasco, Quinta Roo, Yucatán and Campeche) with the support of local governments improve local productivity skills with a sustainability approach to promote productive reconversion, forest conservation, and the integration of biodiversity through preventing deforestation.

Project: Improve and replicate local capacity building processes linked to value chains and networks in the Agriculture, Forest and other Land Use Sector in six jurisdictions of the GCF Task Force Mexico
Result_Title: Adoption of the proposal of the First Version of Apicultural Law in Quintana Roo
Indicator: Int. Out 2. 'Adoption of recommendation for policy/legislation'
Description: A first version of a proposal to update the apicultural law is adopted by the Local Government of Quintana Roo in line with environmental and protection of beekeeping policies, given the risks of the expansion of the agricultural and livestock frontiers.

Project: Improve and replicate local capacity building processes linked to value chains and networks in the Agriculture, Forest and other Land Use Sector in six jurisdictions of the GCF Task Force Mexico
Result_Title: Adoption of recommended participatory roadmaps for 6 states as planning tools for governments and for producers.
Indicator: Int. Out 3. 'Adoption of recommendation for other action'
Description: The participatory roadmaps that identify responsibilities, specific roles, and sources of funding are adopted by 6 states (Jalisco, Chiapas, Tabasco, Quinta Roo, Yucatán and Campeche) to promote local economic development and improvement of business models.

Project: Landscape conservation and livelihood restoration in the Mexican ejidal altiplano: the case of Apan, Hidalgo.
Result_Title: Establishment of a network of stakeholders (state & municipal government, local industry, and communities) through which new knowledge will be generated and disseminated and contribute to climate change mitigation actions
Description: Establishment of a network that contributes to the engagement and commitment of relevant stakeholders to act economically, politically and socially supporting climate mitigation actions in Apan over the long-term.
Implementor: Eetestudio  (Espacio entre tiempo estudio SA de CV)

Project: Accelerating Green Finance Flows Through the Strengthening of the Mexican National Banking and Securities Commission (CNBV)
Result_Title: Enhanced skills and knowledge on regulation for financial intermediares developed through trainings and shared best practices with the CNBV collaboration
Indicator: Int. Out 1. 'Enhanced action because of training'
Description: Enhanced skills and knowledge on ESG Standards and Climate Risk developed through training. Analysing and systematising  best practices on ESG integration and disclosure, climate-related risk, and financial inclusion will provide relevant information to decision makers within the CNBV toward developing, issuing, and supervising new regulatory changes. This will encourage financial intermediaries to incorporate ESG standards and climate-related risks in their operations and decision making processes. Policy briefs will provide further insights and guidance on how to integrate and disseminate ESG in the financial sector. Training webinars and modules, supported by implementing a strong communication campaign, will increase capacities and skills and raise awareness of ESG and climate-related risk among CNBV staff so that they can internalise new knowledge and skills in their daily work.

Project: Technical assistance for the implementation of emergent design for active mobility and public space
Result_Title: Enhanced actions to improve the planning, implementation, operation, and evaluation of an emergent infrastructure in local governments for active mobility or public space, due to lessons learned from trainings
Indicator: Int. Out 1. 'Enhanced action because of training'
Description: 15 local governments will improve their coordination processes between the different government levels and inside the local government with the involved areas during the project.

Project: Technical assistance for the implementation of emergent design for active mobility and public space
Result_Title: Local governments allocate funds for active mobility and public space projects
Description: 15 local governments allocate funds for projects in emergent strategies for active mobility and public spaces.

Project: Accelerating Fleet-wide electrification of public transport in Mexico City
Result_Title: Enhanced evaluation methods for identifying electromobility projects by Metrobus.
Indicator: Int. Out 1. 'Enhanced action because of training'
Description: Metrobus strengthens its evaluation methods for electromobility projects (both technically and financially), as well as for the definition of regulatory structures.

Project: China Skill Share: Training to enhance understanding of domestic and global green finance development and Shenzhen's newly-issued Green Finance Regulation (CN-001a-R)
Result_Title: Adoption by Shenzhen government and financial institutions of the knowledge and skills developed through training activities on green finance development and regulations (TCFD) (CN-001a-R)
Indicator: Int. Out 1. 'Enhanced action because of training'
Description: Capacity building training programmes will aid Shenzhen’s financial institutions and government with the successful and mandatory implementation of TCFD recommendations. Training will help them to report increased individual and organisational capability to implement their TCFD disclosure aims in line with their ambitious timeframes (from March 2021).

Project: Skill share: Colombia Climate Physical Risks and Financial Stability (COL-001a-R)
Result_Title: Adoption by the Banco de la Republica and Superintendencia Financiera of the knowledge and skills developed throughout the capacity building training activities on the impact of physical climate risks (COL-001a-R)
Indicator: Int. Out 1. 'Enhanced action because of training'
Description: Increased capacity of Banco de Republica and Superintendencia Financiera on the impact of climate related risks on the economy and on financial stability. Embedded ways identified to improve and better quantify and assess the impact of climate related risks on the economy and on financial stability.

Project: Skill share: Colombia Climate Physical Risks and Financial Stability (COL-001a-R)
Result_Title: Adoption by the Banco de la Republica and Superintendencia Financiera of the recommended scenarios for top-down climate stress testing (COL-001a-R)
Indicator: Int. Out 3. 'Adoption of recommendation for other action'
Description: The Banco de la Republica and Superintendencia Financiera will adopt the proposed scenarios for performing top-down climate stress tests. This will enable them to assess the impact of physical risks associated with climate change in the Colombian financial system. The ultimate evidence of sustainability will be an ability to run informed stress testing, which will support future working.

Project: Skill share: Colombia Climate Physical Risks and Financial Stability (COL-001a-R)
Result_Title: Adoption by the Banco de la Republica and Superintendencia Financiera of the top-down stress testing methodology to map the effects of climate change physical risks (COL-001a-R)
Description: The Banco de la Republica and Superintendencia will adopt the top-down stress testing methodology which maps the effects of the materialisation of climate change physical risks to the Colombian financial system and refine it according to their needs.

Project: Colombia Skill Share: Develop improved technical capabilities for the MoMe, CREG, UPME and FENOGE in Advanced Metering Infrastructure deployment (COL-003a-R)
Result_Title: Colombia’s MoMe, CREG, UPME and FENOGE adopt the knowledge and skills to feed into the development of Advanced Metering Infrastructure (AMI) policies and regulations (COL-003a-R)
Indicator: Int. Out 1. 'Enhanced action because of training'
Description: Key decision makers at the Ministry of Mines and Energy (MoMe), Energy and Gas Regulation Commission (CREG), Mining and Energy Planning Unit (UPME) and Non-Conventional Energies and Energy Efficiency Fund (FENOGE) have developed the relevant technical expertise in AMI to foster increased action with relevant energy companies and local public bodies. They will be able to apply their new knowledge in the development of policies and regulations relating to AMI deployment.

Project: Colombia Skill Share: Develop improved technical capabilities for the Ministry of Mines and Energy and Barranquilla’s mayor office in Offshore wind project deployment (COL-004a-R)
Result_Title: Colombia's MoMe and Barranquilla’s Mayor’s Office adopt the knowledge and skills to feed into the development of policies for offshore wind projects (COL-004a-R)
Indicator: Int. Out 1. 'Enhanced action because of training'
Description: Key decision makers at the Ministry of Mines and Energy (MoMe) and Barranquilla’s mayor office have developed the relevant technical expertise and will be able to apply their new knowledge in the development of policies, governance, auctions, and social and environmental analysis of offshore wind projects.

Project: South Africa Skill share: Hydrogen Society Roadmap (ZA-001a-R)
Result_Title: Adoption by DSI of the knowledge and skills developed throughout the ToC and MEL training activities (ZA-001a-R)
Indicator: Int. Out 1. 'Enhanced action because of training'
Description: Increased capacity of the DSI and its state and non-state partners on M&E and the importance of the MEL framework for the Hydrogen Society Roadmap. Improved MEL capacity will improve implementation of the Hydrogen Society Roadmap and the delivery of the associated economic, social (including GESI), environmental and climate outcomes.

Project: South Africa Skill share: Hydrogen Society Roadmap (ZA-001a-R)
Result_Title: Adoption by DSI of the Theory of Change (ToC) and Monitoring, Evaluation and Learning (MEL) framework for the Hydrogen Society Roadmap (ZA-001a-R)
Description: Together with the increased capacity on M&E, the DSI and its state and non-state partners will adopt the proposed ToC and MEL framework proposed and refine it according to their needs.

Project: Thailand Skill Share: Workshop to support Thailand to develop and adopt a cross-cutting policy for the promotion of electric vehicles on Thai roads (TH-001a-R)
Result_Title: Recommendations adopted by Thailand's Ministry of Energy in formulating their EV policy (TH-001a-R)
Indicator: Int. Out 2. 'Adoption of recommendation for policy/legislation'
Description:
Increased capacity/capability of the National Electric Vehicles Policy Committee (NEVPC) on Electric Vehicle (EV) policy. Knowledge and skills developed throughout the EV policy workshop have been embedded, incorporating UK best practice, with an understanding of EV policy and commitment, policy formulation, the implications for CO2 emissions from transport, and policies and tax-based incentives to promote the adoption of EVs. 

The EV policy workshop will help NEVPC to realise their ambitions to commit to a specific EV target for the country, adopt proposed policy recommendations based on learnings from UK best practice, and create an EV policy for Thailand.

Project: Colombia Skill Share: Strategy for low traffic neighbourhoods and cities transitioning to proximity urbanism (COL-005a-R)
Result_Title: Adoption of the Barrios Vitales M&E tool, strategy and implementation plan will enable Colombia’s Secretariat of Mobility of Bogotá (SDM) to set up low traffic neighbourhoods, creating a compact and sustainable city  (COL-005a-R)
Indicator: Int. Out 2. 'Adoption of recommendation for policy/legislation'
Description: The Secretariat of Mobility of Bogotá (SDM) will be able to address the main critical issues faced by Bogotá which is trying to adopt proximity urbanism strategies. This will be achieved through the adoption of their low traffic neighbourhoods (Barrios Vitales) implementation plan and strategy, by addressing negative mobility behaviours. As part of the strategy, the adoption of the proposed M&E indicators will ensure that the impacts and implementation of progressive and tactical actions on mobility, public space and urban revitalisation are tracked and measured - creating a compact and sustainable city. This will set an important precedent and experience for future projects.

The recommendations will also help officials in Nigeria's Ministry for Environment to plan for the implementation of the Bill to ensure that it is impactful.

Project: Mainstreaming Climate Risk Assessment in Credit Operations of Brazilian Development Banks
Result_Title: Development of a preliminary understanding of the exposure to climate change of the lending portfolios of the participating development banks
Indicator: Int. Out 3. 'Adoption of recommendation for other action'
Description: The participating DBs (BNDES and BDMG) will be familiar with climate risk evaluation process and it is expected they will raise the processes gaps (e.g. data quality) and start to engage other departments in order to start planning on how to communicate climate risk analysis results and integrate them into their credit operations processes. In the credit process level, these initial steps towards integration of climate risk analysis include the use of the pilot application results as a supporting tool for credit evaluation risks, and the  strategic understanding of the DBs leadership on the potential scale of climate change impacts on their portfolio and the consequential need of a formal management process of such risks.
Implementor: Waycarbon Solucoes Ambientais e Projetos de Carbono LTDA

Description: The Municipality will be expected to map out the action items and develop a programme to conduct the activities set out. Project: ETHEKWINI REGIONAL HYDROGEN ECONOMY STUDY
Result_Title: Lessons learnt workshop
Description: There will be knowledge sharing activities during lessons learnt workshops conducted, targeted at eThekwini municipality energy office and key stakeholders ( project team,  UKPACT South Africa, eThekwini Municipality). It is critical to gain buy-in from both public and private sector to ensure the project sustainability as participants need to be empowered through knowledge to take the steps required to ensure that momentum is not lost beyond the project conclusion. A memo will collate all the findings from the workshop and this will be published on the eThekwini Municipality's website and will be publicly accessible.

Project: ETHEKWINI REGIONAL HYDROGEN ECONOMY STUDY
Result_Title: Hydrogen roadmap concept video creation
Description: Project summary marketing video to engage with the public and private sector to attract investment . This will be approximately 3 minutes long and likely published on social media and eThekwini's website. This will allow the hydrogen roadmap to garner strategic investment and public buy-in. The video will distil the project information into a concise format easily understood and digestible by non-specialist decision makers and will allow the project outputs to be easily disseminated. We will allow for 2 iterations of video drafts before launching final version.

Project: Action Plan for Electrification of Two Wheelers in Jakarta
Result_Title: Adoption of the action plan for electrification of ride hailing operators
Indicator: Int. Out 2. 'Adoption of recommendation for policy/legislation'
Description:
DKI Jakarta government: The local government’s commitment to the plans will be formalised by incorporating the plans into Jakarta’s Regional Medium Term Planning Document (RPJMD), which is issued as a Governor’s Decree.
PLN (Jakarta): Start to align their city-level charging infrastructure provision roadmap with the electric fleet deployment schedule, provide access to electricity as required in the grid supply plan document, and ensure grid stability given the planned additional demand.
Charging infrastructure providers (battery swap station companies): Prepare to develop investment plans based on the projected demand on the e-motorcycle fleet deployment targets.
National government (MoT): Align national e-motorcycle penetration targets.

Project: Action Plan for Electrification of Two Wheelers in Jakarta
Result_Title: Ride-hailing operators to set phases, create timetables, and prepare the mechanisms and investments needed to electrify their fleets.
Indicator: Int. Out 3. 'Adoption of recommendation for other action'
Description:
Ride hailing operators: After the recommendations have been submitted to ride hailing operators, the document suite will be adopted in the company’s electric fleet deployment plan. Start exploring B2B financing schemes with financing institutions for their drivers to procure e-motorcycle and probable business collaborations with charging infrastructure providers based on the fleet deployment plan. 
Ride hailing drivers: Understand the benefits and how to operate e-motorcycle, participate in the operators’ program to switch to e-motorcycle

Project: Action Plan for Electrification of Two Wheelers in Jakarta
Result_Title: Multiple levels of government adopt the recommendations on electric two-wheeler supporting policy and e-mobility policy
Indicator: Int. Out 2. 'Adoption of recommendation for policy/legislation'
Description: The Government of Jakarta and the national government, especially the ministries related to the e-mobility deployment in Indonesia, are expected to understand the gaps and needs of supporting policies. Discussion amongst policymakers on developing supporting policies based on the policy recommendation document is expected to begin. The Government of Jakarta is expected to start drafting a non-fiscal incentive policy package to encourage the use of electric motorcycles by ride-hailing fleets such as odd-even number strategies or a low-emission zone. Vertical coordination between local and national government institutions is also expected to be conducted regularly to align national and local policies.

Project: Action Plan for Electrification of Two Wheelers in Jakarta
Result_Title: The Jakarta Transport Agency and Jakarta Public Works Agency adopted the complete street design guideline as their reference document in their street improvement projects for 2022 and beyond
Indicator: Int. Out 2. 'Adoption of recommendation for policy/legislation'
Description: The Jakarta Transport Agency and Jakarta Public Works Agency adopt the complete street design guideline as their reference document in their street improvement projects for 2022 and beyond. They use the document as a guideline to redesign inclusive streets in the Greater Jakarta Area which can also appropriately accommodate e-motorcycle as a new road user segment. Therefore, there will be clear allocation and design for e-motorcycles on the road which could also improve safety for other road users.

Indicator: Int. Out 1. 'Enhanced action because of training'
Description: After participating in the workshops, beneficiaries will begin preparatory work for completing CDP’s TCFD-aligned disclosures. Such actions will include briefing management on the requirements for a complete report; establishing teams and assigning responsibility; and beginning data collection for eventual use in reports. For companies that are responding for the first time, beneficiaries will be encouraged to submit a minimum version of CDP’s TCFD-aligned report. For companies that have developed reports prior to the sessions, beneficiaries will be provided with training materials on additional areas of consideration within the TCFD roadmap.

Project: Greening Agri Finance in Brazil, mainstreaming low carbon and gender inclusive interventions in Plano Safra to transform Brazil’s agriculture and livestock sectors
Result_Title: Beneficiaries are committed to utilising the diagnostic report as a basis of their common understanding of where Plano Safra stands with regard to disbursement, reach, impact and its perspectives
Description: MAPA will use the figures provided in the report to communicate widely on the current impact of Plano Safra, simulate the impact of regulatory changes it will propose, and take decisions on what form of regulatory change works best. The Central Bank will use the figures provided in this report to assess the impact of Plano Safra’s loans and re-assess the role of the Rural Credit Manual which it leads. The Ministry of Economy will use the figures provided in this report to inform the National Committee eon the Legal Amazon of the current state of Plano Safra. Banco do Brasil will use the results of this output to argue for changes in Plano Safra in its annual report to MAPA and the Central Bank.

Project: Greening Agri Finance in Brazil, mainstreaming low carbon and gender inclusive interventions in Plano Safra to transform Brazil’s agriculture and livestock sectors
Result_Title: BB has the tools to integrate socio-environmental metrics in their assessment of Plano Safra loans and regulations
Description: BB has the tools to simulate the impact of the regulatory interventions and therefore the knowledge base to integrate socio-environmental metrics in their assessment of Plano Safra loans and regulations.

Project: Strengthening climate risk assessment and enabling central bank supervision in the Indian financial sector, a partnership with frontrunning banks and DFIs
Result_Title: Participating financial institutions understand the importance of identifying, measuring and monitoring climate-related financial risks
Description: Through the knowledge assessment, the 8-10 participating financial institutions will have increased appetite for training on climate-related financial risks. This would be demonstrated through sustained engagement by senior leaders in the institutions or through requests for additional training sessions. The RBI, SEBI and Ministry of Finance will also have gained an understanding of the importance of identifying, measuring and monitoring climate-related financial risks. This would be demonstrated by more frequent mentions of this issue in its monthly bulletins or other publications, requests for technical assistance on supervisory and regulatory policy options or use of the findings in internal analyses about how India should reform its financial regulation.

Project: Strengthening capabilities on climate action for investors of the Peruvian financial ecosystem, within the framework of the Green Financing Roadmap
Result_Title: Market actors and members of the project governance network established prepare scenario modelling exercises on climate risks
Description: The members of PIR and the project governance network will strengthen their ties to benefit from the knowledge transfer and will act as a living community to learn more about climate risk assessment. The pledges on climate-related risk assessment and disclosure derived from this output, will encourage several market actors to test their capabilities acquired through the project, by preparing or procuring scenario modelling exercises on climate risks.
Implementor: PIR, Asociacion para la Promocion de la Inversion Responsable y Sostenible

Project: Promoting green finance to foster sustainable development in the North of Argentina
Result_Title: Participating institutions include the recommendations regarding sustainable credit lines in the strategy guidelines
Indicator: Int. Out 3. 'Adoption of recommendation for other action'
Description:
Participating institutions include the recommendations in the strategy guidelines of relevant management high-level board or board of directors. For example they will develop gender indicators within their
portfolio information, include environmental information in the credit risk analysis and desegregate economic sector according their impact in climate change.

Project: Mainstreaming Climate Risk Assessment in Credit Operations of Brazilian Development Banks
Result_Title: Development banks take initial steps to integrate the framework methodology
Indicator: Int. Out 3. 'Adoption of recommendation for other action'
Description: These initial steps to integrate the framework methodology include the initial application of the methodology in the DBs (BNDES and BDMG) context according to their lending portfolio and credit processes;  engagement with credit, operations, environment and strategy internal areas, analysis and definition of pilot application within the beneficiaries lending portfolio and engagement with key financial sector players and the project’s network of stakeholders to exchange experiences.
Implementor: Waycarbon Solucoes Ambientais e Projetos de Carbono LTDA

Project: Mainstreaming Climate Risk Assessment in Credit Operations of Brazilian Development Banks
Result_Title: The DBs (BNDES and BDMG) are empowered to integrate climate risk assessment in their credit operations and are aware of the urgency and complexity of the theme
Indicator: Int. Out 1. 'Enhanced action because of training'
Description: This enhanced capacity will be demonstrated through the identification of the potential and usefulness of the climate risk tool by the beneficiaries, process gaps mapping and preliminary recommendations for tool’s improvements to better meet DB’ needs and the creation of initial plans for the formal incorporation of the tool in the credit process considering BACEN regulations.
Implementor: Waycarbon Solucoes Ambientais e Projetos de Carbono LTDA

Project: Mexico inward skillshare: Carbon budgets and climate strategy
Result_Title: Carbon budget
Description: A carbon budget is produced for Mexico

Project: Malaysia outward skillshare: Developing a Climate Change Act and Climate change centre
Result_Title: CCA is passed
Description: Malaysia passes a CCA and establishes a national CCC

Project: China outward skillshare: green Asset-Backed Security (ABS) issuance
Result_Title: Issuance of a asset-based green bonds by the Industrial Bank of China
Description: Issuance of an asset-based green bonds by the Industrial Bank of China.

Project: Unlocking the Colombian government fund FENOGE to provide energy access whilst reducing greenhouse gas emissions <U+200B>
Result_Title: UPME is able to use the funds from FENOGE in the most cost-effective way
Description: The Ministry of Energy and Mines (UPME) can use the funds from FENOGE in the most cost-effective way before a December 2019 deadline, ensuring that critical projects to bring sustainable energy to Colombia’s remote regions can go ahead.

Project: Colombia Climate Finance Accelerator Follow-Up
Result_Title: Development of an innovative climate project pipeline in Colombia
Description: Increase in the number of private sectors sponsored bankable projects needed to deliver Colombia’s NDC.

Project: Colombia outward skillshare: Mission for Energy Transformation
Result_Title: The Mission's recommendations are passed as policies through Congress
Description: The Mission's recommendations are accepted, and related policies pass through Congress. There is an expectation that, in addition to their own recommendations, skill-share experts give international legitimacy and credibility to the Missions' own recommendations, supporting its passing through Congress.

Project: Mexico inward skillshare: Green Finance
Result_Title: Green Finance Strategy
Description: Mexico delivers its own Green Finance Strategy

Project: China Green Bonds: Effective Implementation; Economic Impacts
Result_Title: Implementation of recommendations
Description: Implementation of the recommendations (MRV system for green bonds, policy changes to support the growth of the green bond market) made to policymakers.

Project: Updating Mexico’s Climate Change Policies
Result_Title: Full cross-cutting integration of climate change into the public policy instruments
Description: Full cross-cutting integration of climate change into the public policy instruments.

Project: UK-China Green Finance Programme
Result_Title: Investment into green assets
Description: Increase investment into green assets to mitigate the impact of climate change.

Project: Capacity Building for Chinese Financial Institutions on Climate Transition Risk Methodologies
Result_Title: Enhanced capacity of key stakeholders
Description: Enhanced capacity of key Chinese financial institutions and policy makers in their understanding of the climate transition risk assessment methodologies and tools that exist.

Project: The Green Performance Premium: examining historical green asset performance and the contribution of ESG-practices to micro- and macro-economic performance
Result_Title: Investment in green assets
Description: The increased commercial interest in green assets as a viable and profitable investment opportunity leads to further investment in green assets.

Project: 2030 sectorial decarbonisation plans<U+200B>
Result_Title: Implementation of the three 2030 Sectoral Decarbonisation Pathways
Description: Implementation of the three sectorial  pathways for the country to increase mitigation ambition, comply with the Paris Agreement commitments, foster low-carbon, and resilient development, and alleviate poverty in Mexico.

Project: Implementing ESG disclosure and integration for a green and sustainable ‘two-way opening’ of the investment market in China
Result_Title: Implementation of recommendations on a ESG disclosure framework
Description: The CSRC to integrate the recommendations on a ESG disclosure framework on their new policy for a ‘two-way opening’ of China’s investment market that integrates sustainability considerations.

Project: Community-based Sustainable Tourism Enhancing Project
Result_Title: Increased offer of sustainable tourism
Description: Scientific Tourist Programme is implemented. Increased offer of sustainable tourism in the Amazon, Pacific and Orinoquia regions.

Project: Harmonising Colombia’s Greenhouse Gas Measurement, Reporting and Verification with the National Inventory for Transparent NDC Tracking.
Result_Title: Informed policy decisions based on a more effective and transparent MRV
Description:
The project will improve the quality and alignment of the technical inputs and data management systems with the Colombian government, which will support a more robust and sustainable inventory process. 
A more effective and transparent MRV will empower the government to make informed policy decisions to increase their climate ambition.

Project: Supporting Mexico’s Green Finance Hub<U+200B>
Result_Title: Implementation of 'greening' recommendations
Description: The Mexican government implements public policy recommendations that contribute to the 'greening' of the Mexican financial system.

Project: Solar bonus programme development and pilot implementation plan<U+200B>
Result_Title: Investments for massive adoption of photovoltaic distributed generation (solar rooftops) in Mexican homes
Description:
The program aims to incentive and to catalyse investments for massive adoption of photovoltaic distributed generation (solar rooftops) in Mexican homes.
The  purpose is to redirect the current residential electricity subsidy, presently at 120,000 million pesos per year, and transform a part of it into the required funds for the implementation of energy efficiency measures and solar rooftops of enough capacity to cover the residential user current consumption.

Project: Sustaining the Growth of China’s Green Bond Market and Facilitating Inter-Country Green Capital Flows
Result_Title: Local issuance of green bonds and ABS aligned with environmental policies and green standards
Description: More local issuance of green bonds that are aligned with China’s environmental policies and international green standards.  More issuance of Chinese green ABS

Project: Operational and environmental sustainability of solid waste management projects
Result_Title: SWM projects are implemented
Description: New projects on SWM reach financial closure and implementation occurs.

Project: Operational and environmental sustainability of solid waste management projects
Result_Title: Structural reform on SWM is implemented
Description: New municipal SWM plans and actions are implemented.

Project: Building a sustainable and scalable low carbon future in Mexico<U+200B>
Result_Title: Regulator and finance professionals with increased capacity in the green market
Description: Trained regulator and finance professionals, particularly outside the capital, show increased capacity in green bonds, markets, labelling, certification, and taxonomy

Project: Scaling up Colombia Green Growth Policy implementation and investments via capacity building of state and non-state actors
Result_Title: Improved capacity of local government on implementation and monitoring of the country's GGP
Description: The project aims to increase the capacity of state and non-state actors to implement, track and monitor Colombia's Green Growth Policy GGP - (CONPES No. 3934).  It will improve the capacity of local government officials to identify and pursue sub-national green growth policies and projects.

Project: Scaling up Colombia Green Growth Policy implementation and investments via capacity building of state and non-state actors
Result_Title: Implementation of the National Biodiversity Strategy
Description: Implementation of the National Bioeconomy Strategy.

Project: Scaling up Colombia Green Growth Policy implementation and investments via capacity building of state and non-state actors
Result_Title: NCRE and bioeconomy projects are implemented
Description:
The improved enabling conditions trigger bioeconomy businesses to develop and prosper while creating value for biodiversity-rich forests, which are key for climate change mitigation.
Disbursement of funds to non-conventional renewable energy projects.

Project: The development of a Green Economy Cluster organisation to support Mpumalanga's role in the validation, implementation and follow-on research of the South African Renewable Energy Industry Masterplan (SAREM)
Result_Title: Mpumalanga Provincial Government Green Economy Training and Strategy Support -Enabling the ecosystem for the growth of the Mpumalanga green economy with a specific focus on renewable energy.
Description: Local government decision makers better equipped to take advantage of the growing  green economy opportunity and to establish the province as a key green economy hub in South Africa.

Project: The development of a Green Economy Cluster organisation to support Mpumalanga's role in the validation, implementation and follow-on research of the South African Renewable Energy Industry Masterplan (SAREM)
Result_Title: Policy adaption based on the South African Renewable Energy Master Plan
Description:
A SAREM process can impact South African policy to set a path for renewable energy market expansion over the next 30 years as determined by the Department of Minerals and Energy, Department of Trade Industry and Competition and Department of Environmental Affairs

1) Growth of local renewable energy manufacturing - South Africa becomes an exporter of locally manufactured renewable energy components
2) A consistent annual growth of renewable energy in South Africa
3) South Africa becomes an exporter of Climate neutral liquid fuel 
4) Decommissioning coal stations across South Africa 
5) A Just Energy Transition in South Africa

Project: The development of a Green Economy Cluster organisation to support Mpumalanga's role in the validation, implementation and follow-on research of the South African Renewable Energy Industry Masterplan (SAREM)
Result_Title: Market Intelligence Report highlighting the green economy investment potential in Mpumalanga
Description: With a thriving renewable energy economy in Mpumalanga and investors able to access accurate market insights. There is a possibility to see large scale reskilling underway with a net decrease in unemployment in Mpumalanga based on 20 000 jobs and additional investment of R40bn (2bn GPB).

Project: Colombia inward skillshare: Green finance
Result_Title: Implementation of actions to achieve regulatory and framework modifications
Description: Implementation of the actions to achieve regulatory and framework modifications, potentially through the 'Green Act' proposed by the Ministry of Finance, which will contribute to the expansion of the green market in Colombia and integrate climate change standard in investment strategies.

Project: Colombia outward skillshare: Sustainable tourism in the Amazon
Result_Title: New sustainable tourism models that can reduce deforestation are developed
Description: National and regional policy makers, and local communities in the Amazon, develop new sustainable tourism models that can reduce deforestation and have associated environmental and social benefits.

Project: Colombia outward skillshare: Sustainable tourism in the Amazon
Result_Title: Applications of the guide by local fishermen, which leads to better interaction with them
Description: Application of the guide by local fishermen that leads to better observations of the dolphins in their natural habitats, reduces negative interactions with the dolphins that may affect them, and leading to better economic income to the sustainable tourism sector.

Project: Harmonisation and capacity building for green finance in Belt and Road Investments
Result_Title: Enhancing skills of key stakeholders will contribute to the operationalisation of the GIP and GDG frameworks
Description: Capacity and knowledge of participating financial institutions improved/increased - Key financial institutions have increased capacity to, and are implementing, climate risk analysis, disclosure, new environmental risk mitigation systems, and the GIP and GDG.

Project: Harmonisation and capacity building for green finance in Belt and Road Investments
Result_Title: Recommendations on further greening the BRI through improvement and operationalisation of the GIP and GDG are implemented
Description: Recommendations on further greening the BRI through improvement and operationalisation of the GIP and GDG are implemented, leading to a reduction or phasing out of funding for environmentally harmful projects in BRI countries, in GHG emissions and environmental harm from the BRI projects

Project: Promoting green recovery by championing the power of disclosure, transparency and UK-China collaboration
Result_Title: increased capacity for Government, regulatory agency and FIs in TCFD disclosure
Description:
Government and regulatory agency have an increase capacity to support TCFD disclosure implementation in China.
Chinese companies and financial institutions have an increase capacity to implement disclosure in line with TCFD standard.

Project: Promoting green recovery by championing the power of disclosure, transparency and UK-China collaboration
Result_Title: Companies in UK-China pilot group put disclosure measure in place
Description: Companies in UK-China pilot group put disclosure measure in place and have better quality of their disclosure .

Project: Accelerating high-quality growth in China’s Green Bond market and supporting post-COVID green economic recovery
Result_Title: Increased capacity for organisations involved in the green bond market
Description: More organisations, especially potential green bond issuers, have better understanding about green bonds fundamentals and  are more capable to issue green bonds

Project: Accelerating high-quality growth in China’s Green Bond market and supporting post-COVID green economic recovery
Result_Title: Improved policy documents released to further scale up and deepen the green bond market
Description: Policy makers release improved policy documents which are more internationally aligned and are more investor-oriented, and more focused on climate action to further scale up and deepen the green bond market. Investors to prioritise green and ESG related projects in portfolio management.

Project: Scaling up Green Finance and establishing building blocks for scalable and low carbon investment in Colombia
Result_Title: Implementation of green guideliness
Description: Colombian Green Finance Guidelines (green definitions) are used as the primary set of definitions for decision-making on green assets and projects across the country.

Project: Scaling up Green Finance and establishing building blocks for scalable and low carbon investment in Colombia
Result_Title: Establishment of a Green Debt Fund
Description: Establishment of a Green Debt Fund.

Project: Catalysing local implementation of climate action: unleashing the potential of non-state actors.
Result_Title: Implementation of projects which contribute to the decarbonisation of the transport sector
Description: Implementation of projects which contribute to the decarbonisation of the transport sector.

Project: Creating Enabling Conditions for Just Transition in México
Result_Title: Increased capacity of stakeholders on Just Transition
Description: Organisations to which stakeholders belong have a higher capacity with regards to Just Transition.

Project: Accelerating capital allocations to transition-aligned solutions through the UK-China ESG Leaders Forum
Result_Title: asset managers and asset owners have increased capacity on ESG
Description: The ESG capacity of asset managers and asset owners is enhanced through a better understanding of the stewarship/engagement process. Asset owners and managers will adopt engagement practices more broadly. This will lead to change in the activities of investee companies, or if no action is taken on emissions, to divestment. Additionally, The ESG capacity of asset managers and asset owners is enhanced through a better understanding of how to overcome the product and data related challenges to scale ESG across different asset classes and across public and private markets. With this knowledge, the investor community in China increases their portfolio allocations towards greener investments and reduced exposure to high-emitting activities.

Project: Accelerating capital allocations to transition-aligned solutions through the UK-China ESG Leaders Forum
Result_Title: recommendations adopted and implemented by regulators for emission reduction
Description: Regulators have a clearer understanding of needs of pension/insurance funds and imperative to integrate ESG into these asset owners' portfolios. Regulators take recommended steps to facilitate increased asset allocations to ESG products, leading to increased financing for lower emission activities.

Project: Mexico Secondments: Agenda 2030 sustainable development team
Result_Title: Sustainable investment strategy implemented across Mexico's federal government; and increased ambition and greater effectiveness of Mexican businesses' sustainability efforts
Description: Mexico takes a step forward in financing for sustainable growth with the adoption across government of a co-ordinated strategy originating in the secondments' work; and/or specific changes to improve sustainability of key projects. The business community in Mexico takes bolder and better co-ordinated action towards sustainable development and reduced GHG emissions, catalysed by government's co-ordinating role

Project: Mexico Secondments: Agenda 2030 sustainable development team
Result_Title: Increased financing for sustainable development in Mexico from strengthened frameworks and greater awareness
Description: Increased financing for sustainable development in Mexico from strengthened frameworks and greater awareness.

Project: Capacity building for green investment and the Green Investment Principles (GIP)
Result_Title: identified beneficiaries have an increased awareness and capacity in green investment
Description: Government regulators in Central Asia and Southeast Asia better understand the green investment and start to develop incentives for green financing. Financial institutions have an increase capacity to integrate climate and environmental factors into their investment decision-making and reduce investment in high-carbon assets in the region.
Implementor: Beijing Institute of Finance and Sustainability

Project: Capacity building for green investment and the Green Investment Principles (GIP)
Result_Title: Targeted financial institutions take commitment into actions in green investments
Description: Financial institutions in the region recognize the urgency of making change in order to achieve both growth and sustainability, and take commitment into actions in green investments for relevant beneficiaries.
Implementor: Beijing Institute of Finance and Sustainability

Project: Driving the green agenda through aligning SA's climate-related financial disclosure with best practice
Result_Title: Beneficiaries understand how to apply/undertake transition risk analysis & disclosure and have the necessary tools to do so
Description: The knowledge that has been shared and the capacity that has been built within financial sector institutions with respect to the importance of climate-related financial risks in South Africa has led to a  significant increase in the number of entities that engage with the TCFD recommendations and start their disclosure journey.

Project: City of Johannesburg Electric Vehicle Readiness Support
Result_Title: CoJ Institutional and Operational Readiness for EVs
Description: CoJ staff are capacitated to develop an EV policy clarifying what is allowed and what is not allowed in the City. In the longer-term, the CoJ organogram could reflect EV needs, relevant KPIs could be introduced for key staff, and by-laws could be developed to make policies legally binding. Operational readiness would include a clear registration process and record keeping of approved EV chargers

Project: City of Johannesburg Electric Vehicle Readiness Support
Result_Title: Electric vehicle policy
Description: When coupled with renewable energy charging, the decarbonization potential of EVs is potent. The City therefore rolls out renewable energy powered charging stations and the City's transport emissions are reduced drastically. Initial modelling suggests that ambitious action can lead to a 9% reduction in transport emissions by 2025.

Project: City of Johannesburg Electric Vehicle Readiness Support
Result_Title: EV tariff approved by NERSA
Description: City Power implements a sensible EV tariff that incentivizes EV charging during periods of high renewable energy generation.

Project: Building the Green Hydrogen Economy (GHE) Just Energy Transition: Co-creating a Just Labour Transition through the TVET College System in South Africa
Result_Title: Anticipatory Governance training
Description: Capacity and knowledge of participating organisations to facilitate the green hydrogen economy improved/increased - majority of staff are knowledgeable about the climate change issues which directly relate to their work and best practice(s), and implementation of relevant programmes are being overseen by individuals with in-depth knowledge

Project: Building the Green Hydrogen Economy (GHE) Just Energy Transition: Co-creating a Just Labour Transition through the TVET College System in South Africa
Result_Title: Hydrogen skills transition plan
Description: Implementation of policy recommendations on hydrogen skills transition plan results in just labour transition towards lower carbon emissions through more effective and targeted skills development matched with industry expectations

Project: Alternative Financing Models for Embedded Generation of Renewable Energy in South African Municipalities
Result_Title: Municipalities and national officials have increased capacity to develop and finance renewable energy embedded generation
Description: Capacity and knowledge of municipal and national officials is increased on developing and financing renewable energy embedded generation projects at the local level - so that key staff are knowledgeable on these issues.

Project: Alternative Financing Models for Embedded Generation of Renewable Energy in South African Municipalities
Result_Title: Recommendations noted and lessons shared with government officials in the renewable energy sector to reduce greenhouse gas emissions
Description: The policy recommendations and lessons learnt taken up by government officials lead to an increase in renewable energy being used to supply electricity in South Africa and reducing greenhouse gas emissions.

Project: Alternative Financing Models for Embedded Generation of Renewable Energy in South African Municipalities
Result_Title: Municipality renewable energy funding increased to fast-track emission reduction, resulting from increased capacity, awareness, collaboration and recommendations made
Description: Municipalities are better positioned to access climate funds and a strong pipeline of bankable projects from municipalities is developed for finance institutions to fund.

Project: Distilling the JET in South Africa: Harmonizing conflict and seeking opportunities
Result_Title: Local stakeholders have: a deeper understanding of the JT and its impacts; understand their agency and role in the JT
Description: Capacity and knowledge of participating  organisations improved/increased - majority of staff are knowledgeable about the climate change issues which directly relate to their work and best practice(s), and implementation of relevant programmes are being overseen by individuals with in-depth knowledge

Project: Distilling the JET in South Africa: Harmonizing conflict and seeking opportunities
Result_Title: Policy recommendations formulated by the project are internalised and implemented by policymakers and other relevant stakeholders
Description: Recommendations are included in policy documents and implemented

Project: Expanding the South African Green Finance Taxonomy and embedding its use
Result_Title: From capacity building pilots and webinars/case studies/tools and templates/launch event
Description: All key project stakeholder groups have increased capacity and knowledge to adopt and use the taxonomy and associated tools

Project: Expanding the South African Green Finance Taxonomy and embedding its use
Result_Title: From taxonomy report and roadmaps
Description: The taxonomy report and roadmaps developed for each key stakeholder user group, have been adopted and implemented, and have been incorporated into existing project evaluation criteria processes

Project: Business case development for Sector Job Resilience Planning in support of Just Transition in South Africa (Mpumalanga)
Result_Title: Capacity building technical assistance to Department of Environment, Forestry and Fisheries on coal sector diversification and early warning systems
Description: DEFF has increased capacity to develop and implement actions towards alternative economic development in Mpumalanga

Project: Business case development for Sector Job Resilience Planning in support of Just Transition in South Africa (Mpumalanga)
Result_Title: Just Transition Social Protection Plan (SPP) for coal phase-out regions in South Africa
Description: The SPP recommended is expected to be adopted within 1- 2 years as South African is accelerating the  decarbonization agenda and close coal power stations. 50% of the South African coal power plant will close by 2024 and the SPP should be in place by then.

Project: A contribution towards a Just Transition Finance Roadmap(JTFR) South Africa
Result_Title: Meetings with National Treasury to make recommendations towards financial services regulations
Description: Implementation will occur in a manner and timing prescribed by the National Treasury as informed by their internal and participatory processes, as well as timing and implementation  decision making  of other impactful processes such as the work of the Presidential Climate Change Coordinate  Commission (PCCCC) and the country's revised Nationally Determined Contributions

Project: A contribution towards a Just Transition Finance Roadmap(JTFR) South Africa
Result_Title: Meetings with Eskom to make recommendations towards strategies to diversify the Mpumalanga economy as they decommission
Description: Eskom implementation is an on-going iterative process which is constantly evolving as new insight is generated.

Project: STRAPSA - Shifting the transport  paradigm  for South Africa
Result_Title: National, provincial and state owned enterprises  design and implement electric road transportation strategies stemming from project support.
Description: National Government (Department of Transport; Department of Trade, Industry and Competition; Department of Environment, Forestry and Fisheries; Department of Mineral Resources and Energy; National Treasury); Provincial Government (Western Cape Government) and State-Owned Enterprise (Eskom) advance and implement green road transport plans for South Africa, including the standards and guidance designed by the project and roll out green procurement strategies.

Project: Climate Transition Pathways
Result_Title: CEO's implement project / activities following the series of CEO Champion Meetings
Description: Broad acceptance of transition pathways in the Low Carbon Pathways report by the CEO champions, enhanced co-operation between all stakeholders and actions (policy, projects), implemented by companies aligned with transition pathways research

Project: Climate Transition Pathways
Result_Title: Government adopt recommendations from the low carbon pathway report and companies adopt recommendations from the low carbon pathway report and the CEO briefing pack
Description: Adoption of policy and other action recommendations outlined in the Low Carbon Pathways Report and CEO Briefing Pack. In particular, the Government of South Africa adopts policy recommendations from the Low Carbon Pathways Report and present at COP 26, and companies adopt other actions from the CEO Briefing Pack and Low Carbon Pathways Report.

Project: Operationalising Energy Performance Certificates in South Africa
Result_Title: Wide-scale adoption of the EPC mechanism and mainstreamed energy efficiency performance management throughout the built environment, driving improved economy-wide energy efficiency
Description: A register of all buildings that have obtained EPCs, along with their actual EPC, will be made publicly available through the NBEPR. EPC certificates will be valid for 5 years, after which a new EPC audit will be required and a new certificate issued. It is anticipated that only at this 5-year interval that improvements to individual buildings energy efficiency will captured in the NBEPR, and that the NBEPR will be able to monitor building by building EE improvements.

Project: Operationalising Energy Performance Certificates in South Africa
Result_Title: NBEPR system providing facilitated access to data and baselining and informing EE policy making and programme development to further drive EE
Description: SANEDI and DMRE will be responsible for reporting on instances in which data obtained from the NBEPR has influenced policy making, and SANEDI will be responsible for monitoring and reporting on actors that have used these data for informing EE related programmes.  Between 1 and 5 EE related policies have been influenced by NBEPR data, and between 1 and 5 EE programmes have been informed by NBEPR data

Project: Operationalising Energy Performance Certificates in South Africa
Result_Title: Developing market of services and financial products associated with energy performance
Description: At least 10 tailored financial products (from a baseline of 6 i.e. 4 additional) have been introduced in South Africa to support buildings EE initiatives informed by NBEPR data

Project: Supporting the roll-out of smart grid technologies in Colombia Phase 2: Moving forward to implementation
Result_Title: Network operators and other relevant energy sector stakeholders have the capability to develop and operate a smart grid in Colombia
Description:
Network operators and other relevant energy sector stakeholders have the capabilities  to develop and operate a smart grid in Colombia 
At least 80% of priority staff identified by project beneficiaries and 50% of priority staff identified by supportive stakeholders complete the self-assessment after completing the training.

Project: Proposal of reform to the public policy and legal framework of territorial planning in Colombia in order to comply with the Paris Agreement
Result_Title: Sustainable territorial planning with climate-sensitive land use policies is implemented by local and national authorities
Description: Sustainable territorial planning by local and national authorities is executed achieving orderly urbanisation, reduced transportation emissions and protection of reserve areas which contributed to a reduction of emissions and climate change effects.

Project: Comprehensive plan and roadmap for sustainable mobility in Bogotá-Región during and after COVID-19
Result_Title: Use by the beneficiaries of the identified funds for financing the projects on Lanes network and modal transfer zones, Transport supply models and demand management and MaaS architecture. In order to find to access resources to finance the proposals
Description: Use by the beneficiaries of the identified funds for financing the projects on Lanes Network and Modal Transfer Zones, Transport Supply Models and Demand Management, and MaaS architecture. The authorities will find it easier to access resources to finance the recommended proposals.

Project: Adopting New Technology, Mindsets, and Practices to Transform Colombia’s Agricultural Sector
Result_Title: Producer associations and municipal offices are better able to support farmers' transitions to CSA practices
Description: Enhancement of extensionistas' and municipal authorities skills increases the capacity of producers associations and agriculture and environment municipal offices to support farmers' shift to practices that reduce carbon emissions.

Project: Deforestation-free Cocoa for the Amazon Piedmont
Result_Title: Farmers, government, and other stakeholders promoting agroforestry in the region develop projects to implement cocoa agroforestry arrangements based on the restoration and sustainable models recommended
Description: Cocoa farmers, Field practitioners, government authorities, Regional Environmental Agencies (CARs), and other organizations/institutions that are promoting agroforestry in the region develop projects and actions in order to implement cocoa agroforestry arrangements based on the restoration guidelines and sustainable business models, as well as the implementation of the recommended MRV system.

Project: Sustainable Tourism Enhancement Project - Phase 2: Boosting conservation and emissions reduction through tourism and technology
Result_Title: Local and national government authorities implement recommendations for policy/legislation that the project delivered related to nature tourism as a tool for forest conservation and emissions reduction
Description: Implementation of real actions developed for nature conservation as a tool for emissions reduction by the Viceministry of Tourism and local authorities of the destinations involved in the project (Alcaldías y Gobernaciones) as a result of the adoption of policy recommendations on climate change mitigation related to tourism.

Project: Sustainable Tourism Enhancement Project - Phase 2: Boosting conservation and emissions reduction through tourism and technology
Result_Title: Resources received from the Funding Platform are invested in forest conservation and actions towards emission reduction
Description: Beneficiary tourism and conservation organisations invest the resources they received from the funding platform in conservation initiatives, buying monitoring devices to continue with the monitoring process, investing in increasing their impact in forest conservations (restoration and reforestation or buying new land for conservation purposes), and other activities to contribute to emissions reduction.

Project: Accelerating development of new bioeconomy businesses and enhanced capacities for green jobs promotion and increased climate action ambition from policy implementation and integration.
Result_Title: Colombian Government implements the Green Growth and low-carbon recommendations in the National Development Plan 2022-2026
Description: It is expected that the national government implement the Green Growth and low-carbon recommendations made, considering that they will need to be approved by law, and will be fully observed during the four years following the completion of the project. Some early outcomes will be evident at the end of project implementation, such as at least three new bioproducts and lessons learned shared among key stakeholders.

Project: Accelerating development of new bioeconomy businesses and enhanced capacities for green jobs promotion and increased climate action ambition from policy implementation and integration.
Result_Title: Increased green labour competencies in fields of energy efficiency, bioeconomy, and reforestation
Description: Increased green labour competencies in the private sector in energy efficiency, bioeconomy and reforestation, as graduates of the SENA's training programmes enter the work force. MinTrabajo is an indirect beneficiary of this knowledge as these three training programmes will indirectly contribute to increasing the number of green jobs.

Project: Preparing the public and financial sector for CTR: Capacity building and call to action
Result_Title: Public institutions and financial sector firms take direct action to manage climate transition risk in Colombia through public policy and investment portfolio modifications
Description: 70 decision-makers implement the projects and action plans they designed to apply tools for managing climate transition risk in public policy mechanisms and investment portfolios respectively. 10 professors from 3 universities scale-up the climate transition risk management course at a national level.

Project: Technical assistance for the implementation of emergent design for active mobility and public space
Result_Title: Implementation of emergent infrastructure for active mobility and public space enhancement
