Description: 10 local governments will implement emergent infraestructure for active mobility and public space.

Project: Technical assistance for the implementation of emergent design for active mobility and public space
Result_Title: Investment in emergent strategies for active mobility and public space enhancement
Description: 10 local governments will invest in emergent strategies for active mobility and public space.

Project: Technical assistance for developing sustainable energy access strategies in Mexico
Result_Title: Beneficiaries have implemented energy access programs and energy access is achieved through sustainable models
Description: Capacity, knowledge, and comprehensive guidance through a handbook will help policymakers to implement successful energy access programs. Successful energy access programs will mitigate CO2 emissions by avoiding the use of candles and diesel as lighting sources.
Implementor: Ilumexico (Eres Energía Renovable SAPI de CV)

Project: Action Plan for Electrification of Two Wheelers in Jakarta
Result_Title: Ride-hailing operators and the Jakarta Government commit the resources necessary to implement the action plan and timetable to electrify ride hailing fleets in Greater Jakarta Area and include the timetable and roadmap in their planning documents
Description: Based on the report of two wheel landscape in Jakarta, the action plan for electrification, the supporting policy recommendations and the street design the Government of Jakarta commit the resources necessary to implement the action plan and timetable to electrify ride hailing fleets in Greater Jakarta Area and include the timetable and roadmap in  their planning document (RPJMN/RPJMD) in order to achieve GHG reductions and increased mobility and accessibility for women, low-income, and marginalised communities.

Project: Institutional Capacity Building Framework Program to accelerate adoption of electric mobility in public transport in India
Result_Title: Aware and empowered Kakinada city with infrastructure and institutional capacity in place to accelerate adoption of electric mobility
Description: This outcome aims to enhance the development of electromobility and renewable energy in the city of Kakinada. It will result from the adoption of all the project outputs, which target different aspects of the same ecosystem, which are all required to create change at the city level.
Implementor: Research Triangle Institute Global India Private Limited

Project: Institutional Capacity Building Framework Program to accelerate adoption of electric mobility in public transport in India
Result_Title: Significant reduction in air pollution and GHGs achieved by 2030
Description:
This outcome will occur through the following milestones which will result from the adoption of all the project outputs, targeting different aspects of the same ecosystem, which are all required to create change at the city level:
1. New businesses established offering choice of electric vehicles, repair and maintenance services.
2. Replacement of auto-rickshaws  by e-rickshaws 
3. Replaced of all buses by e-buses
4. Significantly increased demand for electric vehicles for private transport of two wheelers to be electric
5. Pollution reduction.
Implementor: Research Triangle Institute Global India Private Limited

Project: Mainstreaming Climate Risk Assessment in Credit Operations of Brazilian Development Banks
Result_Title: Increase Brazilian development banks' awareness on climate related financial risks
Description: Outputs containing the framework and tool regarding development processes will build DBs’ internal capacities and a preliminary understanding of climate risk management contributing directly to this outcome. These outputs will be supported by the training and dissemination outputs to influence behaviour to encourage enhanced and sustained actions on climate risk management. If successfully implemented, this approach has an enormous potential to increase awareness and help mainstream climate-related financial risks and opportunities.
Implementor: Waycarbon Solucoes Ambientais e Projetos de Carbono LTDA

Project: Mainstreaming Climate Risk Assessment in Credit Operations of Brazilian Development Banks
Result_Title: Integration of climate-related financial risks and opportunities into Brazilian DB’s credit operations
Description: The framework, analysis and the tool, key project outputs, will directly contribute to this outcome as they will be the primary technical instruments to support DBs in assessing climate risks and opportunities, so they can evaluate and manage the financial and strategic impacts on their portfolios and strategies, and produce functional disclosures. Empowered with these instruments and the two outputs designed to train beneficiaries in their use and encourage adoption, it is expected that the beneficiaries will be able to embed climate change at the strategic, portfolio and transactional levels and be leading players on the TCFD agenda in Latin America due to the project’s strong demonstrative effect on the local financial sector.
Implementor: Waycarbon Solucoes Ambientais e Projetos de Carbono LTDA

Project: Development of an EV Financing Tool and Business Model to Enable the Scaling up of EV Uptake
Result_Title: Enhanced and sustained action on climate change - Reduction in emissions from transport and improved air quality resulting from the increased uptake of EVs and e-mobility solutions
Description: Output 1, Output 2 and Output 3 will contribute  to the achievement of this outcome. This outcome will contribute to the fullfillment of the EV Financing Tool, as an affordable and accessible finance-to-buisiness tool that will facilitate the transition to EVs. It is expected to be used by the Government of Bangladesh, Development Partners and FIs. MSMEs will develop the capacity to support services in the transition to EVs in their existing business models. It is also expected that Mobility as a Service (MaaS) providers will have been sensitised on the importance and business value of integrating sustainable transport into their business strategies.

Project: Development of an EV Financing Tool and Business Model to Enable the Scaling up of EV Uptake
Result_Title: Increased capacity for relevant organisations
Description: All of the project outputs will contribute towards the creation of an enabling environment for electrified transport solutions. This includes capacity and awareness, to support individual public transport operators, MSMEs, cooperatives, and large urban mobility service providers to scale up their EV uptake in Bangladesh. This would contribute to the achievement of the overall programme outcome of achieving reduction in emissions from transport and improved air quality.

Project: Strengthening the use of Earth Observation platforms to support the implementation of climate change mitigation goals in the forest and land use sector in three states in Mexico.
Result_Title: Adjustments are made to programmes and policies (e.g. agricultural subsidy programmes) as a result of recommendations and improved information products
Description: There is an improved understanding of the effectiveness of different subsidies and programmes in reducing deforestation in agricultural sectors through more effective monitoring. Policies and programmes are adjusted based on evidence generated leading to a reduction in deforestation in agricultural supply chains.
Implementor: Ecometrica Ltd. (Ecosistemas Consultoría Integral para Soluciones sustentables)

Project: Building Capacity and an Action Plan to Scale up Transjakarta E buses
Result_Title: Transjakarta commits the resources necessary to implement the action plan and timetable to achieve 100% Transjakarta fleet electrification by 2030 and increased mobility and accessibility for women, low-income, and marginalised communities
Description: Transjakarta will use the action plan and their increased capacity to plan their transition to electric buses and have the capacity to iterate the fleet electrification planning documents. They will be able to develop new business models, contracting practices, partnerships, and internal capacity building to ensure the economical sustainability of fleet electrification, guided by the investment plan from this project. They will use inputs from GESI community groups into the action plan to ensure the continued incorporation of accessibility and safety concerns in implementation plans.

Project: Building Capacity and an Action Plan to Scale up Transjakarta E buses
Result_Title: Multiple levels of government commit the resources necessary to implement the action plan and to achieve 100% Transjakarta fleet electrification by 2030
Description: The Government will use the action plan and investment plan to develop subsidy schemes, commit sufficient funding to subsidize the operation of electric fleets, incorporate electrification plans in Transjakarta’s Key Performance Indicators in their contractual document, and establish a task force to continue the tasks of the PIU devised for this project. The National Government, Government of Jakarta, and local governments will have the guidance to develop the policies and subsidies to support electrification and will have a reference document to set electrification targets. Moreover, they will have the necessary skills to utilize the calculation tool (included in the action plan) to adjust the policies and develop a timeline considering GHG reduction objectives and local contexts.

Project: Building Capacity and an Action Plan to Scale up Transjakarta E buses
Result_Title: The bus operators shift to electric buses
Description: The bus operators will use the timetable and investment plan document (Action Plan, output 1) to prepare the new business model and financial model to shift from ICE buses to e-buses. Given the capacity building programs in Output 3, bus operators will also have the staff who have the capacity to maintain the electric fleet. The bus operators can also replicate the capacity building programs to their existing and future maintenance staff. Based on the charging plans, bus operators will be able to plan investments on depo charging infrastructure, including determining the technology and number of chargers and conduct depo retrofit to accommodate the chargers. Bus operators will also have knowledge to choose the bus technology which suits their operational requirement and pursue collaboration with the bus manufacturers to maintain the buses, especially maintaining the battery performance.

Project: Building Capacity and an Action Plan to Scale up Transjakarta E buses
Result_Title: PLN (State Utility Company) addresses the grid issues related to e-buses and pursues more sustainable energy sources
Description: Based on the fleet deployment and grid supply plan documents in the Action Plan (Output 1), the state utility company (PLN) will ensure that their grid supply is sufficient for the large scale e-bus deployment, and address grid stability issues which is currently still experienced often in the Jakarta area. Considering the forecast of electricity needed for e-bus operation and policy recommendations on well-to-wheel emission reduction, PLN will devise strategic and operational plans to increase sustainable energy mix in their electricity supply. Based on the current policy, PLN has to report the achievements of its plans every four months to the Ministry of Energy and Mineral Resources.

Project: Action Plan for Electrification of Two Wheelers in Jakarta
Result_Title: Government of DKI Jakarta, the national government, and other local governments issue policies for ride-hailing electrification
Description:
The Government of DKI Jakarta, the national government, and other local governments will issue policy packages and plan investment needed to support motorcycle ride hailing fleet electrification.
The Government of Indonesia streamlines existing policies and develops national policies on ride-hailing electrification, guided by the policy recommendations presented in the report. The policy package could include fiscal and non-fiscal incentives for the supply and demand side, ride hailing fleet electrification mandates, and green procurement schemes.

Project: Action Plan for Electrification of Two Wheelers in Jakarta
Result_Title: State Electricity Company (PLN) addresses the grid issues related to the additional demand given the large uptake of e-motorcycle by ride hailing
Description: State Electricity Company (PLN) will address the grid issues related to the additional demand given the large uptake of e-motorcycle by ride hailing according to the roadmap and timetable and pursue more sustainable energy source for their grid supply. PLN as the single entity to provide electricity in Indonesia will plan grid supply provided and ensure the stability of grid to accommodate the additional demand from e-motorcycle uptake by ride hailing fleets. The roadmap and timetable should be put into consideration when planning their 10-year electricity supply plan. The PLN will pay particular attention to certain areas projected to have more additional demand and prone to grid instability, since the demand of EV charging tends to be concentrated in certain areas.

Project: Utility led smart electric vehicle charging for demand response and grid management in New Delhi, India
Result_Title: EV charging protocol for charging network to manage the EV electricity demand
Description: Through all of the project outputs, the project will establish how a distribution utility can bidirectionally communicate with a network of chargers. By demonstrating this in the Indian context, the project will help BYPL and other utility stakeholders develop an in-depth understanding of the protocols available, the demand response capabilities afforded, and technical requirements in terms of the utility's back-office systems. It will help utilities better appreciate the possibilities and limitations of managed charging. The project will help also enhance mutual understanding between utilities and charging network operators for each other’s limitations and motivations.

Project: Utility led smart electric vehicle charging for demand response and grid management in New Delhi, India
Result_Title: BYPL and utilities across India start to actively and passively implement demand management from EV charging and changing network operators implement demand response as a means of achieving cost-savings
Description: The project will provide the understanding of EV charging as a flexible grid resource. Through the analyses conducted, the project partners expect BYPL and utilities across India to actively and passively implement demand management from EV charging. For changing network operators, based on the evidence provided by the project, it is expected that they will implement demand response as a means of achieving cost-savings. The economic and policy mechanisms developed as a result of this project will increase revenue-generating opportunities for network operators through participation in flexibility management.

Project: Utility led smart electric vehicle charging for demand response and grid management in New Delhi, India
Result_Title: Policy makers across India will start to support active and passive implementation of demand management from EV charging and charging incentivises aligned with India's climate objectives of greater penetration of renewable energy are put in  place
Description:
The project will provide the understanding of EV charging as a flexible grid resource. Through the analyses conducted, the project partners expect that policy makers across India will start to support active and passive implementation of demand
 management from EV charging. For policymakers, the project will help implement an evidence base with local data about user behaviour and implementation challenges, feeding into better-informed policymaking on critical aspects such as time of use tariffs for EV charging. This will allow for the creation of charging incentivises that foster the country’s overall climate objectives of greater penetration of renewable energy.

Project: Strategy and Action Plan for Electrification of Public Transport and Intermediate Public Transport in the Indian Cities
Result_Title: Electrification of public transport in Ahmedabad at a local level providing sustainable, affordable and inclusive low carbon mobility
Description: The baseline report, action plan and dissemination activities will be used by Ahmedabad local authorities for the electrification of the intermediate public transport system. The project outputs would help Ahmedabad to carry out bus electrification by procuring buses, setting up supporting infrastructure and securing state government collaboration for policy interventions and funding support.

Project: Strategy and Action Plan for Electrification of Public Transport and Intermediate Public Transport in the Indian Cities
Result_Title: Electrification of intermediate public transport in Mehsana at a local level providing sustainable, affordable and inclusive low carbon mobility
Description: The baseline report, action plan and dissemination activities will be used by Mehsana local authorities for the electrification of the intermediate public transport system. The electrification strategy of IPT will help Mehsana to decarbonize as well as to recognize and improve the existing IPT as a PT and therefore it would be useful for the IPT operator/drivers, city authority as well as users.

Project: Strategy and Action Plan for Electrification of Public Transport and Intermediate Public Transport in the Indian Cities
Result_Title: Capacity building of the local authorities to sustain actions towards de-carbonising urban mobility through public transport and IPT electrification
Description:
This project of electrification strategy and action plan is a comprehensive and multi-pronged approach towards a seamless transition to electric mobility in Public Transport and Intermediate Public Transport (IPT) mode segments. Therefore, the project is developed keeping in view capacity building and strengthening initiatives for local authorities to sustain actions that promote sustainable transport in the cities.
The workshops to be undertaken as part of this project are expected to develop competencies and skills of the beneficiaries enabling them to continue implementing the action plans of Public Transport electrification beyond the project. Capacity will be increased in terms of sensitisation towards climate change, opportunity to transform the PT and IPT segment through electrification, directing urban mobility towards clean energy and to establish the need of mainstreaming women in service delivery.

Project: Enhanced TCFD aligned transparency for an economically and environmentally resilient financial system in Brazil
Result_Title: Corporates and financial institutions in Brazil undertake TCFD aligned disclosure thereby informing and facilitating the shift of capital towards a greener recovery
Description: Corporates and financial institutions (FIs) in Brazil are motivated and capacitated to integrate climate and deforestation-related risks and opportunities in governance and financial decision and undertake disclosure aligned to the Task Force on Climate-related Financial Disclosures (TCFD), thereby informing and facilitating the shift of capital towards a greener recovery. This outcome will be accompanied by a strong shift towards green investment and green recovery in Brazil. This will be tracked by the improved disclosure of climate risk information by Brazilian listed companies in their mainstream report, in line with the TCFD recommendations as well as increase in the level of disclosure among FIs.

Project: Enhanced TCFD aligned transparency for an economically and environmentally resilient financial system in Brazil
Result_Title: Enhanced capacity of corporate and FI actors to align with global TCFD recommendations
Description: There will be a general increase in the level of awareness and knowledge about TCFD and greening financial systems within participating corporates and FIs. Corporate and FI actors have the capacity to measure and report climate and deforestation risks aligned with global TCFD recommendations and become leaders on environmental transparency and action contributing to a sustainable recovery.

Project: Enhanced TCFD aligned transparency for an economically and environmentally resilient financial system in Brazil
Result_Title: Enhanced understanding by key banking, regulatory and policy players at national and sub national levels of climate and deforestation risks, and the impact and opportunities of TCFD-aligned disclosure
Description: Both policy makers and local authorities are strongly anchored in the reality of the TCFD recommendations. Policy makers with oversight of the financial sector benefit from the overall transparency in the sector and local authorities who are making budgeting decisions on behalf of citizens in cities and states are guided by the TCFD principles. By the end of the project, we aim to achieve enhanced understanding by key banking, regulatory and policy players at national and sub national levels of climate and deforestation risks, and the impact and opportunities of TCFD-aligned disclosure.

Project: Closing the gap on sustainable finance and enabling green recovery through capacity building in CDP’s TCFD aligned disclosures and the GRI standards (Indonesia, Thailand)
Result_Title: Systemic behavioural change to measure and report the financial implications of climate change, establish ESG best practices and facilitate the shift in investments and the economy to low carbon
Description: This initiative will seek to normalise corporate disclosure using TCFD and ESG frameworks. The expected project outcome is that a critical mass of companies and FIs in Indonesia and Thailand develop capabilities and skill sets to assess the costs related to physical and transition risks of climate change, identify adverse environmental and social impacts in business operations and develop financial forecasts to mitigate and adapt to these risks and expand on business opportunities in the transition to low carbon. Outputs 1-6 developed through this Project will lead to the creation of an ecosystem that encourages increased disclosure and transparency on reporting financial impacts related to climate change and ESG. The Capital Market Module is particularly aimed to showcase to FIs and capital market regulators the importance of corporate disclosure to advance the growth of green and sustainable finance, provide tools on engaging with portfolio companies on climate and ESG risks and how TCFD disclosure data can be integrated into investment strategies to develop and better price financial instruments.

Project: Closing the gap on sustainable finance and enabling green recovery through capacity building in CDP’s TCFD aligned disclosures and the GRI standards (Indonesia, Thailand)
Result_Title: Demand for green and sustainable finance growth
Description: This project will equip corporates and financial institutions to conduct impact assessments on physical and transition risks and identify financing requirements to mitigate / adapt to these risks and invest in business opportunities focused on sustainability and low carbon transition. The project also aims to demonstrate to FIs the business case for corporate disclosure, specifically how data generated through CDP’s TCFD-aligned questionnaires and the GRI standards can be mapped to SDGs and green and sustainable loan and bond principles. Through the programme, FIs will be able to (i) generate robust green and sustainable finance strategies, (ii) engage with portfolio companies on climate, environmental and social stewardship, (iii) develop due diligence practices that integrate climate and sustainability risks, and (iii) progress on green and sustainable finance offerings to current and potential clients on low carbon and sustainable business opportunities. The Partners therefore expect the project outcome to deliver on demand-led growth for green and sustainable finance through identified financing needs for risk mitigation and market expansion on low carbon and sustainable business opportunities. Such demand-led growth will lead to a solid foundation for the innovation and success of green and sustainable finance in Indonesia and Thailand.

Project: Closing the gap on sustainable finance and enabling green recovery through capacity building in CDP’s TCFD aligned disclosures and the GRI standards (Indonesia, Thailand)
Result_Title: Establishment of an ecosystem that brings together policy, corporate ambition, and sustainable finance to enable cross fertilisation of ideas and networks that promote green recovery and meet NDC goals outlined in the Paris Agreement
Description: The project has been developed in collaboration and support from stakeholder groups that include policy, capital markets and industry associations and is a first-of-its-kind in Indonesia and Thailand to raise the ambition on green recovery post Covid-19.Through this project the Partners will create a feedback loop between policy makers, businesses and finance reinforcing collaborative efforts and a systems-thinking approach to accelerate climate action. By bringing together policy, subject matter experts and market practitioners, stakeholder groups will also have a better understanding of the challenges in meeting policy and corporate ambitions and continue the dialogue on improving the market and policy infrastructures to meet these challenges. Knowledge exchange across stakeholder groups will lead to a cross fertilisation of ideas to identify further growth areas in low carbon and sustainable development and the involvement of financial institutions will lead to better engagement and price discovery of green and sustainable business opportunities.

Project: Greening Agri Finance in Brazil, mainstreaming low carbon and gender inclusive interventions in Plano Safra to transform Brazil’s agriculture and livestock sectors
Result_Title: Banco do Brazil measures and monitors socio-environmental impacts of its current Plano Safra loans and commits to strengthening socio-environmental performance of its loans portfolio to mitigate its impact on climate change and exposure to climate risk
Description: Primarily achieved by capacity building output; supported by  all other outputs. For BB to measure and monitor socioenvironmental impacts of its current Plano Safra loans, they will utilise the tools and capacity delivered in output 3 to effectively run the quantitative and qualitative assessment of the socio-environmental metrics selected in output 2 and use this to feed into their climate impact and climate risk exposure assessments. Output 3 will have built their capacity to do so by running these numbers alongside BB for the agricultural sector, delivering the tools required and demonstrating their workings. As BB incorporates the deliverables of output 3, it is expected to publicly recognise the need to strengthen socio-environmental impact to mitigate its own contribution to climate change and reduce its exposure to climate risk. Their involvement in this project’s design demonstrates they already recognise this at a senior level, but need this project to permeate this recognition across the organisation.

Project: Greening Agri Finance in Brazil, mainstreaming low carbon and gender inclusive interventions in Plano Safra to transform Brazil’s agriculture and livestock sectors
Result_Title: MAPA integrates socio-environmental metrics into the mandatory project appraisal and monitoring procedures of Plano Safra by banks
Description: Primarily achieved by output 3; supported by all other outputs. For MAPA to integrate socio-environmental metrics to the mandatory project appraisal and monitoring procedures of Plano Safra, it will build an argumentation grounded on: the diagnostic (output 1); the evidence of potential impact of such metrics and roadmap (output 2); the powerful example set by BB (output 3, 4  and outcome 1); MAPA’s ability to estimate the impact of the changes it will propose to the rules of Plano Safra (part of output 3); and BB’s report suggesting improvements to Plano Safra (part of outcome 1). It will therefore take all these elements together and construct a quantitative and qualitative narrative that will be subject to political debates and technical scrutiny, hence the importance of the outputs and the legitimacy these will obtain by their multi-stakeholder nature.

Project: Greening Agri Finance in Brazil, mainstreaming low carbon and gender inclusive interventions in Plano Safra to transform Brazil’s agriculture and livestock sectors
Result_Title: All financial institutions disbursing Plano Safra’s loans increasingly prioritise low-carbon and gender inclusive investments
Description: Primarily achieved by outcome 2. Supported by outcome 1, outputs 1, 2 and 5. The integration of socio-environmental metrics into the mandatory project appraisal and monitoring procedures of Plano Safra by banks (outcome 2) can take place in the form of an incentive (e.g. reduced interest rates for impactful projects) or command and control regulation (e.g. minimum requirement for portfolio allocation to eligible interventions). Regardless of the option to be selected by MAPA, it will induce banks disbursing its loans to assess or monitor socio-environmental metrics, and increasingly prefer and induce low-carbon and gender-inclusive interventions in the agriculture-livestock sector as a means to attend to MAPA’s impositions, to mitigate their impact on climate change and reduce their exposure to climate risk – complying with upcoming regulation. BB’s example set in outcome 1 serves to demonstrate how banks can assess, monitor and communicate such metrics in their day-to-day. All banks indirectly benefit from output 1 (diagnostic) and output 2 (roadmap) to the extent they contributed to the diagnostic and roadmap and bought-in to the idea of fostering a low-carbon economy; and from output 5 (consolidated learnings disseminated and demonstrated) to the extent it sets the stage for their actions to bring about reputational benefits.

Project: Developing and embedding an NDC Capital Raising Strategy for Peru
Result_Title: Increased public action addressing identified priority barriers to increasing private climate investment through the implementation of the CRS
Description: This outcome includes the primary and secondary beneficiaries demonstrating increased action to implement steps to unlock private climate investment, based on the levers available to them and through the implementation of the CRS. These actions may include engagement with public sector partners to promote changes and reforms needed to bring about change, engagement with domestic and international private sector actors to facilitate investment processes, direct action through policy or regulation, and the use of investment promotion approaches (such as ‘green investment bank’-type co-investment or the provision of technical assistance).

Project: Developing and embedding an NDC Capital Raising Strategy for Peru
Result_Title: Increased public sector understanding of approaches to attract private capital for climate, and increased capacity to develop and execute strategic planning for raising and allocating climate investment
Description: This outcome includes greater knowledge and ability within the Peruvian public sector – including MINAM, COFIDE and PROFANANPE – to develop and implement the strategic approaches to increasing green finance that will be required in practice. This outcome will include both expanded knowledge base on the challenges to and opportunities for accelerating private climate investment, and increased capacity to plan and implement actions to address barriers.

Project: Strengthening climate risk assessment and enabling central bank supervision in the Indian financial sector, a partnership with frontrunning banks and DFIs
Result_Title: Risk management staff in participating financial institutions begin to identify and measure climate-related financial risks on their balance sheets
Description: Outputs 1, 2 and 3 will contribute to this outcome. Senior leaders in Indian banks, NBFCs and DFIs will use Output 1, the landscape analysis, to demonstrate the need to improve their staff’s knowledge of climate-related risks. We will engage the Chief Risk Officers and other executives within the banks during the project’s inception phase, and then share the results with them. This will ensure that they have ownership of the key findings, and will internally push for their staff to apply their training in climate-related risk management. Staff in the risk management and credit lending departments of the financial institutions will use Outputs 2 and 3, the training modules and training sessions. The trainings will equip these staff with the knowledge, techniques and tools to measure, monitor and report climate-related risks, plus evidence of where domestic and international competitors are already starting to comply with TCFD standards. As they apply these frameworks to investment and lending decisions, staff will newly be aware of the technological, regulatory and political risks associated with high-carbon projects. They will therefore begin to curtail finance for these projects, driving a shift towards lower-carbon alternatives.

Project: Strengthening climate risk assessment and enabling central bank supervision in the Indian financial sector, a partnership with frontrunning banks and DFIs
Result_Title: The Reserve Bank of India introduces more stringent supervisory and credit guidance policies, which would reduce lending to, and investment in, high-carbon projects
Description: Outputs 1, 4 and 5 will be designed and delivered in tandem to achieve Outcome 2. The landscape analysis, Output 1, will reveal whether Indian banks have the knowledge, data and skills to assess climate-related risks. The RBI’s micro-prudential team is responsible for ensuring that supervised banks have robust risk-management frameworks, while its monetary policy and macro-prudential teams monitor risks to the economy. All these departments will value new evidence that shows whether banks are aware of climate risk exposure across their balance sheets and lending portfolios. The RBI options paper, Output 4, will then provide information on how other central banks are responding to these financial risks, as well as the feasibility of these policy options in an Indian context. This will extend the RBI’s existing climate work, which focuses narrowly on agricultural prices and inflation, to the macroeconomy. We will make sure that the RBI and its key stakeholders e.g. the Ministry of Finance, Indian Banks’ Association and state governments like Rajasthan, are engaged with this analytical work via regular meetings and events, Output 5. This will strengthen the evidence and ecosystem around TCFD standards in India, amplifying the issue and securing buy-in from key decision-makers.

Project: Strengthening capabilities on climate action for investors of the Peruvian financial ecosystem, within the framework of the Green Financing Roadmap
Result_Title: Change in the investment criteria of Peruvian financial institutions, to include climate change considerations
Description: As a result of the combination of all project outputs, market actors and beneficiaries will engage in board discussions on how climate risks should influence their investment criteria and decisions. This could include setting responsibilities for managing climate risks, assessing how climate risks will impact their business strategy, setting measures to manage properly climate-related risks and setting specific targets and metrics to improve the management of climate related risks and opportunities. These discussions at the board level will trigger a change in the financial institutions' investment criteria to include climate change considerations into risk management. Thus, divestment will occur and capital will flow away from stranded assets with climate risks and into new sustainable investment opportunities. The portfolio structure changes as well as the flow of capital, providing a competitive advantage for new low carbon and climate-resilient assets. Consequently, this triggers a sustained action on emission reductions.
Implementor: PIR, Asociacion para la Promocion de la Inversion Responsable y Sostenible

Project: Strengthening capabilities on climate action for investors of the Peruvian financial ecosystem, within the framework of the Green Financing Roadmap
Result_Title: New regulation in place to encourage relevant investments for a low carbon and climate resilient economic recovery
Description:
The supervisory entities for financial markets (SBS and SMV) will acquire the following relevant capacities: Understanding of the influence of climate change in financial stability and the tools available to model this
effect, Comprehension of different regulatory approaches towards the evaluation and disclosure of climate-related risks from financial institutions, and the effect of enforcing rules to encourage a green economic
recovery and understanding what policy measures over financial markets can boost economic recovery on a post-COVID era. This built capacity will be exercised in the preparation of a new regulation for the inclusion of climate-related metrics as a standard in all financial reporting.
Implementor: PIR, Asociacion para la Promocion de la Inversion Responsable y Sostenible

Project: Strengthening capabilities on climate action for investors of the Peruvian financial ecosystem, within the framework of the Green Financing Roadmap
Result_Title: Development of one innovative investment vehicle by project beneficiaries to support the shift of financial flows to a pathway consistent with the Paris Agreement mitigation goals and a climate-resilient economy for Peru
Description: Thanks to the workshops and policy reports provided by the outputs, fund managers will explore the options available to formulate new investment vehicles for green assets. Fund managers will become aware of the attractive economic potential from hosting capital into green investments. The migration of financial resources out of potentially stranded assets, will create pressure to search and manage new opportunities in the sustainable investment niche. The project's outcomes will build the capacity of fund managers and provide the know-how to frame investment vehicles that can channel capital towards low carbon and climate-resilient issuers and projects in Peru. This encompasses green and sustainable bonds, green loans or ESG-linked loans, and the blended finance mechanisms.
Implementor: PIR, Asociacion para la Promocion de la Inversion Responsable y Sostenible

Project: Greening Finance in Argentina to Combat Climate Change and Promote Inclusion
Result_Title: Relevant stakeholders of the financial sector have the capacities, knowledge and information required to incorporate sustainable finance, ESG and climate risks assessment and management into their investment practices
Description:
Course participants will be able to identify, manage and disclose climate-related finance flows as well as to identify climate-related opportunities. The trainings will build capacities by supporting financial sector
participants to develop sustainable finance skills to incorporate them into their management and investments. Participants will have improved abilities and knowledge to recognise climate risks, ESG
attributes, climate-related financial risks and other topics on sustainable finance. Financial sector institutions will use the report regarding climate risks and stranded assets, and the trainings to incorporate ESG factors into investment decisions. Listed companies will be able to improve their disclosure procedures under TCFD and SASB standards, following international best practice.
Implementor: Carbon Trust Mexico S.A. de C.V.

Project: Greening Finance in Argentina to Combat Climate Change and Promote Inclusion
Result_Title: Argentina’s exchanges and other stakeholders of the commodities market start to implement the actions included in the roadmap to contribute to greening the sector and reduce GHG emissions
Description: Stock exchanges, such as MATBA-ROFEX or Cereals, confirm their engagement and ownership of the process and start the process of implementation of the roadmap once the project ends, in a participatory and open manner, incorporating all stakeholders. Given the complexity of the market and measures that could be taken to green a specific commodity, the process of implementation will be gradual. Yet, it will result in market participants including sustainability and mitigation actions as part of their strategies.
Implementor: Carbon Trust Mexico S.A. de C.V.

Project: Greening Finance in Argentina to Combat Climate Change and Promote Inclusion
Result_Title: The MAV-Rosario Stock Exchange rolls out the new green short-term debt instrument tag
Description: The MAV-Rosario Stock Exchange rolls out the new green short-term debt instrument tag, using the guidelines developed during the project and encourages the financing of green agro-industrial projects that reduce GHG emissions. The acceptance of the guidelines will cause the official creation of the market. Additionally, the MAV-Rosario Stock Exchange may create a green segment and a ticker that help investors identify green cheques.
Implementor: Carbon Trust Mexico S.A. de C.V.

Project: Capacity building to the government of Peru to support its first sovereign green bond issuance
Result_Title: Peru‘s first sovereign GB issuance accelerates the country’s low-carbon transition, supporting the implementation of national climate policies, financing of green recovery and improved transparency of investments
Description: The project will mobilise long-term financial resources earmarked to investments in across productive sectors, social development, environmental sustainability and climate change to support Peru in achieving NDC targets while addressing gender inclusion, poverty reduction and green recovery. This is achieved by endowing MEF with the capacity and tools for Peru’s first sovereign green bond issuance. The GB governance structure led by MEF will be responsible for guidance and oversight of the issuance process to guarantee broad ownership of decision making processes. The GB Framework will be used to identify, select, verify and report on the projects eligible for GB financing. MEF will receive technical assistance to develop monitoring and reporting indicators for accurate reporting of the environmental, economic and social impact of green bond proceeds against Peru´s NDC and SDG targets.

Project: Promoting green finance to foster sustainable development in the North of Argentina
Result_Title: New funding opportunities for green and social inclusive activities, through sustainable credit lines implemented by participating financial institutions
Description: Based on the range of recommendations and knowledge products developed, participating local financial institutions develop suitable Sustainable Credit Lines to generate a sustainable loan portfolio that fosters a greener and inclusive economy in this region. The participating financial institutions develop a sustainable portfolio and finance activities that specifically reduce emissions, protect the ecosystems, and provide financial inclusion to vulnerable groups. Sustainable producers will incorporate capacities and tools to identify credit offers, apply for credit and be able to better respond to access conditions.

Project: Promoting green finance to foster sustainable development in the North of Argentina
Result_Title: Sustainable, Green and Social Bonds issuance for funding Sustainable Credit Lines
Description: These financing tools will be used by the local financial actors participating in the project, both to finance the designed lines, as well as other activities that impact on reducing emissions or foster financial inclusion. The participating financial institutions will have the technical capabilities, resulting from training and assistance, to identify and prepare all the necessary aspects to carry out a bond issuance of this type, including technical information, a clear roadmap and contact with the regulatory authorities and potential investors.

Project: Green Economy Policy for Sarawak
Result_Title: Implementation of a carbon trading framework in Sarawak
Description: The legislation and regulation related with implementing carbon offsetting and trading framework are amended based on the adoption of the recommendations. These are evidenced by identification of the budget sources from the State Budget, and approval of the allocation for this budget to be used for implementing the carbon offsetting and trading framework. The budget identification and resource allocation will be the key steps towards the implementation of the carbon trading framework and for Sarawak to transition into Green Economy.

Project: Deforestation-free Cocoa for the Amazon Piedmont
Result_Title: CB&P stakeholders leverage funding in order to scale up the process developed in the Amazon Piedmont to other regions in Colombia
Description: Funding from CB&P stakeholders is oriented to promote deforestation-free cocoa as an economic alternative to reduce emissions while ensuring sustainable livelihoods for cocoa producers in prioritized territories of Colombia.

Project: Hutanomics: Developing frameworks to enable private sector investments into nature-based climate solutions in Terengganu, Malaysia
Result_Title: Uptake of policy recommendations by state government and the usage of knowledge products by the partnerships between state government and private sector towards the implementation of pilot NBS climate project.
Description: The recommendations will lead the development and implementation of policies specific to the development of NBS projects as part of the state's climate agenda in recognising the role of forests in mitigating climate change. There may also be new legislation gazetted and governance framework specific to the classification of forests managed for carbon as an NBS project. Recommendation and knowledge products is used by the state government to develop and implement NBS climate projects with private sector partners. Funding would be mobilised by the private sector towards the implementation of pilot NBS climate project.

Project: Sabah Renewable Energy Rural Electrification Road Map
Result_Title: Mobilization of finance stream to implement renewable energy activities
Description: Implementing stakeholders successfully mobilise diverse finance streams to implement the renewable energy activities under the Road Map.

Project: MYEcoPlan – Developing a Low Carbon City Planning System for PLANMalaysia
Result_Title: Increased capacity of PLANMalaysia and town planners to utilize MYEcoPlan system
Description: The MYEcoPlan system will act as a supporting tool for recipients to monitor and track performance towards any carbon reduction goals which will eventually lead to the outcome of promoting sustainable and greener land use planning. Through this project, capacities and capabilities of the beneficiaries, particularly PLANMalaysia will be built and strengthened from the trainings / ToTs and capacity-building workshops conducted by technical experts to the staffs. This technical assistance will come in the form of operating and managing the system, building a better understanding on carbon emissions calculations as well as adopting low carbon initiatives in land use planning. The MyEcoPlan system is expected to improve the work of PLANMalaysia, IRDA and MBIP to achieve a greener and more sustainable land use planning, i.e. in Nusajaya township at a local scale and towards the development of a environmentally-friendly land use planning system at a national scale. In particular, PLANMalaysia will have the capacity to operate and manage the MYEcoPlan system as well as replicate or scale-up the system to include larger areas and more indicators. Meanwhile, the town planners will be able to develop the calculation framework for other low carbon initiatives to update the MYEcoPlan system, towards achieving a greener and more sustainable land use planning.

Project: MYEcoPlan – Developing a Low Carbon City Planning System for PLANMalaysia
Result_Title: PLANMalaysia, IRDA & MBIP implement MYEcoPlan system in national land use planning
Description: PLANMalaysia, IRDA and other local authorities incorporate the system into their low carbon city planning guidelines. For example, IRDA to implement MYEcoPlan system in the development of Low carbon society blueprint Iskandar Malaysia 2030.

Project: Strengthening the Legislative-Executive-Stakeholder dialogue on Mexico's climate change and energy goals at the national and subnational levels
Result_Title: Adoption and implementation of the updated state climate change laws contribute to demonstrable actions towards emissions reductions
Description: The adoption and implementation of the updated state climate change laws may contribute to demonstrable actions towards emissions reductions.

Project: Sabah Renewable Energy Rural Electrification Road Map
Result_Title: Increased capacity of the Government of Sabah in managing RE mini grids
Description: The Government of Sabah and other stakeholders deploy their capacity to manage the planning and implementation of RE mini-grids.

Project: Sabah Renewable Energy Rural Electrification Road Map
Result_Title: Implementation of Rural Electrification with Renewables
Description: “Rural Electrification with Renewable” Road Map is implemented by Government of Sabah.

Project: Hutanomics: Developing frameworks to enable private sector investments into nature-based climate solutions in Terengganu, Malaysia
Result_Title: The Green Financing Task Force institutionalize the methods to develop NBS climate projects in the state of Terengganu.
Description: The Green Financing Task Force have the capacity to use the recommendations and knowledge products to develop and implement NBS climate projects in the state of Terengganu. These results and mechanism are institutionalized within the relevant state government agencies.

Project: Harnessing Green Finance through Climate-related Risk Management and Opportunities in Malaysia
Result_Title: Recommendations in climate-related best practices, risk management and impact mitigation are implemented by BNM, VBIAF sectoral guide working group, JC3, and key banks.
Description: Recommendations in climate-related best practices, risk management and impact mitigation are implemented by Bank Negara Malaysia (BNM), Value-based Intermediation Financing and Investment Impact Assessment Framework (VBIAF) sectoral guide working group, Joint Committee on Climate Change (JC3), and key banks. Advanced recommendations (e.g. international standards and cerifications) and risk management guidance in the VBIAF sectoral guides are adopted and used as a reference by FIs in developing their sectoral ESG assessment framework.

Project: Harnessing Green Finance through Climate-related Risk Management and Opportunities in Malaysia
Result_Title: Increased capacity of financial institutions in climate scenario analysis and stress testing to assess impact of climate related risks and opportunities on businesses, strategy and financial planning.
Description: Climate change will influence financial institutions to make the transition to a low carbon portfolio, where financial institutions will need to restrategise and remodel their business in adhering with the climate scenario analysis and stress testing. With the knowledge and skills received from the capacity building and relevant activities to apply climate risk assessment tools, financial institutions will be able to identify their current exposure to climate-related risks and integrate them in their business process, such as through the implementation of (1) risk framework - by having the capacity to assess impact of climate related risks and opportunities on businesses, strategy and financial planning; (2) talent development framework - based on the understanding that their staff have to be equipped with the neccessary skills in climate risk management, hence the bank will need to integrate it as part of the talent development framework for various levels of staff.

Project: Mexico Secondments: Enhancement of the Mexico City Public Environmental Fund (FAP)
Result_Title: Implementation of FAP manual and institutionalisation of structure and capacities from the FAP for fostering sustainable finance
Description: The recommended procedures and manuals for the Public Environmental Fund (FAP) are implemented and the FAP upgrades its internal composition and procedures to increase the access to cashflows, available from national and international sources, for financing more ambitious environmental and mitigation and adaptation projects, than the business-as-usual FAP project pipeline.

Project: Mexico Secondments: Enhancement of the Mexico City Public Environmental Fund (FAP)
Result_Title: Projects that were able to access FAP funds are being implemented
Description: By implementing its new capacities, using its communications strategy to execute the agreements with new partners, and developing and adopting tools to access the Fund, the Public Environmental Fund (FAP) is able to increases the pool of resources to be invested in projects and programmes for mitigation and adaptation to climate change.

Project: Business case development for Sector Job Resilience Planning in support of Just Transition in South Africa (Mpumalanga)
Result_Title: Coal waste beneficiation feasibility study and business cases (of at least 2 opportunities, if financially viable)
Description: The project expects DEFF to enable a public, private partnership that would invest in the bankable business cases this is expected to be executed within 1 -2 years of the study completion (i.e. 2022 -2023).

Project: Business case development for Sector Job Resilience Planning in support of Just Transition in South Africa (Mpumalanga)
Result_Title: Biomass business plan development and SMME evaluation
Description: It is difficult to know when the business plan and SMME evaluation will take place. However, experience has shown that the length of the process depends on the size of the business, with larger enterprising requiring the manufacturing of plants, purchase agreements, etc, taking longer.

Project: Urban Road Map to improve urban logistics in Mexico City
Result_Title: Recommendations on urban logistics to address climate change  are implemented by authorities and stakeholders at a local level.
Description: Recommendations on urban logistics to address Climate Change are implemented by beneficiaries (SEMOVI, the Municipality of Azcapotzalco, Ferrovalle) through a set of clear activities and actions.

Project: Urban Road Map to improve urban logistics in Mexico City
Result_Title: Enhanced capacities in representatives from local governments to imporve meausres taken towards freight transport and public space recovery.
Description: The representatives from local governments (SEMOVI and Municipality of Azcapotzalco) and private sector (Ferrovalle) have enhanced capacity resulting in the implementation of improved measures towards freight transport and better usage of public space.

Project: Strengthening the Legislative-Executive-Stakeholder dialogue on Mexico's climate change and energy goals
Result_Title: Increased capacity of legislators contribute to the implementation of Climate Change Local Legislation.
Description: Increased capacity of legislators, due to the skill enhancement activities of the project, that contribute to a sustained congressional work on climate legislation.s.

Project: Green Finance for the development of Smart Cities in Mexico II, working to accelerate the implementation of low carbon local projects and sustainable development
Result_Title: Implementation of climate change projects to access green finance opportunities applying innovative business models
Description: Implementation of climate change projects to access green finance opportunities applying innovative business models coming from the knowledge shared with participating cities. The majority of staff is knowledgeable about the climate change projects and the green finance opportunities and requirements, which directly relate to the implementation of actions, and relevant programmes/initiatives are being overseen by individuals with in-depth knowledge.

Project: Strengthening the Legislative-Executive-Stakeholder dialogue on Mexico's climate change and energy goals at the national and subnational levels
Result_Title: Increased capacity of legislators contributes to sustained congressional work on climate legislation
Description: The increased capacity of legislators, due to the skill enhancement activities of the project, contributes to sustained congressional work on climate legislation.

Project: Assessment of the greenhouse gas mitigation potential of hydrogen. An implementation roadmap for Mexico
Result_Title: INEEC implements potential green hydrogen projects in Mexico
Description: INECC (the beneficiary) implements green hydrogen pilot projects and disseminates information about new technologies available in Mexico as a mitigation option for meeting the NDCs.

Project: Strengthening the use of Earth Observation platforms to support the implementation of climate change mitigation goals in the forest and land use sector in three states in Mexico.
Result_Title: Enhanced capacity for reducing deforestation in agricultural sectors by SADER, CONAFOR, and state governments
Description: Enhanced capacity of relevant actors such as SADER, CONAFOR, and state governments to adjust programs and policies that help to reach NDC goals in the land use sector. There is an improved understanding of the effectiveness of different subsidies and programmes in reducing deforestation in agricultural sectors through more effective monitoring. Policies and programmes are adjusted based on evidence generated leading to a reduction in deforestation in agricultural supply chains
Implementor: Ecometrica Ltd. (Ecosistemas Consultoría Integral para Soluciones sustentables)

Project: Expanding sustainable infrastructure network for electric vehicles in urban transportation modes
Result_Title: The learnings and recommendations for a better technological and financial planning and climate action considerations in the uses of electric buses are implemented by the beneficiaries (Metrobús & CFE-PAESE)
Description: Metrobús incorporates climate recommendations into the program expansion and the learnings. Recommendations and network-related efforts lead to an increased interest and participation of the international community of practice, led by the UK, with strong participation and implementation of stakeholders from government and CFE-PAESE.

Project: Integrated freight transport plan combining rail and road freight modes aiming at reducing GHG and improving logistic integration and local economic development for Mexico City
Result_Title: Recommendations implemented by authorities and stakeholders
Description: Recommendations adopted in Intermediate Outcome 3 are now being implemented through a set of clear activities or action is underway.

Project: Integrated freight transport plan combining rail and road freight modes aiming at reducing GHG and improving logistic integration and local economic development for Mexico City
Result_Title: Enhanced action by authorities in regards to freight transport and better usage of public space
Description: The representatives from local governments (SEMOVI and Municipality of Azcapotzalco) and Private Sector (Ferrovalle) have enhanced capacity resulting in the implementation of improved measures towards freight transport and better usage of public space.

Project: Technical assistance for developing sustainable energy access strategies in Mexico
Result_Title: Recommendations on energy access pilots developed in off-grid communities are implemented, mitigating CO2 emissions
Description: By ensuring energy access pilots recommended to off-grid communities, stakeholders stop relying on candles and diesel for light, mitigating the CO2 emissions produced by these harmful and polluting sources.
Implementor: Ilumexico (Eres Energía Renovable SAPI de CV)

Project: Technical assistance for developing sustainable energy access strategies in Mexico
Result_Title: Investors finance programs to scale up and achieve universal energy coverage in Mexico, displacing CO2 emissions, as well as promoting networking and alliances
Description: Through the development of a financial model, policymakers will be able to attract private funding to scale-up energy access programs for off-grid communities.
Implementor: Ilumexico (Eres Energía Renovable SAPI de CV)

Project: Proposal of reform to the public policy and legal framework of territorial planning in Colombia in order to comply with the Paris Agreement
Result_Title: Improved and increased capacity/knowledge of participating governmental organisations on climate change issues which directly relate to territorial planning
Description: Improved capacity and knowledge of participating governmental organisations (DNP, MinVivienda, MADS, and local authorities) to implement relevant programs and best practices on climate change issues directly related to their work.

Project: Accelerating development of new bioeconomy businesses and enhanced capacities for green jobs promotion and increased climate action ambition from policy implementation and integration.
Result_Title: Further resources mobilised to scale-up and replicate acceleration mechanisms with new commercially viable bioeconomy projects
Description:
The three inclusive and low-carbon bioeconomy businesses receive investment to develop and scale-up the businesses. Also, it is expected that after 2 years following the completion of the project, Minciencias will mobilize further resources to operate the acceleration mechanism with new projects that can reach the commercial stage within the following years, allowing for a scale-up and replication. 
Then it is expected further collaboration and partnership between international cooperation, Minciencias, Innpulsa, ProColombia, and MinComercio in order to scale up the mechanism and achieve a bigger impact on the Colombian bioeconomy stakeholders.

Project: Deforestation-free Cocoa for the Amazon Piedmont
Result_Title: Key actors within cocoa value chain have increased capacity for the implementation of climate smart agriculture and for the development of programmes and activities to strengthen deforestation-free cocoa business models and agroforestry arrangements
Description: Capacity and knowledge of key actors (public officials, cocoa associations, environmental authorities, companies, and other institutions) of cocoa value chain improved/increased. The majority of staff are knowledgeable about the climate change issues which directly relate to their work and best practice(s), and implementation of relevant programmes are being overseen by individuals with in-depth knowledge. Key actors of cocoa value chain in the Amazon Piedmont appropriate a common vision for deforestation-free cocoa in the Amazon Piedmont in accordance to CB&P objectives and values.

Project: Greening the Colombian Financial System: Implementing local green definitions to enable long-term investment into priority sectors.
Result_Title: Enhanced capacities of financial sector for Green Bond issuances which contribute to GHG emissions reductions
Description: Market players, potential green and sustainable bond issuers, government agencies, verifiers identify green assets, screen criteria and replicate processes to issue green and sustainable bonds that will contribute to reduce GHG emissions.

Project: Greening the Colombian Financial System: Implementing local green definitions to enable long-term investment into priority sectors.
Result_Title: The Green Finance community use the National Taxonomy and CASA Colombia as a proxy, and the Sustainable National Fund is implemented according to recommendations.
Description: MHCP implements a Sustainable National Fund. This is important to access sovereign green assets while complying with international standards in its governance, risks management, underwriting procedure, and sustainable policy. The National Taxonomy will be referenced when talking about sustainable finance in the country and issued bonds are aligned to it.

Project: Supporting livelihoods through Ecotourism Routes for Forest and Peace.
Result_Title: Resources are mobilised to communities to help them cover the costs of the homestay improvements and effectively adopt the suggested improvements in their homestays proposed in the architectural guides.
Description:
Communities access funds from 
financing schemes or investors to develop homestays to receive tourists or other tourism businesses, and effectively implement the suggested improvements in their homestays proposed in the architectural guides.

Project: Adopting New Technology, Mindsets, and Practices to Transform Colombia’s Agricultural Sector
Result_Title: CSA benefits incorporated in relevant regional policy frameworks
Description: Relevant authorities implement the recommendations and effectively include climate smart agricultural practices and community-based carbon monitoring systems to contribute towards climate change mitigation in the PDEA (Departmental Plan for Agricultural Extension) and the regional plan for climate change for Orinoquia (PRIOCC).

Project: Scaling up rural electrification via capacity building to public and private actors
Result_Title: An increased number of rural electrification projects are selected by MME's Royalties System Program (SGR) for financing and private sector participation in rural electrification initiatives is augmented
Description: Subnational entities have the capacity to design and structure rural renewable energy projects and develop high quality funding proposals to the SGR system. Private sector participation increases in rural electrification planning by the development/identification of financially viable, scalable, and replicable rural electrification business models by testing, and bringing to the market innovative commercial business models capable to overcome financial barriers and reduce rural electrification dependence on public funding.

Project: Scaling up rural electrification via capacity building to public and private actors
Result_Title: Implementation of recommendations on Rural Energization Plans (PERS) across prioritized department(s)
Description: Recommendations on Rural Electrification Plans are implemented in prioritized departments based on PERS project.

Project: Empowering territories’ for low carbon transformation
Result_Title: Increased knowledge and commitment to implement decarbonization pathways by governments in five primary beneficiary departments and stakeholders
Description: Governments in five primary beneficiary departments (Antioquia, Bogota, Boyoaca, Cundinamarca, Valle del Cauca) increase their knowledge on descarbonization pathways and commit to develop a long-term strategy. In addition, stakeholders of different sectors in society develop understanding, behavioural changes underway, and secured consensus to adopt long-term transformations toward descarbonization pathways.

Project: Empowering territories’ for low carbon transformation
Result_Title: Effective impact policy actions are identified to adopt long-term visions for energy and transport  in highest emitter departments
Description: Governments in the highest emitter departments adopt and implement policy actions recommended which are aligned with the long-term visions for energy and transport.

Project: Expanding the Colombian Climate Asset Disclosure Initiative (CCADI)
Result_Title: Increased capacity of the financial sector to mobilise resources to address climate-related impacts, redirect investments to activities with positive climate impact and better allocate capital to avoid resources going to high-emission activities
Description: Financial institutions have increased capacities to make positive-climate impact investment decisions, thereby showing the ability to redirect financial flows towards economic activities that have a positive climate impact and projects that support mitigation and adaptation to climate change. Similarly, financial institutions have enhanced capacities to quantify and include climate risk management in the investment decision process, and to better allocate capital in order to avoid financial flows going towards activities with high emissions.

Project: Expanding the Colombian Climate Asset Disclosure Initiative (CCADI)
Result_Title: Institutional investors and real sector companies in Colombia implement TCFD recommendations and policies to transition the financial sector to a low-carbon economy
Description: By supporting the companies in the real sector to implement the TCFD recommendations, the business sector will align with low-carbon strategies that are resilient to climate change impacts. The continuous articulation, support, and implementation of recommendations and policies by the main stakeholders in the financial sector will have a positive impact in the country's abilities to mitigate and adapt to the effects of climate change.

Project: Steering the Colombian Road Freight Sector Towards a Zero Emissions Strategy GIRO-ZERO
Result_Title: Stakeholders build capacities based on the recommendation to implement strategies towards zero emissions within the RFT sector and benefit the sector as a whole by measurement, reporting, and verification (MRV) of emissions generated
Description: Road Freight Companies, members of Colfecar, and the public sector build capacities from the project recommendations in relationship to fleet, operational and logistics optimization and monitor impacts and contributions to Colombia's emissions reduction targets and NDCs. In addition, information sharing within the Giro Zero network leads to increased capacity within the members of the network to implement a system of measurement, voluntary reporting, and verification (MRV) of emissions, which is used for benchmarking and demonstrating the contribution towards the emissions reductions targets and NDCs.

Project: Steering the Colombian Road Freight Sector Towards a Zero Emissions Strategy GIRO-ZERO
Result_Title: Stakeholders implement recommendations and show results that contribute towards zero emissions within the Road Freight Transport Sector
Description: Road Freight Companies, truck owners, and truck drivers adopt cleaner technologies and practices (while also being profitable for them). The Ministry of Transport and Ministry of the Environment enact regulations and policies following project's recommendations.

Project: Preparing the Road to Zero-emission Urban Mobility in Colombian Cities: Accelerating Electric Bus Adoption
Result_Title: Plans adopted for rapid procurement of e-buses in three target cities are implemented
Description: Three target cities in Colombia have a clear understanding of the electric bus-related assistance and resources available to cities at the national level and implement ambitious, achievable, and time-bound plans or targets for the rapid procurement of electric buses. Furthermore, WRI guidance is disseminated nationally and other cities demonstrate interest in electrifying their bus fleets.

Project: Comprehensive plan and roadmap for sustainable mobility in Bogotá-Región during and after COVID-19
Result_Title: First stages of the implementation of recommendations on transport models for Bogotá-Region, construction of MaaS/MRVplatform design and Constitution of the Transport Regional Authority.
Description: Local Authorities in Bogotá-Region implement the recommendations developed by the project including the transport supply models and demand management strategies for Bogotá-Region, the priority lanes network and modal transfer zones design, and the construction of the MaaS/MRV platform (by beneficiaries’ own means or through a third party). These will help to change mobility habits, reduce GHG emissions and travel times. In addition, the Transport Regional Authority is constituted in accordance with the recommendations and guidelines for the regional institutional framework and fulfillment of the "Pact for Reporting GHG emissions" by broader transport stakeholders.

Project: Sustainable Tourism Enhancement Project - Phase 2: Boosting conservation and emissions reduction through tourism and technology
Result_Title: Tourism organisations and stakeholders actively working on forest conservation have increased organisational capacities in leadership, conservation, sustainable tourism, business management, and coordination to implement conservation initiatives
Description: Enhanced capacities of tourism businesses regarding leadership, conservation, sustainable tourism, and business management will allow them to grow and become more profitable while empowering them to implement conservation initiatives that will also allow them to have additional income. Similarly, tourism stakeholders have increased capacity to coordinate and implement specific actions for sustainable nature tourism development and emissions reduction from tourism operations that have conservation initiatives, under the framework of 20 conservation agreements and 10 local partnerships among local tourism stakeholders.

Project: Supporting the roll-out of smart grid technologies in Colombia Phase 2: Moving forward to implementation
Result_Title: Smart technologies are implemented behind the meter across industrial, commercial, and residential sectors. Network operators implement ToU tariffs that unlock new business opportunities for behind the meter smart technologies deployment
Description: At least 20% of industrial and commercial, as well as 5% of residential consumers, implement necessary changes by 2030 to reach the energy reduction potential as identified in the UK Pact Round 1 Project. One Time of Use (ToU) tariff is implemented for clients within each region and adoption by 10% of them within three years after project delivery, which unlocks new business opportunities for behind the meter smart technologies deployments based on UPME recommendations.

Project: Supporting livelihoods through Ecotourism Routes for Forest and Peace.
Result_Title: Increased capacity within the communities to develop and deliver sustainable touristic packages that incorporate biodiversity and culinary knowledge, and are able to market them to national and international tourists and travel agencies
Description: The communities effectively incorporate the knowledge learned in the biodiversity and culinary trainings into the tourism packages. They effectively share this knowledge with the travelers through the guided nature tours and offer the recipes learned in the cooking course to the visitors. The detailed tourist plans and fine-tuned routes will strengthen the communities so they are able to manage the tourism endeavours autonomously, gradually including more people in the tourism value chain. In addition, communities have increased capacity to market their tourism routes and more national/international tourists and travel agencies interested in these destinations. The communities will implement the adopted marketing tools and marketing action plans. This strategic marketing and the more competitive experiences will result in more income from ecotourism related activities, shifting the area's economy from the traditional extractive activities and climate change-inducing (mainly mining and deforestation) into ones that are sustainable and do not contribute to deforestation.

Project: Paving the Way for Setting Ambitious GHG Emissions Reductions in the Private Sector to enhance the National Climate Change Policy
Result_Title: Key government stakeholders and Mexican companies adopt SBT as a reference for corporate GHG emissions reduction and as a mechanism to enhance National Climate Change Policy
Description: Key stakeholders from government institutions with enhanced capacities have a better understanding of the impacts and applicability of SBTs and their potential use as part of climate policies, benefitting also the private sector by supporting and promoting corporate climate action through government programs and incentives.

Project: Improve and replicate local capacity building processes linked to value chains and networks in the Agriculture, Forest and other Land Use Sector in six jurisdictions of the GCF Task Force Mexico
Result_Title: Implementation of recommended roadmaps in 6 states and an Apicultural Law in Quinata Roo resulted from the local training models and planning tools development for reducing carbon emissions and preserving forests
Description: Implementation of the recommended roadmaps for 6 states (Jalisco, Chiapas, Tabasco, Campeche, and Yucatán) and a Apicultural Law Proposal in Quintana Roo.

Project: Improve and replicate local capacity building processes linked to value chains and networks in the Agriculture, Forest and other Land Use Sector in six jurisdictions of the GCF Task Force Mexico
Result_Title: Municipalities from 6 states increase their capacities by adopting methodological models that boost local productive sustainable business, preserve forests, and improve food production systems
Description: Municipalities from 6 states (Jalisco, Chiapas, Tabasco, Quintana Roo, Campeche and Yucatán) increase their capacities by adopting the methodological guides adapted to the context of each of the project, focused on boosting sustainable productive business and preservation of forests and food production systems.

Project: Landscape conservation and livelihood restoration in the Mexican ejidal altiplano: the case of Apan, Hidalgo.
Result_Title: Increased technical and coordination capacities on water, soil, and forest management in key local stakeholders
Description: Key actors increase their technical capacities to manage and monitor the ecosystems (water, soil, and forest) and are capable of working in coordination with each other through governance and funding mechanisms that ensure participative and inclusive governance, as well as equitable and transparent funding.
Implementor: Eetestudio  (Espacio entre tiempo estudio SA de CV)

Project: Landscape conservation and livelihood restoration in the Mexican ejidal altiplano: the case of Apan, Hidalgo.
Result_Title: Transparent funding mechanism capable of distributing equitable gains across various stakeholders officially adopted and implemented
Description: The coalition of government, communities, and enterprises maintain activity and continue to push advancement, leading to the institutionalization of the funding mechanism. The enterprises and other actors activate the funding mechanisms by investing capital.
Implementor: Eetestudio  (Espacio entre tiempo estudio SA de CV)

Project: Landscape conservation and livelihood restoration in the Mexican ejidal altiplano: the case of Apan, Hidalgo.
