Result_Title: Implementation of recommended inclusive governance and legal mechanisms on water management, property rights, and agricultural patterns by local stakeholders in Apan
Description: The local commission, public authorities, and other relevant stakeholder (e.g., local producers and local industry) implement and institutionalize recommendations on water management, property rights, and agricultural patterns in Apan, Hidalgo.
Implementor: Eetestudio  (Espacio entre tiempo estudio SA de CV)

Project: Accelerating Green Finance Flows Through the Strengthening of the Mexican National Banking and Securities Commission (CNBV)
Result_Title: Financial intermediaries have increased capacity and implement ESG and climate-risk to comply with CNBV-issued regulation, reducing their exposure to climate-related risks, and improving communications among key actors
Description: Increased capacity for relevant organisations, particularly financial intermediares and key actors, to integrate ESG and climate-related risks into their operations. Once the CNBV issues new regulation related to ESG and climate risks, financial intermediaries are mandated to adopt such regulations. The project expects the CNBV to make regulatory changes within the next 4 years, in line with their strategic plan. When the CNBV issues Unique Banking Memos (CUBs in Spanish), financial intermediaries have a grace period, which can range between 3 months to 1 year according to the complexity of changes, to incorporate new regulations. However, some financial intermediaries are already taking actions and expect these number to increase through the communications efforts of CNBV, signaling their intention to issue regulation on ESG and climate-risks in the future.

Project: Technical assistance for the implementation of emergent design for active mobility and public space
Result_Title: Increased capacity in local governments to take emergent strategies & infrastructure for active mobility and public spaces
Description: Increased capacity in local governments to successfully plan, implement, operate, and evaluate emergent infrastructure projects for active mobility or public spaces.

Project: Accelerating Fleet-wide electrification of public transport in Mexico City
Result_Title: Recommendations implemented for an improved electrification strategy
Description: Metrobus & SEMOVI define the structure for procurement and operation of electric buses informed by project recommendations.
Implementor: Dalberg Advisors (Asesores en Desarrollo Dalberg S. de R.L.)

Project: Accelerating Fleet-wide electrification of public transport in Mexico City
Result_Title: Metrobus and SEMOVI are able to assess financial implications and pathways to electrification, due to enhanced capacity from trainings.
Description: Metrobus and SEMOVI have adopted the financial tools to assess alternative scenarios and can incorporate the input into decision making.
Implementor: Dalberg Advisors (Asesores en Desarrollo Dalberg S. de R.L.)

Project: Consolidation of the Mexican Climate Finance Hub - mobilizing resources to mitigation and adaptation activities and achieve Mexico´s emission reduction goals
Result_Title: Increased capacities in key actors such as financial institutions, private companies, public and subantional entities,  to work together and address climate crisis challenges and local risks and indetifying investment oppportunites through new development
Description: Increased capacities through a methodology that identifies climate risks locally but also promotes investments opportunities for relevant actors (financial actors,  public and private) to tackle climate change challenges locally.

Project: Consolidation of the Mexican Climate Finance Hub - mobilizing resources to mitigation and adaptation activities and achieve Mexico´s emission reduction goals
Result_Title: Local investors are able to identify relevant investment opportunities developed by both public companies and subnational entities, and are able to mobilize capital towards those opportunities through newly developed investment vehicles
Description: Subnational entities get funding from local institutional investors, becoming study cases for other entities looking for funding to execute their green pipeline.

Project: China Skill Share: Training to enhance understanding of domestic and global green finance development and Shenzhen's newly-issued Green Finance Regulation (CN-001a-R)
Result_Title: Enhanced individual and organisational capability of Shenzhen government and financial institutions to meet TCFD recommendations (CN-001a-R)
Description: Capacity building training programmes will aid Shenzhen’s financial institutions and government with the successful and mandatory implementation of TCFD recommendations. Training will help them to report increased individual and organisational capability to implement their TCFD disclosure aims in line with their ambitious timeframes (from March 2021).

Project: Skill share: Colombia Climate Physical Risks and Financial Stability (COL-001a-R)
Result_Title: The Banco de la Republica and Superintendencia Financiera upskill wider teams/departments on the impact of physical climate risks (COL-001a-R)
Description: Building on the skills enhanced in-country around the impact of physical climate risks, the Banco de Republica and Superintendencia Financiera will disseminate knowledge to upskill others in both institutions and further increase organisational capacity.

Project: Skill share: Colombia Climate Physical Risks and Financial Stability (COL-001a-R)
Result_Title: The Banco de la Republica and Superintendencia Financiera will help other Colombian financial institutions to understand climate change risks and support new policy making to reduce emissions (COL-001a-R)
Description: Building on the adoption of scenarios and top-down stress testing methodology, the Banco de Republica and Superintendencia Financiera will be able to support other Colombian financial institutions (other state agencies, research centres and the private sector) in having a better understanding of climate change risks so they can include them in their risk management strategies. This would support new policy making and in turn shape financial flows to reduce emissions for lower carbon growth.

Project: Colombia Skill Share: Develop improved technical capabilities for the MoMe, CREG, UPME and FENOGE in Advanced Metering Infrastructure deployment (COL-003a-R)
Result_Title: Enhanced organisational capacity of Colombia’s MoMe, CREG, UPME and FENOGE to feed into national policy and incorporate AMI projects in Colombia (COL-003a-R)
Description: Increased capabilities will feed into national policy and regulation and translate into tangible action at the subnational level to accelerate the deployment of AMI in Colombia.

Project: Colombia Skill Share: Develop improved technical capabilities for the Ministry of Mines and Energy and Barranquilla’s mayor office in Offshore wind project deployment (COL-004a-R)
Result_Title: Enhanced organisational capacity of Colombia's MoMe and Barranquilla’s Mayor’s Office to feed into national policy and incorporate OSW projects in Colombia (COL-004a-R)
Description: Increased capabilities will feed into national policy and translate into tangible action at the subnational level. This strategic activity will build common ground between the national and local governments, which will help to accelerate the decision-making process from policy makers, towards incorporating OSW projects in Colombia.

Project: South Africa Skill share: Hydrogen Society Roadmap (ZA-001a-R)
Result_Title: Creation of hydrogen roadmap and policy framework for the development of the hydrogen economy in South Africa (ZA-001a-R)
Description: Building on the MEL skills enhanced in-country, the DSI and its partners will: develop a robust, implementable, and measurable Hydrogen Society Roadmap that enables delivery of the associated economic, social (including GESI), environmental and climate outcomes; enhance cross-sectoral knowledge about hydrogen; and set the policy framework for the development of the hydrogen economy in South Africa.

Project: Thailand Skill Share: Workshop to support Thailand to develop and adopt a cross-cutting policy for the promotion of electric vehicles on Thai roads (TH-001a-R)
Result_Title: Implementation of Thailand’s EV policy (TH-001a-R)
Description: The National Electric Vehicle Policy Committee (NEVPC) will further develop and implement a robust and comprehensive Electric Vehicle (EV) policy that will align with Thailand’s economic strategy. Thailand’s aim is to become a hub for electrical vehicles within 5 years, aiming to produce 60,000 EVs by 2022 and committing to 30% of vehicles sold in 2030.

Project: Colombia Skill Share: Strategy for low traffic neighbourhoods and cities transitioning to proximity urbanism (COL-005a-R)
Result_Title: Colombia's Secretariat of Mobility of Bogota (SDM) implements the Barrios Vitales strategy and implementation plans to achieve low traffic neighbourhoods throughout cities in Colombia  (COL-005a-R)
Description: The Secretariat of Mobility of Bogotá (SDM) implements robust and measurable Barrios Vitales projects beyond the city of Bogotá, and interacts with the departments of transportation in neighbouring cities to showcase the benefits of such interventions. Wider implementation of the Barrios Vitales plan and strategy enables progressive and tactical actions on mobility, public space and urban revitalisation throughout Colombia.

Project: ETHEKWINI REGIONAL HYDROGEN ECONOMY STUDY
Result_Title: Establishment of the eThekwini Municipality Hydrogen Economy Final Report : recommendations chapter
Description: The Municipality will be expected to implement the items that are classified as requiring a short amount of time to complete and classified as having a low level of difficulty within 6-9 months of the project conclusion.

Project: Paving the Way for Setting Ambitious GHG Emissions Reductions in the Private Sector to enhance the National Climate Change Policy
Result_Title: Mexican companies from high-emission sectors set internal targets and utilize the recommendations to implement a defined path to reduce green house emissions
Description: 15 companies in Mexico, including companies from high-emission sectors, establish science-based targets resulting from the project recommendations. Science-based targets have the intention of meeting the goals of the Paris Agreement and reduce Greenhouse gas (GHG) emissions) to prevent increased climate change impact.

Project: Nigeria Public Sector Skill Share: Support in drafting Nigeria’s Climate Change Bill and sharing the UK’s experience of the Climate Change Act
Result_Title: Implementation of Nigeria's Climate Change Bill
Description: Nigeria's Ministry for Environment will further develop and implement robust and comprehensive climate change legislation to help them achieve climate reductions consistent with their NDC commitment and ultimately to transition to a net zero emissions country.
